story:
A bit about us

We are a group of local farmers and producers from around the Okanagan Valley, Armstrong down to Osoyoos. We have banded together to change the way the Okanagan accesses the locally grown product. We firmly believe that what's grown here should benefit those who live here. Its important for us that we support the Okanagan wholeheartedly and we believe this grocery store is the first step in that. Together with your donation we can disrupt the large scale food distributor and bring about a more prosperous future for us all, at a better price too!

What's in it for you & for us

We are offering up some pretty crazy benefits for those who believe in what we will accomplish from the start. From lifetime memberships, to exclusive catered dinners we are offering it all. We hope that you see, with your support we will all benefit. 

As far as what's in it for us? We need the money for operating capital to get us through the winter and to help us secure a lease on our first property (hopefully one of many). We will be featuring almost exclusively Okanagan products. If we can get it here, we will get it here, plain and simple. 

The Impact

With each individual donation we are one step closer to a more local and sustainable Okanagan. As a contributor you will have first rate access to the most wonderful meat and produce that the world has to offer. Here in the Okanagan we grow food that is top notch, yet the farmers and the ranchers struggle to make a living. With our new shared service model for the farmers and 24/7 access to a farmers market style store for our customers we can all reap the benefits of our world class produce! 

Without you, our backers, this idea for a more local and sustainable tomorrow withers on the vine. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, some of you just can't contribute, it's not in the financial cards. We're farmers, trust us we have been there. That doesn't mean you can't help us out. We ask that if anything we have said to this point sounds like a good idea that you help us spread the word. The more people that know about what we are doing the better off we are as a community. Post for us on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc. Phone your neighbour and tell them about how excited you are for what's coming. Go door to door and spread the word... Ok maybe don't go door to door! 

Any help is appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to read this much!

story:
Drug companies have been buying the rights to cheap generic drugs and then creating outrageous markups (For example, this lifesaving drug which cures a common AIDS related infection: http://goo.gl/R1zFQU ). Drugs which used to cost pennies now cost thousands of dollars, endangering lives.

We plan to create a public benefit corporation that will create cheap generic drugs once again. With a $1M seed investment, we will perform the necessary research and groundwork in preparation of developing a pharmaceutical plant dedicated to producing cheap generic pharmaceuticals to save the lives of those in need.

Pharmaceutical manufacturing is an enormously complicated task from both technical and regulatory perspectives. It will be several years before we are ready to manufacture generic drugs safely. However, we have the technical and business skills necessary to make it happen. Our team consists of experienced entrepreneurs, scientists, businessmen, and doctors who will gradually work to make lifesaving drugs affordable again.

story:
I'm from South Florida with family ties in Georgia, and North Carolina. I began my cooking and restaurant experience at the age of 15, working as a busboy at IHOP (House of Panckes) in Delray Beach. I went on to work as a short order cook, pantry chef, line chef and head chef assistant (in numerous other restaurants). I learned more about cooking watching my mother, and more about baking, by helping my grandmother. 

       After serving in The U.S. Navy and being "Honorably Discharged" I started baking my mother's sweet potato pie recipe in Honolulu, and created a market for them in the island community. I missed my mom's pies and was so far from home, I learned to make them myself. I even went on to create various flavors of sweet potato pies such as....Bourbon & Praline, Banana Chocolate Cream Cheese, Peanut Butter  and nearly 60 others.  All of my sweet potato pie flavors are distinctively different, and delicious, and the combinations work very well together with the sweet potato pie.  I am currently working on a website where you can view a list and some pictures of all the flavors.  I've found some remarkable extracts, aromatic oils and "creme aromatizzate" (flavored creams) from here in Italy and many from France, that are unlike anything we have in the U.S.  I have married the three cultures in a delicious union of unimaginable, mouth-watering culinary ecstasy.  I can hardly wait for you to try them.

       I left Hawaii in 2004 after meeting the future mother of my beautiful daughter and moving to Rome, Italy.  I have been here in Rome now for 11 years and teaching English to school students on occasion, and working in films as an extra when available.  The economy is still in "crisis" here and I find myself struggling to support myself and family.  Meanwhile, my clients in Hawaii are still asking friends about me and my pies, and a possible return. 

        I left a lucrative, expanding business and a void in a market that hasn't been filled.  There are long time clients there, that have expressed an interest in the past, to maybe participate in a franchising venture after seeing a successful business model.

        With the generous financial assistance of investors from this site, I hope to return to Hawaii, and create that "Business Model" and establish a solid means of support for myself and family as well as others that are looking for a means of financial support.  In a crisis economy and changing times as we're seeing right now, I want to help other families and individuals to open their own Gregory's franchise and share the wealth and independence from being their own bosses. Sweet potatoes in some form or another are grown and found the world over. When other cultures taste this "American Tradition" they fall in love with it. I want to see "Gregory's Sweet potato pies" in as many countries as you see "Coca Cola, and Mc Donalds."  Companies that expand and "mass-produce" their once "handmade" goodies, often lose that home made quality and taste, that brought them initial success.  My dream is to offer franchises to Cooking/baking families that will keep the recipe simple, delicious and home made, while enjoying a fast-growing profitable family business.  I think some of you as early investors will take advantage of the opportunity to one day manage your own "Gregory's" franchise.

          With your help, we can start in Hawaii and spread our success across the mainland U.S., through California and cross the country to the East coast and beyond. 

          I'm hoping to receive at least $15,000 to start this process.  We will return to Hawaii, secure a commercial kitchen temporarily, purchase ingredients, appropriate licenses, insurance and contact all customers on our extensive client list and resume pie production and sales.

        I am looking forward to returning to work and seeing my customers and serving them and their families.  Knowing them and watching their kids grow up on this delicious treat the way I did, is a tremendous joy to me.  I would love to share my delightful treats with you all (investors in this dream) in the way of reward perks for your generous contributions. 

              We will continue to run this campaign until we reach our funding goals.  All funds will be used for the purposes stated above.   At the age of 58 years, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me and the families that will be franchisors and partners in this venture.  Myself, like so many others have had dreams in our hearts postponed and even forgotten because of laziness, procrastination and fear of failure and even fear of success.  I am on FIRE right now to see this gift come to fruition! I see you all as my team and encouragement. I will remain in contact with all contributors and invite you all to visit our production facilities in Honolulu, once we are established there.   Thank you all from the bottom of my heart, for helping me to change my life! And Thank you Indiegogo...

story:
Be Heard

Getting your entire team involved in a social media campaign is a little like herding cats.  Every team member wants to help make your startup weekend, crowd funding campaign or event a success, but they inevitably forget to like, tweet or share all of the messages generated by the social media director.

Here at Kansas City Startup Weekend our team of designers, developers and business professionals is working to solve this problem.  Our solution?  Amp.

Amp is an app that allows your team's social media director to get the your message out using everyone's social accounts.  Amp allows your team members to tune into the team's channel to re-tweet and share each and every post your social media director generates.

Amp is secure - it allows your team members to amplify the team's message without sharing login credentials.  They simply install the Amp app, connect their accounts and tune into your channel.  That's it.


When your social media director posts on the team's channel, everyone's twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn account will automatically re-tweet, like and share the post.  This allows you to focus on creating a company, developing great software or planning a fantastic event.

We Need Early Adopters

We are looking for early adopters who want to use Amp to enhance their social media campaigns.  Whether you are promoting an Indiegogo campaign or a rock concert Amp can play an important role in making sure you are getting the most out of your team's social media presence.
We are looking for five customers who are willing to pledge $1 each and become alpha testers.  We need to know what features you want and how you might use the App to promote your team.
Our Team
The Amp team at Kansas City Startup Weekend is made up of experienced entrepreneurs, developers and business professionals.  We're dedicated, we're motivated and we're excited to be bringing this great app to the world:

Ryan Sipes - Lead Developer

A long time open source software developer Ryan has contributed to the Solus Project, GtK,DuckDuckGo and many others. He is a former systems administrator for the Northeast Kansas Library System. Ryan has extensive experience with datacenter management including the construction and maintenance of high availability virtualization systems.

Arron Atchison - Cloud Computing

Arron is a longtime Linux enthusiast with experience in virtualization, containers, and scaling services to meet user demands. Arron has an interest in Apache Mesos and Ubuntu MAAS and loves playing with different management tools like Ansible and Salt.

Joshua Montgomery - Developer

One of the few entrepreneurs in the United States to build a gigabit fiber network from scratch, Joshua brings more than 15 years of entrepreneurial experience to the Mycroft project. Joshua’s previous project, Wicked Broadband, has been featured in Wired, ArsTechnica and Forbes.

Miriam Gray - Marketing

Miriam is a Park University graduate with a strong marketing background.  Equipped with a pen rather than a sword, Miriam is a charming author of marketing copy.  A long time entrepreneur, she is able to look at a product or service, distill it to its essence and communicate with potential customers.

Kris Adair - Social Media Director

With more than 10 years of experience as a financial controller, Kris brings the Amp project expertise in financial planning, budgeting and accounting. In addition to her duties at Amp, Kris serves on the USD497 school board and is the director of the Lawrence Center for Entrepreneurship, a facility dedicated to helping entrepreneurs achieve success.

Zach Spears - Video Production

Zachary Spears is an up and coming young film maker. Among his many projects is his work on the film Jayhawkers by Kevin Wilmott. His enthusiasm for all things film is both contagious and endearing. Zach’s job is to help the team communicate the creativity and utility of the Mycroft platform by producing high quality videos and stills. http://zachspears.com/

Lionell Brown - Customer Relations

Nell is possibly the friendliest person in the State of Kansas.  He is the customer service director for Wicked Broadband where he is responsible for overseeing both the field technicians and the call center.  Lionell is also an entrepreneur who has been pursing mobile power technology in his spare time.

Jordan Sipes - Developer

Jordan is a talented developer with broad experience in desktop and mobile platforms.  He currenlty works as an application developer for SearchLawrence.com a local real estate search platform that integrates city, county and MLS records to create a cohesive picture of the local real estate market.

Derick Schweppe - Designer

Derick is an industrial design instructor at the University of Kansas where he shares his passion for design with talented students. Derick’s portfolio is filled with projects that help people develop emotional connections to the products they use every day. 

Amp's Impact

At Amp we are making the world a better place through shared social media promotion.  Amp teams will be able to use social media more effectively.  This will translate in to more successful social media campaigns.

The Kansas City Startup Weekend team behind Amp has participated in numerous successful Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns as well as several successful businesses.

Risks & Challenges

Our team is committed to developing a working version of Amp by the end of Kansas City Startup Weekend, however, even the most talented development team may not be able to implement a distributed social media tool like Amp in just 54 hours.  We may not be able to finish the product this weekend and may not be able to come back to the project later.  

Backers should understand that we are primarily looking to validate the market for this product and may not pursue the project after Kansas City Startup Weekend concludes.

If we are unable to complete the Amp app or decide not to pursue the project further we will cancel the campaign and refund all pledges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this app is a great idea and want to provide input into how we can make it better for your crowd funding campaign, tweet @krisadair.  She can connect you with our customer validation team so that we can get your input.

story:
Hello,

My name is Sasha, I have a wonderful husband and 4 amazing children.

At the beginning of the year my husband and I both got retrenched, we lost everything because of this and 3 of my children had to go stay with family as we could not support them anymore.

My husband started working for himself but as his business is still very small, we hardly make nearly enough to buy back what we lost and live. I have been actively seeking employment but unfortunately I still have not found anything. I have decided to start up my own business as sitting and waiting for a call back is not getting us anywhere.

 

My campaign is to raise funds towards my business. I need to buy a 3D printer. The basic concept is to 3D print 4D ultra sound images of expecting parents so they can have a unique keep safe that will last them for years to come of their special miracle. I plan on doing many other items as well but starting with this as its is close to my heart and I simply love the idea of being able to offer this to parents who can not afford the high prices hospitals charge to make these. 

 

I do not want to seem as though I take this for granted and would like to offer, to the kind people who help me a thank you by giving them either a discount on products or even a freebie of their choice depending of course on the amount funded (shipping not included). Please send me proof of payment to sasha.dream88@gmail.com so I can contact you for your freebie or discount!!

Anyone and everyone can help, even if you can not help with funds, you can help by sharing this with your friends, family, everyone, this site has many sharing tools available. Just by you sharing this, you are already helping me in a big way and I thank you, very much.

If I manage to raise enough funds and my business grows, I will be able to bring my children back, to bring them home and give them a life every parent wants to give their children, one without worry. Life may be hard at times and sometimes one needs a hand, today I reach out my hand to total strangers and ask for help, help me rebuild a better life....

story:
About Us

We are a group from Central Indiana who have a passion for connecting people to their communities. We are passionate about cycling and it's promotion, as well as lovers of good beer! 

Pedal Pub Bloomington is our way of bringing all of this to the city of Bloomington, IN. 

By contributing, you will be helping to bring a world class entertainment feature to a great city that will help to foster friendship and community, and better connect existing businesses. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $10,000 to help with build-out costs of our storefront and to allow pre-booking of the bikes while we get our booking software running and finalize  our operation with the city. 

In exchange for your support, we are offering several perks!

  • Early access to booking one of our first rides!
  • Exclusive founders edition merch
  • Naming rights to a bike
  • Many other items!

If we fail to reach our goal, we will use the funds raised to continue our build out of our retail space. 

 

The Impact

By contributing to Pedal Pub Bloomington, you are helping to better connect a community. 

We have a successful track record of founding and operating small businesses in Central Indiana, and are looking forward to bringing something this fun to a community that we love!

Our two bikes are due to arrive in Bloomington mid July, and we cannot wait to get them ready to take you on one of our fantastic routes!

 

Risks & Challenges

We have faced several challenges in launching Pedal Pub Bloomington, but the worst is behind us! Our largest remaining challenge it working with the city to obtain a liquor license to allow a BYOB policy onto the bikes. In the mean time we plan to operate without alcohol on board and to better promote and encourage our partner breweries and bars along our routes. 

We have an extensive amount of experience on our team navigating local government and are confident our mission to connect the community will be one that resonates and allows us to operate as other Pedal Pub locations do throughout the United States. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like and share our campaign on social media for your chance to win 2 free seats on a route and an awesome swag kit to keep you riding in style!
story_txt:
About Us
We are a group from Central Indiana who have a passion for connecting people to their communities. We are passionate about cycling and it's promotion, as well as lovers of good beer! 
Pedal Pub Bloomington is our way of bringing all of this to the city of Bloomington, IN. 
By contributing, you will be helping to bring a world class entertainment feature to a great city that will help to foster friendship and community, and better connect existing businesses. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise $10,000 to help with build-out costs of our storefront and to allow pre-booking of the bikes while we get our booking software running and finalize  our operation with the city. 
In exchange for your support, we are offering several perks!

Early access to booking one of our first rides!
Exclusive founders edition merch
Naming rights to a bike
Many other items!

If we fail to reach our goal, we will use the funds raised to continue our build out of our retail space. 
 

The Impact
By contributing to Pedal Pub Bloomington, you are helping to better connect a community. 
We have a successful track record of founding and operating small businesses in Central Indiana, and are looking forward to bringing something this fun to a community that we love!
Our two bikes are due to arrive in Bloomington mid July, and we cannot wait to get them ready to take you on one of our fantastic routes!
 

Risks & Challenges
We have faced several challenges in launching Pedal Pub Bloomington, but the worst is behind us! Our largest remaining challenge it working with the city to obtain a liquor license to allow a BYOB policy onto the bikes. In the mean time we plan to operate without alcohol on board and to better promote and encourage our partner breweries and bars along our routes. 
We have an extensive amount of experience on our team navigating local government and are confident our mission to connect the community will be one that resonates and allows us to operate as other Pedal Pub locations do throughout the United States. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Like and share our campaign on social media for your chance to win 2 free seats on a route and an awesome swag kit to keep you riding in style!

story:
Summary

  • Church’s Taphouse is the dream of three families that have come together and want to help local churches and organizations fulfill their mission and have a greater tangible impact on their community – Mike and Heather Smith, Mike Simpson and Jenna St Clair-Simpson and Zach and Karina Tanksley.
  • Our campaign is to raise money to open a not-for-profit Taphouse in Hillsboro, OR that will provide financial support to churches and organizations that are filling physical needs in people’s lives.  
  • Your donations will allow us to open the doors of Church’s Taphouse to the community which will then support churches and organizations that are feeding the hungry, housing the homeless and helping people in need.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our funding goal has been set at an ambitious $150000. With that we are looking to:
    • Secure a location in the AmberGlenn / Quatama neighborhood of Hillsboro, OR
    • Build out the location including plumbing, electrical, bar, custom tap system, bar stools and table & chairs, etc.
    • Acquire product (beer)
    • Any leftover funds will go to pay the lease of the facility
  • In return for you support of Church’s Taphouse, we have unique stickers, glasses and t-shirts that we’ll be sending out. Also, we have unique packages that allow you to become part of our community by choosing our beer flights and where are charitable contributions from those flights go (within the guideline that the organization is non-profit and is meeting a physical need for people). Also, you can become one of the Taphouse Elders getting yourself a custom pint glass and a personalized seat to keep at the Taphouse and free beer!
  • We realize that $150000 is an ambitious goal that we may not reach with just Indiegogo. Any funds raised with Indiegogo that fall short of this campaign goal will be added to other funds through subsequent campaigns with Indiegogo or elsewhere.  

The Impact

  • We believe that the christian church has a pretty simple mission: To love God, and to love people. Church’s Taphouse will help the church and other organizations love people by supplying financial support to churches and organizations that are making a tangible difference in people’s lives. It is our hope that this will encourage churches and organizations to become more involved with helping their communities.
  • With the combined experience of our team, we have over 50 years in planning and leading events, fundraisers and group programs.
  • This dream to open this Taphouse is 3 years or so in the making. It has survived childhood cancer, a parent dying from cancer, childhood accidents, job transitions, moving, etc. Basically, a whole lot of hard life. Helping churches and other non-profits support communities is something were very passionate about. Please join us on this journey… Because Beer Helps!

Risks & Challenges

  • Currently our biggest challenge is finding a location that allows us to be present in the neighborhood that we feel called to. There are several locations available, however as of Nov 2018, they are sublets and as such are more expensive.
  • We are open to locations on the fringe of the neighborhood that we’re looking into, but that would not be our first choice.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign with others that you think may be interested.
  • Share on social media.
  • If you are a tradesman (electrician, plumber, etc.) who is interested in helping us with our build out please contact Mike Smith at Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com
  • If you are a leasing agent or owner that with property in the AmberGlenn / Quatama neighborhood of Hillsboro, OR please contact Mike Smith at Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com
  • If you’re a leader of a local church or organization that would like to get involved, please email Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com
  • Please pray for us and this project.

Summary

Church’s Taphouse is the dream of three families that have come together and want to help local churches and organizations fulfill their mission and have a greater tangible impact on their community – Mike and Heather Smith, Mike Simpson and Jenna St Clair-Simpson and Zach and Karina Tanksley.
Our campaign is to raise money to open a not-for-profit Taphouse in Hillsboro, OR that will provide financial support to churches and organizations that are filling physical needs in people’s lives.  
Your donations will allow us to open the doors of Church’s Taphouse to the community which will then support churches and organizations that are feeding the hungry, housing the homeless and helping people in need.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal has been set at an ambitious $150000. With that we are looking to:
Secure a location in the AmberGlenn / Quatama neighborhood of Hillsboro, OR
Build out the location including plumbing, electrical, bar, custom tap system, bar stools and table & chairs, etc.
Acquire product (beer)
Any leftover funds will go to pay the lease of the facility


In return for you support of Church’s Taphouse, we have unique stickers, glasses and t-shirts that we’ll be sending out. Also, we have unique packages that allow you to become part of our community by choosing our beer flights and where are charitable contributions from those flights go (within the guideline that the organization is non-profit and is meeting a physical need for people). Also, you can become one of the Taphouse Elders getting yourself a custom pint glass and a personalized seat to keep at the Taphouse and free beer!
We realize that $150000 is an ambitious goal that we may not reach with just Indiegogo. Any funds raised with Indiegogo that fall short of this campaign goal will be added to other funds through subsequent campaigns with Indiegogo or elsewhere.  

The Impact

We believe that the christian church has a pretty simple mission: To love God, and to love people. Church’s Taphouse will help the church and other organizations love people by supplying financial support to churches and organizations that are making a tangible difference in people’s lives. It is our hope that this will encourage churches and organizations to become more involved with helping their communities.
With the combined experience of our team, we have over 50 years in planning and leading events, fundraisers and group programs.
This dream to open this Taphouse is 3 years or so in the making. It has survived childhood cancer, a parent dying from cancer, childhood accidents, job transitions, moving, etc. Basically, a whole lot of hard life. Helping churches and other non-profits support communities is something were very passionate about. Please join us on this journey… Because Beer Helps!

Risks & Challenges

Currently our biggest challenge is finding a location that allows us to be present in the neighborhood that we feel called to. There are several locations available, however as of Nov 2018, they are sublets and as such are more expensive.
We are open to locations on the fringe of the neighborhood that we’re looking into, but that would not be our first choice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign with others that you think may be interested.
Share on social media.
If you are a tradesman (electrician, plumber, etc.) who is interested in helping us with our build out please contact Mike Smith at Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com

If you are a leasing agent or owner that with property in the AmberGlenn / Quatama neighborhood of Hillsboro, OR please contact Mike Smith at Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com

If you’re a leader of a local church or organization that would like to get involved, please email Mike.smith@churchstapshouse.com

Please pray for us and this project.

story:
Do you want to escape the hustle of life by enjoying an luxury spa experience?

We want to pamper you with the comfort and warmth of nature, in the heart of Panama City! Our goal is  uplift, revive, renew and build confidence of the clients we serve. We believe pampering and self care experiences should be a regular part of life.

Our intimate modern spa environment offers you high-quality relaxation and exceptional guest service. Because our capacity is limited to a small number guests at any given time, you are guaranteed a relaxing experience whether alone or with a group of friends.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to build this uplifting spa experience! All of our crowdfunding pre-sales will help to pay for a portion of the spa construction costs and will allow us to offer you the ultimate healing experience. 

The $7,500 raised from this crowdfunding campaign will help cover additional costs for unique features that will enhance our guests' experiences, such as a Yoni Steam thrown seat and increased staff for more personalized care.

We are pre-selling a limited number of generously discounted Body Culture Spa visits  before our spa's relaunch this November.

 

Our Health & Wellness Impact

“Health is a state of the body, wellness is a state of being”

Sauna wraps and Yoni steams are an ancient form of healing used to cleanse the body and mind. It originated with native populations across the globe, with the Finnish sauna {SOW-NAH} being the most popular ritual we see today. The sauna is a place to retreat, cure what ails you and gather with friends to share in an uplifting experience.

Body Culture will provide a modern luxury take on the age-old sauna and Yoni steam tradition and the new methods of body contouring. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you want to support us in more ways than one? Please help us get the word out and share the link to our campaign page with your contacts via email, Facebook and Instagram. You can use the Indiegogo share tools above!

 

A Glimpse into our Spa Design and equipment upgrades. 

The spa design will provide guest with a modern yet cozy glam experience. Our equipment upgrade will allow us to triple the number of clients we can serve daily, provide three new jobs in our community, all while providing them greater body contouring results faster.

story:
NEW: Adding to our promise

When we launched this campaign, we felt that adding 18 million more works to Elog.io was a laudable goal in itself. Thanks to the generous help from Flickr, Safe Creative and Europeana, we may easily add much more than that within days of closing this campaign. We're likely talking about adding closer to 100 million more works to Elog.io.
This changes our campaign promise. While the goal of raising $6,000 remains the same, we'll be able to do more with what we get. We've included some of our use cases that we've built Elog.io with (see "What can Elog.io do?" below) and if we succeed in this campaign, we'll start working off that list to add more functionality to Elog.io.

Our campaign

There are billions of photographs on the Internet, but difficult or impossible to find any information about them. We've made Elog.io to make it easier to find information about photos. Giving people access to the provenance of a photo helps them understand who authored it, where it comes from, and makes it possible to build a range of awesome and innovative new tools (see below)!

Elog.io has a lot of promise to make the world a
better place for photographers and other visual
artists. - Jonathan Bailey @ Plagiarism Today

Stop and look at this photograph!

Do you know where this photo is from? Do you know who took it? This is a photo of the signing of the Geneva agreement on the settlement of the political situation around Afghanistan, taken by Eduard Pesov. If you didn't know that, chances are you'll think about the photo differently now that you do. 

Knowing the context in which a photograph appear changes the meaning of it. It changes the value of it. So it's a shame that many photos don't have this information available.

What more is, even when photographers try to include this information, social media sites like Facebook, Instagram and Twitter actively or by acts of negligence, remove such information when photos are shared.


Ever wondered where all these ‘history’ pics come from? http://t.co/lD3CG4bHre can be useful for identifing sources pic.twitter.com/KOefX9c6Zv

— Theo Kuechel (@TheoKL) December 14, 2014

This isn't just a theoretical problem. It has practical implications too. Knowing who authored something is essential to be able to give credit to that person, something that's required by many licenses used for photos. If you want to know whether you can include a photo you've found in your blog or not, you need to be able to figure out what license applies to it. The more you know about a photo you've found, the more you can do.

We developed Elog.io to make processes like these easier. At its core, Elog.io is a database specifically suited to store provenance information about any kind of digital work. Information which can be used by anyone. We've demonstrated how this works by building two plugins (one for Firefox and one for Chrome) that uses the information in Elog.io to give information about photo you find online, including giving credit to their authors, automatically. Because knowing the author of a photo is the start of a wonderful conversation and the beginning of unraveling the full context. 

http://t.co/fr7CLCouZB - a plugin that makes photo attribution easy and seamless. Life saver for editors, publishers, writers… h/t @RDBinns

— Tin Geber (@tingeber) December 16, 2014

What can Elog.io do?

Having access to the provenance of photos you find online allows you to find the source, author, and license information for that photo. It allows you to give credit, if you're required to do so, or if you want to provide attribution to the author. It allows individuals and businesses working with digital works to verify who authored something, and what the license information is. It can help people looking to find more works by the same author.
Elog.io works for any kind of media: books, photos, movies, songs. We've included some perks for photos that make them easier to find, but the technology powering Elog.io is generic. It is also completely Free and Open Source Software, allowing others to build upon the same technology to create new and amazing things.
When designing Elog.io, we went through very many use cases, to make sure that the design we came up with was able to fulfill all of them with little or no effort. Here's a list of what Elog.io could do:
  • Voluntary use tracking (you/your application notify Elog.io when you've used a work)
  • Semi-automatic use tracking (manually or automatic, our plugins take note of works that you see online that are uses of other works, and notifies Elog.io of this to make this knowledge known)
  • Crowd curation of metadata (improving the quality of the Elog.io data set by making it possible for the crowd to edit the information, with potential feedback loops to Wikimedia Commons, Europeana and other data sources)
  • Remix tracking (a variation of use tracking, but focusing on the needs of remixing communities)
  • Creator pingbacks (get notifications when your work is used elsewhere, or when its metadata is updated)
  • Create presentations (automatic credits inserted at the end of your Powerpoint or LibreOffice presentation)
  • License validation (verify the licenses of images in your document against Elog.io, for instance)
  • License traffic sign (automatically green, yellow or red light images when you copy them from the web, with a notice about the license terms)
  • Metadata scrubbed (a service to purposefully scrub metadata from images and the Elog.io catalog to verify that an author can not be identified that way, for people who want to avoid being connected with their works)
  • GLAM-visitor connection (presenting more information from a gallery, library, archive or museum about a work found online, encouraging deeper and more valuable connections between the institute and its potential visitors)
  • Vendor-neutral tagging of images (making it possible to make connections between people and objects featured in photos)
  • License chooser (make it easier to choose an open license based on what previous works you've included that might limit your choice of license)
  • Github for creators (version control and provenance tracking for the creative community - we actually replicated parts of the Github data model to facilitate this)
  • Private or public annotation of works (contribute your own metadata to a work, either publicly or privately just for you or a group you're part of)
  • License logging (make a persistent record that at a certain date, you used a work under a certain license, and have Elog.io keep this record for you, in case the original work license change)
  • Conflict resolution (record and provide ways to act when works have conflicting information, especially in cases of public domain works also being registered as copyrighted by an entity)
  • License & work lookup (make it possible for people or organisations that use or support openly licensed works to look them up in Elog.io to ascertain licenses, or verify that something is in the public domain)


Who am I?

I'm Jonas Öberg, a technologist, teacher, software developer, project manager, non-profit serial entrepreneur, husband and father from Sweden. While working as a regional coordinator for Creative Commons, I came to see how difficult it was for people to attribute correctly, even when they had the best intentions to do so (which isn't always the case). With the help of the Shuttleworth Foundation, I began working on a way to automate the process of attribution, building on the idea that giving people and computers access to the provenance of a work enables us to build tools that make use of that information in an intelligent way.

When we started working with Jonas, we thought it was just about automating the process of attribution, but we learned that there's more at stake here: knowing where a photograph comes and who took it is crucial to understand it. I'd never go to a museum or gallery that had no information about their exhibits! And I hope that I'll one day have that information when i browse the web too. - Helen Turvey, CEO Shuttleworth Foundation

Through that work, I realised that the attribution is the visible part of a larger issue; connecting the creators with the works that they have created, and providing context and history to works posted online. But having systems in place that support attribution, would also unravel a lot of other uses. For those viewing the works, it would give them the context to appreciate the works. It would add meaning and value, and offer ways to connect to the creator.

Just as almost anyone who has published something on the Internet, I've seen my work used and abused by others. I enjoy seeing the creative spark that one of my creations could inspire. But not giving credit takes something away. It takes away the connection between myself and my creation. It puts severe limits on how others perceive my work when they see it online. When they can not even find who authored the work, they're prevented from understanding the full context of it.

In this way, Elog.io is also a way to satisfy my own need: it creates the first steps towards creating the largest provenance store for digital works. It allows someone to be inspired by my work and create something new from it, safe in the knowledge that their new work will automatically link back to me, and to its source. As well as allowing someone to publish my work on their own web site or blog and have it automatically attributed and linked back to me. Persistent. Automatic.

The world according to Elog.io

Ever since we launched Elog.io, we've used community curated repositories of information. Databases where the community, not only the authors, have come together to curate information about photographs. We want to continue in this spirit, to ensure that the information in Elog.io is respected by the community, because in Elog.io is an implicit acknowledgement of respect for the creator and their wishes regarding their creations. Elog.io is saying "we know who created this, and we'll make sure this information is in Elog.io, so that we can provide consistent and accurate information about it for history."

From science to food, we all remix other people's work in order to create something new. Elog.io has the option of including information about the source of every work added. When creating a new song, it can be referenced back to the audio works in Elog.io that were used to create it, contributing to the tree of remixes. You could do this directly in Elog.io, but it'll be more powerful when it's integrated in the tools you use to create.

elog.io is a great plugin/API that makes photo attribution easy & seamless. @elog_io hope to see a wordpress integration soon ! #commons

— lilian ricaud (@lilious) January 5, 2015

Elog.io isn't just about photographs though, it's about media. We've purposefully built Elog.io using a standard from the W3C (the ones who build standards for the Web) that's called Media Annotation. It can cover video, audio, images, and a whole bunch of other stuff too. If you can build it, we're pretty sure that Elog.io can describe it.

How we'll use the money

We'll use the money from this campaign to get 18 million additional photographs under open licenses or in the public domain into Elog.io, and we'll provide documentation and instructions for how you and others can provide information to Elog.io. That's the only thing we'll promise. If we stretch beyond our goal, we'll put all of those resources into expanding on our promise. We could do 40 millions, 100 millions, or more.

Our budget

Specifically, the costs that we have to look forward to for the period of March 2015 – June 2015 are:

  • Salary for one developer, $1150 per month = $4,600

  • IndieGoGo fees (ca 4-9% + 25 USD) = $480

  • Hosting fees (database server & storage), $60 per month = $240

  • Rewards = $680

What if shipping & rewards cost more than $680? Don't worry, we've got that covered from our own pockets. Most of the shipping costs are already pre-paid, as are a bunch of t-shirts. We estimate the additional cost of $680 to cover the rewards, but this varies up and down depending on how many contributors we have to the campaign and what rewards they select.

Credits

  • Video from 31c3 conference in Hamburg, 2013. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0.
  • Video background music by Ian Alex Mac, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0.
  • Xkcd comic by Randall Munroe, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 2.5
  • The combined video by Jonas Öberg, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0.
  • Black and white photograph of the signing of the Geneva agreement by Eduard Pesov. From the RIA Novosti archive, image #827168. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0.
  • Photo of Jonas Öberg by Kristina Alexanderson. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 2.0.
  • Icons from participants of the Noun Project, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 United States. Icons used include works by David Fauveau (medal icon), Misirlou (media icon), Brennan Novak (network icon), Wilson Joseph (chart icon), Björn Andersson (lock icon), and SuperAtic LABS (puzzle icon). Public domain works from the Noun Project used include the icon of a community garden, created during an Iconathon, and the help icon by Nice and Serious.

Github for creators (version control and provenance tracking for the creative community - we actually replicated parts of the Github data model to facilitate this)
Private or public annotation of works (contribute your own metadata to a work, either publicly or privately just for you or a group you're part of)
License logging (make a persistent record that at a certain date, you used a work under a certain license, and have Elog.io keep this record for you, in case the original work license change)
Conflict resolution (record and provide ways to act when works have conflicting information, especially in cases of public domain works also being registered as copyrighted by an entity)
License & work lookup (make it possible for people or organisations that use or support openly licensed works to look them up in Elog.io to ascertain licenses, or verify that something is in the public domain)

Who am I?

I'm Jonas Öberg, a technologist, teacher, software developer, project manager, non-profit serial entrepreneur, husband and father from Sweden. While working as a regional coordinator for Creative Commons, I came to see how difficult it was for people to attribute correctly, even when they had the best intentions to do so (which isn't always the case). With the help of the Shuttleworth Foundation, I began working on a way to automate the process of attribution, building on the idea that giving people and computers access to the provenance of a work enables us to build tools that make use of that information in an intelligent way.When we started working with Jonas, we thought it was just about automating the process of attribution, but we learned that there's more at stake here: knowing where a photograph comes and who took it is crucial to understand it. I'd never go to a museum or gallery that had no information about their exhibits! And I hope that I'll one day have that information when i browse the web too. - Helen Turvey, CEO Shuttleworth Foundation
Through that work, I realised that the attribution is the visible part of a larger issue; connecting the creators with the works that they have created, and providing context and history to works posted online. But having systems in place that support attribution, would also unravel a lot of other uses. For those viewing the works, it would give them the context to appreciate the works. It would add meaning and value, and offer ways to connect to the creator.
Just as almost anyone who has published something on the Internet, I've seen my work used and abused by others. I enjoy seeing the creative spark that one of my creations could inspire. But not giving credit takes something away. It takes away the connection between myself and my creation. It puts severe limits on how others perceive my work when they see it online. When they can not even find who authored the work, they're prevented from understanding the full context of it.
In this way, Elog.io is also a way to satisfy my own need: it creates the first steps towards creating the largest provenance store for digital works. It allows someone to be inspired by my work and create something new from it, safe in the knowledge that their new work will automatically link back to me, and to its source. As well as allowing someone to publish my work on their own web site or blog and have it automatically attributed and linked back to me. Persistent. Automatic.
The world according to Elog.io
Ever since we launched Elog.io, we've used community curated repositories of information. Databases where the community, not only the authors, have come together to curate information about photographs. We want to continue in this spirit, to ensure that the information in Elog.io is respected by the community, because in Elog.io is an implicit acknowledgement of respect for the creator and their wishes regarding their creations. Elog.io is saying "we know who created this, and we'll make sure this information is in Elog.io, so that we can provide consistent and accurate information about it for history."
From science to food, we all remix other people's work in order to create something new. Elog.io has the option of including information about the source of every work added. When creating a new song, it can be referenced back to the audio works in Elog.io that were used to create it, contributing to the tree of remixes. You could do this directly in Elog.io, but it'll be more powerful when it's integrated in the tools you use to create.

elog.io is a great plugin/API that makes photo attribution easy & seamless. @elog_io hope to see a wordpress integration soon ! #commons— lilian ricaud (@lilious) January 5, 2015

Elog.io isn't just about photographs though, it's about media. We've purposefully built Elog.io using a standard from the W3C (the ones who build standards for the Web) that's called Media Annotation. It can cover video, audio, images, and a whole bunch of other stuff too. If you can build it, we're pretty sure that Elog.io can describe it.
How we'll use the money
We'll use the money from this campaign to get 18 million additional photographs under open licenses or in the public domain into Elog.io, and we'll provide documentation and instructions for how you and others can provide information to Elog.io. That's the only thing we'll promise. If we stretch beyond our goal, we'll put all of those resources into expanding on our promise. We could do 40 millions, 100 millions, or more.
Our budget
Specifically, the costs that we have to look forward to for the period of March 2015 – June 2015 are:

Salary for one developer, $1150 per month = $4,600
IndieGoGo fees (ca 4-9% + 25 USD) = $480
Hosting fees (database server & storage), $60 per month = $240
Rewards = $680

What if shipping & rewards cost more than $680? Don't worry, we've got that covered from our own pockets. Most of the shipping costs are already pre-paid, as are a bunch of t-shirts. We estimate the additional cost of $680 to cover the rewards, but this varies up and down depending on how many contributors we have to the campaign and what rewards they select.
Credits

Video from 31c3 conference in Hamburg, 2013. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0.

Video background music by Ian Alex Mac, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0.
Xkcd comic by Randall Munroe, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 2.5
The combined video by Jonas Öberg, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0.
Black and white photograph of the signing of the Geneva agreement by Eduard Pesov. From the RIA Novosti archive, image #827168. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0.
Photo of Jonas Öberg by Kristina Alexanderson. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 2.0.
Icons from participants of the Noun Project, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 United States. Icons used include works by David Fauveau (medal icon), Misirlou (media icon), Brennan Novak (network icon), Wilson Joseph (chart icon), Björn Andersson (lock icon), and SuperAtic LABS (puzzle icon). Public domain works from the Noun Project used include the icon of a community garden, created during an Iconathon, and the help icon by Nice and Serious.

story:
A place for Utah Airsofters to call home.

You know us as Rad and Ajax, airsofters and Owner/Operators of Tactical Airsoft Supply. We have been airsofters since 2002 and we've been supplying and supporting the local scene since 2007. Over the years we have hosted hundreds of local games, fostered teams, supported players and developed airsoft fields. We have consistently grown the sport by sharing media of Utah's amazing day and night games to the world. We have also helped innovate the sport by researching and developing improvements in guns and game play. 

We now feel that it is the right time for us to take the next step. It is our ambition to provide sustainable indoor arenas for the Weber/Davis/Salt lake and Utah counties and beyond. We also aspire to facilitate an eventual outdoor field for the entire community to enjoy. We know we cant do it without your support.

With your support we hope that we can move towards our goals together, starting with our Layton Arena. This Arena will be approx 10,000 sq feet and highly detailed with walls, furniture, fixtures and obstacles. We have the conveniently located Layton property currently under contract and we are confident that with your support we will soon be able to buy it and immediately start development. Your contribution will show us that we have your blessing to make this happen for the Utah Airsoft community and we will work tirelessly to make our ideas into a reality. 

We are asking for $10k to cover part of the property closing costs, fire suppression system and building costs of our Layton arena. Any additional funds generated will go to outfitting the interior field and making it detailed and amazing. We will be offering some cool perks such as:  Krytac AEG give away, your name on our wall of contributors and unlimited access to the arena during the testing and development phase.  We are also giving away an RK74 CQB, GC16 Predator Full metal body Battleship grey, GC16 Full metal Warthog 7" and a CM16 300 BOT. All courtesy of G&G Armament. 

In the unlikely chance we do not acquire our Layton property, we will be sure to reimburse 100% of any of the funds generated by this campaign. 

Our success is your success, we hope to finally bring to you a safe place to play airsoft without super long commutes or bad weather days. We have been in this sport for such a long time that our commitment should speak for itself and you can trust that we will do our best to make this idea into a reality as a united community.

There are many ways to help us achieve our goals if you cannot contribute monetarily. Supporting our local shops will further push us towards making our arenas a reality. Also, you can share, and re-share our campaign to inform everyone that we need their support.

Thanks so much for reading!

Rad and Ajax

story:
Short Summary

My name's Aaron Hampton, Co-Founder of Breakout Mobile. For about the last half of my life I've worked in the industrial sector. For nearly half of THAT, I've been involved in new technology and solving the problems related to that technology. Needless to say... I'm a problem solver. I run up against a problem, I want to solve it.

In my career, I've run into a few like minded individuals. One of those individuals introduced me to a type of real life puzzle games called escape rooms. The short version is that you take a team into a room, are given a scenario and a time limit then work as a team to solve riddles, puzzles and other challenges to 'get out' in time. It's unlike anything else I've ever done and I'm HOOKED.

We at Breakout-Mobile are trying to make it a little easier for the guys and gals in the office to step away from the desk for an hour and recharge. We want to build rooms and send them to work campuses so that workers can break out of their office and come back to work feeling like they can do anything. We need your help to fund the first room and get this thing moving.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $60,000 to set Breakout-mobile in motion.

We'll greenlight the project with $45,000 if necessary.

The first $30,000 will go towards procuring a mobile platform and furnishing it for the scenario.

Another $5,000 are set aside for taxes, insurance, services, etc.

The final $25,000 will be held in reserve for operating expenses as we build a name for ourselves and begin seeing more customers each day. While it's extremely comforting to have operating capital in reserve, it's a soft target. We'll be able to move forward with around $10,000 in a pinch. 

In exchange for your support, we're going to be offering up Breakout-Mobile Keychains, Tee-shirts, Group discount vouchers, Pre-paid group events, Opportunities to influence future rooms and Even a weekend brainstorming session with the folks at Breakout.

Risks & Challenges

As we see it, the biggest risk to success lies in the support of the community.

If we don't bring quality entertainment to the table, or aren't given a chance to show everyone what a great product we have, we're going to struggle.

On the plus side, we're SURROUNDED by the right kind of people to make this work. Escape rooms are wildly popular here. We're just taking it a step further and bringing the experience to the end customer.

Our team has been involved in startups for the last 10 years. We're familiar with doing whatever it takes to finish a job; we're used to highs and lows and digging deep when you're exhausted but can see the light at the end of the tunnel.

I've personally managed facilities and teams and am excited to bring this dream to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find you're sympathetic to our cause but for some reason can't lend financial support, we'd love your support sharing our story!

We're going to be relying heavily on word of mouth and (hopefully) a reputation that draws people back to our rooms for new and exciting challenges.

Tweet about us, Tell your friends about us, Make a post about us on Facebook... Anything and everything helps and we appreciate your support!

story:
Grocery shopping just got a whole lot easier!

Hello everybody, my name is Cole Stanley and I am the founder and owner of Conessen Worldwide. I wanted to create a different type of shopping experience that would bring the foodstuffs and groceries of the world right to you. Instead of having multiple accounts with different foodstuffs providers, you can order right from one convenient location on our website.
The goal is that you will be able to order foods from other countries and have it delivered right to your door without having to worry about hunting your favourites down or those exorbitant fees associated with more traditional methods of acquiring the goods online. This service will work both from and to the US and other countries whether you want your favourite cereal from the US or are anxious to try that new pastry from Finland you've been hearing about and supported countries will be rolling out every month as a result. 

I devised this company after wrestling with my inability to acquire my favourite candies from Sweden, Ahlgrens Bilar, which are the absolute BEST candies that I have had (so far), easily and affordably. 

When I had this issue and found that other websites would either charge me $15 PLUS shipping for an 8oz bag of the candies or simply not have them in stock, I devised a way for people in other places in the world to be able to get their own country-specific grocery products sent to them anywhere in the world for both less than the other guys, and with more variety than they were probably used to.

This service is particularly great for expats or those who are in the military or family members of those who are, who cannot get the foods they are used to or want in the place they currently live and provides the ability to continue to grocery shop as you would normally, and not have to worry about tracking down the foods specifically wanted.

In addition, the service provides a way to have daily, weekly, monthly, semi-annually, or annual delivery of products. Therefore, if someone wants to get almost all of their Christmas food shopping done in July, they have the ability to make it happen and can schedule the delivery of the goods on a specific day and simply get right to work preparing their Christmas meal the day before without having to go out to the store or having to search far and wide for their family's favourite type of stuffing or candy canes. It is in this way that convenience becomes a factor as there isn't a service that allows you to place ADVANCE orders and only get charged when the item is fulfilled, not right away.  

The question of funding:

We are currently searching for about $100,000 in funding to support our endeavors in multiple regards. As this is a startup, it can get very expensive, very fast and as a result there is a monetary buffer built into my goal so that if anything inevitably happens unexpectedly that increases our costs, we will be able to cover it. 

The monetary breakdown is as follows and is a basic representation of what we expect costs to be: 

Workspace overhead: $6,525/year.

Website hosting and development expenses:

Hosting: $199.99/year.

Continual Development: $500.

Domain: $12.99/year.

Advertising: $5000 for paper, artistic, online, and offline advertising as well as video advertising.

Accounting and taxes:

$258.72/year for accounting software, plus approximately $500 for taxes for the first year.

Working capital for expansion, promotions, design, shipping negotiations, credit file opening and maintaining, inventory procurement, and other miscellaneous expenses including contractors and expanding into the Canadian and European markets: $75,500.

Telephone and technology expenses:

$313.80/year. 

Indiegogo and payment processing fees: $5000

General Business Insurance: $5000/year. 

We have included a $1,189.50 padding for any costs that stray from what has been estimated and if we raise more than our goal, all proceeds will go into providing working capital so that we may expand our offerings faster and potentially hire more people than originally planned to assist in this endeavor. 

Perks will be fulfilled upon the opening of our online store. Coupon codes will be e-mailed to those who have earned discounted or free service and it will be your responsibility to input the codes to receive your perk(s) upon ordering your products. Some time after donating, you will receive an email breaking down what you have earned and instructions for redemption. Please remember that it is your responsibility to input all the codes correctly and at the time of your order.

This ecommerce solution for your everyday grocery needs will open regardless of the funding outcome, but it can open faster and more smoothly with the correct amount of funding and support from everyone and their friends and family! 

That being said, in the (hopefully) unlikely event we do not attain our goal for whatever reason, we will reprioritize the funds to pay what needs to be paid first; and, of course, fulfill all redeemed perks. 

Social impact:

We believe that the world is far too divided for its own good and that the fact people are hesitant to share new foods, let alone new ideas and processes, are part of the reason there is significant conflict in the world about who or what is "better" or "worse" than what we individually know. 

This company aims to eventually break down those borders and allow people anywhere in the world, not to just enjoy their own home country's foodstuffs, but also to be curious and order foodstuffs from different places to try something new and learn about a new culture or process. This in turn can allow people to open up to new ideas and become more worldly citizens than they were before they stumbled upon us.

At Conessen Worldwide, we're trying to break down social borders once and for all, and while we doubt we will stop all the fighting and challenges in the world, we endeavor to open the collective world's mind up to new cuisine and new experiences that they may have never thought about trying beforehand. 

There's bound to be SOMETHING:

As with all new ventures, things tend to not go as planned a lot of the time, and therefore, I am building that into this campaign so that you are aware of the challenges we currently are looking at.
At the moment, the main issue is developing effective partnerships and the fees that go along with them. Rather than compete with these providers, my company supplements what one company doesn't have, with another company that DOES have the item. Making the order seamless to consumers. In order to do that, steps have to be taken to make both orders arrive at the same time and to allow for minimal effort on both parties, the consumer, and the supplier (the business). 

Any help is good help:

We totally understand if you aren't able to help fund our campaign and appreciate all the support that you can show us.

As such, please be sure to click the links below and like/share our page on Facebook/Twitter and subscribe to our mailing list by e-mailing support@conessen.net. Please also be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools and to spread the word about this new shopping solution in your community! 
It is in this way we can continue to grow, while still being able to keep you in the loop about all of our latest developments. 
If anyone has a question about what we do, how the funds are being used, or if you simply want to say something nice, please email us at: support@conessen.net and/or comment on one of our profiles at the aforementioned websites. Thank you everyone and we'll continue to keep you updated on this endeavor as it's far from over!

story:
Update as of 11/29/2015 unfortunately I will have to cancel this campaign do to having to back out of my lease.. So there will be no business opening at this time until I find another space. Thank You for your understanding, and if you have donated to this project you will be refunded. 

Hello my name is Sky Geller. Some  of you may know me already, given that be family, friends and or social media, but for those that don't, let me start out by telling you a little about myself. I'm a mother, soon to be up and coming small business owner and collector of the MACABRE. I have a deep passion for Osteology along with History. I have worked in retail for the past 11 years and have been collecting for 9 years, actively for the past 4. Recently I have gotten the opportunity to be in a book project entitled "Collectors Of The Macabre" with Laurence King Publications of London and editor Paul Gambino. Most of my collection will be published in the beginning of next year 2016.  Twelve other collectors and I were carefully selected for this project, along with Evan Michelson, Ryan Mathew Cohn, Brent Stuart, Nathan Roberts and Calvin Von Crush just to name a few.  My collecting interests are Real Human Bone, Poisons and Medical items but not limited too.  I purchase all my pieces 100% legally through museums, archaeologist, professors, doctors and other collectors like myself.

My collection is growing frequently which has prompted my decision into opening my own business / museum in entitled "St. Augustine Skull & Bone Museum", which I am rather overjoyed about. This projects had been in the works for the past two years now and I am so excited to say that on the 1st of November I am singing a lease on a small cute little spot on Spanish Street in down town historic St Augustine, for those of you that know about this ancient city I'm sure you would agree this is more then a great spot to open such a project of this nature. Given the local ghost tours, pub crawls and Flagler collage students this has great educational purposes. 

With this news, I am hoping that you will consider helping me fund my business as one that will be welcomed by all patrons, both tourist and locals alike. The Skull & Bone will bring a unique and diverse outlook on, Osteology, Anatomy, History and Visual Arts.

I'm looking forward to being able to reach my goal and open doors as soon as possible.  Your contributions will mainly go towards educational hand built custom displays and some initial buisness coast setups.  I am starting out small do to expenses, and limited space available in the town. I myself have high hopes for expansion and making the Skull & Bone a permit fixture in St. Augustine Florida. With an estimate of 3.7-5 million visitors a year. 

NOTE! The skull pictured will be on display and along with 20 plus other displays. 

Xxx. Also to any collectors that want to join in this project by donating a skull of choice, I will have a designated wall for us collectors and will place a plaque or document of your choice with your contact name, business, email and or social media next to your skull donation. Creativity is encouraged! xxX

Thank you for reading and considering my project, feedback is more then welcomed. Sky

story:
What are our objectives?​

With your generous donation, we will utilize the resources given to us to further promote our company, lower the cost of our products for those in need and continue to serve as a lending hand to those that struggle financially. Once our business gets on its feet financially, we will begin to make regular donations to charitable foundations and homeless shelters.

Why is our company different from the pack?

Deploy Express is proud to say that we only supply products that have an extensively great record in terms of overall safety, quality and customer satisfaction so customers can be ensured that they never have to send something back!

 

What we need & What you get .

As a business hampered with overwhelming startup fees and equipment expenses, we need YOUR help to launch our business and with it look forward to spreading the message that “We all need somebody to lean on”. We are looking at a $6000 US funding goal. Donations surpassing the goal are most welcome and much appreciated. Remember, a donation even as small as a $1 counts and would be greatly appreciated! As for the contributors, there are tokens of appreciation that will be available to you upon your donation and for every $50 dollars donated, you will receive a complimentary T-Shirt with your name on the back and our company logo on the front!

What will we do with the funds?

Below are the necessities that the funds will be going towards in order to get the business  up and running.

Employee Training is one of the biggest expenses to starting our business, as we hire new people to enter in our business, we must train them using the same great training mechanisms we were trained with, which include books, seminars and tutorials on how to do the job correctly. The estimated expense for new employee training are estimated to cost three thousand dollars.

Technological costs also contribute significantly to our expenses, including the purchasing of newer technological gadgets to further enhance our professionalism when conversing with clients. Along with the cost of newer technological equipment, the costs of building a secure website contribute to our expenses. The reason for the creation of a highly secure website used for transactions would be to prevent anyone with malicious intent from stealing and releasing the information of our customers - something we take very seriously. The overall technological expenses are estimated to cost three thousand dollars.
