story: Freetii is still in its development phase and minor design changes may be made.  As with any product development, there are risks associated with tooling, tolerancing, coatings, durability, freight and the like.  Manufacturing and distributing Freetii is a complex process and there is a possibility that factors beyond our control affect our ability to meet delivery forecasts.  We have selected a date that is achievable without working in any fat as a contingency.  We respectively ask that you please only back the campaign if delivery date slippage is not a concern to you.
story_txt:
______________________________

We have moved. The Freetii project is relaunching on Kickstarter on July 19 with further discounts.  Visit freetii.com to register your interest.  
Preview:
http://kck.st/1SASCas

______________________________











Loose leaf tea is known for its premium quality and refined taste, yet we consume a huge amount more of bagged tea. The lure of convenience that bagged tea offers seems to overshadow our desire for quality.

FreetiiTM is the all in one premium tea infusing mug and yes, as the intro alludes, we're boasting how convenient it is.








The patented innovation is in the two piece mug design which allows you to effortlessly prepare loose leaf tea with a simple load, twist, and pour. Freetii is ideal for iced tea lovers and those that enjoy a healthy herbal infusion.  



















Freetii is great for making herbal tea, you can make herbal tea in three simple steps; place tea in the base, twist on the top mug attachment and pour in boiling water.  With the travel version of Freetii, you only need to place the lid thereafter and you can be on your way while your tea is still infusing. 

LOOSE LEAF HERBAL TEA
Freetii's continuous steeping design holds the tea leaves in the bottom portion of the mug while the top portion is filtered ready for you to enjoy at any time.






FRESH LEAF HERBAL TEAIf you can resist the lure of convenience that dried loose leaf tea offers, making tea from fresh ingredients has added health benefits. Herbalists recommend fresh over dried because some active ingredients are compromised during the drying process.
Freetii's features include a 'mortar and pestle' and a 'knife and chopping board' all designed to conveniently cut, chop and press fresh herbs. The advantage of using these utensils to prepare your tea is that the juices and in turn mess is contained within the inner surfaces of the mug. 









Freetii is great for making iced tea, there are two methods in which you can prepare iced tea using Freetii; cold water infusion, and hot water infusion.   
Cold Water InfusionIf time is on your side cold water infusion is a very convenient way to make iced tea.  Simply place loose leaf tea, cold water, and raw cane sugar in the mug.  Pop the travel lid on and place Freetii in the fridge overnight.  In the morning your iced tea is ready is ready to take with you.  This is a variation of sun tea (where the sun is used to warm the water which fastens the process).  
Hot Water InfusionTo make iced tea quickly, use hot water infusion.  Place loose leaf black tea in the wooden part of the mug, twist on the clear part of the mug and add boiling water.  Allow the tea to steep for the amount of time you desire, then add corn syrup, ice, cold water, and any flavour hints like lemon or peach.  Although the tea stays in the mug the ice cold water will slow the steeping process preventing your tea from going bitter (view the 30-second demo of this preparation method under the 'More Info' heading). 










MUG  $26.00 + Shipping ($8-$12)(1) Mortar, (1) Pestle, (1) Mug Top, (1) Coaster




TRAVEL MUG  $29.00+ Shipping  ($8-$12)(1) Mortar, (1) Pestle, (1) Mug Top, (1) Coaster, (1) Knife, (1) Lid
GIFT SET$56.00 + Shipping ($10-$14)(1) Mug, (1) Travel Mug, (1) Herbal Tea Book








FREETII FOR HEALTH
Some health professionals have concerns about the chemicals used to make some tea bags.  Dr. Mercola published an article "Tea Bags - A Surprising Source of Potential Toxins".  View article.  Freetii parallels the convenience of bagged tea so that you can enjoy quick and effortless loose leaf tea and have peace of mind that your tea is free of toxins.

Freetii is designed to get the most out of your herbal tea. It does this in three ways; no loss of oil and juice during the transfer from mortar to mug, the continuous steeping design, and by containing the nutrients through the use of the cover during steeping.



 



FREETII FOR THE ENVIRONMENT
As well as health benefits there are environmental benefits for using loose leaf over bagged tea.  Rebecca Smithers from The Guardian reports that the "vast majority (of tea bags) are only 70-80% biodegradable".   View article.Freetii is designed with environmental design principles at the forefront.  At the end of Freetii's life, Freetii can be easily dismantled into the individual material types for recycling.  An even better option is to repurpose Freetii, Freetii is a mortar and pestle after all.  A sustainable wood is very important, the mortar and pestle are made from fast-growing acacia which is regarded as one of the most sustainable wood types.  
FREETII FOR TASTE
It is widely regarded that whole loose leaf tea has a better flavour than bagged tea.  This can be attributed to three main reasons:
1. bagged tea is usually made from low tea grades, such as dust and fannings which tend to lose their flavour containing oils quicker.
2. bagged tea is usually a mixed blend from various sources and regions, whereas whole leaf tea is usually a specialty tea from a specific region. 
3. The conventional bag limits the infusion because of the restricted area that the tea is contained within.  






 


 by Neil Strohbeck
When I was young I asked my older brother's friend Derryn who was a passionate innovator what idea he was currently working on?  He replied, "tell me a problem and I'll tell you an idea".  It bugged me because he never did answer my question.  However, the words stuck with me and his influence forever made me see problems in a new light.   
The idea for Freetii came about when I was making fresh peppermint tea to ease an unsettled stomach.  After pressing the fresh peppermint leaves, and transferring them into my mug, I noticed a lot of the oil and juice was left in the mortar and I couldn't find an effective way of transferring it into my mug.  I was faced with a problem, so off I went, the creative cogs started turning and the desire to develop a solution resulted in Freetii. 
It was exciting developing Freetii because it evolved far beyond our expectations. The initial concept was a tea-pot with herb pressing functionality.  After questioning why things are the way they are the concept for the two piece mug was conceptualised.  As we resolved the finer details it evolved, progressively adding more functions until it became the multipurpose, multifunctional  mug that is Freetii.




Enter our competition to win a Freetii.  Entry takes just 15 seconds.  Entry Form.

 





   


The Freetii herbal tea book will inspire you to get out and try some different teas. It features herbs that help with relaxation, sleep, settling an upset stomach and much more. The book is focused on ingredients you may already have growing in your garden and herbs you can easily forage for.  It's a free download from freetii.com.






Avooq is a start-up product innovations company based in Melbourne, Australia.  We are old friends from our primary school years that lost contact but coincidentally enrolled in the same university course studying Product Design Engineering.  A few years later our shared passion for design lead us to start Avooq together.  View our creations at avooq.com.  












30 Second Promo:30 Second Promo:


A comprehensive list of Frequently Asked Questions can be found here

A special thanks to Gina Brown for the photography.  
A big thanks to Natalie Dahanawake, Nicole Goldup, Rebecca Keen, and Caitlin Morley for their contributions.








 Freetii is still in its development phase and minor design changes may be made.  As with any product development, there are risks associated with tooling, tolerancing, coatings, durability, freight and the like.  Manufacturing and distributing Freetii is a complex process and there is a possibility that factors beyond our control affect our ability to meet delivery forecasts.  We have selected a date that is achievable without working in any fat as a contingency.  We respectively ask that you please only back the campaign if delivery date slippage is not a concern to you.

story:
For the english description go to Bionove.de en version.

Wir sind Alexander Hofmann und Henry Hofmann.

Ich, Alexander Hofmann bin seit 2000 in der Gastronomie tätig. 2006 habe ich in Berlin zusammen mit einem Kompagnon den Pizza Lieferservice P.A.M. aufgebaut, der auch immer noch erfolgreich existiert. Allerdings habe ich meinen Anteil 2007 an meinen Kompagnon verkauft, da ich ein unwiderstehliches Angebot in Dänemark bekommen habe. Mein Sohn Henry Hofmann ist IT Spezialist und teilt meine Affinität für die Gastronomie und wird sich unter anderem um den IT Bereich in unserem zukünftigen Unternehmen kümmern.

Wir möchten die Berliner Gastronomie mit einem weiteren Highlight bereichern.

Unser Angebot umfasst Pizza, Pasta und Burger zubereitet ausschließlich aus Bio-Zutaten. Jedes Gericht das wir anbieten,wird es auch als veganes Pendant geben. Eine Große Auswahl an frischen Salaten und Smoothies runden das Angebot ab. Selbstverständlich bieten wir nur Biogetränke an. Um unseren Ernährungsbewussten Kunden die Auswahl zu erleichtern, versehen wir alle Speisen mit einer Kalorien Angabe.

Aber wir wollen noch mehr. Unser Konzept beinhaltet auch den weitestgehendsten Verzicht auf Einwegverpackung. Wir liefern unsere Speisen in speziellen Transportgefäßen aus, die der Fahrer gleich wieder mitnimmt. Dadurch entsteht weder für den Kunden, noch für uns Müll und entlastet die Umwelt. Unsere frisch gemixten Smoothies liefern wir in Glas-Pfandflaschen aus.

Die Auslieferung erfolgt, der Umwelt zuliebe, mit Elektrofahrzeugen.

Für die Einrichtung und Gestaltung unseres Geschäfts sowie für die besonderen Transportgefäße und die Anschaffung der Elektrofahrzeuge, benötigen wir  noch 35000,- €

Natürlich gibt es für alle Unterstützer ein speziellen Perk

Für

5€ gibt es eine Urkunde und die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren.

                                              



10€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren und ein Gratis Essen incl. Getränk   

     +   


20€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren und ein 2er Set Pflanzensamen in der Dose (Tomate, Basilikum)

     +   


50€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren und ein 3er Set Pflanzen in der Dose (Tomate,Basilikum,Chili)

     +   

100€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren, sowie ein 3er Set Pflanzen in der Dose (Tomate, Basilikum, Chilli) und auch 5 Gutscheine jeweils für ein kostenloses Essen incl. Getränk

 +  +


500 € gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren und die persönliche „Silbercard“ (10% (maximal 20€)Nachlass auf jede Bestellung,Lebenslang)


1000€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu platzieren und die persönliche „Goldcard“ (50% (maximal 20€)Nachlass auf jede Bestellung,Lebenslang)


5000€ gibt es eine Urkunde, die Möglichkeit einen Link* auf unserer Seite zu plazieren und die persönliche „Blackcard“ (1 Essen und 1 Getränk frei pro Bestellung,Lebenslang)


    *ausgenommen sind Politische, Erotische, oder Rechts-Radikale Seiten.

story:
My name is THEOPHILUS AYEH as project coordinator for HEALTH FOR ALL VILLAGES here in Ghana.I have been working in the rural areas of Ghana for over 15 years in trying to assist the younger generation realise their future dreams.

There is one area where my contribution fall short and thus is GOOD HEALTH for this generation,in view of this i am appealing to all to donate to this worthy course so to uplift the growing status of these vulnerable young ones in our villages.

I am currently working in 15 unmotorable communities.

Donations will be channeled to the procurement of drugs,materials,organising communal labours,tree planting exercise,health education programs.

My project currently run on about 20 volunteers both expats and ghanaian students.

We therefore appeal to you to kindly donate to this worthy course.

THANK YOU

story:
Inter-Urban Farms - 

Bringing the future of farming to Columbus, Ohio

Inter-Urban Farms needs your help to raise $85,000 to bring the Leafy Green Machine from Freight Farms to Columbus, Ohio. This self-contained vertical farm will grow fresh produce year-round and be sold to local businesses and individuals. Our grander vision is to not only to promote sustainable urban agriculture, but also train local employees in personal and professional development. 

By creating an opportunity for people to grow and sell food within their own communities, Inter-Urban Farms provides access to locally grown produce and generates jobs, facilitating the development of local economies.  This is the first initiative of a much larger vision to ultimately empower communities across the country through sustainable urban agriculture.

Leafy Green Machine - 

At its foundation, vertical farming is the practice of producing agriculture in vertically stacked layers.  All of this starts with the Leafy Green Machine (LGM): a two-acre farm fit into 320ft². This self-contained vertical farm, designed by Freight Farms, is highly efficient and offers many solutions to the needs of urban agriculture. 

While conventional farming only uses flat space, this vertical farm takes advantage of the third dimension, maximizing production in a given area while also utilizing resources more efficiently.  Furthermore, the LGM is an indoor farm allowing for greater control over natural elements, producing products equal, if not superior, in quality to conventional outdoor farming methods.


The Leafy Green Machine uses hydroponics - a water recycling system that runs nutrient rich water through the roots of the plants, thus resulting in a more efficient use of water (approximately 10 gallons a day/3,650 gallons a year).

The vertical farming aspect is in the towers that hang from the ceiling of the container. Rows and rows of them are planted with various greens and photosynthesis happens through red and blue LEDs optimized for leafy green plant growth. After all of this the container is outfitted with a number of sensors including: temperature, humidity,  and carbon dioxide. All of these are synced with the mobile which allows for real-time monitoring. 

This is the LGM from Freight Farms. It’s a recycled insulated shipping container that has been repurposed as a vertical farming unit with the following main features:

 - A series of hanging towers planted with various greens. Photosynthesis occurs through red and blue LEDs optimized for leafy green plant growth.

 - Temperature, humidity and carbon dioxide sensors that can be synced with a mobile to allow for real-time monitoring including: temperature, humidity, and carbon dioxide.

-  Hydroponics system - a water recycling system that runs nutrient rich water through the roots of the plants - resulting in a more efficient use of less water (approximately 10 gallons a day and 3,650 gallons a year). 

Who We Are - 

Our names are Jens Tuin and Quintin Graves and together we are Inter-Urban Farms. We share a passion for using food as a means to empower communities and develop local economies.

Jens studied economic development in college and sees sustainable agriculture as a way to help developing countries around the world as well as neighborhoods in the United States. He’s volunteered with local community groups to learn more about urban agriculture in Columbus. 

Quintin is a Columbus native who envisions this project as the future for this growing city. Quintin wants to create the future by actively working to bring vertical farming to benefit Columbus and other communities. 

Our Financial Goal - 

We are campaigning for $85,000 to buy a Leafy Green Machine from Freight Farms. This is a community project, and we need your help to make it happen!

The Impact - 

Your contribution is not simply buying a shirt, but a vote for the future of farming. This unit represents something bigger than any one person. The methods used to grow food with the Leafy Green Machine are cognizant of the earth and the consumers. It’s not about a new age movement, it’s about realizing the true externalities of conventional farming. From any given perspective using less resources to produce more is a superior outcome for all involved. It’s about efficiency just as much as it is respect. 

Not only does it make financial sense, but also develops a community. It’s a smarter way to grow food that engages and breeds transparency. Communities and individuals advance in taking control of their future through food production. 

It’s economic development and community development.

We’re excited begin this journey. Join us today!

Risks & Challenges - 

There is no doubt this is a lofty goal. This campaign pitches a movement as much as it does a product. It’s a belief and hope that the way food is produced can meet demand while maintaining integrity. Success looks like a large group of people moved to action; all coming together to make a statement. That statement is that Columbus, Ohio wants healthy food that doesn’t waste resources or diminish the humanity behind it. 

The risk is that we’re carrying a conscience into the conversation about bottom lines. While this sentiment isn’t shared everywhere in the country we believe it’s here in Columbus. Agriculture is a huge part of this city.

We believe that vertical farming is important and possible in the world of food production. 

We’re both committed to the integrity of the food. 

Gathering a large number of individuals and businesses will help us find backers who share our vision for urban areas in the city of Columbus!
story_txt:
Inter-Urban Farms - 
Bringing the future of farming to Columbus, Ohio

Inter-Urban Farms needs your help to raise $85,000 to bring the Leafy Green Machine from Freight Farms to Columbus, Ohio. This self-contained vertical farm will grow fresh produce year-round and be sold to local businesses and individuals. Our grander vision is to not only to promote sustainable urban agriculture, but also train local employees in personal and professional development. 

By creating an opportunity for people to grow and sell food within their own communities, Inter-Urban Farms provides access to locally grown produce and generates jobs, facilitating the development of local economies.  This is the first initiative of a much larger vision to ultimately empower communities across the country through sustainable urban agriculture.

Leafy Green Machine - 
At its foundation, vertical farming is the practice of producing agriculture in vertically stacked layers.  All of this starts with the Leafy Green Machine (LGM): a two-acre farm fit into 320ft². This self-contained vertical farm, designed by Freight Farms, is highly efficient and offers many solutions to the needs of urban agriculture. 

While conventional farming only uses flat space, this vertical farm takes advantage of the third dimension, maximizing production in a given area while also utilizing resources more efficiently.  Furthermore, the LGM is an indoor farm allowing for greater control over natural elements, producing products equal, if not superior, in quality to conventional outdoor farming methods.










The Leafy Green Machine uses hydroponics - a water recycling system that runs nutrient rich water through the roots of the plants, thus resulting in a more efficient use of water (approximately 10 gallons a day/3,650 gallons a year).

The vertical farming aspect is in the towers that hang from the ceiling of the container. Rows and rows of them are planted with various greens and photosynthesis happens through red and blue LEDs optimized for leafy green plant growth. After all of this the container is outfitted with a number of sensors including: temperature, humidity,  and carbon dioxide. All of these are synced with the mobile which allows for real-time monitoring. 

This is the LGM from Freight Farms. It’s a recycled insulated shipping container that has been repurposed as a vertical farming unit with the following main features:

 - A series of hanging towers planted with various greens. Photosynthesis occurs through red and blue LEDs optimized for leafy green plant growth.

 - Temperature, humidity and carbon dioxide sensors that can be synced with a mobile to allow for real-time monitoring including: temperature, humidity, and carbon dioxide.

-  Hydroponics system - a water recycling system that runs nutrient rich water through the roots of the plants - resulting in a more efficient use of less water (approximately 10 gallons a day and 3,650 gallons a year). 


Who We Are - 
Our names are Jens Tuin and Quintin Graves and together we are Inter-Urban Farms. We share a passion for using food as a means to empower communities and develop local economies.

Jens studied economic development in college and sees sustainable agriculture as a way to help developing countries around the world as well as neighborhoods in the United States. He’s volunteered with local community groups to learn more about urban agriculture in Columbus. 

Quintin is a Columbus native who envisions this project as the future for this growing city. Quintin wants to create the future by actively working to bring vertical farming to benefit Columbus and other communities. 

Our Financial Goal - 
We are campaigning for $85,000 to buy a Leafy Green Machine from Freight Farms. This is a community project, and we need your help to make it happen!

The Impact - 
Your contribution is not simply buying a shirt, but a vote for the future of farming. This unit represents something bigger than any one person. The methods used to grow food with the Leafy Green Machine are cognizant of the earth and the consumers. It’s not about a new age movement, it’s about realizing the true externalities of conventional farming. From any given perspective using less resources to produce more is a superior outcome for all involved. It’s about efficiency just as much as it is respect. 
Not only does it make financial sense, but also develops a community. It’s a smarter way to grow food that engages and breeds transparency. Communities and individuals advance in taking control of their future through food production. 
It’s economic development and community development.
We’re excited begin this journey. Join us today!














Risks & Challenges - 
There is no doubt this is a lofty goal. This campaign pitches a movement as much as it does a product. It’s a belief and hope that the way food is produced can meet demand while maintaining integrity. Success looks like a large group of people moved to action; all coming together to make a statement. That statement is that Columbus, Ohio wants healthy food that doesn’t waste resources or diminish the humanity behind it. 
The risk is that we’re carrying a conscience into the conversation about bottom lines. While this sentiment isn’t shared everywhere in the country we believe it’s here in Columbus. Agriculture is a huge part of this city.
We believe that vertical farming is important and possible in the world of food production. 
We’re both committed to the integrity of the food. 
Gathering a large number of individuals and businesses will help us find backers who share our vision for urban areas in the city of Columbus!

story:
Miami Made Mead

Hello folks, my name is Christian Gil and I am the founder and mazer of Allfather Meadery. For those of you that might be wondering what is a mazer? It is just the technical name used to describe a mead maker. Over 2 years ago I started this project alongside my lifelong friends Bryan, Jim, and Renato; we were a group of college students with a shared passion for brewing and an ambition to create something fresh for the ever-evolving Miami craft beverage scene.

Here at Allfather Meadery we are built on tradition. I have gathered years of experience in the craft brewing industry, in the final frontier that is Miami’s craft beer scene. I have also studied and trained through multiple styles of fermentation from wine to spirits at Florida International University Chaplin’s School of Hospitality and Tourism Management.  

Our campaign focuses on offering an ancient beverage with renewed vigor to the Miami area. The main reason why this project is so important to us it’s the opportunity it gives us to share our passion and knowledge with the community that we love. As a contributor, you will be a keystone in providing yourself and the Miami community access to the fastest growing craft beverage in the country, while taking pride in the fact that it is produced locally.

Our Quest

Our primary goal is to reach the sum of 50, 000.00 USD. This capital will be allocated to the following:

  • Leasing cost for a medium size industrial production space, which would include a taproom.
  • Industrial Brewing equipment such as: fermenters, hoses, pumps and filtration devices.
  • Permits and Licenses.

A contribution as little of 5 dollars gets a set of stickers for yourself or to share with your drinking buds! The Allfather Meadery t-shirt is made of 100% cotton, produced in Miami by an awesome friend of the founders.

The exclusive reward is a membership to our inaugural Bottle Club, the ones that will start it all! your names will be carved in the Meadhall. Inaugural Bottle Club membership also includes 5 limited release mead bottles, which will be made available to the club members before they are released to the public. Plus, members will also receive exclusive “Allfather Meadery Bottle Club” mead drinking glass and t-shirt.

The Impact

Here at Allfather, we want to create quality mead for our community and abroad. With your generous contributions, we plan on creating a unique taproom that will service South Florida along with a distribution system that will allow our meads to be enjoyed elsewhere.

Mead is a drink that was huge back in the day, but has slowly been phased out by other alcoholic beverages as time went on. We believe that mead is finally make a long due comeback. Slowly, but steadily, meads and meaderies have been popping up nationwide. By contributing to a new budding meadery, you are helping the entire industry get back some of its long-lost market share and popularity. Mead is a viable alternative to traditional wines and is delicious with many pairings or just by itself.

Help us bring back an ancient (yet hearty) crowd favorite of the Vikings we all know and love.

Risks & Challenges

We are fully aware of all the obstacles we must overcome to become a functional meadery; obtaining a suitable work place, production permits, red tape, etc. These challenges lay between us and making the transition from home brewing to becoming the meadery that Miami deserves.

The list above seems intimidating, thankfully our team counts with the qualifications to take on these challenges. A master’s degree in marketing, a hospitality graduate with half a decade of experience brewing, an engineer with experience on design and construction. In addition, we have met with some of the leaders of the mead industry in Florida, which have shown much good will and a desire to share their experiences and knowledge with us.

Other Ways You Can Support Us

  • Don’t forget to keep up with us on Facebook and Instagram! There you’ll find information about events, festivals and new releases!
  • IG: @allfathermead
  • Facebook: Allfather Meadery
  • Get familiar with the Indiegogo Share Tools and use them to make some noise about our campaign!

Reward List!

  • 1 Dollar: A Heartfelt Thank You!
  • 5 Dollars: Pack of 3 Official Allfather Stickers (500 available)
  • 25 Dollars: Official Allfather T-Shirt and pack of 3 Stickers.  (400 available)
  • 50 Dollars: Official Allfather Snifter Mead Drinking Glass, T-Shirt and pack of 3 Stickers. (300 available)
  • 225 Dollars: Inaugural Bottle Club Membership. (200 available)
    • The ones that will start it all! Your names will be forever remembered on the walls of the Meadhall.
    • Advanced notification for special mead releases and taproom events.
    • Original Bottle Club membership includes one bottle of each of our 5 yearly limited releases (with the option to buy more).
    • 10% off any purchase in the taproom.
    • Exclusive “Allfather Meadery Bottle Club” Glen Cairn mead drinking glass
    • Exclusive “Allfather Meadery Bottle Club” T-Shirt.
  • 1000 Dollars: One brewing session with the Allfather Team. (10 available)

 Work on any mead of your choice. You will be involved in the entirety of the process, from concept development to label design and bottling. Additionally you will receive 3 cases of the finalized product. The inaugural Bottle Club Membership is included.

  • 2500 Dollars: Name an Allfather Meadery Fermenter. (4 available)

This will allow you to name a fermentation tank in the Meadery; an image or wording of your choice will be added to the fermentation tank (within reason). You will also get all the perks from the Brewing Session with the Allfather Team and the added benefits from the Inaugural Bottle Club Membership.

story:
Stella’s needs your help 

Hello everyone, Neal and Amber here. We are the owners of Stella’s Taproom & Grille in Westfield MA. We opened a great little restaurant in Westfield because we love the small town feel and the tight community that Westfield has to offer. For us to continue to be a part of the town of Westfield, we need a hand with some funding. Improving our operations will help us serve you better.

We want to grow and stay open in Westfield

The costs of opening Stella’s far exceeded our projections. We did work with the Massachusetts Small Business Development Center, in Springfield, to help determine our needs. We now need to get over some financial growing pains and start moving forward with getting Stella’s to its next level. We need some working capital to replace some existing equipment and buy some new equipment and in general, keep the doors open.

We want to expand the menu to give you more choices of our great homemade food. We want to grow our business so that we can be a source for Westfield to look to when community drives need a location to host events. We want to  grow our business so that we can be charitable to the great causes that arise in the town of Westfield. We want to grow our business and be a great corporate citizen that can help nurture the growth of downtown Westfield and the Gaslight District. 

Great Food, Great People

All of you who have come in to Stella’s and gotten to know us seem to like us. What we see it the great people who live here come in and visit, with us and your neighbors. At every turn we try to provide the genuine hospitality that any neighbor would give if you entertained folks in your own home. The idea we had when opening Stella’s was to provide and place for people to come in and eat, drink and spend time away from the daily grind. We eventually want to make the seating more comfy for y’all.

It has been a tough few months

While we have pretty good nights on Friday and Saturday. We do not get much traffic in for lunch and during the week for dinner. We are trying to stay committed to 7 day and week lunch and dinner service but we have several days per week that fall below our operating cost threshold.  

Please spread the word, If you have been here and had a good time and a good meal; tell everyone you know. The more people who come through the door will make us better at every turn. Amber and I might know about 50 people here in town by name, but we would like to know a few thousand eventually. Everyone reading this I hope will help in some way, by donating or telling a friend or coming back in. Indiegogo has a bunch of different ways you can help us,  please use whichever one works best for you.

Thanks,

Amber and Neal Shipwash

story:
Most of us who use the ocean aren't fully aware of what we can do to help improve our own safety. When it comes to sharks, the fear of shark attack causes us to think too much about what can go wrong rather than what we can do to stay safe. We need to change that! 

The aim of this campaign is to open an Ocean Safe Centre that brings people and shark safety together.  The focus will be on sharing information about beach safety, shark safety equipment, managing shark fears, and supporting communities who share the ocean with sharks.

We need to start thinking differently by focusing on the awe of sharks rather than the jaws of sharks, so that we can find the right solutions to balance human safety and wildlife protection.

The issue

I know it's not an easy problem to solve. My son Kyle was killed by a great white shark in 2011. Then the Western Australia shark cull controversy erupted, and our journey became part of a bigger story.

The drum line decision triggered a global debate about how we should protect our ocean wildlife when more people want to spend time in the water. At the heart of this debate is a battle of fears versus scientific fact.

If we are ever going to resolve the issue we need to know how to manage our fears so we can all make smart choices about how and when we use the ocean. We all need to do it together because sharks don't understand state or national boundaries. We have to take responsibility for their future existence as well as our own.

The key message is that sharks don't have the choice to change their behaviours, so we need to step up and change ours.

If you're going in the ocean you need to know what you can do to stay safe.

Ocean Safe Centre

The goal is to establish an Ocean Safe Centre that focuses on bringing people and shark protection together, and to develop a world's best practice model for helping individuals and communities tackle shark fear and trauma if an attack occurs. 

Information Centre

  • Free entry to any member of the public
  • Latest scientific evidence about sharks and other ocean safety issues
  • Displays and demonstrations about how to overcome shark fears
  • Information about shark attacks and intervention trends
  • Information on local ocean safety conditions
  • Display and sale/hire of personal protective shark safety equipment
  • Display of beach shark protection equipment (e.g., eco-barriers)
  • Information on trending environmental issues
The key difference between the Ocean Safe Centre and other marine information centres is that the Ocean Safe Centre will focus on beliefs and attitudes of humans.
To be most effective the Ocean Safe Centre needs to be financially self-sufficient so that the information sharing can be independent, and so it can grow and expand the resources to help other communities. So, with the input of some talented colleagues the Ocean Safe Centre will have it's own retail product line.

Retail 

Retail products will include ocean, shark and surfing themed items such as artworks, clothing and souvenirs. 
Here's a short clip of one of the featured artists, Simon James of Margaret River. The Burden family recommends Simon because he's the creator of Kyle's amazing memorial sculpture.

The Ocean Safe Centre will also write it's own books, and stock books and documentaries related to ocean safety and managing fears.

Support Services

As a trained psychologist with additional expertise in safety, I will head up a consulting service that will help us better understand shark fear and how individuals and communities in shark hotspots can be supported, with services including:
  • information on the psychology of fear and fear of shark attacks
  • coaching clinics and programs to help overcome fears
  • support and information for people affected by shark and ocean tragedies
  • consulting and media liaison services
  • research


Campaign Funding

The Ocean Safe Centre needs a venue with enough floor space for all the services and retail products, so the funds raised will be used to secure a commercial lease, fit out of the premises and setting up of a website.

If the tide of support pushes the campaign past the $90,000 mark, every extra dollar will be spent on the venue lease and operational costs. The more funds received the bigger and better resourced the Ocean Safe Centre will be. This will lead to greater opportunity to fund employment and expand support services as quickly as possible.
This is a fixed fund campaign. If our target isn't reached your pledge amount will be fully refunded. 


The Perks

Every contribution is a vote of public support for the concept of an Ocean Safe Centre and deserve to be rewarded.
  • Every contributor has the option of being named on the Wall of Fame in the Ocean Safe Centre and on the website. 
  • Pledge a little more and receive a product from our unique shark, surfing or environmental themed t-shirts.
  • For a larger pledge there is a selection of limited edition artwork and VIP discount cards for use in-store and online.
  • Rewards are only valid if we meet our target.
  • Delivery dates will vary depending on the timeline for the opening of the retail store and the type of perk offered.

Other Ways to Help

Whether you pledge to the Ocean Safe Centre Campaign or not, you can still help by:

  • getting the word out about the Campaign
  • sharing it on your Facebook page
  • watching our clip on Youtube
  • telling your friends about the concept and the Campaign

If you have other ways you might be able to help this Ocean Safe Centre Campaign please send through your ideas to Sharon Burden at the email address provided under the Team section, or via the Facebook messaging option. 

There's only six weeks to make this happen!

sharing it on your Facebook page
watching our clip on Youtube
telling your friends about the concept and the Campaign   If you have other ways you might be able to help this Ocean Safe Centre Campaign please send through your ideas to Sharon Burden at the email address provided under the Team section, or via the Facebook messaging option. There's only six weeks to make this happen!

story:
Short Summary

Mariah is a young entrepreneur dedicated to promoting travel and sustainability.  

TRe responds to the global climate crisis by providing comfortable-convenient charging stations for electric vehicle owners across the USA.  An April 2021 study published by the Nature Energy Journal, shared that nearly 1 in 5 California Electric Vehicle (EV) owners switched back to gas after owning EV.  TRe seek to address this challenge by supplying multi-functional charging stations across all major highways and state routes. 

My vision in starting the company is to offer a place to recharge, not just vehicles, but eco-conscious customers as well.  TRe provides a place to recharge your mind and body through access to wellness activities, healthy refreshments, and eco-friendly lounges.  Gas powered life is unsustainable and energy-draining. Eco-powered life channels The Right Energy (TRe). 

What We Need & What You Get

The Details:

  • Phase 1 of TRe will require procurement  of commercial property (i.e. closed gas stations, vacant land, etc.) Funding will go towards the property loan down payment Cost Estimate: $ 59, 000). 
  • TRe Stations will provide vehicle charging pods, healthy smoothies and snacks, waterless car wash service. Customers can relax in the eco-friendly rest lounge and enjoy time with their furry friends in the outdoor dog park.
  • Initial investors receive a free VIP membership package. 
  • Phases 2 & 3 will incorporate wellness and community engagement. Cost: Revenue driven.  
  • Full refunds will be issued if goal not reached. 

The Impact

Gas powered life is unsustainable and energy-draining. Eco-powered life channels The Right Energy (TRe).

  • Your contributions will promote the sustainable lifestyle and reduce carbon emissions. 
  • Let's make the world a better place to live one charge at a time!

Risks & Challenges

Currently operating with a limited budget. 

  • Fortunately, I grew up on a limited budget and have a high skill level in squeezing a dollar out of a dime to achieve a goal. 
  • In an effort to reduce administrative costs, I will not hire employees during Phase 1, and instead rely on passionate and dedicated volunteers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a financial contribution at this time, don't worry...you can still help: 

  • Follow, Share, Like TRe on Instagram @tre_therightenergy
  • Promote the brand by sporting TRe apparel: www.therightenergy.org
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Don't let life be meaningless !

  • Intro. In a period when entrepreneurial focus is on internet related things (I.o.T), only few seek solutions for their employees’ better life, the working and personal life (I.o.People). Do you agree with this? Seeing this wrong direction and wishing to make a first step, hoping the others will come and follow by seeing the positive results, we are proposing you to back-up a social model that should materialize in a benefits circle for all involved: employees-entrepreneur-society. Have you ever thought and acted to change something you considered should be adjusted, doing it  in the others' benefit too?  The model testing should be done on a minimum two entrepreneurial start-ups (for higher relevance should be on 5-10), and last for at least one year before concluding the results. The results should be scaled, due to high collective advantages provided. 

 

What we aim to prove?  That social circle programs are  functional and offer many social advantages, not just to those directly involved.

  • History. Working with hundreds of companies in the last years, we many times observed the improper attention provided to their employees in different projects, although they were the ones delivering the projects. This bothered us. Are we the only ones who feels this?. There ‘in the basement’ this feeling started to grow and the change-seed appeared. The ‘plant’ got so big so it had to burst in an entrepreneurial initiative, including a plan to deal with the source of discontent. We could  only finance part of the changing plan, but together we could do it the proper and fully-relevant way. We  honestly need you.

Do you join the change journey?  

  • The program name. Current draft version is "Social Circle" due to circle of benefits it creates. The final name will be established together with you and the most creative and most appreciated version will win. Acquire the Perk "Significant vote right" for extra voting right.
  • The social model and the targeted effects. The program targets:

 Deeper program technical information (how it works, updates and others) are available in our Facebook Group. 

Link: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1953439628297894/ 

     The benefits for each party involved:

    How were the benefits selected? By focusing on how entrepreneurs could be stimulated to provide a better experience for their employees, receiving in return something significant for them too.  For the entrepreneur we have addressed the issue of  finding a proper and decent priced office location. The office would take more the form of a co-working space providing for employees more interconnection options. The final focus was and it would be  the people.

    The demands for each party involved:

     How were the demands selected? By looking where are the major social issues, over which  we can take effective actions with instant and relevant effects. So, according to public data for 2018: in only few studies the people are mentioned as a top 5 strategic interest point for an entrepreneur;  only 2% of Romanian population donates blood (vs. approx 59% France & Austria); we selectively collect only 5% from the garbage requested by EU; only one out of five Romanian companies gets involved in social and charity projects (a study form 2014). Focusing on them the demands were selected.

     Would this demands be relevant for you and your country? If you are not  a Romanian, probably not, but the social model is an adjustable one, starting from a screening of the top 5 major relevant issues over which at low level you can act with instant effect.

    • Funding needs. Detailed computations of the finance necessities drove as to an interval of approx amount/year/participant of $4,800 (a single participant program) and descending to approx $2,800 (a five participants program). The more participants, the lower the necessary amounts for each, due to shared expenses. More is less.

    The structure of the above $4,800 costs is: 70% lower rent, 9% utilities, 9% taxes/amounts clearing, 6% free internet, 5% space planning and security and 2% property fees.

    The lowered rent (paying only 50% of the market value) would give them access to an private or shared office of max 20 sqm with another shared 20 sqm meeting room and kitchen. The average renting price in Cluj-Napoca is $14/sqm.

    To be noted that participants would still have to make personal contributions including: 1% of the turnover to charity (approx $500), half of the rent value, office fittings and equipment, consumables.

    The number of participants will be determined based on total collected amounts, as follows:
     

    • Backers rewards. You can get the satisfaction of supporting this social project, one that can positively change us all.

    Acquiring perks you would benefit from:

    What other perks would you like to receive?

    • What if? What if the support values would not be enough not even for one participant program? Then we would decrease the level of the rent subsidized, but no lower than 25%, a significant step for the actions the participant would have to do as program demands. As organizer, I am expecting to incur some expenses, for unpredictable situations, that I would cover from my pocket.

    What would you do if the targeted value is not collected? Give us ideas.

    • The team. I am Barbu Nicolae, from Romania, Cluj-Napoca. I am 34 and I have a professional experience of over 15 years, covering specialties: consulting, finance, training, auditing, management and sales. Through my last job, a financial one, I was responsible of few hundred million euro assets portfolio. I have published 8 articles in online and written newspapers, touching the subjects: European Investment Fund guaranteed loans, private pension capital market and taxation. Starting with end of 2018 I have become a social entrepreneur and I am responsible for organizing and running the campaign, with Andreea's support.

                         

    I am Andreea Danescu (Raicu), from Romania, Bucharest. I am 30, with over 10 years of professional experience in PR and festivals/events management. For now I am coordinating the team of the 5th edition of the World Experience Festival (this year theme: The Unheard Music), to be held in Cluj-Napoca this June (visit: https://world-experience.ro). I have a 5 years social-entrepreneurial experience. For this project I provide mentorship and  gladly share the social entrepreneurial expertise with Nicu. 

      

    • Call to action. We are honestly grateful for any support, even if it is just sharing the project. So please spread the word! Same level of appreciation would be granted to any emailed ideas or comments that would help us better structure and deliver the project. Last, but not least,  please do take into consideration the financial support. Thank you in advance!

    • Sources and Intellectual Property.

    ​Pictures source: Pixbay.com (except those from "The Team" section)

    Video producer Paspalidis Epameinondas. Property rights Barbu Nicolae.

story:
Rent a help creates a safe and reliable cleaning, babysitting and au pairing service. We plan to make it easier for people to book help on the go with the guarantee of excellent service via our website. Our staff will be trustworthy and polite with a proven track record. We will have registration on our website for both clients and employees,

This will give both parties security and knowledge that the wrong people are not asking to use our service.We plan to employ college, high school teens and young adults as it is extremly hard to find employment in Johannesburg as a student so we hope to make a difference, one student at a time.

The funds will be used to create our website to pay for advertising and marketing purposes as well as our employees in the build up phase. We would require the funds within the next 4 weeks ,

I would just like to say how grateful we will be for any funds given to us as it has always been a dream to make a company which also caters to students, as a student myself i know how hard it is finding a reliable job here and all contributions will make a big difference in the long run.

Thank You!

story:
My name is Marlin McKay and I am seeking $350,000 dollars to create community through Georgetown’s first and only Family Entertainment Center, End Zone Entertainment!

The End Zone Family Fun Center will solve a burgeoning problem of limited to no viable options for activities and entertainment for the residents of Georgetown, as well as, the growing population of surrounding communities.  

In the city of Georgetown, there is currently no: bowling alley, skating rink, arcade, miniature golf, laser tag, or even a simple space to have a birthday party.  

As a result, residents are forced to leave the city, which leads to limited community engagement, the loss of time in travel that could otherwise be spent on the enjoyment of activities or time better spent on other commitments, the unintended consequence of revenue leaving the city in the form of gas, food, retail and ultimately tax dollars from those purchases that could be used to improve the city of Georgetown.  

With the exception of the Theaters of Georgetown, the Suffoletta Aquatic Center and the Pavilion serve as the only locals for recreation and are often over-saturated, seasonal, or require a membership.  

End Zone Entertainment will be a sophisticated and inviting environment that is free from excessive marketing towards adults through alcohol.  We are all about kids being kids and having FUN!

Contributions involve individuals pledging amounts at or above $5

We have created several rewards and redemption items for community contributions.

Below you will find a table that breaks down how much each individual would need to contribute for us to reach our minimum/maximum goal, as well as, specifics on how reaching each goal impacts the overall progress of the project. The contribution totals were based on 35% of the total population of 22 cities north and west of Lexington and 10% of the combined populations of Nicholasville and Lexington. This figured out to be a combined population total of 175,000 residents with 35% of that number (61,250) contributing the amounts below:

For example: 1 person would contribute $5 to $10 (minimum to maximum), however, a family of 4 would need to contribute $5 for each member of the family; which would amount to a $20 to $40 (minimum to maximum) contribution per household.


We are excited to provide the residents of Georgetown a safe, healthy, affordable, and fun place to have memory making experiences that they can feel comfortable visiting day or night.

Thank you for your time and consideration!

Sincerely,

Marlin K. McKay

Future Owner/Operator of End Zone Entertainment

 

Risks and Challenges

There are certainly risks and challenges associated with this project. The most prominent one being, the magnitude of the project itself poses a definite risk, however, careful consideration has gone into "the why," as well as, "the how," of addressing these challenges.

  • #1 - The size of the project has been identified as a concern due to the total cost of the investment hovering at or near 3 million dollars. Some have questioned, "why not another bowling alley or why go so big?" Research has shown that there have been previous recreational facilities that have failed in the city of Georgetown. There was at one point a roller rink, a bouncy house facility, and even 2 bowling alleys. The major problem with these facilities, is that they were single purpose businesses that limited their demographic and overall reach. Resulting in small traffic, low revenue, and eventual closure.

 

  • #2 - The need to collaborate with the Small Business Association by utilizing the 504 business plan. The 504 business plan requires that we provide a 10% to 15% cash injection of the total investment ($350K to 450K); which would allow us to move forward with financing and is the reason for the Indiegogo Campaign, however, if we are able to generate 20% ($600K) of the total investment, we would be able to bypass having to use the 504 plan in favor of a conventional loan; which would expedite the completion of the project.  We plan to attain 350K, at the minimum, and seek investors to reach 450K to 600K. 

 

  • #3 - The challenge of communicating with cities and towns across Central Kentucky to inform them of our presence. The way social media has grown and impacted our society in the last 10 years has afforded us the opportunity to reach a wide range of people in a instant and economical way. We plan to also notify all available media outlets to spread the word and target community organizations to garner their support.

 

  • #4 - The challenge of convincing people to support their local communities by visiting the location often, instead of traveling to Lexington and other major cities for their recreational needs. This is perhaps the most difficult challenge and ultimate risk to the project. We are all creatures of habit and changing any culture requires a consistent amount of behavior and experiences that establish expectations and deliver on principle.

story:
Hello, I am here to tell you about Craftolia.com launching this campaign called Craftolia.com Marketplace.  We developed a unique marketplace where you can buy one of a kind piece and sell items that you make in your own home.  This marketplace was made in order to give people a place to showcase their handmade items.  We think it will help people in need of a solution for the barriers of entry to starting a small business.

Do you ever think about starting your own small business where you sell items you make yourself?

Do you want to sell items you hand makes but feel that you lack of knowledge, funds or experience?

Are you interested in making extra money on the side but don’t have the time?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

Overview

Our popular culture reinforces the idea that starting a small business is difficult and not feasible for anyone. We're out to change that using Craftolia.com! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution. With no start up costs you can start your very own online business and sell your arts and crafts.  Bringing this platform to an individual can change their ideas about what they can accomplish for the rest of his or her life.  Finding out your art can be posted online with ease will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

Our Story

How much is it going to cost you to start the business you’ve dreamed of?

In 2009, the Kauffmann Foundation estimated that the average start-up cost was approximately $30,000. The truth is that no business is the same and many micro-businesses can get started for as little as $3,000 or less, but this is still a sizable cost. These businesses are often home-based sole proprietorships with low upfront investments. Another low-cost option is a franchise.

While your average Main Street franchise may require a larger investment, home-based franchises can be started with as little as $1,000-$5,000, but with Craftolia.com you can still. – This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution, where people can sell their items without these large fees.  This is where we started to envision “Craftolia.com” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

  • Global platform
  • Social sharing options
  • Low start up costs
  • User friendly functions

When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to sell.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in the industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the industry of online sales platforms. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth.

About Us

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s effective and easy to use for your selling needs. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement of providing every user with a seamless selling experience.  Craftolia’s goal is to narrow the gap between craft makers (artists, designers) and customers, interested in unique products. We create simple ways to sell handmade, vintage and art worldwide.


How you can Help Craftolia.com

For us to bring the “Craftolia.com” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of the “Craftolia.com”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.

We will also be using the funding to:

  • Expand the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise solutions of the “Craftolia.com”
  • Further customize the first version of the “Craftolia.com”
  • Create additional products and services that will compliment “Craftolia.com”

The “Craftolia.com” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook and Twitter at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about #24,000 in order to break “Craftolia.com” onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up. 

Final Thank You and Links

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Craftolia.com” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

If you wish to contact us:

E-mail: info@craftolia.com

Website: www.craftolia.com

Our Social Media Connections:

Twitter: @craftolia_en

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Craftolia.en

Contact Information

E-Mail: info@craftolia.com

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at info@craftolia.com
story_txt:
Hello, I am here to tell you about Craftolia.com launching this campaign called Craftolia.com Marketplace.  We
developed a unique marketplace where you can buy one of a kind piece and sell
items that you make in your own home. 
This marketplace was made in order to give people a place to showcase
their handmade items.  We think it will
help people in need of a solution for the barriers of entry to starting a small
business.
Do you ever think about starting your own small business where you sell items you
make yourself?Do you want to sell items you hand
makes but feel that you lack of knowledge, funds or experience?
Are you interested in
making extra money on the side but don’t have the time?
If you answered, “Yes” to
any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…
Overview
Our popular culture
reinforces the idea that starting a small business is difficult and not
feasible for anyone. We're out to change that using Craftolia.com! Help us
establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution. With no start
up costs you can start your very own online business and sell your arts and
crafts.  Bringing this platform to an
individual can change their ideas about what
they can accomplish for the rest of his or her life.  Finding out your art can be posted online with
ease will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with
a donation to this project today!
Our Story
How
much is it going to cost you to start the business you’ve dreamed of?
In 2009, the Kauffmann Foundation estimated that the average start-up cost was
approximately $30,000. The truth is that no business is the same and many
micro-businesses can get started for as little as $3,000 or less, but this is
still a sizable cost. These businesses are often home-based sole
proprietorships with low upfront investments. Another low-cost option is a
franchise. 
While your average Main Street franchise may require a larger
investment, home-based franchises can be started with as little as
$1,000-$5,000, but with Craftolia.com you can still. – This fact prompted us to
dig deeper into a solution, where people can sell their items without these
large fees.  This is where we started to
envision “Craftolia.com” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

Global platform

Social sharing options
Low start up costs
User friendly functions

When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us
that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly
we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to sell.  Our features will make us incredibly
qualified to succeed in the industry. 
This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a
key player if not leader in the industry of online sales platforms. Our mission
is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect
and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth.
About Us

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched
solution that’s effective and easy to use for your selling
needs. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement
of providing every user with a seamless
selling experience.  Craftolia’s goal is
to narrow the gap between craft makers (artists, designers) and customers,
interested in unique products. We create simple ways to sell handmade, vintage
and art worldwide.How you can Help Craftolia.comFor us to bring the “Craftolia.com” to
life, we need your support!
Your generous funding will help us get
things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost
of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get
the chance to be one of the first users of the “Craftolia.com”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.
We will also be using the funding to: 

 Expand the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise solutions of the “Craftolia.com”
 Further customize the first version of the “Craftolia.com”

 Create additional products and services that will compliment “Craftolia.com”


The “Craftolia.com” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook and Twitter at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!
How We'll Use the Funds
We need about #24,000 in order to break “Craftolia.com” onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up. Final Thank You and Links
We feel so grateful to
everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed
what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working
hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute
thanks to all our generous supporters. 
Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what
your donation helped us achieve.  You are
part of our “Craftolia.com” family.
If you cannot donate but
you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a
referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the
word!

story:
Introducing MANE, a hair society that caters solely to women with textured hair. We're planning to open our first salon in 2016 in DC and then expanding across country in order to bring great textured hair care to everyone.  We pride ourselves on being specialists who provide healthy styles for natural and chemically processed hair.  Read on and watch the video to learn how MANE is redefining hair care and ensuring that women with textured hair are never an afterthought.  


Where Textured Hair Comes First!

"Blowout bars, dominican salons, regular salons, oh my"; in an industry where straight hair is mainstream, MANE will provide the services women with kinky, coily, or wavy hair need in order to enjoy their hair in whatever style they like.  By combining education on how to manage your hair, techniques to style your hair without damaging, and a first class salon experience, MANE will be a place you can count on to not only style your textured hair, but also maintain its health.  

What Makes MANE Different?


What Does MANE Offer?

MANE offers several different services to help you embrace your textured hair:


Sounds Great, But Will It Work?

We know how important it is to find a reliable salon that will be able to take care of your hair, so we decided to test the concept.  We worked with our Creative Director, Tippi Shorter, to host a one-day pop-up shop to make sure that our dream wasn't a complete fantasy.  We were completely booked solid for the day, and some  of our customers had some really insightful thoughts about their current hair care challenges and how MANE help fix those issues:

What We Need

We've built the business model, we've brought together the right team and advisors, and we've tested the concept, now we just need help getting it off the ground.  To date, we've been bootstrapping the project ourselves, but in order to really bring MANE to everyone, we need your support.  If you can help us, you'll be helping to reshape textured hair care, breathing life into a new business model, and we'll owe you a big thanks (and a lot of cool perks!). 

The Perks

MANE Will Be Rolling Out Over 2016



The MANE Hair Society Team

story:
My name is Edward Marfo. I am 22 years old and a Ghanaian. I currently live in Abura Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana. i actually grew up in a orphanage center from the age of seven until i was sixteen . thus i lost my mom at a very tender age. upon living the charity center, i went and stayed with an uncle at Abura Dunkwa where i worked as a shop keeper at a local provision shop. three years ago , i started a local cyber cafe with just three computers. however in June of 2013, i closed the cyber cafe , sold off the computers to start the drug store business i am into now. i am a senior high school graduate. i have had a lot of experience in this life. Having to grow up without parents and living in the charity with people who had the same problems as mine made me strong and to know that in this world i am not alone . i always express my heart warm appreciation to those who have helped me in my journey through life till this day. My aim in life is to become a social entrepreneur and grow my drug store business to a point where i can open many branches nationwide and help those in need. As a young man, my greatest philosophy is that : i don't need a job, all i need is a breakthrough idea and with the little i have start so far, if i keep going i will be come an inspiration to the many youth in my country and continent at large.To all who will offer me a helping hand been it a donation or even a loan, just know that by supporting my proactivity, you are giving me a lifetime chance to live well. i am humbly appealing to all who will come by my profile to help me in any little way that you can. thank you and i am grateful in advance.

IN MY COMMUNITY

I operate a drug store (mini pharmacy) on a very small scale. it is a licensed one . i sell the basic health care drugs like the paracetamol, multi vitamin capsules and syrup , pain killers and many more. i choose this kind of business because of the need for first aid drugs in my locality. As i write, i am the only one who provide such a service in my community hence serving a large number of rural folks.
Seriously speaking my drug or pharmacy business really require a lot of capital but i am willing to always learn from small beginnings and its struggles.
My business is a life saving one and i am so proud of the decision i took to go into that business although i did not know how i was going to grow. but because i had a greater why , today have much hope for i believe i will be able to raise some funds from this platform to invest into my project.

I am therefore humbly appealling to all who will come across my profile and project on this platform to help me in any little way that you can. Help me and through your help, you are giving a young, passionate and hardworking young man a lifetime chance.

thank you very much in advance..

story:
Tiles Leveling System (TLS) - is a device used for surface leveling while laying ceramic tiles and ceramic granite both on the floor and on the walls.

Applies for laying tiles with thickness from 3 mm to 35 mm. Used mainly for laying large format tiles (400x400, 450x450 and more).

Advantage of using TLS during the tiling

  • TLS helps to avoid fluctuations in the plane on the tiles joints.
  • Prevents " sagging " tiles in the process of drying ( curing ) of the adhesive composition.
  • Provides straight seams between tiles of 1.5 mm minimum ( if the seam requires more crosses are additionally used for tiling ) .
  • Provides maximum surface alignment of tiles in the place. .
  • Significantly reduced time of tiles laying.
  • In case using TLS by experienced professional tiler the productivity increases at least 100 % and the quality of work is flawless.
  • If you have decide to make tiles laying yourself at your place, using TLS you will get the result of professional.
  • TLS - is not only a product, but  it's a technology of tiles laying as well.

story:
Who I am and what I want to do

Hello world! I'm Leonardo. I am 26 and I come from Italy. During my life I have been several times abroad for studying and working, and I have seen how young people can build up their own career without any problem. It is on my passion, international communication, that I'd like to work. I want to start this campaign to build awareness on this project on . I would also like to raise some money to make my dream real: To build a company that will be able to successfully work in the communication field.

  • I have already, on my own, built a website, that will son host a free blog. I've also launched a Twitter account and I am now bringing the logo (a home made one) on other social platforms. The idea it's a seed: that is why I need a small help from several good-hearted people: like a seed, it needs time and love to grow. The long-term perspective is to build a startup company working in the field of Public Relations and institutional communication.
  • You, as a contributor to my self-employment project can benefit the most from this campaign: you can be gifted from being one of the first believers in this idea. Good karma, and a lot of gratitude by me and my future colleagues. You can also get some small tastes of what it means to be on this side, in the form of simple perks that you can see on this page. They are all simple, and seem unrelated, but each of them represent, small parts of what I am today, and what I would like to bring to the business!

I need your support.. What do You Get?

  • To start, I have planned to spend around 1,500 Euro for the blog, considering that nothing from that amount will be for my personal pocket.
  • They will be spent on building the structure of blog, consulting services and, of course, paying taxes and related costs. I will take care of communicating the idea and of establishing the brand (as I have already started to do on social media). Depending on the total funds received I will also create an online story-board documenting all the major steps accomplished.
  • My perks are part of my world. I do not have great things to offer, that is why I opted for small things, that often require some of my time to deliver. They are part of what I like. I hope you enjoy my choice. Please, feel free to ask for something, even if it is not included. Looking forward to preparing them for shipment!
  •  If I don't reach my entire goal, all funds will come back directly to the funders ("believers"). :) 
  • So, you do not loose even a single penny! 

The Impact

  • My startup project is essentially built around the idea of launching a Public Relations company, that can measures, within the first years, with great European competitors. It takes time to build a solid reality (and, of course some money!). I have been working already in the sector, and communication and international relations are my fields of study. I think I have skills, I just need a good opportunity, like this one, to share them with the world.
  • Have you ever wondered how governments and public institutions build awareness around their action? Well, they mostly do so, by hiring a Public Relations (strategic) professional. That is exactly what I want to do (geek, uhm?!).  Ever seen a badly structured logo, campaign or an invading newsletter? That is exactly what I do not want to see, being that the reason why I want to run a business through this project.

Challenges of my project

  • I know the journey will be long, but, as today, I will ask to conscious and more qualified people to help me out in this project. That's also why I opted to start with just the idea of a Blog.
  • I will also take personally care of keeping you, nice community of lovers, well informed on my steps: as I said before, I need help, but, most of all, I need to build a community of believers in this idea.
  • There are no major risks for you (except receiving a wrong-sized t-shirt). And i must say, I see no major risks for me as well. I will need to work hard, and keep my mind focused on my original idea.
  • These challenges will be solved by me with a group of like-minded partners. Together will find the way. All the major costs are on my personal pocket. 

Other Ways You Can Help: Sharing love is keyword!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  •  To conclude, I ask your contribution in several forms: a small amount funded would be great. 
  • I am aware that people not always can or are willing to give money: that is why I would love if you could just to follow us in our journey, through social media platforms or on our blog. We are also establishing a monthly newsletter, to which you can subscribe by clicking here.
  • Finally, Indiegogo has some great shared tools: feel free to use them to share our idea of "fairer PR in a fairer community". 

If you made till here.. my gratitude for your time and support.

PLEASE SHARE LOVE! :) 

Leonardo.
