story:
Please join with The Palm Springs Air Museum in bringing history to life and restoring to fly again, our United States Navy PBY Catalina. The "flying boat" that served as a patrol bomber and search and rescue from World War II through the 1980's. 

The Palm Springs Air Museum is one of the finest and most respected Air Museums in the world. For over twenty years bringing history alive with not only a wonderful collection of aircraft but also with 400 volunteers, some who have stood on the beaches of Guadalcanal during World War II to those who have flown to the edges of Outer Space.

You will be part of the legacy of bringing history to the generations who remember this aircraft with respect and also to the generations who follow. Our youth will see and experience first hand the excitement of aviation that perhaps they only briefly read about in school.

We are totally committed to this restoration and your help will be going entirely to offset the expenses of this commitment. A long term project, this will be among our continuing fundraising. It is funded by the Palm Springs Air Museum which is a non-profit organization (Tax ID 33-0615350) and your participation helps greatly in allowing the Museum to continue it's core mission of bringing history and pride to the public it serves.

Some of the staffing of this is being done by volunteers who are taking on this project with incredible enthusiasm. However an aircraft being restored to flying condition requires professional aircraft mechanics doing most of the work. And sadly enthusiasm alone will not pay for the tremendous expense of a project of this magnitude. So we really need you to be a part of our Team!

So here comes the fun stuff! No question that the most sought after will be our PBY Catalina T-Shirt designed by world famous aviation artist Stan Stokes! The extraordinary and beautiful photo book by Hans Wiesman "80 Years, A Tribute the the PBY Catalina" will keep you in awe turning it's pages over and over. Very fun Instax cameras graciously provided by Fujifilm are also yours to have. 

All monies raised will go to the project whether less or more than our goal. Your help means so much more too! It helps the Palm Springs Air Museum bring the history and excitement of aviation to groups of school children who visit during the year. It gives the Museum the ability to bring education and actual flying demonstrations on a weekly basis to our visitors and community. It allows the Museum to honor our Veterans by providing free entrance to them and their families and being a part of special programs. Your help from a little to a lot is very far reaching!

The Palm Springs Air Museum has built itself by accomplishing and meeting many goals. Recently completed is our Cold War Hangar dedicated to Major General Kenneth P. Miles. A modern 20,000 sq. ft. facility that we funded and built entirely from private donations! Then there is our recently completed Norman Lawrence Sirota D-Day Gliders Exhibit with an actual rebuild of one of the many ill-fated D-Day Gliders. Again all funded by the Museum from private donation. From our extensive and beautiful aircraft collection to our almost 10,000 volume library, the Palm Springs Air Museum is a testament to the responsible use of privately donated funding and now stands at almost 100,000 sq. ft. 

We know some some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please get the word out for us!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Share us on Social Media, Facebook or whatever is your favorite.

Like and watch the Facebook page for the Palm Springs Air Museum.

Share the excitement of joining in the legacy of restoring the PBY Catalina with us! That truly means so very much! Thank You!
story_txt: Please join with The Palm Springs Air Museum in bringing history to life and restoring to fly again, our United States Navy PBY Catalina. The "flying boat" that served as a patrol bomber and search and rescue from World War II through the 1980's. The Palm Springs Air Museum is one of the finest and most respected Air Museums in the world. For over twenty years bringing history alive with not only a wonderful collection of aircraft but also with 400 volunteers, some who have stood on the beaches of Guadalcanal during World War II to those who have flown to the edges of Outer Space.You will be part of the legacy of bringing history to the generations who remember this aircraft with respect and also to the generations who follow. Our youth will see and experience first hand the excitement of aviation that perhaps they only briefly read about in school.We are totally committed to this restoration and your help will be going entirely to offset the expenses of this commitment. A long term project, this will be among our continuing fundraising. It is funded by the Palm Springs Air Museum which is a non-profit organization (Tax ID 33-0615350) and your participation helps greatly in allowing the Museum to continue it's core mission of bringing history and pride to the public it serves.Some of the staffing of this is being done by volunteers who are taking on this project with incredible enthusiasm. However an aircraft being restored to flying condition requires professional aircraft mechanics doing most of the work. And sadly enthusiasm alone will not pay for the tremendous expense of a project of this magnitude. So we really need you to be a part of our Team!So here comes the fun stuff! No question that the most sought after will be our PBY Catalina T-Shirt designed by world famous aviation artist Stan Stokes! The extraordinary and beautiful photo book by Hans Wiesman "80 Years, A Tribute the the PBY Catalina" will keep you in awe turning it's pages over and over. Very fun Instax cameras graciously provided by Fujifilm are also yours to have. All monies raised will go to the project whether less or more than our goal. Your help means so much more too! It helps the Palm Springs Air Museum bring the history and excitement of aviation to groups of school children who visit during the year. It gives the Museum the ability to bring education and actual flying demonstrations on a weekly basis to our visitors and community. It allows the Museum to honor our Veterans by providing free entrance to them and their families and being a part of special programs. Your help from a little to a lot is very far reaching!The Palm Springs Air Museum has built itself by accomplishing and meeting many goals. Recently completed is our Cold War Hangar dedicated to Major General Kenneth P. Miles. A modern 20,000 sq. ft. facility that we funded and built entirely from private donations! Then there is our recently completed Norman Lawrence Sirota D-Day Gliders Exhibit with an actual rebuild of one of the many ill-fated D-Day Gliders. Again all funded by the Museum from private donation. From our extensive and beautiful aircraft collection to our almost 10,000 volume library, the Palm Springs Air Museum is a testament to the responsible use of privately donated funding and now stands at almost 100,000 sq. ft. We know some some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:Please get the word out for us!Use the Indiegogo share tools!Share us on Social Media, Facebook or whatever is your favorite.Like and watch the Facebook page for the Palm Springs Air Museum.Share the excitement of joining in the legacy of restoring the PBY Catalina with us! That truly means so very much! Thank You!

story:
Where did you last buy everything you need for your Soirée?

When it comes to planning your next big event, many stores lack in their ability to meet all your needs in one place. You’re likely to find a store for your gifts, a shop for your rental décor, and another for all your floral needs. If you’re lucky, sometimes two of these are combined.  Not to mention, when it comes to those beautiful blooms, the limited options are disappointing. Grocery bunches or overpriced arrangements, are often all that’s available and not at all what you want. No longer will you have to sacrifice design, quality and budget to receive the adorable décor and necessary convenience you’re looking for.



Introducing the Soirée without the Fuss (and a few more Perks)!

Parlour Soirée™ is set to launch May 2015 as the first Bespoke Life Soirée Shop™ in Waterloo!

What does this mean you ask?  Well it means we are focused on and are passionate about these ethics....

Offering Bespoke Event Services and Products--Styling (rental décor), Blooms (floral arrangements) and Gifts for any life celebration (Christmas, weddings, birthday’s, baby showers, Mother’s day, Valentine's, etc.). Our passions and ethics lies within being eco-conscious, a love for vintage, handmade and/or custom made items, personable/ quality custom service, pocket book (budget) friendly products/ service and a community based business/company.  75% of our products and services will follow one or all of these ethics with most of our products being sourced from local artists or made within Canada. This means Parlour Soirée™ not only supports the environment, but also our local economy. Including our businesses, families and neighbours, some of whom make amazing artisanal pieces! After shop doors open, Parlour Soirée™ will have workshops, a loyalty points program and a... top secret service... which will be unveiled just before our Grand Soirée™! With doors open in May, Parlour Soirée™ will donate 2% of total annual sales to national and local philanthropies. This will be divided between the Canada Nature Conversation (1%) and the Waterloo Regional Heritage Foundation (1%), with plans to expand our donations to an art program and or other community/ Canadian foundations as our sales grow.


Creating the Vision



In early 2014 Parlour Soirée was born. Created by the hands of Amanda Seymour as a home-based Styling and Blooms service business.  After a successful wedding season, and a desire to have a retail location, a pretty awesome opportunity fell in her hands in January 2015.  Amanda leased a 700 square foot studio in Conestogo and took to renovating the space.

With the desire to be a community involved business, serving the communities needs, filling in the gaps for a quality custom product and service in a budget friendly and convenient way, the aha moment come to what is now Parlour Soirée Inc. today as a Bespoke Life Soirée Shop™. Since then, we've been working hard to make this dream a reality.



 We began intensive research and planning.  The Start Up Company  provided a training program to Amanda to help develop the vision, market research, a  business plan and pitch, marketing development, assigned a mentor and ultimately helped us develop a simulated Bespoke Life Soirée Shop™.   We've also been learning from customers and the feedback has been overwhelmingly positive!
Parlour Soirée™ has started renovations. Designing a layout for optimal service, efficiently knocking down and rebuilding a wall, removing the carpet, fixing electrical, and plumbing for better ease of service and flow and installing a magnificent reclaimed pallet floor.


Still on the agenda for Parlour Soirée™ are; plans to build custom counters from reclaimed doors and lumber, a stunning custom walk in cooler--it's easier to fit lumber through a door than a pre-build cooler!


(Opps...the picture is side ways! This is our floral cooler to be)

Financial Roadmap


Amanda has invested everything she has in getting this creative, one of a kind studio prepared for the  all the Soirée Lovers in Southern Ontario – now we need your help to give the business its last jumpstart! To date, we've pooled saved money, worked hard &  endless hours in jobs we were not so keen on and took out some financing to purchase supplies, business expenses (including the legal stuff), obtained our studio and started to get it outfitted for the Soirée. All to make this dream become a reality.


Amanda has invested over $75,000 in the business and needs $7,750 more to get us on the road to sending out invitations for our Grand Soirée™! . This campaign is "all or nothing" - if we do not hit our $5000 goal we do not  get to keep any pledges as all pledges are returned to the donor!! Help us reach at least 5k and spread love, happiness and Soirée Style™ across Southern Ontario.

We appreciate anything that you can give - even $1! We're offering some sweet positive reinforcement starting at just $10. If only 500 Soirée Lovers bought a swag bag, we would be fully funded and ready to get the Soirée started!

Is there a perk you would like us to add?  Let us know and we will make a custom perk just for you!
Challenges & Opportunities 
Our brand concept is new and unique, as with anything different, risk is always present. Yet, this unique concept, with its all in one approach, offers ease and relaxing to what can be stressful for many. Parlour Soirée™ also has the ability to create any style and therefore, can work with everybody and their individual and unique visions. 

Overall, our biggest challenge is getting the word out so people in Southern Ontario know Parlour Soirée™ is launching its first Bespoke Life Soirée Shop™ – help us spread the word and put people on the look-out for us! 

Be sure to use the social media share buttons at the top of the page!

We thank you soo much for being apart of the Soirée with us! 
Much love, Parlour Soirée xx

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Creator: Dr. James Ligon
    Location: Humble, Texas
    Bio: I have been practicing dentistry for almost 20 years and have worked with a dental supply company for over 10 years.
    Advanced Degree(s): DDS, MA
  • Our dentist-formulated toothpaste will not include harmful substances such as Sodium Lauryl Sulfate, Ethylene Glycol, Fluoride, Titanium Dioxide or Glycerin. We are including natural agents such as turmeric and black seed oil and others that have been proven to be strong inflammatory antagonists. Our goal is to have a toothpaste that is not only good for the teeth and gums but also beneficial to the rest of the body at a fair, affordable price.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $35,000 to achieve our goal...our costs include product, website, storage facility, marketing, research and insurance.

  • If we achieve full funding it will be used for the manufacture of 20,000 to 30,000 tubes of our toothpaste as well as ongoing marketing and testing of our product at a local school of dental hygiene for efficacy. 
  • If we achieve a surplus in funding we will be able to develop another product centered around "oil-pulling".
  • If our full funding goals are not achieved we will probably only be able to manufacture less than 10,000 and have a very limited budget for marketing.
  • We will be able to deliver, of course, our product and tooth brushes.

The Impact

We are not just asking for funds to make some type of toothpaste to sell but we are asking for help to provide a healthy alternative to people that want a toothpaste which contains natural entities that have been scientifically proven to provide benefit to the body as a whole.  Help us change lives for the better.

Risks & Challenges

We believe that our greatest challenge will be marketing our product.

We intend to overcome the hurdle by initiating multiple distribution channels including but not limited to:

Direct to consumer

Affiliate Marketing

MLM

Chain grocery and drug stores

Other Ways You Can Help

These days money is tight for most of us.  If you can't provide financial support please spread the word about out campaign to others.

Thanks for considering us and we wish you well.

story:
Everyday investors lack the resources to screen companies and make an informative investment decisions. 

We believe in the power of the crowd and want to encourage people to participate in startup investments by connecting them to peers with whom they may exchange ideas, discuss and feel more comfortable when reviewing new companies whose success they want to be a part of.  

Gold Eagle Crowdfunding Finder is aiming to create a community for investors in this space who would like to meet founders and fellow investors.  We will create a platform for them to share ideas and thoughts on new technologies and companies via blogs and chatrooms and through message boards. We envision a community where people will come together for a common goal of backing a technology they like and participate in active discussions on it, igniting the power of the crowd!  

We are shark tank for the masses. We democratize opportunity and empower individuals to be on equal footing with the titans of Wall Street. By creating a marketplace for small startup investments where our users can research, share opinions and due diligence, review and invest in startups- our users can be part of the seed investment game that used to be the exclusive playing field of deep pocketed angels, VCs and PEs.

We are fighting for you, the regular guy, without millions in your bank account and connections in investment firms, to be able to have a level playing field when you recognize a good startup to back.

This is the only title 3 investment crowdfunding aggregator in the space. We offer a wholistic A to Z approach where a user can do anything from sourcing a company, researching it until investing in it.

We are a unique social media marketplace where users can network with and meet their peers so they could feel empowered and not alone when dealing with complex investment decisions without wealth of data and analysis like the public markets

This is a brand new industry. It is YOUR opportunity to get in early! be a part of our selected network and benefit from its collective knowledge, connections and ideas. 

Uses of Funds:

Backers' funds will be used to improve the user experience and the access to companies' data and due diligence.

Funding will enable data sharing APIs with crowdfunding securities portals in this space, to show more granular data and integrate more data feeds into our marketplace. 

Backers' funds will be also be used to improve our community which will provide more access to information and ideas about the offered companies.

Our community allows for investors rating and comments.  Backers' funds will capitalize on that and help perfect our behavior predicting sentiment analysis AI software. The software will summarize hundreds of blog/ chats/ reviews entries and produce statistical charts showing the community's perception of companies and industries. 

Funding will also help grow our companies offering and meet our goal of covering the entire securities crowdfunding universe on the website.

 

The Website:

Sample Company Page:

Sample Review Page:

Follow us:

https://www.crowdfundingfinder.com 

https://www.instagram.com/crowdfunding_finder/

https://www.linkedin.com/in/crowdfunding-finder...

https://twitter.com/CrowdFundFinder

https://www.facebook.com/Cr0wdFundingFinder/

story:
Introducing Q-Safe

Q-Safe is a keying with 3 QR codes that help keep people with Learning Disabilities, Dementia and other cognitive difficulties safe. Q-safe also provides family, friends and loved ones with peace of mind. Q-Safe is bespoke to each person using our secure system and works simply by scanning with a Smart Device.

Each QR code completes a different task when scanned with our QR code reader App and works across all Smart Devices. When scanned by the user Q-Safe can:

  1. Call their chosen Next of Kin
  2. Text their location to their chosen Next of Kin
  3. Display their chosen ‘about me’ information


How does it help people with Learning Disabilities, Dementia and associated cognitive difficulties?


Why us?
Inclusive Media Solutions was founded in September 2013 by William Britton and specialises in mobile technology for the cognitive disability community. Prior to founding Inclusive Media Solutions Will spent 5 years as a Further Education lecturer of students with Learning Disabilities and Assistive Technology specialist. Passionate about cognitive disabilities but annoyed by the lack of effective mobile technology products and expert advice in the community Will created Inclusive Media Solutions to fill this void.



                                                         Why a key ring?

We know from experience that people with cognitive disabilities get lost or confused about where they are; this can lead to them being anxious and scared. Q-Safe is discreet and can be kept on them at all times and is simply initiated by the users Smart Device. With your help we will be able to make Q-Safe weatherpoof

Is it safe?
With years of experience working with vulnerable people we know that safeguarding is essential. Q-Safe is a custom developed system; if the user looses or misplaces their key ring we can simply disable it centrally from our system. This deactivates the keyring and a new one can be distributed to the user.

Scanning Q-Safe is easy!

To scan the Q-Safe key ring we have developed a FREE app available on iOS and Android devices. Our App is a ‘scan and go’ QR code scanner designed for simplicity and ease of use, ideal for people with Learning Disabilities, Dementia and other cognitive difficulties. With your help we will be able to further develop this App to support Q-Safe across various mobile platforms



Where will the funds go?
We have been working on our prototype for 6 months, we’ve worked with our target market on looks, functionality, safety and ease of use. We now need your help to overcome the final hurdle and make our prototype ready for commercial use. Your support will help tens of thousands of vulnerable people keep safe. We will use the funds on the following areas:
  • QR system development - Custom system set up on our safe and secure server 
  • App development - Ensure compatibility with Q-Safe and testing
  • Materials and distribution - Plastic casing on keyring for weatherproofing and durability. Distribution of product to Perk 4
  • Final stage testing - With a variety of ages across the market to gather further primary feedback
  • Website development: Update website showing product, graphics and information. 

Why people with cognitive disabilities need your help

Mobile technology is revolutionising the way we interact with the world and it’s changing all our lives for the better. It’s important we understand how mobile technology can help people with Learning Disabilities, Dementia and associated cognitive difficulties by providing them with innovative solutions to the independence they deserve.

Meet the Team

William Britton: 

  • Founder and Director of Inclusive Media Solutions Will is deeply passionate about how mobile technology can enrich the lives of people with cognitive disabilities.

Adam Burley: 

  • Founder and Director of Burley Inclusive Adam runs a Learning Disability Support service in the UK and his service will be an integral part of the testing phase.

 David McNab: 

  • Better known as Sherpa Reynolds Dave takes time away from game development and lends a hand at building our Q-Scan mobile App

Keith Sinclair: 

  • A good start up business needs a good mentor and that’s exactly what Keith is, with 20 years experience in the third sector Keith is Will’s business mentor and will help oversee project.

Project Timeline

Risks

There will always be risks that can delay you receiving your Q-Safe key ring, although unlikely we thought we would share them with you;

  • Delay due to software development – we will do everything we can to keep you informed and explain any delays that may occur
  • Delay due to testing – testing the finished product may highlight problems we have yet to encounter on our prototype. We will keep you informed throughout the process on the problems faced and how we are overcoming them.
  • Dispatch – There is always a low risk of the product not arriving, please be sure to contact us and we will rectify this.

Contact
Any questions about Q-Safe, donations or would like more information on the campaign please contact: info@inclusivemediasolutions.co.uk
For Media and PR: will@inclusivemediasolutions.co.uk

Thank you

being anxious and scared. Q-Safe is discreet and can be kept on them at all times and is simply
initiated by the users Smart Device. With your help we will be able to make Q-Safe weatherpoof



Is it safe?
With years of experience working with vulnerable people we
know that safeguarding is essential. Q-Safe is a custom developed system; if
the user looses or misplaces their key ring we can simply disable it centrally
from our system. This deactivates the keyring and a new one can be distributed to the user.




Scanning Q-Safe is easy!
To scan the Q-Safe key ring we have developed a FREE app available
on iOS and Android devices. Our App is a ‘scan and go’ QR code scanner designed
for simplicity and ease of use, ideal for people with Learning Disabilities,
Dementia and other cognitive difficulties. With your help we will be able to further develop this App to support Q-Safe across various mobile platforms




Where will the funds go?
We have been working on our prototype for 6 months, we’ve
worked with our target market on looks, functionality, safety and ease of use.
We now need your help to overcome the final hurdle and make our prototype ready
for commercial use. Your support will help tens of thousands of vulnerable
people keep safe. We will use the funds on the following areas:



QR system development - Custom system set up on our safe and secure server 

App development - Ensure compatibility with Q-Safe and testing
Materials and distribution - Plastic casing on keyring for weatherproofing and durability. Distribution of product to Perk 4
Final stage testing - With a variety of ages across the market to gather further primary feedback
Website development: Update website showing product, graphics and information. 






Why people with cognitive disabilities need your help
Mobile technology is revolutionising the
way we interact with the world and it’s changing all our lives for the better.
It’s important we understand how mobile technology can help people with
Learning Disabilities, Dementia and associated cognitive difficulties by
providing them with innovative solutions to the independence they deserve.
Meet the Team
William
Britton: 

Founder and Director of Inclusive Media Solutions Will is deeply
passionate about how mobile technology can enrich the lives of people with
cognitive disabilities.


Adam
Burley: 



Founder and Director of Burley Inclusive Adam runs a Learning
Disability Support service in the UK and his service will be an integral part
of the testing phase.


 David
McNab: 



Better known as Sherpa Reynolds Dave takes time away from game
development and lends a hand at building our Q-Scan mobile App

Keith
Sinclair: 


A good start up business needs a good mentor and that’s exactly what
Keith is, with 20 years experience in the third sector Keith is Will’s business
mentor and will help oversee project.


Project Timeline



Risks
There will
always be risks that can delay you receiving your Q-Safe key ring, although
unlikely we thought we would share them with you;


Delay due to software development –
we will do everything we can to keep you informed and explain any delays that
may occur


Delay due to testing – testing the
finished product may highlight problems we have yet to encounter on our
prototype. We will keep you informed throughout the process on the problems
faced and how we are overcoming them.


Dispatch – There is always a low
risk of the product not arriving, please be sure to contact us and we will
rectify this.



Contact

Any questions about Q-Safe, donations or would like more information on the campaign please contact: info@inclusivemediasolutions.co.uk

For Media and PR: will@inclusivemediasolutions.co.uk












Thank you

story:
Introduction

I have created this Indiegogo campaign to raise money for a security test of Odoo by NCC Group.

Odoo is the fastest growing business management ERP software (and it is Open Source too), and NCC Group are a world leader in software security testing.

In line with the Odoo responsible Disclosure policy, all issues reported and addressed will be reported on their page  here: https://www.odoo.com/page/responsible-disclosure and patches will be released. The Partner perk is to bring you in to the NDA during the process.

Confirmed issues will be published on the Odoo Github security issues page here.

I will be working with Odoo and partners to use the funds raised in the most effective way to get the best from this campaign.

If you care about the way people store your data within their businesses, you should read on.

Background

Modern companies, large and small, are under pressure to provide more efficient services and interfaces where customers can self-serve, and this often puts information at risk. The Public Sector is also affected, with healthcare suffering frequent breaches.

We all would benefit from a world where people can get on with doing good business with confidence in their connected applications, and vendors should have comfort that the solution that they have installed is up to the job.

The evidence

A quick search on google for ERP vulnerabilities should provide enough evidence of the impact of the issues, and the Information Commissioners office (ICO) is reporting a sustained level of registered breaches despite increased profile of the issues and investments in systems.

ERPScan released a paper in 2015 describing some real issues with mainstream ERP packages, including demonstrations and examples. PWC report that the scale and cost of breaches has doubled in their 2015 survey and the UK Government are urging business to do more in a press release of June 2015.

What do I intend to do about it?

The traditional ERP industry seems averse to engaging in public conversations about security, often suggesting that it is an issue with the platform, not the application, or offering costly solutions. Therefore, it becomes risky and expensive to build services that consumers demand and suppliers aspire to.

Surprisingly, many of the best solutions are also the simplest and least costly. To achieve an acceptable level of security, there are many areas of concern including networking, applications, training, culture, physical and remote access. It is not feasible to assess everything for everyone, but at the least, we need to find an application that can pass some basic tests to give an implementation a fighting chance to be secure.

I have worked with software applications critical to businesses for over 20 years, and have seen some serious problems waiting to happen, as much as I can see some really good implementations. For the last 15 years, I have been running OpusVL - a company that implements enterprise Open Source solutions.

The industry needs to step up to the demands of small and large business, but it is not easy to make an impact with the big ERP vendors. Odoo (previously known as OpenERP) is feature-rich and Open Source, I think this is the best place to start, and the benefits of crowd funded improvements can be felt by anyone who chooses to download it.

I have decided to launch this crowd funding project to raise the profile of the issues, and professionally and credibly deliver real solutions through the Odoo application.

Does this really affect you?

Before you think to yourself that this does not affect you, consider how many companies hold your data or provide you with services across the public and private sectors. Do you assume that their systems are secure? Have you ever asked? What would you ask anyway?

You need them to be secure as much as they do - help me raise the bar for security across business applications. By funding this project, Odoo will have a formal security assessment and set the new bar, we will have raised the profile of the issues and other ERP vendors will not be able to ignore it.

Has this been done before?

There are many cases where crowd funding and collaborations have been used to check and improve the security of popular Open Source software.

ITPortal write here about how Crowd Funding is a good way to address the security of Open Source software. ZDNet report on the funding of security audits for key Open Source applications here and a report by the Telegraph here. An article here from the University of Cambridge describes some of the work they have done on community funded projects.

Why now?

The instances of data leak, attacks and breaches are growing yet businesses need to improve productivity by implementing more software, much of this in the "cloud". The marketplace is growing, security is not keeping up.

Forbes report on the PWC prediction that cloud connected business software revenue will more than double by 2016 to $78Bn, it is likely that something that holds your data will be affected.

Open Source has matured, it exists in almost every piece of modern technology, from home devices such as phones, TV's and smart homes, to enterprise IT, cars and machines; the credibility and usefulness is no longer in question.

The impact of this audit will enable greater use of Odoo including banking & finance and the Public Sector.

The project

I am looking to raise £10,000 to commission NCC Group to test the features of Odoo. OpusVL will provision the Odoo software, create documentation to be released back to the Odoo project and manage the overall project. The team at OpusVL are focussed on Open Source and business. They have managed various projects with NCC previously and have worked with Odoo for nearly a decade. NCC have tested many business applications and Open Source software.

A technical overview of the project can be found below, along with more details of the people involved.

Once the funding project has completed, the test will commence. It is anticipated that the process will be complete within 4 weeks and reports issued in line with the levels of sponsorship.

What will the funding be used for?


Ready to go

To prepare for this project, I have the following in place:

  1. Full support and co-operation of Odoo SA – The editor of the Odoo ERP software

  2. A 35 page proposal form NCC describing how they will carry out the audit and understanding that the work will be carried out during August

  3. A team of experts at OpusVL who can manage the results of the audit, create and submit patches and provide feedback

  4. An installed and ready to test Odoo platform

  5. A network of supportive Odoo partners should more resources be needed

- All that is needed now is to raise the funds

What will I do with £10,000?

If I reach my target of £10,000, I will be able to launch a formal security audit of Odoo by NCC Group, and from the learnings of the audit, create documentation for the community to benefit from.

We will have achieved a baseline security understanding of Odoo.

Engagement of NCC Group

NCC Group will provide a security audit in consultation with the partners sponsoring the project. The audit will include:

  • Pre-audit plan
  • Audit of the base Odoo application:
  • - log-in pages
  • - database management
  • - session handling
  • - module management
  • General scripted tests against Odoo
  • Post-audit report

Production of Odoo security guides

The following guides / cheat sheets will be created by the team working on the project:

  • Developer guide - making secure modules for Odoo
  • System Administrator - Best practices for implementing a secure Odoo
  • ERP / Odoo user - Don't be the weakest link when using Cloud ERP

The documents will include contributions made by supporters of this project, and will be submitted to the Odoo Technical Documentation repository for others to extend and contribute to under a creative commons license.

Stretch goals
Stretch 1: If £25,000 is raised
  • A full audit will be performed by NCC as described in the technical overview below
  • The audit will include the top 3 modules requested by the "stretch vote" 
  • Documents will be further extended with information learned with this more extensive process

Stretch 2:  If £40,000 is raised

  • Source code analysis - review of the core Odoo code base - See the technical description for more details

Stretch 3: If £75,000 is raised

  • Odoo logic review and review - See the technical description for more details

Stretch 4: If £85,000 is raised

  • A high-security module will be created that can be applied to ensure optimum security and implement best practice within Odoo based on the knowledge gained from this campaign.
  • The source code audit will be extended, additional modules tested and further documentation provided.

If the campaign looks as it may exceed these goals, I will update it with new stretch goals and also take on board suggestions from funders.

How does this help you?

For the Odoo partner

  • Real security enhancements

  • Increase in Odoo profile

  • Enrich the Odoo brand - taking security seriously

For the Odoo user

  • Confidence that the security of Odoo is taken seriously

  • Assurance that data entered in to Odoo is safe

For the Odoo developer

  • Support the creation of a best practice guide for creating Odoo addons

  • Provide a better understanding of the threat model

For the system administrator

  • Know the applications you are deploying have been tested

  • Reduce risk of unauthorised access to other applications

  • Benefit from independent information on implementing a secure Odoo installation

For the Open Source supporter

  • Support yet another Open Source application become best of breed

  • Enhance the security reputation of Open Source

For the ERP user

  • Consider this an investment in the future security of the ERP industry

  • Help raise awareness of the issues affecting the industry

  • Get your vendor to take notice - your vendor may not respond to an individual case, but they will notice an industry-funded campaign

  • Enable new functionality and features by increasing competition

For everyone else

  • You don't have to work in healthcare to be affected by a healthcare data breach, the same for schools, businesses that you may interact with

  • Your suppliers - you need them to be safe

  • What if your customer had a breach and went out of business?

More about the team


I have selected NCC Group as they are globally recognised as a software security leader, respected by Governments and corporates alike. As one of the largest providers of penetration and security testing in Europe, they have a wide range of penetration testing skills, including social engineering attacks. The company claims to be 100% ethical where all testers undergo rigorous vetting.

Although I have invited NCC to undertake this project, they are acting independently, NCC have no ties to any commercial suppliers including Odoo and OpusVL. They boast full ISO/IEC 27001 certification and hold the CESG CHECK accreditation and have numerous CLAS personnel.

NCC Group is an active member of CREST, the standards-based organisation for penetration test suppliers, aimed at ensuring highest standards of leading-edge security testing and hold both Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) and Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) for the PCI DSS and PA-DSS compliance.


Back in 2006, I selected what was then TinyERP, now Odoo, to be the Open Source ERP platform to build upon. Although Version 3 was rough round the edges, it was built on an extensible and robust framework, the only one of it's kind. I was sure that it would ultimately challenge the marketplace, and it seems that the time has now come. Odoo have created the next generation ERP software.

Based on implementing best practice web methods within their ERP application, they are able to achieve the flexibility, performance and security of a web based system, with the functionality of an ERP (and lots more). I believe that Odoo is already probably one of the most secure ERP systems, but I want to test this theory further and evidence this. Many legacy ERP applications are shamefully inadequate when it comes to security, Odoo is already very promising, but this needs to be proven.

Odoo operate a "responsible disclosure" programme for security reports, meaning that anyone submitting a report must agree not to share it until a patch is released, the enterprise customers have been notified, and a reasonable period of time has passed for remedial work before public announcements are made.

Odoo are now one of Europe's fastest growing companies, and recently been visited by the European Commission when they launched their 315€Bn business growth fund - details here: https://www.odoo.com/page/press-release-european-commission-visit

OpusVL have worked with Odoo since V3.3 both internally and for clients, and has installed one of Europe’s largest installations. Modules are created on a daily basis and advanced functionality is regularly implemented. The company has robust project management methodologies blended with flexible processes.
Operating their own hosting environments and having been on the receiving end of NCC security audits for high-profile clients on numerous occasions, this project can be managed effectively and efficiently by the team.

The team implement Odoo for real businesses so are close to the contemporary issues faced, and hear the questions asked by users and business leaders alike, making them ideally suited to manage the project. OpusVL is committed to Open Source communities and employs staff that share this ethos.

OpusVL development staff routinely look for bugs and improvements for Odoo as well as the other Open Source applications they work with. Issues are reported to the code maintainers and where patches have been created, these are submitted to the application code repositories. In most cases, Odoo accept issues filed by OpusVL and bring them in to the main code base.

Some recent reports by OpusVL relate to SQL injections, session ID hijacking and cross site scripting bugs. These generally require a level of privilege on the system already, but never the less, are undesirable. The view from the OpusVL team is that Odoo are designing software with security as a first principle and are ready to accept security reports, this project will further refine their processes. OpusVL will manage this project under my guidance.

FAQ

What if the project is over-funded?

There is lots to do, As explained in the stretch goals, the test can be widened across modules, and across versions. There is an excellent network of partners around the globe who have skills to extend the project if needed. There is no upper level that cannot be put to good use to support the objectives of the project.

Does this make my implementation of Odoo secure?

No, this is focussed on the application, you will still need to use good practice when implementing it for yourself, and ensure you have a culture of security within the organisation. You may want to commission your own security test once you have implemented Odoo. With this project, you know the state of the Odoo application which will reduce the scope of risk.

Why is it not secure anyway?

I do not believe any connected system is "secure", it is levels of insecurity. Risk is determined by how hard someone will try to get at what you have. Most front doors are not secure, but most people do not have things worth the risk of stealing. If they do, they fit an alarm, and the house with the weakest security becomes the target. However, if you happen to have a very smart house, with lots of nice tech in the front window, you may want to increase security. Technology is the same, we need to make sure the level of security is appropriate for the use of the software, and the methods of access are understood.

This project is intended to raise funds to validate the level of security of the Odoo application, and use the balance to repair issues in priority order.

Why don't Odoo commission the audit?

Firstly security testing must be undertaken independently, it is more credible if the audit was commissioned externally. Secondly, Odoo make their full suite of software available at no cost. It would cost millions to replicate so they are already giving a great deal by allowing any one of us to use it for free.

Is Open Source more or less secure?

The fact that software is Open Source does not affect the level of security it provides. However, Open Source has the benefit that many users can see how it really works which enables issues to be found, best practice to be implemented and fixes made. Closed-source software relies on the internal development teams finding issues and fixing them. Sometimes software becomes stable, and no-one has an interest in updating it, with Open Source, if you have an interest, you can choose to fix it.

If Odoo was not Open Source, we would not be able to do a meaningful test anyway, and if we did, we would not be empowered to fix it.

Does publishing security defects enable rogues to break in?

No. It informs the users of the software that issues have been found, and provides a way to resolve them. Information is not released to the public for a short time, called the responsible disclosure period, this is typically a few weeks. Hiding security issues generally only benefits people who are trying to break in.

Surely I should expect Odoo to fix the software for free?

The Odoo application is Open Source - you get the benefit of millions of pounds of investment, shared by many who have designed and developed the software. By using the software for free, you cannot expect the value-added professional services of a security audit. Odoo provide an optional Enterprise contract which includes bug fixes when found. Any patches found through this process will be fed through the Enterprise process. Users of the Free Odoo application will find benefit from the improvements from the standard repositories but will have to help themselves or engage a knowledgeable company to install them.

Is Odoo considered more or less secure than other ERP software?

The ERP industry sets a low bar for security, we believe the starting position for Odoo is already much higher than the competition, however, we want to prove this.

So what else is Odoo doing to improve security?

Odoo already process many security reports every year and take it very seriously. This will be evidenced shortly when they launch a project on https://hackerone.com/

What happens when a new version of Odoo is released?

Any patches created will be applicable to future versions of Odoo, and in most cases, will also apply to previous versions.

What are other ERP providers doing?

Sadly, not enough. More and more businesses rely on ERP systems to run their day to day operations, their security concerns are sometimes resolved by costly bespoke fixes instead of improving the core platforms.

How will I get access to the fixes?

All patches and issues detected will be sent to Odoo in line with their standard "Responsible Disclosure" reporting policy. These are usually published by Odoo within a few weeks, once all enterprise customers have had sufficient notice.

Where will the output of this project be found?

The code and patches will be available on GitHub (the on-line code version control repository) along with the Odoo core code. Information will be submitted to the Odoo documentation and user guides will become available to the public in due course.

Who will own the code and documentation?

All of the work generated through this project will be released under Open Source / Creative Commons licenses for the benefit of the communities.

Is this for everyone?

It may not be for you if you do not have any data that is important enough to store securely, or if you feel that the systems that hold your data are flexible and secure enough already. Even so, you may feel that it is worth investing to help others reach a level of security that they can be comfortable with.


Stretch 1: The Full audit plan - Technical overview

If the campaign generates £25,000, a full audit will be carried out as detailed here.

Key objectives

From the independent verification, a report will be created:

  • any weaknesses that may be present, which an attacker aiming to compromise the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of data contained within an Odoo implementation and data could exploit

  • the threats facing information assets within Odoo so that the level of risk can be quantified and addressed, and adequate expenditure provided

  • that an Odoo user's security expectations and requirements are being met

  • that a thorough and comprehensive penetration test covering policy, procedure, design, and implementation has occurred

To adopt best practice by conforming to legal and industry regulations, NCC Group will analyse any weaknesses detected, evaluate the impact and probability of exploitation associated with each security weakness, formulate corrective actions, and provide recommendations for mitigating the risks associated with the vulnerability.

The test Odoo is Version 8 installed on an up to date Debian platform. It has the base set of standard modules installed including:

  • CRM

  • Sales order

  • Purchase order

  • Accounting & finance

  • Base web builder with contact form

Additionally, if target is met, the top 3 "stretch modules" will be included.

The following components are within the scope of the testing:

  • Login pages, both web and admin

  • URL's

  • Database admin

  • API

An assessment will take place of these modules to identify security vulnerabilities that may be exploited to compromise either the server-side application or ordinary users of the application. The assessment will involve the following broad areas of work:

  • Recon and analysis - mapping of the application's content and functionality, analyse its behaviour, identify all possible entry points for user input, and develop a clear understanding of the attack surface exposed by the application

  • Assessment of access handling - testing of the application's core security mechanisms, including authentication, session management, and access control, to identify any defects that may enable an attacker to gain unauthorised access to functionality and data

  • Assessment of input handling - test of the application's resilience to numerous kinds of unexpected input throughout its functionality, looking for code injection and other vulnerabilities

  • Assessment of application logic - probing for defects within the application's logic, including inappropriate reliance on client-side controls and logic flaws within server-side functionality

The primary areas of concern in web application security are authentication bypass, injection, account traversal, privilege escalation, and data extraction.

The testing methodology covers all of the OWASP top ten web application security risks and more:

  • A1: Injection

  • A2: Broken Authentication and Session Management

  • A3: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

  • A4: Insecure Direct Object References

  • A5: Security Misconfiguration

  • A6: Sensitive Data Exposed

  • A7: Missing Function Level Access Control

  • A8: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

  • A9: Using Known Vulnerable Components

  • A10: Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards

Web application assessments will be performed on the target Odoo application remotely. The purpose of the assessment is to identify any vulnerabilities which can be exploited in order to attack the system or other users, bypass controls, escalate privileges, or extract sensitive data.

During the assessment the consultants will use proven non-invasive testing techniques to quickly identify any weaknesses. The application is viewed and manipulated from several perspectives, including with no credentials, user credentials, and privileged user credentials.

Test details

The following tests will be included.

Unvalidated Input

Where information from web requests is not validated before being used by a web application, an attacker could use this flaw to access and attack the supporting back-end components or other users. Examples of this type of attack include cross-site scripting, SQL injection, OS command injection, and SOAP injection.

Broken Access Control

Access control restrictions determine what authenticated users are allowed to do in a web application. When they are not properly enforced an attacker can exploit these flaws to access other users’ accounts, view sensitive files, or use unauthorised functions.

Broken Authentication and Session Management

When account credentials and session tokens are not properly protected, an attacker can exploit these weaknesses in order to defeat authentication restrictions and assume other users’ identities. Session hijacking can be achieved when a valid session token is exploited to gain unauthorised access to information or services in a computer system. Session tokens are normally randomised or encrypted to prevent session hijacking. Cookies are supposed to be stored and sent back to the server unchanged, but an attacker can modify their values. The process of tampering with the value of cookies is called cookie poisoning, and is sometimes used after cookie theft to make an attack persistent. When a user logs in to an application, they usually supply a user ID or username and password to access it. It is possible for an attacker to discover the user ID and, with one part of the authentication taken care of, to run a brute-force attack which attempts to match a library of words to the password.

Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Flaws

This occurs when the web application can be used as a mechanism to transport an attack to an end-user’s browser. A successful attack could disclose the end-user’s session token, attack the local machine, or spoof content to fool the user. An attacker can exploit these vulnerabilities by creating a malicious link or writing malicious code into a web application.

Buffer Overflows

Some web application server-side components may be vulnerable to buffer overflow attacks. A remote attacker may be able to provide specially-crafted malicious input which causes the components to crash and, in some cases, can lead to remote code execution. The affected components are usually drivers, CGI, libraries, and web application server components.

Injection Flaws

Web applications often pass parameters or arguments between the application and the OS or external system. If an attacker can embed malicious commands in these parameters, the external system may execute those commands on behalf of the web application. Most frequently this attack uses SQL or LDAP. SQL injection is the inputting of malicious SQL commands to the web front-end presentation service. SQL injection is possible on applications which dynamically create content on the server via a call to a SQL server (Oracle, MS-SQL, MySQL etc.). A lack of filtering on the client-side data input can allow an attacker to delimit the existing SQL query and append additional SQL. This means that any value which can be manipulated by the client may be vulnerable, including hidden values and parameters passed in both GET and POST HTTP requests.

Improper Error Handling

There are instances where error conditions occur during normal operations and are not handled properly. If an attacker can identify the errors that the web application fails to handle correctly, they can systematically force those errors, revealing system information.

Insecure Storage

Storing information such as credentials usually involves cryptography. Integrating cryptography into a web application can be complex, and as a result there are often deficiencies in its execution. When the cryptographic function is not coded properly, or is not integrated appropriately, information is not protected.

Denial of Service

An attacker can survey an application to determine what processes use the most resources. With this knowledge it is possible to consume web application resources to a point where legitimate users can no longer access or use the application. In extreme cases the application can be knocked over and cease functioning completely.

Insecure Configuration Management

Having a strong server configuration standard is critical to a secure web application. These servers have many configuration options that affect security and are not secure out of the box. Configuration management ensures that any box being built from new has the correct security configuration and administration settings for its environment and purpose.

Detailed Methodology

An in-depth and thorough assessment of in-scope web applications will be performed to ensure that correct configuration and recommended practices have been followed to minimise client exposure. The following is a sample list of common tests that are performed when carrying out an application test. It will vary depending on the technology and protocols that have been implemented.

Web Server Specific

  • Identify known vulnerabilities related to the web server version.

  • Assess configuration issues.

  • Search for default web server content.

  • Identify information leakage.

  • Locate information hidden within field variables of HTML forms and comments.

  • Examine information contained in banners, usage instructions, help messages, and error messages.

Authentication

  • Find a possible brute-force password guessing point in the application.

  • Find valid login credentials with password grinding.

  • Review lockout policy for failed attempts

  • Review lockout timeout

  • Assess use of generic authentication error messages, preventing username enumeration.

  • Bypass authentication with spoofed tokens.

  • Bypass authentication with replay of authentication information.

  • Determine the application logic to maintain authentication sessions, such as number of failures, logins allowed, and login timeouts.

  • Determine the limitations of access control in the applications – access permissions, login session duration, and idle duration.

Input Manipulation

  • Find limitations of defined variables and protocol payload, data length and type, construct format.

  • Use exceptionally long character strings to find buffer overflow vulnerability in applications.

  • Concatenate commands in the input strings of the applications.

  • Inject SQL language in the input strings of database-tied web applications.

  • Examine cross-site scripting opportunities in the web application.

  • Examine unauthorised directory or file access with path and directory traversal.

  • Manipulate session or persistent cookies.

  • Manipulate the (hidden) field variable in the HTML forms.

  • Manipulation of HTTP fields such as “Referrer” and “Host”.

  • Check validation, ensuring strong type, length, and data-format input.

  • Determine the protocol specification of the server or client application.

Deduce the program logic from error or debug messages in application outputs and from program behaviours and performance. By forcing the application to generate errors, useful information can be gained about the logic of the program

Session Management

  • Determine session management information – number of concurrent sessions, IP-based authentication, role-based authentication, identity-based authentication, cookie usage, and session ID in hidden HTML field variables.

  • Estimate session ID sequence and format.

  • Determine if the session ID is maintained with IP address information; check if the same information can be retrieved on another machine.

  • Gather excessive information with direct URL, direct instruction, action sequence jumping, or page skipping.

  • Replay gathered information to fool applications.

  • Check if commercially-proven session tokens such as ASP.NET_SessionID or JSESSIONID are in use.

  • Ensure session variables are kept server side.

  • Check for validation, cookie re-injection, and cookie manipulation.

  • Ensure session tokens are not mixed with authentication tokens.

  • Ensure authentication cookies are non-persistent.

  • Check if a session timeout is enforced.

  • Check simultaneous login functionality

  • Ensure that the user session is deleted on logout.

  • Ensure the client-server communication channel is adequately secured for its intended use.

Language and Application Specific

  • Identify application default content.

  • Availability of administration interface.

  • Check for default accounts.

Output Manipulation

  • Retrieve valuable information stored in cookies.

  • Retrieve valuable information from the client application cache.

  • Retrieve valuable information stored in serialised objects.

  • Retrieve valuable information stored in temporary files and object.


Stretch 2: - Source code review

All software, no matter how well-written, has bugs. These bugs can, if an attacker becomes aware of them, become a vector for attack.

It is difficult for even the most skilled programmers to see the flaws in their own work, and an outside review of the code will often turn up potentially-dangerous vulnerabilities that have been missed by the development team.

With a professional code review, the number of vulnerabilities in your software will be minimised, and thus the opportunities for attackers to use your product for malicious purposes.

NCC Group’s consultants have a vast knowledge of security issues relevant to web applications, with experience in all common web programming languages and frameworks, as well as all major servers.

While automated tools are used to find common vulnerabilities, the bulk of the work will involve the consultants manually analysing the source code and configuration files for the application, with special attention being paid to those areas of the code which interact with the database, implement error-handling functionality, involve login and session management, or are otherwise likely to contain vulnerabilities.

The review will lead to a full report, with details of all issues found and suggestions for mitigation. This activity will give you the assurance you need that your application is free from common vulnerabilities, and that data within the application is secure.

If the project is over funded, a revised test plan will be provided to all funders. The methodology will be the same, but the scope will be increased to cover more modules. Stretch module votes will be counted and modules will be tested in order of votes.

As the test is only directed at the application, the platform will not become part of the assessment. For this reason, it should not matter what operating system is used, and Debian is our preference for ease of implementation.


Stretch 3: Logical testing

The logical make-up of the application is assessed from a completely unauthenticated stand point to make sure the application is not vulnerable to misuse in all forms.

Reporting

Sponsors eligible for a report will receive the results in line with the industry standard Common Vulnerability Scoring System. CVSS is a vendor-independent industry open standard, designed to convey vulnerability severity and to help determine urgency and priority of response. The table below gives a key to the icons and symbols used throughout this report to provide a clear and concise risk scoring system. Not all vulnerabilities fall within CVSS; vulnerabilities which are not covered by CVSS are referred to as custom issues and have a risk rating severity of critical, high, medium, low, or informational.



Thank you!
Thank you for reading, I do hope you can see the benefit of supporting this campaign.

Stuart J Mackintosh.
story_txt:
Introduction
I have created this Indiegogo campaign to raise money for a security test of Odoo by NCC Group. 
Odoo is the fastest growing business management ERP software (and it is Open Source too), and NCC Group are a world leader in software security testing.In line with the Odoo responsible Disclosure policy, all issues reported and addressed will be reported on their page  here: https://www.odoo.com/page/responsible-disclosure and patches will be released. The Partner perk is to bring you in to the NDA during the process.Confirmed issues will be published on the Odoo Github security issues page here. I will be working with Odoo and partners to use the funds raised in the most effective way to get the best from this campaign.If you care about the way people store your data within their businesses, you should read on.
Background
Modern companies, large and small,
are under pressure to provide more efficient services and interfaces
where customers can self-serve, and this often puts information at
risk. The Public Sector is also affected, with healthcare suffering frequent breaches.
We all would benefit from a world where people can get on with
doing good business with confidence in their connected
applications, and vendors should have comfort that the solution that they
have installed is up to the job.


The evidence
A quick search on google for ERP vulnerabilities should provide enough evidence of the impact of the issues, and the Information Commissioners office (ICO) is reporting a sustained level of registered breaches despite increased profile of the issues and investments in systems. 

ERPScan released a paper in 2015
 describing some real issues with mainstream ERP packages, including 
demonstrations and examples. PWC report that the scale and cost of 
breaches has doubled in their 2015 survey and the UK Government are urging business to do more in a press release of June 2015.What do I intend to do about it?
The traditional ERP industry seems averse to engaging in public 
conversations about
security, often suggesting that it is an issue with the platform, not
the application, or offering costly solutions. Therefore, it becomes 
risky and expensive to build services that consumers demand and 
suppliers aspire to.
Surprisingly, many of the best solutions are also the simplest
and least costly. To achieve an acceptable level of security, there are 
many areas of concern including networking, applications,
training, culture, physical and remote access. It is not feasible to
assess everything for everyone, but at the least, we need to find an
application that can pass some basic tests to give an implementation
a fighting chance to be secure.
I have worked with software applications critical to businesses for
over 20 years, and have seen some serious problems waiting to happen,
as much as I can see some really good implementations. For the last 15 years, I have been running OpusVL - a company that implements enterprise Open Source solutions.
The industry needs to step up to the demands of small and large 
business, but it is not easy to make an impact with the big ERP vendors.
 Odoo 
(previously known as OpenERP) is feature-rich and Open Source, I 
think this is the best place to start, and the benefits of crowd funded 
improvements can be felt by anyone who chooses to download it.

I have decided to launch this crowd funding project to raise the 
profile of the issues, and professionally and credibly deliver real 
solutions through the Odoo application.
Does this really affect you?
Before you think to yourself that this does not affect you,
consider how many companies hold your data or provide you with
services across the public and private sectors. Do you assume that their systems are secure? Have you ever
asked? What would you ask anyway? 
You need them to be secure as much
as they do - help me raise the bar for security across business 
applications. By funding this project, Odoo will have a formal security 
assessment and set the new bar, we will have raised the profile of the 
issues and other ERP vendors will not be able to ignore it.
Has this been done before?
There are many cases where crowd funding and collaborations have been
 used to check and improve the security of popular Open Source software.
ITPortal write here
 about how Crowd Funding is a good way to address the security of Open 
Source software. ZDNet report on the funding of security audits for key 
Open Source applications here and a report by the Telegraph here. An article here from the University of Cambridge describes some of the work they have done on community funded projects.
Why now?The instances of data leak, attacks and breaches 
are growing yet businesses need to improve productivity by implementing 
more software, much of this in the "cloud". The marketplace is growing, 
security is not keeping up.Forbes report
 on the PWC prediction that cloud connected business software revenue 
will more than double by 2016 to $78Bn, it is likely that something that
 holds your data will be affected.Open Source has matured, it 
exists in almost every piece of modern technology, from home devices 
such as phones, TV's and smart homes, to enterprise IT, cars and 
machines; the credibility and usefulness is no longer in question.The impact of this audit will enable greater use of Odoo including banking & finance and the Public Sector.
The project
I am looking to raise £10,000 to commission NCC Group
 to test the
features of Odoo. OpusVL will provision the Odoo software, create 
documentation to be released back to the Odoo project and manage the 
overall project. The team at OpusVL are focussed on Open Source and 
business. They have managed various projects with NCC previously and 
have worked with Odoo for nearly a decade. NCC have tested many business
 applications and Open Source software.
A technical overview of the project can be found below, along with more details of the people involved.
Once the funding project has completed, the test will
commence. It is anticipated that the process will be complete within
4 weeks and reports issued in line with the levels of sponsorship. 
What will the funding be used for?

Ready to go
To prepare for this project, I have the following in place: 



Full support and co-operation of
	Odoo SA – The editor of the Odoo ERP software


A 35 page proposal form NCC
	describing how they will carry out the audit and understanding that
	the work will be carried out during August 
	


A team of experts at OpusVL who
	can manage the results of the audit, create and submit patches and
	provide feedback 
	


An installed and ready to test
	Odoo platform 
	


A network of supportive Odoo
	partners should more resources be needed 
	


- All that is needed now is to raise the funds
What will I do with £10,000?
If I reach my target of £10,000, I will be able to launch a formal security audit of Odoo by NCC Group, and from the learnings of the audit, create documentation for the community to benefit from.We will have achieved a baseline security understanding of Odoo.Engagement of NCC GroupNCC Group will provide a security audit in consultation with the partners sponsoring the project. The audit will include:
Pre-audit plan

Audit of the base Odoo application:

- log-in pages
- database management
- session handling
- module management

General scripted tests against Odoo

Post-audit report
Production of Odoo security guidesThe following guides / cheat sheets will be created by the team working on the project:
Developer guide - making secure modules for Odoo

System Administrator - Best practices for implementing a secure Odoo

ERP / Odoo user - Don't be the weakest link when using Cloud ERP

The documents will include contributions made by supporters of this project, and will be submitted to the Odoo Technical Documentation repository for others to extend and contribute to under a creative commons license.

Stretch goals

Stretch 1: If £25,000 is raised
A full audit will be performed
by NCC as described in the technical overview below

The audit will include the top 3 modules requested by the "stretch vote" 
Documents will be further extended with information learned with this more extensive process

Stretch 2:  If £40,000 is raised
Source code analysis - review of the core Odoo code base - See the technical description for more details
Stretch 3: If £75,000 is raisedOdoo logic review and review - See the technical description for more details
Stretch 4: If £85,000 is raised 
A high-security module will be
created that can be applied to ensure optimum security and implement
best practice within Odoo based on the knowledge gained from this campaign.
The source code audit will be extended, additional modules tested and further documentation provided.




If the campaign looks as it may exceed these goals, I will update it 
with new stretch goals and also take on board suggestions from funders.How does this help you?
For the Odoo
partner


Real security enhancements 
	


Increase in Odoo profile 
	


Enrich the Odoo brand - taking security seriously 
	


For the Odoo user


Confidence that the security of
	Odoo is taken seriously 
	


Assurance that data entered in to Odoo is safe 
	


For the Odoo
developer


Support the creation of a best
	practice guide for creating Odoo addons 
	


Provide a better understanding of the threat model 
	


For
the system administrator


Know the applications you are
	deploying have been tested 
	


Reduce risk of unauthorised access
	to other applications 
	


Benefit from independent information on implementing a secure
	Odoo installation 
	


For
the Open Source supporter


Support yet another Open Source
	application become best of breed 
	


Enhance the security reputation of Open Source 
	


For the ERP user


Consider this an investment in the future security
	of the ERP industry 
	


Help raise awareness of the issues
	affecting the industry 
	


Get your vendor to take notice -
	your vendor may not respond to an individual case, but they will
	notice an industry-funded campaign 
	


Enable new functionality and features by increasing
	competition 
	


For everyone else


You don't have to work in
	healthcare to be affected by a healthcare data breach, the same for
	schools, businesses that you may interact with 
	


Your suppliers - you need them to
	be safe 
	


What if your customer had a breach and went out of business? 
	


More about the team


I have selected NCC Group as they are globally recognised as a software security
leader, respected by Governments and corporates alike. As one of the
largest providers of penetration and security testing in Europe, they have a wide range of penetration testing skills, including
social engineering attacks. The company claims to be 100% ethical where all
testers undergo rigorous vetting. 

Although I have invited NCC to undertake this project, they are
acting independently, NCC have no ties to any commercial suppliers including Odoo and OpusVL.
They boast full ISO/IEC 27001 certification and hold the CESG CHECK
accreditation and have numerous CLAS personnel. 

NCC Group is an active member of CREST, the standards-based
organisation for penetration test suppliers, aimed at ensuring
highest standards of leading-edge security testing and hold both
Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) and Qualified Security Assessor (QSA)
for the PCI DSS and PA-DSS compliance.


Back in 2006, I selected what was then TinyERP, now Odoo, to be the
Open Source ERP platform to build upon. Although Version 3 was rough
round the edges, it was built on an extensible and robust framework,
the only one of it's kind. I was sure that it would ultimately
challenge the marketplace, and it seems that the time has now come.
Odoo have created the next generation ERP software. 

Based on implementing best practice web methods within their ERP
application, they are able to achieve the flexibility, performance
and security of a web based system, with the functionality of an ERP
(and lots more). I believe that Odoo is already probably one of the
most secure ERP systems, but I want to test this theory further and
evidence this. Many legacy ERP applications are shamefully inadequate 
when it comes to security, Odoo is already very promising, but
this needs to be proven. 

Odoo operate a "responsible disclosure" programme for
security reports, meaning that anyone submitting a report must agree
not to share it until a patch is released, the enterprise customers
have been notified, and a reasonable period of time has passed for
remedial work before public announcements are made.
Odoo are now one of Europe's fastest growing companies, and
recently been visited by the European Commission when they launched
their 315€Bn business growth fund - details here: https://www.odoo.com/page/press-release-european-commission-visitOpusVL have worked with Odoo since V3.3 both internally and for
clients, and has installed one of Europe’s largest installations.
Modules are created on a daily basis and advanced functionality is
regularly implemented. The company has robust project management
methodologies blended with flexible processes. Operating their own
hosting environments and having been on the receiving end of NCC
security audits for high-profile clients on numerous occasions, this
project can be managed effectively and efficiently by the team.The team implement Odoo for real businesses so are close to the
contemporary issues faced, and hear the questions asked by users and
business leaders alike, making them ideally suited to manage the
project. OpusVL is committed to Open Source communities and employs
staff that share this ethos.OpusVL development staff routinely look for bugs and improvements
for Odoo as well as the other Open Source applications they work
with. Issues are reported to the code maintainers and where patches
have been created, these are submitted to the application code
repositories. In most cases, Odoo accept issues filed by OpusVL and bring them
in to the main code base.Some recent reports by OpusVL relate to SQL injections, session ID
hijacking and cross site scripting bugs. These generally require a
level of privilege on the system already, but never the less, are
undesirable. The view from the OpusVL team is that Odoo are designing
software with security as a first principle and are ready to accept
security reports, this project will further refine their processes. OpusVL will manage this project under my guidance.

FAQ


What if the project is over-funded?
There is lots to do, As explained in the stretch goals, the test
can be widened across modules, and across versions. There is an
excellent network of partners around the globe who have skills to
extend the project if needed. There is no upper level that cannot be
put to good use to support the objectives of the project. 


Does this make my implementation of Odoo secure?
No, this is focussed on the application, you will still need to
use good practice when implementing it for yourself, and ensure you
have a culture of security within the organisation. You may want to
commission your own security test once you have implemented Odoo.
With this project, you know the state of the Odoo application which
will reduce  the scope of risk. 

Why
is it not secure anyway?
I do not believe any connected system is "secure", it is
levels of insecurity. Risk is determined by how hard someone will try
to get at what you have. Most front doors are not secure, but most
people do not have things worth the risk of stealing. If they do,
they fit an alarm, and the house with the weakest security becomes the 
target. However, if you happen to have a very smart house,
with lots of nice tech in the front window, you may want to increase
