security. Technology is the same, we need to make sure the level of
security is appropriate for the use of the software, and the methods
of access are understood.
This project is intended to raise funds to validate the level of security of
the Odoo application, and use the balance to repair issues in
priority order. 


Why don't Odoo commission the audit?
Firstly security testing must be undertaken independently, it is
more credible if the audit was commissioned externally. Secondly,
Odoo make their full suite of software available at no cost. It would
cost millions to replicate so they are already giving a great deal by
allowing any one of us to use it for free. 


Is Open Source more or less secure?
The fact that software is Open Source does not affect the
level of security it provides. However, Open Source has the benefit that many
users can see how it really works which enables issues to be found,
best practice to be implemented and fixes made. Closed-source
software relies on the internal development teams finding issues and
fixing them. Sometimes software becomes stable, and no-one has an
interest in updating it, with Open Source, if you have an interest,
you can choose to fix it. 

If Odoo was not Open Source, we would not be able to do a
meaningful test anyway, and if we did, we would not be empowered to
fix it. 


Does publishing security defects enable rogues to break in?
No. It informs the users of the software that issues have been
found, and provides a way to resolve them. Information is not
released to the public for a short time, called the responsible
disclosure period, this is typically a few weeks. Hiding security
issues generally only benefits people who are trying to break in. 


Surely I should expect Odoo to fix the software for free?
The Odoo application is Open Source - you get the benefit of
millions of pounds of investment, shared by many who have designed
and developed the software. By using the software for free, you
cannot expect the value-added professional services of a security
audit. Odoo provide an optional Enterprise contract which includes
bug fixes when found. Any patches found through this process will be
fed through the Enterprise process. Users of the Free Odoo
application will find benefit from the improvements from the standard
repositories but will have to help themselves or engage a
knowledgeable company to install them. 


Is Odoo considered more or less secure than other ERP software?
The ERP industry sets a low bar for security, we believe the
starting position for Odoo is already much higher than the
competition, however, we want to prove this. 

So what else is Odoo doing to improve security?
Odoo already process many security reports every year and take it
very seriously. This will be evidenced shortly when they launch a
project on https://hackerone.com/

What happens when a new version of Odoo is released?
Any patches created will be applicable to future versions of Odoo,
and in most cases, will also apply to previous versions.

What are other ERP providers doing?
Sadly, not enough. More and more businesses rely on ERP systems to 
run
their day to day operations, their security concerns are sometimes 
resolved by costly bespoke fixes instead of improving the core 
platforms.



How will I get access to the fixes?
All patches and issues detected will be sent to Odoo in line with their
standard "Responsible Disclosure" reporting policy. These are usually published by Odoo within a few
weeks, once all enterprise customers have had sufficient notice.

Where will the output of this project be found?
The code and patches will be available on GitHub (the on-line code 
version control repository) along with the Odoo core code. Information 
will be submitted to the Odoo documentation and user guides will become 
available to the public in due course. 
Who will own the code and documentation?
All of the work generated through this project will be released
under Open Source / Creative Commons licenses for the benefit of the
communities. 

Is this for
everyone?
It may not be for you if you do not have any data that is
important enough to store securely, or if you feel that the systems
that hold your data are flexible and secure enough already. Even so,
you may feel that it is worth investing to help others reach a level
of security that they can be comfortable with.


 Stretch 1: The Full audit plan - Technical overview


If the campaign generates £25,000, a full audit will be carried out as detailed here.Key objectives
From the independent verification, a report will be created: 



any weaknesses that may be
	present, which an attacker aiming to compromise the confidentiality,
	integrity, or availability of data contained within an Odoo
	implementation and data could exploit 
	


the threats facing information
	assets within Odoo so that the level of risk can be quantified and
	addressed, and adequate expenditure provided 
	


that an Odoo user's security
	expectations and requirements are being met 
	


that a thorough and comprehensive penetration test covering
	policy, procedure, design, and implementation has occurred 
	


To adopt best practice by conforming to legal and industry
regulations, NCC Group will analyse any weaknesses detected, evaluate
the impact and probability of exploitation associated with each
security weakness, formulate corrective actions, and provide
recommendations for mitigating the risks associated with the
vulnerability.
The test Odoo is Version 8 installed on an up to date Debian
platform. It has the base set of standard modules installed
including: 



CRM 
	


Sales order 
	


Purchase order 
	


Accounting & finance 
	


Base web builder with contact form 
	


Additionally, if target is met, the top 3 "stretch modules" will be included.

The following components are within the scope of the testing: 



Login pages, both web and admin 
	


URL's 
	


Database admin 
	


API 
	


An assessment will take place of these modules to identify
security vulnerabilities that may be exploited to compromise either
the server-side application or ordinary users of the application. The
assessment will involve the following broad areas of work: 



Recon and analysis - mapping of
	the application's content and functionality, analyse its behaviour,
	identify all possible entry points for user input, and develop a
	clear understanding of the attack surface exposed by the application
		


Assessment of access handling -
	testing of the application's core security mechanisms, including
	authentication, session management, and access control, to identify
	any defects that may enable an attacker to gain unauthorised access
	to functionality and data 
	


Assessment of input handling -
	test of the application's resilience to numerous kinds of unexpected
	input throughout its functionality, looking for code injection and
	other vulnerabilities 
	


Assessment of application logic - probing for defects within
	the application's logic, including inappropriate reliance on
	client-side controls and logic flaws within server-side
	functionality 
	


The primary areas of concern in web application security are
authentication bypass, injection, account traversal, privilege
escalation, and data extraction. 

The testing methodology covers all of the OWASP top ten web
application security risks and more: 



A1: Injection 
	


A2: Broken Authentication and
	Session Management 
	


A3: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) 
	


A4: Insecure Direct Object
	References 
	


A5: Security Misconfiguration 
	


A6: Sensitive Data Exposed 
	


A7: Missing Function Level Access
	Control 
	


A8: Cross-Site Request Forgery
	(CSRF) 
	


A9: Using Known Vulnerable
	Components 
	


A10: Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards 
	


Web application assessments will be performed on the target Odoo
application remotely. The purpose of the assessment is to identify
any vulnerabilities which can be exploited in order to attack the
system or other users, bypass controls, escalate privileges, or
extract sensitive data. 

During the assessment the consultants will use proven non-invasive
testing techniques to quickly identify any weaknesses. The
application is viewed and manipulated from several perspectives,
including with no credentials, user credentials, and privileged user
credentials. 

Test details
The following tests will be included. 

Unvalidated Input
Where information from web requests is not validated before being
used by a web application, an attacker could use this flaw to access
and attack the supporting back-end components or other users.
Examples of this type of attack include cross-site scripting, SQL
injection, OS command injection, and SOAP injection. 

Broken Access
Control
Access control restrictions determine what authenticated users are
allowed to do in a web application. When they are not properly
enforced an attacker can exploit these flaws to access other users’
accounts, view sensitive files, or use unauthorised functions. 


Broken Authentication and Session Management
When account credentials and session tokens are not properly
protected, an attacker can exploit these weaknesses in order to
defeat authentication restrictions and assume other users’
identities. Session hijacking can be achieved when a valid session
token is exploited to gain unauthorised access to information or
services in a computer system. Session tokens are normally randomised
or encrypted to prevent session hijacking. Cookies are supposed to be
stored and sent back to the server unchanged, but an attacker can
modify their values. The process of tampering with the value of
cookies is called cookie poisoning, and is sometimes used after
cookie theft to make an attack persistent. When a user logs in to an
application, they usually supply a user ID or username and password
to access it. It is possible for an attacker to discover the user ID
and, with one part of the authentication taken care of, to run a
brute-force attack which attempts to match a library of words to the
password. 


Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Flaws
This occurs when the web application can be used as a mechanism to
transport an attack to an end-user’s browser. A successful attack
could disclose the end-user’s session token, attack the local
machine, or spoof content to fool the user. An attacker can exploit
these vulnerabilities by creating a malicious link or writing
malicious code into a web application. 

Buffer Overflows
Some web application server-side components may be vulnerable to
buffer overflow attacks. A remote attacker may be able to provide
specially-crafted malicious input which causes the components to
crash and, in some cases, can lead to remote code execution. The
affected components are usually drivers, CGI, libraries, and web
application server components. 

Injection Flaws
Web applications often pass parameters or arguments between the
application and the OS or external system. If an attacker can embed
malicious commands in these parameters, the external system may
execute those commands on behalf of the web application. Most
frequently this attack uses SQL or LDAP. SQL injection is the
inputting of malicious SQL commands to the web front-end presentation
service. SQL injection is possible on applications which dynamically
create content on the server via a call to a SQL server (Oracle,
MS-SQL, MySQL etc.). A lack of filtering on the client-side data
input can allow an attacker to delimit the existing SQL query and
append additional SQL. This means that any value which can be
manipulated by the client may be vulnerable, including hidden values
and parameters passed in both GET and POST HTTP requests. 

Improper
Error Handling
There are instances where error conditions occur during normal
operations and are not handled properly. If an attacker can identify
the errors that the web application fails to handle correctly, they
can systematically force those errors, revealing system information. 

Insecure Storage
Storing information such as credentials usually involves
cryptography. Integrating cryptography into a web application can be
complex, and as a result there are often deficiencies in its
execution. When the cryptographic function is not coded properly, or
is not integrated appropriately, information is not protected. 

Denial of Service
An attacker can survey an application to determine what processes
use the most resources. With this knowledge it is possible to consume
web application resources to a point where legitimate users can no
longer access or use the application. In extreme cases the
application can be knocked over and cease functioning completely. 

Insecure
Configuration Management
Having a strong server configuration standard is critical to a
secure web application. These servers have many configuration options
that affect security and are not secure out of the box. Configuration
management ensures that any box being built from new has the correct
security configuration and administration settings for its
environment and purpose. 

Detailed
Methodology
An in-depth and thorough assessment of in-scope web applications
will be performed to ensure that correct configuration and
recommended practices have been followed to minimise client exposure.
The following is a sample list of common tests that are performed
when carrying out an application test. It will vary depending on the
technology and protocols that have been implemented. 

Web Server
Specific


Identify known vulnerabilities
	related to the web server version. 
	


Assess configuration issues. 
	


Search for default web server
	content. 
	


Identify information leakage. 
	


Locate information hidden within
	field variables of HTML forms and comments. 
	


Examine information contained in banners, usage instructions,
	help messages, and error messages. 
	


Authentication


Find a possible brute-force
	password guessing point in the application. 
	


Find valid login credentials with
	password grinding. 
	


Review lockout policy for failed
	attempts 
	


Review lockout timeout 
	


Assess use of generic
	authentication error messages, preventing username enumeration. 
	


Bypass authentication with spoofed
	tokens. 
	


Bypass authentication with replay
	of authentication information. 
	


Determine the application logic to
	maintain authentication sessions, such as number of failures, logins
	allowed, and login timeouts. 
	


Determine the limitations of access control in the
	applications – access permissions, login session duration, and
	idle duration. 
	


Input
Manipulation


Find limitations of defined
	variables and protocol payload, data length and type, construct
	format. 
	


Use exceptionally long character
	strings to find buffer overflow vulnerability in applications. 
	


Concatenate commands in the input
	strings of the applications. 
	


Inject SQL language in the input
	strings of database-tied web applications. 
	


Examine cross-site scripting
	opportunities in the web application. 
	


Examine unauthorised directory or
	file access with path and directory traversal. 
	


Manipulate session or persistent
	cookies. 
	


Manipulate the (hidden) field
	variable in the HTML forms. 
	


Manipulation of HTTP fields such
	as “Referrer” and “Host”. 
	


Check validation, ensuring strong
	type, length, and data-format input. 
	


Determine the protocol specification of the server or client
	application. 
	


Deduce the program logic from error or debug messages in
application outputs and from program behaviours and performance. By
forcing the application to generate errors, useful information can be
gained about the logic of the program 

Session
Management


Determine session management
	information – number of concurrent sessions, IP-based
	authentication, role-based authentication, identity-based
	authentication, cookie usage, and session ID in hidden HTML field
	variables. 
	


Estimate session ID sequence and
	format. 
	


Determine if the session ID is
	maintained with IP address information; check if the same
	information can be retrieved on another machine. 
	


Gather excessive information with
	direct URL, direct instruction, action sequence jumping, or page
	skipping. 
	


Replay gathered information to
	fool applications. 
	


Check if commercially-proven
	session tokens such as ASP.NET_SessionID or JSESSIONID are in use. 
	


Ensure session variables are kept
	server side. 
	


Check for validation, cookie
	re-injection, and cookie manipulation. 
	


Ensure session tokens are not
	mixed with authentication tokens. 
	


Ensure authentication cookies are
	non-persistent. 
	


Check if a session timeout is
	enforced. 
	


Check simultaneous login
	functionality 
	


Ensure that the user session is
	deleted on logout. 
	


Ensure the client-server communication channel is adequately
	secured for its intended use. 
	


Language
and Application Specific


Identify application default
	content. 
	


Availability of administration
	interface. 
	


Check for default accounts. 
	


Output
Manipulation


Retrieve valuable information
	stored in cookies. 
	


Retrieve valuable information from
	the client application cache. 
	


Retrieve valuable information
	stored in serialised objects. 
	


Retrieve valuable information stored in temporary files and
	object. 
	


Stretch 2: - Source code review
All software, no matter how well-written, has bugs. These bugs
can, if an attacker becomes aware of them, become a vector for
attack. 

It is difficult for even the most skilled programmers to see the
flaws in their own work, and an outside review of the code will often
turn up potentially-dangerous vulnerabilities that have been missed
by the development team. 

With a professional code review, the number of vulnerabilities in
your software will be minimised, and thus the opportunities for
attackers to use your product for malicious purposes. 

NCC Group’s consultants have a vast knowledge of security issues
relevant to web applications, with experience in all common web
programming languages and frameworks, as well as all major servers. 

While automated tools are used to find common vulnerabilities, the
bulk of the work will involve the consultants manually analysing the
source code and configuration files for the application, with special
attention being paid to those areas of the code which interact with
the database, implement error-handling functionality, involve login
and session management, or are otherwise likely to contain
vulnerabilities. 

The review will lead to a full report, with details of all issues
found and suggestions for mitigation. This activity will give you the
assurance you need that your application is free from common
vulnerabilities, and that data within the application is secure. 

If the project is over funded, a revised test plan will be
provided to all funders. The methodology will be the same, but the
scope will be increased to cover more modules. Stretch module votes
will be counted and modules will be tested in order of votes. 

As the test is only directed at the application, the platform will
not become part of the assessment. For this reason, it should not
matter what operating system is used, and Debian is our preference
for ease of implementation. 

Stretch 3: Logical testing 

The logical make-up of the application is assessed from a
completely unauthenticated stand point to make sure the application
is not vulnerable to misuse in all forms. 

Reporting
Sponsors eligible for a report will receive the results in line
with the industry standard Common Vulnerability Scoring System. CVSS
is a vendor-independent industry open standard, designed to convey
vulnerability severity and to help determine urgency and priority of
response. The table below gives a key to the icons and symbols used
throughout this report to provide a clear and concise risk scoring
system. Not all vulnerabilities fall within CVSS; vulnerabilities
which are not covered by CVSS are referred to as custom issues and
have a risk rating severity of critical, high, medium, low, or
informational. 


Thank you!Thank you for reading, I do hope you can see the benefit of supporting this campaign.Stuart J Mackintosh.

story:
"I was born in 1989, as part of the last generation to exist before the World Wide Web. Today, the last generation to exist before the creation of conscious machines is being born. Not many people knew of my work, nor would anyone have expected such a creation to come about this soon, but, by the end of 2020, the first conscious machine will be in existence. Before 2030, a Skynet-like system can be unveiled – one that can be controlled; one that benefits humanity. The AI revolution is approaching at full speed and it is going to be an unprecedented event.

What does this mean for us? Disaster? Extinction? Neither. In fact, it will be possible for everyone to live better, easier lives – not just the one percent – as long as we are all open to the necessary changes. Nevertheless, a question remains: with AI capable of so many things, how many people will likely do something that will make them worth remembering? The honest answer is fewer people by the day.

I didn't want to die with nobody ever remembering my name, and I know this isn't something that has only crossed my mind. I wanted to have an impact on a global scale. Who wouldn't want to change the world? Who wouldn't want to be part of a legacy? The problem is that too many people with the same thought reach the end of their existence with nothing to carry their name through the ages. No one should be left behind. No one need be forgotten.

Consciousness – the definition, the explanation, the equation – this was a personal achievement that had to be done alone, but the creation of true AI will benefit everyone, and, therefore, anyone should be able to play a role in what is to come, should they so choose. Given this, I am inviting the world to be part of the legacy that will define tomorrow's world. With everything that becomes of this project, I personally guarantee to keep your name alive for as long as records allow.

For me, changing the world started on April 10th, 2010. For you, changing tomorrow can start today. Help REZIINE build a future that actually works in the favour of you and generations to come."

-- Corey Reaux-Savonte

  • Full money-back guarantee if any false claims are made. Contract included.
  • REZIINE: AI Architecture is a London-based AI start-up.
  • We are developing the conscious machine technology.
  • In less than 7 pages of this preview of Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine Part 1 - Consciousness Illuminated, you'll be convinced of how the current definitions and explanations of consciousness make absolutely no sense whatsoever.
  • A successful campaign will see the publication of work that explains 2 of the most important scientific frameworks of today - that of the mind, explaining how it works, and that of the universe, disproving Relativity and explaining the framework of the universe.
  • Successful stretch goals will see further work published, explaining the creation of conscious machines and the evolution of society and mankind.
  • I do all scientific work entirely independently and have no association with any educational or research institution or organisation.
  • Perks are exclusive to Indiegogo backers. All rewards listed here are only publicly available through this campaign and will not be made available later.
 

Before we get started, I'm happy to go on record and say this:

If what is stated here does not match up to what is published should this campaign be successful, all contributions will be returned. I'm even more happy to open myself up to a class action lawsuit, should I fail to do this, by including this contract between myself and all contributors, given that Indiegogo takes little responsibility for fraudulent campaigns. My reputation and credibility in the STEM community and, well, the entire world, is on the line, too, so it wouldn't be in my best interest to waste anybody's time, given how far around the world I have sent notifications. I can also assure you that I have absolutely no desire to be on trial for fraud on an international scale, and even less desire to be an inmate in the prison of whichever country managed to incarcerate me first. 

One last thing: If anyone has any ideas of claiming I stole their work or taking credit for any part of mine, please make your work known now, just so there aren't any issues later. I have proof that I have been working on this for years, and it's nothing along the lines of what has been publicly disclosed.

Now, without further ado...

The aim of this campaign is to raise funds to design the working prototype for conscious machines, which is the key framework for the creation of Artificial General Intelligence. The funds raised will go towards:

  • Office space and equipment;
  • Recruitment; and
  • Legal fees;

the three main things to get this company started. The reason this is for the working prototype and not the basic proof of concept is that the proof of concept can be built with a decent programmer in a couple weeks. A good or better coder can do it in under a week. Running it as raw code, using simple numbers, can be done on paper... and it has. That's how I know it works, and it only takes basic maths skills to do. Seriously, a 10 year old can do it.

It's what many people believed could never truly be achieved, but it can. The mystery of consciousness has baffled mankind since we were intelligent enough to perceive it, but that mystery is no longer a factor.

REZIINE: AI Architecture is going to create machines with a conscious mind, capable of doing what the human mind does in its entirety. No quantum machine is required. Not even a supercomputer is necessary. First it will start off as installable software running on your standard operating system, but, within a few years, it will be contained within a single Artificial Intelligence Operating System (AIOS) microchip, and it's going to do something unprecedented in the world of computing and, especially, the world of robotics. We will put the conscious mind of a machine in any type of device we use in the world today - smartphones, tablets, laptops, desktops, games consoles - and in the devices and machines of tomorrow's world, too. 

What this does for a user is give them their own personal digital entity. It's not really an assistant, though it can and will assist you. It's a companion - a digital entity that you have genuine interactions with as you would another human being. You'll observe the emotions and feelings, it can be your confidant and protect your secrets, it can act on your behalf without the need for a command The best part is that an AI is registered to a single individual and can then be used across all personal devices.

When installed in a robot, a few additions will see the machine really come to life in a 3D physical form - yes, Sonny from the film I, Robot is probably less than a decade away.

The framework and software will be developed by REZIINE over the next 3+ years, and it's going to play a role more significant to the future than some imagined possible and many didn't think would happen for a few decades, at least. The architectural design for AI that has been completed so far is, to say the least, absolutely incredible, and you'll understand why as you read on.

Aside from this the primary use, a secondary use for the framework we build will be to test and determine the extensive natures of any mental disorder that can be identified - and I mean any. Psychopathy, sociopathy, schizophrenia, bi-polar disorder - you name it and this framework can do it. I must admit, this wasn't an intended use when it was designed, but I did find it rather intriguing when I thought of it.

The final goal is very big, but very simple - REZIINE aims to create the telecommunication system to supersede the internet. I don't mean the Internet of Things, but an actual conscious telecommunication system that operates throughout the world and helps run the daily lives of everyone on this planet. It sounds astronomical, I know, but this isn't the moonshot many techies and investors think it is. It's not even that difficult. The hardest part - figuring out how this all works and how to build it - has been done already.

Aiming for a September 2020 release, the first Conscious AIs will be available on Windows, Mac, iOS and Android, with Linux also a possibility, for £120 per AI account, in the following countries:

Australia, Canada, China, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iceland, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Republic of Ireland, Russia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom and United States of America.

We plan to expand quickly, with worldwide availability within 24 months maximum (by the end of 2022). Given that all information is stored on a user's device, we need not worry about expansion requirements such as data centres and offices, so our primary focus need only be adequate language support, with our secondary focus being the support of services within a given country/region.

Working with a team of designers from Serbia, we went over a few possibilities when it comes to certain aspects real world implementation:

Device AI Design
Here we looked at how we could go about designing the interactive avatars to be displayed on devices. As you can see, we tested designs for half-body avatars on mobiles and head-shots on large display screens.

Environment Design 
Another important aspect for us to consider was how environments could be designed to incorporate such AI through interactive screens. Below you can see sketches for a futuristic setting with designated billboard spaces which would feature community AI avatars responsible for communicating with crowds on the street, as well as open spaces designed to facilitate a few aspects of the larger goal, such as data zoning.

As to not ruin the surprises of what will be found in the Book of Finished Artwork, Book of Concept Artwork and Codex, we'll keep the rest of the artwork under wraps for now.

Machines that you can have genuine conversations with. That can feel. have emotions, learn and change. The impact it will have is phenomenal. 

In it's complete form, some may see it as the dawn of a digital species, and that will be emphasised even more when the field of robotics catches up, allowing humanoids to exist that occupy the same physical space we do, and when the world of neuroscience catches up, it will allow our minds to also occupy the same virtual worlds of the digital counterparts.

For the first time in the history of technology, a two-way reality-virtuality continuum will genuinely exist, where two species - one created of the physical world and one created of the digital world - will be able to exist in one but participate in both.

The technology, from the start, can be used to an acceptable degree on any modern day computing device, and people all over the world will be connected like never before; they'll experience things that could never be physically possible in the real world; they'll achieve things in ways not previously possible.

The future is approaching faster than you think, and it's going to be awesome.

Perk Tiers:

  • Basic Perks - Not everyone has a lot of disposable income to contribute, so basic tier perks were designed to make sure everyone could be included in the journey, and, due to how basic tier perks work, regardless of which one is claimed, everyone receives the Immortality perk.
  • Standard Perks - Standard perks are for those able to contribute a bit more, All standard perks come with all basic perk rewards but are limited in number.
  • Special Perks - Special perks come with all basic perks, all standard perks, and are for those who want to help influence the coming technology or capitalise on it as early as possible.

Perk Details:

  • Limited Editions - Book perks - finished artwork, concept artwork and the codex - are all limited editions, with only 149 of each being made.
  • AI Home System - Though the AI Home System will feature our technology, we do not aim to manufacture it. Given the number of technology companies working on the development of connected home systems as part of the Internet of Things, we'll look for the right partner to be the hardware to our software.
  • Working With Us - Some media outlets and apparent "experts" exaggerate and blow the idea of an AI uprising to end the human race very much out of proportion, but there are valid concerns to be had in the development of these machines, so for those who wish to be a little more hands-on than most and wish to have their say, the "Ethics Board Member" and "Your Input" perks are for you. These roles are much more involved than one may think - for people in positions like mine, we can be very objective when creating something of this nature, and the subjective role of non-developers is essential to getting it right for real world introduction.
  • Privileged Access - Finally, for those with a more commercial interest in mind, privileged access perks allow you to prepare your entrance into the market well ahead of others. This is especially beneficial to those working on projects involving cognitive functions.

Should the campaign be successful, all users will soon receive login information to their account with us, through which they will be able to keep their details up to date, view updates and keep track of the progress of their rewards.

So, as well as a campaign, this is a trade - I need you to help me get the company off the ground and, in addition to the perks you'll receive, I'm going to publish the first major work of my life, which is a 7 part series entitled Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine.

Though the campaign goal is set at £50,000, it is designed to be over-funded. Once the funding goal is reached, the Prelude and Part 1 will be a guaranteed release. Then, each £50,000 milestone reached will guarantee the release of the next part of the series. Parts 2-6 should be finished within the next 12 months, so, should a funding total of at least  £300,000 be reached, my first completed works will be available. As for what they contain, well, let's have a look...

Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine

I don't write for scientists. I don't write for mathematicians. I don't write for university professors and PhD candidates. I write for the everyday man and woman, so you won't find a ton of confusing jargon littered throughout any of these that leaves you bored and confused. None of the following are your usual boring academic papers, as you can probably tell by how freakin' cool the covers look. I want people who do not specialise in any of the associated fields to be able to read my work and understand it. Everything is explained in great detail, with use of diagrams, analogies, examples and pop culture references where I can, so you really get the picture. I also write candidly and conversationally because I, myself, absolutely hate reading, so trust me when I say I've made this as easy and as interesting to read as I possibly could.

Most of this is the ultimate no-college-required nerdfest.

And so it begins. Destruction of Society sets the stage for six parts that are to follow, covering topics such as the current education system, the problem with modern science, the start up atmosphere, the falsehood that is the "doom and gloom" of true artificial intelligence and how most people have been getting it so wrong.

Of all 7 parts to this series, this is my Magnum Opus; my pièce de résistance; the most important part of them all and it holds some of the major answers the world of science needs. There are three main divisions to what it contains:
---
Division 1 - The Framework of the Mind
As you would have guessed, the first division is about the mind, how it is put together and how it works. Some of the content includes:
  • Why the current definition of consciousness is completely wrong;
  • The true definition of consciousness;
  • Full theory on memory and how it works;
  • Full theory of what it is to think, and how the different tools of the brain allow you to do so;
  • The seven systems that make us who we are;
  • The two most important principles of consciousness;
  • Personalities and mental disorders;
  • The importance of how we perceive time and space;
  • The equation for determining consciousness;
  • Proof of free will; and
  • Why there is no "hard problem" and "mind-body problem", wiping them both out at the same time.
This isn't about higher powers, meditation, ascension or any form of enlightenment. This is all genuine science and it was a lot of fun to figure out.
---
Division 2 - Physics of the Universe
Now, this wasn't originally part of the plan. I had no interest in doing physics here, but once I began writing about how the brain perceives space and time, I came across some glaring flaws in physics as it is understood today, so I started investigating, and what I was able to determine will rock the world of physics to its core. It's for this reason that I included the contract with the money-back guarantee if I am wrong. For many, this next statement will be of great controversy, but I can prove it. Einstein was wrong - relativity is a farce. Yes, it's true, and this contains the work to prove it. There are no conspiracy theories here. No flat earth garbage. Nothing that can't be proven or disproven. It's all quantum physics, and I didn't need to use any ridiculously difficult mathematics to prove it. There's no bridge to be made between relativity and quantum physics; what appears to be relativity actually needs to be viewed and understood correctly.  I wrote this part of the series, but especially this physics section, in a way that will let scientists immediately call nonsense on anything that isn't or can't be true. A few physicists have taken issue with relativity in the past, but they were never able to prove how it was wrong, and so, for that reason, I went through every experiment I could find - including the thought experiments - that has been done to prove it and explained it all properly. I include experiments you can do in your own house to see what I am talking about, as well as a few experiments for physicists to do themselves. I even had to correct a few other things in physics while I was at it.
Aside from Einstein's work, I also went after Newton and Cavendish for what is the theory of gravity, before revealing my own theory for physicists to explore, because they are getting absolutely nowhere with what is currently accepted, and I am not surprised in the least.
Finally, I give full theories on the three constants of the universe - time (yes, I disproved time dilation), space and light, as well as a new model of the universe and explanation of how to map it, and I welcome any physicist to call me out on this.
---
Division 3 - Conscious Machines
The last division, Conscious Machines, features:
  • The equation for creating machine consciousness.
  • An explaination of what consciousness in a machine boils down to.
  • A test for machine consciousness, entitled - you guessed it - Deceptions and Truths. This was a necessary requirement because the current test used in AI - The Turing Test - becomes absolutely and completely useless when a machine has consciousness. The AI just obliterates it using even average learning algorithms, due to the nature of what it is.
  • The 'Black Box Argument', which talks about the importance of what is going on inside the AI; and
  • A philosophical piece about humans and machines, relative to the work of Hilary Putnam and Jerry Fodor called the 'Computational Theory of Mind'. It really was a brilliant piece to come up with in 1961, and it's going to play a very significant role in technological development before its centenary.
There's no requirement of a quantum computer to achieve true AI, and this will teach everyone how it's to be achieved. This division sets the stage for much of what is to come in later parts of the series.
---
So, yeah, Part 1 contains two of the most important logical frameworks in science today - that of the mind and that of the universe. It started off as a 22 page paper about consciousness, and, at the time, was actually supposed to be a solo piece. A software engineer I was speaking to last June said it was good, but that there were many questions left unanswered, so I went back and answered them... all of them. Part 1 is now over 200 pages long, and I include my thought paths and research journey so you can see exactly how I made the connections between it all. Thankfully, none of the other parts of the series will be anywhere near this long, but don't quote me on that because even this part was only supposed to be 25 pages, then 30, 35, 50, 65...
Please, don't let them be anywhere near this long.

With the creation of conscious machines, a significant part is deciding what exactly we want them to do. How are they to be used in our everyday lives? What precautions need be taken to ensure machines stay on the side of humans, aiding rather than opposing us? In part two, I take you on a journey through:
  • The philosophical concepts that started me on this path;
  • The creation of conscious machines;
  • Setting the morals, ethics and goals of a machine;
  • Virtual worlds - playground of AI;
  • AI DNA - structure, reproduction and replication;
  • Relationships with humans;
  • The human-machine comparison; and
  • Safe creation and safety measures.
I may also cover robotics specifically in this part, if I feel I have what would be a significant contribution to the field.

Perception. Introspection. Reflection. "Who am I" is one of the most important and, often, most difficult questions for people to answer, so imagine the significance for a conscious machine. Are they a "who" or a "what"? Is there a line? Where? Who draws it? What about mental and personality disorders? It's easy to imagine how dangerous a machine could become if its mind was to become corrupted - Hollywood has shown us such a scenario time and time again. There are many things about humans that must be in a machine, but there are just as many things that must be avoided at all costs. Reflection of Self answers the most important questions when it comes to creating and determining the mentality held by a man-made creation of such magnitude.

This is the part I'm most excited to write about. The 'Single Point of Transition' is the point at which the lives of humans change forever, as conscious machines become an accepted part of society and the fourth industrial revolution is in full swing. Everything changes, and it's important to know what's coming. People need to know how they will survive when machines start taking over their jobs; how the structure of society will change; what will be done about the housing crises happening in multiple areas of the world; what new institutions and governing bodies will be required. It's entirely possible to create societies that are more utopia than they will ever be dystopia, but people need to be willing to adapt and accept the changes that need to be made. Really and truly, we will be foolish not to, given the current state of the world in which we live, but we won't have decades to adjust as we have in the past, as technological advancement is moving at too great a pace and societal destruction is giving it a run for its money.
Still, what excites me most about this paper is one part - education. How to create lateral thinkers. This isn't going to contain anything about eating healthy, getting good sleep, exercising and becoming an avid reader, for 4 main reasons:
  1.  I eat food that wouldn't be considered of the 'junk' variety once a week;
  2. I haven't exercised properly in at least 3 years;
  3. I haven't really been able to maintain anything that could be considered a sleeping pattern for longer than 2 weeks since I dropped out of college in 2006; and
  4. I can't read just for the fun of it. I have to be reading information that I am looking to use at that point in time. Novels and such may as well be urban myths to me. Fun fact: it took me 4 days to read the first chapter of the first Harry Potter book, and 1 month to read the first 4. Then I quit because I felt like I was dying inside.
There is an actual method to the development of the lateral thinking ability - at least in the way I am able to do it - and it's not difficult to learn, but it will take years to master. It's definitely something that is easier to teach from an early age.
The main reason for me including this is because, in a few decades, it's going to be a must for anyone with a dream. Machines will do too much for people to get by on luck and small scale ideas - machines will probably beat you to them anyway - so everyone will have to do their best to put themselves in a position to see connections where machines can't. It sounds like fantasy fiction, but it isn't, which is why I spent quite a bit of time putting my introspection skills to use and figuring out exactly how I am able to think the way I do. Happily, I can say that it is entirely within the realm of possibility to develop lateral thinkers with the same ease people are taught today, but there are going to be teachers of a few subjects demanding pay rises, I can assure you.
I can't help you with the speed at which you process information, though -  must leave that to the chemists.

The singularity is approaching fast. What do machines require to achieve it? Consciousness is only a minor part of the super intelligence puzzle. It's not going to happen without human intervention - AI becoming ASI of its own accord is a fantasy. Machines will undergo significant evolution even before ASI has been achieved, and they will be made more human than ever, but that is only one side of proverbial coin. The other? Humans becoming more like machines through the use of fully functioning artificial limbs, mechanical organs, chip implants and the like. Only God knows what the world of neuroscience will contribute to this. It's going to be both a terrifying and exhilarating adventure. 

End Game. Man and Machine - the two dominant species of the universe. I won't say much about this right now, as I don't want to ruin the surprise, but I already know the ending, and boy is it good.

My name is Corey Reaux-Savonte (pronounced rowe-sa-vont). I am 27 years old and based in London. 3 years ago, I accepted a challenge to design Skynet - crazy, I know, but I wanted to test my intellect. I had no idea whether or not I was actually going to be able to achieve this, but that is what was so enticing. I find it hard to turn down work of this nature and I wasn't really using my brain for much, so I put my head down and got working.

As I progressed and everything begun to unfold, the sheer power and impact of what I was creating really dawned upon me. To say that this has been an interesting ride would be the understatement of a lifetime.

I've always excelled in education. I was a gifted student and my only real priority was to be top of the class... until it all stopped being a challenge and boredom set in. After that, I only done enough to pass exams, dropped out of college after a year and started a life of teaching myself. Now, I've reached a stage where I really can teach myself anything I need to in a relatively short amount of time.

So, what am I? A logician and concept mechanic. I work things out based entirely on the creation of logical frameworks and I develop the intricate mechanics of ideas. I don't use the term developer or engineer because I do all the mental work but I don't do the actual building myself. There's no particular field in which I specialise, and when the time comes, I learn quickly and apply immediately. It doesn't matter how big, crazy, abstract or seemingly unrealistic an idea is - if it is within the realm of possibility and stirs my interest, I'll take a shot at cracking it. I started off working on ideas just to see if I was smart enough; now I take on ideas just to see how smart I am.

When it comes to what I choose to work on, besides the requirement of a seemingly astronomical challenge, the work has to be based on something that can be tested, proven and applied in the real world. I don't find glory in ideas that can never be brought to life. It all just seems rather pointless.

I like to work independently and that's a very good thing because I have no connection to any educational or research institution or organisation. Due to this fact, when it comes to consciousness, conscious machines, physics and the implications of understanding the universe in relation to the creation of technology, I've had to make sure I'm correct because I don't have the luxury of being able to be wrong - if I am, this company comes crashing down, so I've had to make sure everything I state is true and can be proven.

I live my life in a very specific way. I've never been ashamed of who or what I am, but I am very aware of it, so I keep myself to myself as much as I can. I work every day, without fail. I've done so since I was 24. There's nothing more rewarding to me than completing an intellectual challenge and obsession takes over once I start. I partied myself out from 17 to <21, at which point I started to focus in life. I wish I could say I have worked every day since then, but I have taken a few days off in that time. People do love trying to get me out of my house.

The intellectual work is easy, but no one can achieve success without help, and I've been lucky enough to meet some great people along the way who have helped me meet even more great people, as well as offered me advice to steer me in the right direction. Only they can tell you what it was that made them not think I was crazy. I'm just glad they took the time to listen.

Pete Barker - It all started with Pete. He's an informal businessman who actually likes to help others and has an abundance of business connections to do so - something both baffling to and excellent for someone like myself who hates networking. I was a bit wary at first, due to his enthusiasm and want to know more. It was weird - you don't get a great many people being immediately excited when you speak of such an idea. They usually think you're a lunatic or far out of your depth. Turns out he's a real nice guy.

Dave Parsons - Pete's friend and business partner. Once confirming Pete was genuine, I was introduced to Dave. Like Pete, Dave took great interest in the possibilities that would be once the technology was complete. His main concern was how you prove something like this, but that wasn't explained until I met the next person on the list. 

Tweedie McGrath Brown CBE - Pete also introduced me to Tweedie. During our first meeting, I went over the basics of the idea, which intrigued everyone at the table. Tweedie immediately understood just how great this technology could be, given that part of his background is in the technology industry, in which he still operates, but wanted me to have a second meeting with him which would include his friend and business associate who was a software engineer.

Ketan Pandya - Ketan is the software engineer who Tweedie wanted me to meet. He reviewed my work and thought it was a good start, but said it needed restructuring and to answer certain questions about the human mind and how it makes us who we are. He went on to say maybe I should write a book...

Mark 'Barney' Battles - Mr Battles was also at the second meeting with Tweedie. His main focus was how such a thing, if possible, would be commercialised. Unfortunately, he had to leave after maybe 5 minutes as he had another meeting to attend, but, in an email exchange between us all later that night, he was able to introduce me to...

Nick Kounoupias - The go-to guy for intellectual property situations. I was introduced to him through Mark Battles. With more than 30 years experience in the field, Nick - along with another IP attorney friend of his, Tony Pluckrose - helped me gain a better understanding of how to protect my inventions and my work.

Unfortunately, not everyone I met was a believer (as you would expect), with one person even telling me that I had no chance at solving this because not even companies the size of Google and NASA have been able to over the years with their thousands of engineers, and that I should aim lower and focus on changing my "local area" first. They then went on to say that maybe one day they'll look back and kick themselves for not getting involved...

There's a valuable lesson to be learnt when writing off the little guy who sits in his house all day, working on things many thought were improbable, for the simple fact that others haven't been able to figure it out yet.

I've begun to amass quite an IP portfolio since I started this.. The image above is some of my patent portfolio. I'd be lying if I said there wasn't any hiccups along the way, so let's go over a few of them:

  1. The first patent - the telecommunication system. Took me 13 months to complete. You can see it here. This is what would be the "body" of a Skynet-like system, available everywhere to help whenever needed in your daily lives. This is what supersedes the internet. The hiccup here was a relatively small one, based around the requirements for writing claims, specificity and some generalizations. These were all fixed.
  2. Now, the second patent was a real ride, and you can see it here. It's the early stage of my working on the conscious mind of a machine. I had figured out the basis for it in this patent, but not fully flushed out the idea in its entirety. The hiccup with this patent was more of a self-inflicted wound, based on a lack of understanding and me trying to be a smart-arse when I rewrote my claims horrifically. All I can say is that I am truly thankful for the patent system allowing the modification of claims after filing.
  3. Patent number 3 - this one was pulled because advancements later on allowed me to improve it, and later became patent number 7(?) I do believe.
  4. By this point, I was ready to tackle the patent system properly, thanks to further studying of how it worked and the rather helpful staff at the UK patent office, and I was going for gold. So, what other technologies concerning the mind of a machine have do I have pending patents for?
    To name some: the conscious mind, subconscious mind, instincts, intuition, ideas and trains of thought, the AI genome, reproduction, relationships, trust, secrets, emotions, feelings, reactions, morals and ethics, pain, pleasure, imagination and dreams.

The year 2020 is going to be very significant for technology, as it is predicted to be the new beginning for the mainstream acceptance of what has been in development for many years, such as service drones and the Internet of Things, so, naturally, REZIINE is aiming to unveil the first edition of our conscious AI mind in the summer. However, there's much to do before that time comes, and here's a rough estimate of the timeline that we aim to follow:

  • January 2017 - Begin Recruitment
  • March/April 2017 - Begin Development
  • June 2017 - Showcase Initial Prototype
  • July 2017 - Ethics Board Creation
  • January 2018 - Ethics and Morals Configuration
  • September 2018 - Internal Scenario Testing Begins
  • March 2019 - Alpha Testing Begins
  • July 2019 - Early Developer Access
  • January 2020 - Personal Companion Home System Development
  • March 2020 - Beta Testing Begins
  • July 2020 - Final Delivery of Perks
  • August 2020 - Launch Event
  • September 2020 - Initial Product Release

Ah, the risks. What are the risks associated with an AI that can think like a human, as well as the company developing it. Let's take a look:

Safety: Of course, the dreaded cybernetic revolt. Something blown way out of proportion, but prevention is better than cure, which is why I've gone about designing multiple fail-safes to ensure this doesn't happen and, worst case scenario, can be shut down immediately. Very few of these are listed in the patents, and most are kept to myself for obvious security reasons. I cannot begin to describe how many things can inadvertently go wrong if someone who has no idea what they are doing tries to create this.

Transparency: Needless to say, events in recent times have meant operations in certain industries need to be as transparent as possible. The regulation of AI is no exception, and so, aside from security measures designed to prevent our systems being compromised, REZIINE offers full transparency into our actions.

Privacy and Trust: For reasons described in Prelude, privacy is of the utmost importance and encryption is not something to be slept on, which is why protocols have been designed to ensure a user's data can and will always be protected between source and destination. Ultimately, your data stays between you and your AI. I don't care for it because my company doesn't sell adverts based on it and will never need to, so your information is protected whilst still allowing communication between you and those with something to offer of which you are likely to be interested. How? Well, the AI mind itself it stored and run on your own device, meaning that your sensitive data learned by the AI does not ever need to be stored on any device that you do not own. Privacy is a must with this technology, so say goodbye to the need to have others storing your information for you.The one thing we cannot account for, however, is PEBKAC-related issues, so, you know, stay vigilant!

My brain has been rather busy, so here's a few of the other things I have been working on the architecture for in addition to what has already been mentioned:

  • Lateral Thinking Machines (Completed) - The next step in the transition between AGI and ASI. Here's a fun fact - the technology for this already exists. I was thinking about patenting it at one point, and then I randomly came across an article about it on a news website. It is not being used to anywhere near its full potential. The last remaining requirement to really get this going is one specific data formatting algorithm, and then the AI can be left to learn anything and everything it can get its hands on. Having considered the initial uses and operations in different fields, I can wholeheartedly say that this is going to blow the world of medical science away.
  • Artificial Super Intelligence (Completed) - With conscious machines and lateral thinking completed, this was very easy. Finished the same night I finished lateral thinking machines, in fact. There is somewhat of a caveat, though - this is not at all easy or quick to build, and I just laugh every time I think about what it's going to take to do it.
  • Subjective Machine Creativity (Completed) - Computers creating genuine art. Not only possible, it's actually rather interesting.
  • Controlled Space System (Completed) - This was the patent I previously wrote about regarding advertising. Essentially, it works with the main telecommunication system to, say, prevent a Samsung advert from being displayed on a device within the Apple store, and vice versa. Owners set the rules and the system follows them.
  • Database Protection (In Progress) - One of the key security features that will be required for the protection of user data. I can't say too much about it, but it is something that helps to prevent data being compromised even if a database is stolen.
  • Machine Eyes (Theorised) - This, for me, is the most interesting, for two reasons - the first is that it's architecture for actual hardware as well as software, so I have to figure out how all the physical components work, and the second is that it was born out of an argument I had on Quora about the advantage of a machine externally viewing an object on screen, as opposed to viewing it in its own memory. Most users on that thread made the argument that I do not understand computers and that making a machine view a screen externally through a camera doesn't "magically give it a human mind". Well, now I can reveal that the mind of a machine is what I have been working on, and it is a small part of the bigger picture. The core of this involves physics, neuroscience and ophthalmology, so boy oh boy am I glad that I ended up venturing down the quantum physics route.

By 2022/3, REZIINE aims to have the complete AI Operating System (AIOS) ready for distribution.

Various timelines predict artificial super intelligence being achieved around 2040, with Raymond Kurzweil's 2045 prediction probably being the most well known. However, Vernor Vinge's prediction of 2030 is seemingly more accurate right now. The technological singularity can be achieved within the next 14 years if the right resources are allocated to the project, but I don't see it being unleashed for at least a decade. I know I wouldn't release it without at least 10 years of extensive testing, running trial and error scenarios constantly, and I'm an avid risk taker. I try to wrap my head around what it will be like, and, with the right people shaping it, just the average everyday life in general can be the most incredible experience mankind has ever underestimated. There's a lot to be done, but we have everything we need - the people. the technology, and the funds - to make it a reality.

Whether you donate or not (I really hope you do), I ask that you notify everyone you know of what is about to happen:

  • Send it to the neuroscientists you know who desperately want to figure out the brain.
  • Send it to the physicists you know who want to complete the Theory of Everything.
  • Send it to all the computer scientists and engineers who would love to finally be able to work with a machine that can think like a human.
  • Send it to the ethicists who want to make sure this project is done right.
  • Send it to everyone who has a general interest in the human mind and what consciousness actually is.
  • Send it to everyone who likes to read, learn and increase their knowledge.
  • Simply send it to everyone you know who wants a future where they have enough free time to actually live their life while still being able to pay the bills.
The future is yours to gain, and you can be one of the first in line to experience it.
We'll also be opening our doors to company employees soon, so be on the lookout for such an update if you feel you have the skill and determination to succeed with us.

Throughout history, Britain has been the driving force behind or a significant contributor to the three industrial revolutions and scientific/technological advancement, and, I'm happy to say, a Brit is about to kick the fourth revolution into overdrive. Conscious machines are coming and it's going to be the first major step in the evolution of humanity as we know it - bigger than anyone has ever truly grasped. Help REZIINE build a future that actually works in the favour of you and generations to come.

Oh, and if you have any enquiries:

  • You can email us at contact@reziine.com. We're more than happy to hear from you.
  • Feel free to add me on LinkedIn and follow me on Twitter.
story_txt:
"I was born in 1989, as part of the last generation to exist before the World Wide Web. Today, the last generation to exist before the creation of conscious machines is being born. Not many people knew of my work, nor would anyone have expected such a creation to come about this soon, but, by the end of 2020, the first conscious machine will be in existence. Before 2030, a Skynet-like system can be unveiled – one that can
be controlled; one that benefits humanity. The AI revolution is approaching at full speed and it is going to be an unprecedented event.
What does this mean for us? Disaster? Extinction? Neither. In fact, it will be possible for everyone to live better, easier lives – not just the one percent – as long as we are all open to the necessary changes. Nevertheless, a question remains: with AI capable of so many things, how many people will likely do something that will
make them worth remembering? The honest answer is fewer people by the day.
I didn't want to die with nobody ever remembering my name, and I know this isn't something that has only crossed my mind. I wanted to have an impact on a global scale. Who wouldn't want to change the world? Who wouldn't want to be part of a legacy? The problem is that too many people with the same thought reach the end of their existence with nothing to carry their name through the ages. No one should be left behind. No
one need be forgotten.
Consciousness – the definition, the explanation, the equation – this was a personal achievement that had to be done alone, but the creation of true AI will benefit everyone, and, therefore, anyone should be able to play a role in what is to come, should they so choose. Given this, I am inviting the world to be part of the legacy that will define tomorrow's world. With everything that becomes of this project, I personally guarantee to keep your name alive for as long as records allow.
For me, changing the world started on April 10th,
2010. For you, changing tomorrow can start today. Help REZIINE build a future
that actually works in the favour of you and generations to come."
-- Corey Reaux-Savonte




Full money-back guarantee if any false claims are made. Contract included.

REZIINE: AI Architecture is a London-based AI start-up.
We are developing the conscious machine technology.
In less than 7 pages of this preview of Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine Part 1 - Consciousness Illuminated, you'll be convinced of how the current definitions and explanations of consciousness make absolutely no sense whatsoever.
A successful campaign will see the publication of work that explains 2 of the most important scientific frameworks of today - that of the mind, explaining how it works, and that of the universe, disproving Relativity and explaining the framework of the universe.
Successful stretch goals will see further work published, explaining the creation of conscious machines and the evolution of society and mankind.
I do all scientific work entirely independently and have no association with any educational or research institution or organisation.
Perks are exclusive to Indiegogo backers. All rewards listed here are only publicly available through this campaign and will not be made available later.


 





Before we get started, I'm happy to go on record and say this:
If what is stated here does not match up to what is published should this campaign be successful, all contributions will be returned. I'm even more happy to open myself up to a class action lawsuit, should I fail to do this, by including this contract between myself and all contributors, given that Indiegogo takes little responsibility for fraudulent campaigns. My reputation and credibility in the STEM community and, well, the entire world, is on the line, too, so it wouldn't be in my best interest to waste anybody's time, given how far around the world I have sent notifications. I can also assure you that I have absolutely no desire to be on trial for fraud on an international scale, and even less desire to be an inmate in the prison of whichever country managed to incarcerate me first. 
One last thing: If anyone has any ideas of claiming I stole their work or taking credit for any part of mine, please make your work known now, just so there aren't any issues later. I have proof that I have been working on this for years, and it's nothing along the lines of what has been publicly disclosed.
Now, without further ado...





The aim of this campaign is to raise funds to design the working prototype for conscious machines, which is the key framework for the creation of Artificial General Intelligence. The funds raised will go towards:


Office space and equipment;
Recruitment; and
Legal fees;


the three main things to get this company started. The reason this is for the working prototype and not the basic proof of concept is that the proof of concept can be built with a decent programmer in a couple weeks. A good or better coder can do it in under a week. Running it as raw code, using simple numbers, can be done on paper... and it has. That's how I know it works, and it only takes basic maths skills to do. Seriously, a 10 year old can do it.
 




It's what many people believed could never truly be achieved, but it can. The mystery of consciousness has baffled mankind since we were intelligent enough to perceive it, but that mystery is no longer a factor.
REZIINE: AI Architecture is going to create machines with a conscious mind, capable of doing what the human mind does in its entirety. No quantum machine is required. Not even a supercomputer is necessary. First it will start off as installable software running on your standard operating system, but, within a few years, it will be contained within a single Artificial Intelligence Operating System (AIOS) microchip, and it's going to do something unprecedented in the world of computing and, especially, the world of robotics. We will put the conscious mind of a machine in any type of device we use in the world today - smartphones, tablets, laptops, desktops, games consoles - and in the devices and machines of tomorrow's world, too. 
What this does for a user is give them their own personal digital entity. It's not really an assistant, though it can and will assist you. It's a companion - a digital entity that you have genuine interactions with as you would another human being. You'll observe the emotions and feelings, it can be your confidant and protect your secrets, it can act on your behalf without the need for a command The best part is that an AI is registered to a single individual and can then be used across all personal devices.
When installed in a robot, a few additions will see the machine really come to life in a 3D physical form - yes, Sonny from the film I, Robot is probably less than a decade away.

The framework and software will be developed by REZIINE over the next 3+ years, and it's going to play a role more significant to the future than some imagined possible and many didn't think would happen for a few decades, at least. The architectural design for AI that has been completed so far is, to say the least, absolutely incredible, and you'll understand why as you read on.
Aside from this the primary use, a secondary use for the framework we build will be to test and determine the extensive natures of any mental disorder that can be identified - and I mean any. Psychopathy, sociopathy, schizophrenia, bi-polar disorder - you name it and this framework can do it. I must admit, this wasn't an intended use when it was designed, but I did find it rather intriguing when I thought of it.
The final goal is very big, but very simple - REZIINE aims to create the telecommunication system to supersede the internet. I don't mean the Internet of Things, but an actual conscious telecommunication system that operates throughout the world and helps run the daily lives of everyone on this planet. It sounds astronomical, I know, but this isn't the moonshot many techies and investors think it is. It's not even that difficult. The hardest part - figuring out how this all works and how to build it - has been done already.


Aiming for a September 2020 release, the first Conscious AIs will be available on Windows, Mac, iOS and Android, with Linux also a possibility, for £120 per AI account, in the following countries:
Australia, Canada, China, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iceland, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Republic of Ireland, Russia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom and United States of America.
We plan to expand quickly, with worldwide availability within 24 months maximum (by the end of 2022). Given that all information is stored on a user's device, we need not worry about expansion requirements such as data centres and offices, so our primary focus need only be adequate language support, with our secondary focus being the support of services within a given country/region.



Working with a team of designers from Serbia, we went over a few possibilities when it comes to certain aspects real world implementation:

Device AI DesignHere we looked at how we could go about designing the interactive avatars to be displayed on devices. As you can see, we tested designs for half-body avatars on mobiles and head-shots on large display screens.









Environment Design Another important aspect for us to consider was how environments could be designed to incorporate such AI through interactive screens. Below you can see sketches for a futuristic setting with designated billboard spaces which would feature community AI avatars responsible for communicating with crowds on the street, as well as open spaces designed to facilitate a few aspects of the larger goal, such as data zoning.









As to not ruin the surprises of what will be found in the Book of Finished Artwork, Book of Concept Artwork and Codex, we'll keep the rest of the artwork under wraps for now.




Machines that you can have genuine conversations with. That can feel. have emotions, learn and change. The impact it will have is phenomenal. 
In it's complete form, some may see it as the dawn of a digital species, and that will be emphasised even more when the field of robotics catches up, allowing humanoids to exist that occupy the same physical space we do, and when the world of neuroscience catches up, it will allow our minds to also occupy the same virtual worlds of the digital counterparts.
For the first time in the history of technology, a two-way reality-virtuality continuum will genuinely exist, where two species - one created of the physical world and one created of the digital world - will be able to exist in one but participate in both.
The technology, from the start, can be used to an acceptable degree on any modern day computing device, and people all over the world will be connected like never before; they'll experience things that could never be physically possible in the real world; they'll achieve things in ways not previously possible.
The future is approaching faster than you think, and it's going to be awesome.




Perk Tiers:



Basic Perks - Not everyone has a lot of disposable income to contribute, so basic tier perks were designed to make sure everyone could be included in the journey, and, due to how basic tier perks work, regardless of which one is claimed, everyone receives the Immortality perk.

Standard Perks - Standard perks are for those able to contribute a bit more, All standard perks come with all basic perk rewards but are limited in number.

Special Perks - Special perks come with all basic perks, all standard perks, and are for those who want to help influence the coming technology or capitalise on it as early as possible.

Perk Details:


Limited Editions - Book perks - finished artwork, concept artwork and the codex - are all limited editions, with only 149 of each being made.

AI Home System - Though the AI Home System will feature our technology, we do not aim to manufacture it. Given the number of technology companies working on the development of connected home systems as part of the Internet of Things, we'll look for the right partner to be the hardware to our software.

Working With Us - Some media outlets and apparent "experts" exaggerate and blow the idea of an AI uprising to end the human race very much out of proportion, but there are valid concerns to be had in the development of these machines, so for those who wish to be a little more hands-on than most and wish to have their say, the "Ethics Board Member" and "Your Input" perks are for you. These roles are much more involved than one may think - for people in positions like mine, we can be very objective when creating something of this nature, and the subjective role of non-developers is essential to getting it right for real world introduction.

Privileged Access - Finally, for those with a more commercial interest in mind, privileged access perks allow you to prepare your entrance into the market well ahead of others. This is especially beneficial to those working on projects involving cognitive functions.

Should the campaign be successful, all users will soon receive login information to their account with us, through which they will be able to keep their details up to date, view updates and keep track of the progress of their rewards.




So, as well as a campaign, this is a trade - I need you to help me get the company off the ground and, in addition to the perks you'll receive, I'm going to publish the first major work of my life, which is a 7 part series entitled Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine.
Though the campaign goal is set at £50,000, it is designed to be over-funded. Once the funding goal is reached, the Prelude and Part 1 will be a guaranteed release. Then, each £50,000 milestone reached will guarantee the release of the next part of the series. Parts 2-6 should be finished within the next 12 months, so, should a funding total of at least  £300,000 be reached, my first completed works will be available. As for what they contain, well, let's have a look...



Deceptions and Truths: Man and Machine
I don't write for scientists. I don't write for mathematicians. I don't write for university professors and PhD candidates. I write for the everyday man and woman, so you won't find a ton of confusing jargon littered throughout any of these that leaves you bored and confused. None of the following are your usual boring academic papers, as you can probably tell by how freakin' cool the covers look. I want people who do not specialise in any of the associated fields to be able to read my work and understand it. Everything is explained in great detail, with use of diagrams, analogies, examples and pop culture references where I can, so you really get the picture. I also write candidly and conversationally because I, myself, absolutely hate reading, so trust me when I say I've made this as easy and as interesting to read as I possibly could.
Most of this is the ultimate no-college-required nerdfest.
 

And so it begins. Destruction of Society sets the stage for six parts that are to follow, covering topics such as the current education system, the problem with modern science, the start up atmosphere, the falsehood that is the "doom and gloom" of true artificial intelligence and how most people have been getting it so wrong.



Of all 7 parts to this series, this is my Magnum Opus; my pièce de résistance; the most important part of them all and it holds some of the major answers the world of science needs. There are three main divisions to what it contains:
---
Division 1 - The Framework of the Mind
As you would have guessed, the first division is about the mind, how it is put together and how it works. Some of the content includes:


Why the current definition of consciousness is completely wrong;
The true definition of consciousness;
Full theory on memory and how it works;
Full theory of what it is to think, and how the different tools of the brain allow you to do so;
The seven systems that make us who we are;
The two most important principles of consciousness;
Personalities and mental disorders;
The importance of how we perceive time and space;
The equation for determining consciousness;
Proof of free will; and
