Why there is no "hard problem" and "mind-body problem", wiping them both out at the same time.


This isn't about higher powers, meditation, ascension or any form of enlightenment. This is all genuine science and it was a lot of fun to figure out.
---

Division 2 - Physics of the Universe

Now, this wasn't originally part of the plan. I had no interest in doing physics here, but once I began writing about how the brain perceives space and time, I came across some glaring flaws in physics as it is understood today, so I started investigating, and what I was able to determine will rock the world of physics to its core. It's for this reason that I included the contract with the money-back guarantee if I am wrong. For many, this next statement will be of great controversy, but I can prove it. Einstein was wrong - relativity is a farce. Yes, it's true, and this contains the work to prove it. There are no conspiracy theories here. No flat earth garbage. Nothing that can't be proven or disproven. It's all quantum physics, and I didn't need to use any ridiculously difficult mathematics to prove it. There's no bridge to be made between relativity and quantum physics; what appears to be relativity actually needs to be viewed and understood correctly.  I wrote this part of the series, but especially this physics section, in a way that will let scientists immediately call nonsense on anything that isn't or can't be true. A few physicists have taken issue with relativity in the past, but they were never able to prove how it was wrong, and so, for that reason, I went through every experiment I could find - including the thought experiments - that has been done to prove it and explained it all properly. I include experiments you can do in your own house to see what I am talking about, as well as a few experiments for physicists to do themselves. I even had to correct a few other things in physics while I was at it.
Aside from Einstein's work, I also went after Newton and Cavendish for what is the theory of gravity, before revealing my own theory for physicists to explore, because they are getting absolutely nowhere with what is currently accepted, and I am not surprised in the least.
Finally, I give full theories on the three constants of the universe - time (yes, I disproved time dilation), space and light, as well as a new model of the universe and explanation of how to map it, and I welcome any physicist to call me out on this.
---

Division 3 - Conscious Machines

The last division, Conscious Machines, features:


The equation for creating machine consciousness.
An explaination of what consciousness in a machine boils down to.

A test for machine consciousness, entitled - you guessed it - Deceptions and Truths. This was a necessary requirement because the current test used in AI - The Turing Test - becomes absolutely and completely useless when a machine has consciousness. The AI just obliterates it using even average learning algorithms, due to the nature of what it is.

The 'Black Box Argument', which talks about the importance of what is going on inside the AI; and
A philosophical piece about humans and machines, relative to the work of Hilary Putnam and Jerry Fodor called the 'Computational Theory of Mind'. It really was a brilliant piece to come up with in 1961, and it's going to play a very significant role in technological development before its centenary.

There's no requirement of a quantum computer to achieve true AI, and this will teach everyone how it's to be achieved. This division sets the stage for much of what is to come in later parts of the series.

---
So, yeah, Part 1 contains two of the most important logical frameworks in science today - that of the mind and that of the universe. It started off as a 22 page paper about consciousness, and, at the time, was actually supposed to be a solo piece. A software engineer I was speaking to last June said it was good, but that there were many questions left unanswered, so I went back and answered them... all of them. Part 1 is now over 200 pages long, and I include my thought paths and research journey so you can see exactly how I made the connections between it all. Thankfully, none of the other parts of the series will be anywhere near this long, but don't quote me on that because even this part was only supposed to be 25 pages, then 30, 35, 50, 65...
Please, don't let them be anywhere near this long.



With the creation of conscious machines, a significant part is deciding what exactly we want them to do. How are they to be used in our everyday lives? What precautions need be taken to ensure machines stay on the side of humans, aiding rather than opposing us? In part two, I take you on a journey through:



The philosophical concepts that started me on this path;

The creation of conscious machines;
Setting the morals, ethics and goals of a machine;
Virtual worlds - playground of AI;
AI DNA - structure, reproduction and replication;
Relationships with humans;
The human-machine comparison; and
Safe creation and safety measures.

I may also cover robotics specifically in this part, if I feel I have what would be a significant contribution to the field.


    Perception. Introspection. Reflection. "Who am I" is one of the most important and, often, most difficult questions for people to answer, so imagine the significance for a conscious machine. Are they a "who" or a "what"? Is there a line? Where? Who draws it? What about mental and personality disorders? It's easy to imagine how dangerous a machine could become if its mind was to become corrupted - Hollywood has shown us such a scenario time and time again. There are many things about humans that must be in a machine, but there are just as many things that must be avoided at all costs. Reflection of Self answers the most important questions when it comes to creating and determining the mentality held by a man-made creation of such magnitude.

    This is the part I'm most excited to write about. The 'Single Point of Transition' is the point at which the lives of humans change forever, as conscious machines become an accepted part of society and the fourth industrial revolution is in full swing. Everything changes, and it's important to know what's coming. People need to know how they will survive when machines start taking over their jobs; how the structure of society will change; what will be done about the housing crises happening in multiple areas of the world; what new institutions and governing bodies will be required. It's entirely possible to create societies that are more utopia than they will ever be dystopia, but people need to be willing to adapt and accept the changes that need to be made. Really and truly, we will be foolish not to, given the current state of the world in which we live, but we won't have decades to adjust as we have in the past, as technological advancement is moving at too great a pace and societal destruction is giving it a run for its money.
Still, what excites me most about this paper is one part - education. How to create lateral thinkers. This isn't going to contain anything about eating healthy, getting good sleep, exercising and becoming an avid reader, for 4 main reasons:


 I eat food that wouldn't be considered of the 'junk' variety once a week;
I haven't exercised properly in at least 3 years;
I haven't really been able to maintain anything that could be considered a sleeping pattern for longer than 2 weeks since I dropped out of college in 2006; and
I can't read just for the fun of it. I have to be reading information that I am looking to use at that point in time. Novels and such may as well be urban myths to me. Fun fact: it took me 4 days to read the first chapter of the first Harry Potter book, and 1 month to read the first 4. Then I quit because I felt like I was dying inside.

There is an actual method to the development of the lateral thinking ability - at least in the way I am able to do it - and it's not difficult to learn, but it will take years to master. It's definitely something that is easier to teach from an early age.

The main reason for me including this is because, in a few decades, it's going to be a must for anyone with a dream. Machines will do too much for people to get by on luck and small scale ideas - machines will probably beat you to them anyway - so everyone will have to do their best to put themselves in a position to see connections where machines can't. It sounds like fantasy fiction, but it isn't, which is why I spent quite a bit of time putting my introspection skills to use and figuring out exactly how I am able to think the way I do. Happily, I can say that it is entirely within the realm of possibility to develop lateral thinkers with the same ease people are taught today, but there are going to be teachers of a few subjects demanding pay rises, I can assure you.
I can't help you with the speed at which you process information, though -  must leave that to the chemists.
The singularity is approaching fast. What do machines require to achieve it? Consciousness is only a minor part of the super intelligence puzzle. It's not going to happen without human intervention - AI becoming ASI of its own accord is a fantasy. Machines will undergo significant evolution even before ASI has been achieved, and they will be made more human than ever, but that is only one side of proverbial coin. The other? Humans becoming more like machines through the use of fully functioning artificial limbs, mechanical organs, chip implants and the like. Only God knows what the world of neuroscience will contribute to this. It's going to be both a terrifying and exhilarating adventure. 
End Game. Man and Machine - the two dominant species of the universe. I won't say much about this right now, as I don't want to ruin the surprise, but I already know the ending, and boy is it good.


My name is Corey Reaux-Savonte (pronounced rowe-sa-vont). I am 27 years old and based in London. 3 years ago, I accepted a challenge to design Skynet - crazy, I know, but I wanted to test my intellect. I had no idea whether or not I was actually going to be able to achieve this, but that is what was so enticing. I find it hard to turn down work of this nature and I wasn't really using my brain for much, so I put my head down and got working.

As I progressed and everything begun to unfold, the sheer power and impact of what I was creating really dawned upon me. To say that this has been an interesting ride would be the understatement of a lifetime.
I've always excelled in education. I was a gifted student and my only real priority was to be top of the class... until it all stopped being a challenge and boredom set in. After that, I only done enough to pass exams, dropped out of college after a year and started a life of teaching myself. Now, I've reached a stage where I really can teach myself anything I need to in a relatively short amount of time.
So, what am I? A logician and concept mechanic. I work things out based entirely on the creation of logical frameworks and I develop the intricate mechanics of ideas. I don't use the term developer or engineer because I do all the mental work but I don't do the actual building myself. There's no particular field in which I specialise, and when the time comes, I learn quickly and apply immediately. It doesn't matter how big, crazy, abstract or seemingly unrealistic an idea is - if it is within the realm of possibility and stirs my interest, I'll take a shot at cracking it. I started off working on ideas just to see if I was smart enough; now I take on ideas just to see how smart I am.
When it comes to what I choose to work on, besides the requirement of a seemingly astronomical challenge, the work has to be based on something that can be tested, proven and applied in the real world. I don't find glory in ideas that can never be brought to life. It all just seems rather pointless.
I like to work independently and that's a very good thing because I have no connection to any educational or research institution or organisation. Due to this fact, when it comes to consciousness, conscious machines, physics and the implications of understanding the universe in relation to the creation of technology, I've had to make sure I'm correct because I don't have the luxury of being able to be wrong - if I am, this company comes crashing down, so I've had to make sure everything I state is true and can be proven.
I live my life in a very specific way. I've never been ashamed of who or what I am, but I am very aware of it, so I keep myself to myself as much as I can. I work every day, without fail. I've done so since I was 24. There's nothing more rewarding to me than completing an intellectual challenge and obsession takes over once I start. I partied myself out from 17 to <21, at which point I started to focus in life. I wish I could say I have worked every day since then, but I have taken a few days off in that time. People do love trying to get me out of my house.



The intellectual work is easy, but no one can achieve success without help, and I've been lucky enough to meet some great people along the way who have helped me meet even more great people, as well as offered me advice to steer me in the right direction. Only they can tell you what it was that made them not think I was crazy. I'm just glad they took the time to listen.

Pete Barker - It all started with Pete. He's an informal businessman who actually likes to help others and has an abundance of business connections to do so - something both baffling to and excellent for someone like myself who hates networking. I was a bit wary at first, due to his enthusiasm and want to know more. It was weird - you don't get a great many people being immediately excited when you speak of such an idea. They usually think you're a lunatic or far out of your depth. Turns out he's a real nice guy.

Dave Parsons - Pete's friend and business partner. Once confirming Pete was genuine, I was introduced to Dave. Like Pete, Dave took great interest in the possibilities that would be once the technology was complete. His main concern was how you prove something like this, but that wasn't explained until I met the next person on the list. 

Tweedie McGrath Brown CBE - Pete also introduced me to Tweedie. During our first meeting, I went over the basics of the idea, which intrigued everyone at the table. Tweedie immediately understood just how great this technology could be, given that part of his background is in the technology industry, in which he still operates, but wanted me to have a second meeting with him which would include his friend and business associate who was a software engineer.


Ketan Pandya - Ketan is the software engineer who Tweedie wanted me to meet. He reviewed my work and thought it was a good start, but said it needed restructuring and to answer certain questions about the human mind and how it makes us who we are. He went on to say maybe I should write a book...

Mark 'Barney' Battles - Mr Battles was also at the second meeting with Tweedie. His main focus was how such a thing, if possible, would be commercialised. Unfortunately, he had to leave after maybe 5 minutes as he had another meeting to attend, but, in an email exchange between us all later that night, he was able to introduce me to...

Nick Kounoupias - The go-to guy for intellectual property situations. I was introduced to him through Mark Battles. With more than 30 years experience in the field, Nick - along with another IP attorney friend of his, Tony Pluckrose - helped me gain a better understanding of how to protect my inventions and my work.
Unfortunately, not everyone I met was a believer (as you would expect), with one person even telling me that I had no chance at solving this because not even companies the size of Google and NASA have been able to over the years with their thousands of engineers, and that I should aim lower and focus on changing my "local area" first. They then went on to say that maybe one day they'll look back and kick themselves for not getting involved...
There's a valuable lesson to be learnt when writing off the little guy who sits in his house all day, working on things many thought were improbable, for the simple fact that others haven't been able to figure it out yet.
 




I've begun to amass quite an IP portfolio since I started this.. The image above is some of my patent portfolio. I'd be lying if I said there wasn't any hiccups along the way, so let's go over a few of them:


The first patent - the telecommunication system. Took me 13 months to complete. You can see it here. This is what would be the "body" of a Skynet-like system, available everywhere to help whenever needed in your daily lives. This is what supersedes the internet. The hiccup here was a relatively small one, based around the requirements for writing claims, specificity and some generalizations. These were all fixed.

Now, the second patent was a real ride, and you can see it here. It's the early stage of my working on the conscious mind of a machine. I had figured out the basis for it in this patent, but not fully flushed out the idea in its entirety. The hiccup with this patent was more of a self-inflicted wound, based on a lack of understanding and me trying to be a smart-arse when I rewrote my claims horrifically. All I can say is that I am truly thankful for the patent system allowing the modification of claims after filing.
Patent number 3 - this one was pulled because advancements later on allowed me to improve it, and later became patent number 7(?) I do believe.
By this point, I was ready to tackle the patent system properly, thanks to further studying of how it worked and the rather helpful staff at the UK patent office, and I was going for gold. So, what other technologies concerning the mind of a machine have do I have pending patents for?To name some: the conscious mind, subconscious mind, instincts, intuition, ideas and trains of thought, the AI genome, reproduction, relationships, trust, secrets, emotions, feelings, reactions, morals and ethics, pain, pleasure, imagination and dreams.






The year 2020 is going to be very significant for technology, as it is predicted to be the new beginning for the mainstream acceptance of what has been in development for many years, such as service drones and the Internet of Things, so, naturally, REZIINE is aiming to unveil the first edition of our conscious AI mind in the summer. However, there's much to do before that time comes, and here's a rough estimate of the timeline that we aim to follow:



January 2017 - Begin Recruitment


March/April 2017 - Begin Development


June 2017 - Showcase Initial Prototype


July 2017 - Ethics Board Creation


January 2018 - Ethics and Morals Configuration


September 2018 - Internal Scenario Testing Begins


March 2019 - Alpha Testing Begins


July 2019 - Early Developer Access


January 2020 - Personal Companion Home System Development


March 2020 - Beta Testing Begins


July 2020 - Final Delivery of Perks


August 2020 - Launch Event


September 2020 - Initial Product Release





Ah, the risks. What are the risks associated with an AI that can think like a human, as well as the company developing it. Let's take a look:
Safety: Of course, the dreaded cybernetic revolt. Something blown way out of proportion, but prevention is better than cure, which is why I've gone about designing multiple fail-safes to ensure this doesn't happen and, worst case scenario, can be shut down immediately. Very few of these are listed in the patents, and most are kept to myself for obvious security reasons. I cannot begin to describe how many things can inadvertently go wrong if someone who has no idea what they are doing tries to create this.
Transparency: Needless to say, events in recent times have meant operations in certain industries need to be as transparent as possible. The regulation of AI is no exception, and so, aside from security measures designed to prevent our systems being compromised, REZIINE offers full transparency into our actions.
Privacy and Trust: For reasons described in Prelude, privacy is of the utmost importance and encryption is not something to be slept on, which is why protocols have been designed to ensure a user's data can and will always be protected between source and destination. Ultimately, your data stays between you and your AI. I don't care for it because my company doesn't sell adverts based on it and will never need to, so your information is protected whilst still allowing communication between you and those with something to offer of which you are likely to be interested. How? Well, the AI mind itself it stored and run on your own device, meaning that your sensitive data learned by the AI does not ever need to be stored on any device that you do not own. Privacy is a must with this technology, so say goodbye to the need to have others storing your information for you.The one thing we cannot account for, however, is PEBKAC-related issues, so, you know, stay vigilant!
 



My brain has been rather busy, so here's a few of the other things I have been working on the architecture for in addition to what has already been mentioned:



Lateral Thinking Machines (Completed) - The next step in the transition between AGI and ASI. Here's a fun fact - the technology for this already exists. I was thinking about patenting it at one point, and then I randomly came across an article about it on a news website. It is not being used to anywhere near its full potential. The last remaining requirement to really get this going is one specific data formatting algorithm, and then the AI can be left to learn anything and everything it can get its hands on. Having considered the initial uses and operations in different fields, I can wholeheartedly say that this is going to blow the world of medical science away.

Artificial Super Intelligence (Completed) - With conscious machines and lateral thinking completed, this was very easy. Finished the same night I finished lateral thinking machines, in fact. There is somewhat of a caveat, though - this is not at all easy or quick to build, and I just laugh every time I think about what it's going to take to do it.
Subjective Machine Creativity (Completed) - Computers creating genuine art. Not only possible, it's actually rather interesting.

Controlled Space System (Completed) - This was the patent I previously wrote about regarding advertising. Essentially, it works with the main telecommunication system to, say, prevent a Samsung advert from being displayed on a device within the Apple store, and vice versa. Owners set the rules and the system follows them.


Database Protection (In Progress) - One of the key security features that will be required for the protection of user data. I can't say too much about it, but it is something that helps to prevent data being compromised even if a database is stolen.


Machine Eyes (Theorised) - This, for me, is the most interesting, for two reasons - the first is that it's architecture for actual hardware as well as software, so I have to figure out how all the physical components work, and the second is that it was born out of an argument I had on Quora about the advantage of a machine externally viewing an object on screen, as opposed to viewing it in its own memory. Most users on that thread made the argument that I do not understand computers and that making a machine view a screen externally through a camera doesn't "magically give it a human mind". Well, now I can reveal that the mind of a machine is what I have been working on, and it is a small part of the bigger picture. The core of this involves physics, neuroscience and ophthalmology, so boy oh boy am I glad that I ended up venturing down the quantum physics route.






By 2022/3, REZIINE aims to have the complete AI Operating System (AIOS) ready for distribution.
Various timelines predict artificial super intelligence being achieved around 2040, with Raymond Kurzweil's 2045 prediction probably being the most well known. However, Vernor Vinge's prediction of 2030 is seemingly more accurate right now. The technological singularity can be achieved within the next 14 years if the right resources are allocated to the project, but I don't see it being unleashed for at least a decade. I know I wouldn't release it without at least 10 years of extensive testing, running trial and error scenarios constantly, and I'm an avid risk taker. I try to wrap my head around what it will be like, and, with the right people shaping it, just the average everyday life in general can be the most incredible experience mankind has ever underestimated. There's a lot to be done, but we have everything we need - the people. the technology, and the funds - to make it a reality.
 



Whether you donate or not (I really hope you do), I ask that you notify everyone you know of what is about to happen:


Send it to the neuroscientists you know who desperately want to figure out the brain.
Send it to the physicists you know who want to complete the Theory of Everything.
Send it to all the computer scientists and engineers who would love to finally be able to work with a machine that can think like a human.
Send it to the ethicists who want to make sure this project is done right.
Send it to everyone who has a general interest in the human mind and what consciousness actually is.
Send it to everyone who likes to read, learn and increase their knowledge.
Simply send it to everyone you know who wants a future where they have enough free time to actually live their life while still being able to pay the bills.

The future is yours to gain, and you can be one of the first in line to experience it.
We'll also be opening our doors to company employees soon, so be on the lookout for such an update if you feel you have the skill and determination to succeed with us.



Throughout history, Britain has been the driving force behind or a significant contributor to the three industrial revolutions and scientific/technological advancement, and, I'm happy to say, a Brit is about to kick the fourth revolution into overdrive. Conscious machines are coming and it's going to be the first major step in the evolution of humanity as we know it - bigger than anyone has ever truly grasped. Help REZIINE build a future that actually works in the favour of you and generations to come.
Oh, and if you have any enquiries:


You can email us at contact@reziine.com. We're more than happy to hear from you.
Feel free to add me on LinkedIn and follow me on Twitter.

story:
Rafa is 5 years old and a very creative little guy. He is always dreaming about making silly and simple stuff like every 5 year old does.
Recently he came up with the idea to make a recipe book for 5 year olds with obviously very simple recipes like: Chocolate milk, toast with butter and strawberry jam or Quesadillas.

It is a very simple idea, but for sure very rewarding for him as he can understand he has the power to materialize his ideas and sell them all over the world. 

$500 is the lowest amount allowed by Indiegogo's system, but even $10 could be enough achievement for him to feel super successful and supported. :)

The money will be going for his savings account and to buy materials for his next project ... plastic bottle made toy cars :)


The recipe book will be emailed to everyone (PDF), it is hand written by him (spanish and english) so expect inverted numbers or letters, some cute misspellings and awesome 5yr old drawings.

Thanks!
Daniel (Rafa's dad)

story:
RAINBOW PLAYTREE: A mighty magical tree of rainbow coloured ropes designed for people to climb, swing, hang out, or under. This is a pop up playground that brings Indian children and adults back to a state of natural play. We need help to seed the first of these magical trees in Cubbon Park, Bangalore. The others we take to schools and localities that need a simple and cost-efficient outlet for natural play.

THE Workshop is a cross-disciplinary design research initiative where designers, innovators, makers, and the curious can explore and pursue their interest in the made world, develop personal projects, conduct academic research and start collaborative projects.

The Rainbow Playtree ‘ a pop - up playground’  is THE workshop’s first community initiative to bring the fun back to outdoor play.

Why are we doing this?

In today’s world, the word play has acquired an entirely new definition. Statistical data shows that today’s children play for less time per week than their parents.

Our aim is to take play back to its roots, back to the outdoors and back to being fun.

Rainbow PlayTree a riot of spontaneity, exploration, creativity, fun and a never ending state of play. A large tree is draped with ropes of varying lengths and gradients of colour forming beautiful ‘rainbow coloured vines’. Add to this large tires, and climbing knots and we have a vertical playground that rises up to the occasion –– transforming the playground into an urban jungle of sorts. This is not just about saving trees, or a raising awareness that trees play a very insignificant part of a child’s life. It is about reconnecting all these dots. Trees. Play. Children. Curiosity.

Location:

Everyone is welcome to hang out with the first rainbow tree at Cubbon Park, Bengaluru.

What more?

    

The Rainbow Playtree opens up a doorway to a whole new whole of adventure. Taking it beyond play, we will collaborate with climbing experts (partner organisations) who will give free instruction and safety demonstrations to encourage children to explore the outdoors.

A break from the mundane the rainbow tree adds a old-school analog experience in an overtly technology-driven and concretized urban landscape. It is a metaphor for fireworks, hopefully drawing people towards it and inspiring them relive their childhood.

How much we need ?

The project requires $2500 in funding which helps us set up one pop up playground in Cubbon Park, Bangalore as well as donate two playgrounds to two government/NGO run schools in the city.

In the eventuality of not reaching our target, donations received will go towards setting up a pop up playground in a school.

THE IMPACT

Rainbow Tree is a wake up call. An urban intervention that explores the simplicity of play not inhabited by gizmos, creations, manifestations and simulations. A installations that takes us back to our roots. Where a playground is a creative platform for new ideas, ideals and postulations.

It infuses into the verdant green of the park a riot of colour, to a school without a playground, it gives them a fun, and creatively themed space to hang out and do what kids do best, keep dreaming.

For the city, it is a mere spectacle, a distraction from the constant churn and every-changing pace, from the fact that we need to pay a little more attention to nature and the nature of play.

For the children. All we hope for is that they love to hang out about Rainbow Playtree.

Challenges

Finding the right trees. We need to find the right trees that will be safe enough to build this playground on.

Safety - We will be giving safety instructions.

How you can help beside donations ?

Help Rainbow Play-trees travel across India.

We need all the help we can get.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Dark Side Coffee Company has offered some of the freshest roasted coffee in central Arkansas for over a year now.  We have an awesome group of followers and coffee lovers.  Dark Side Coffee is ready to take the next step and open a double drive thru to better serve our customers.  We will continue to offer our fresh roasted coffee along with espresso drinks and local baked goodies.  
Please help support this Local Business while we make plans to better serve our community.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone! 

I am János "John" Csorba and I want to tell a few words about me and my project. I believe it's a true and just cause but it's also personal in my case. After finishing University and have made a big mistake, money attracted me too much and as it happens it ended me four years in prison. 

I've served my time but I would like to help other people not to fall into the same trap. So my idea is to make the JailBreakers' Crime Prevention Center in my Capital Budapest. In Hungary Crime and Drug Prevention is very ineffective, as the government doesn't spend enough funds on it and also because young people don't listen and trust policemen and drug experts when they talk to them in the classrooms. 

But what if in a realistic and cool environment, in a prison style furnished and decorated Pub people like me who have the genuine experience with crime and drugs talk with them?! We now the real temptation but we also now the price of it, so the youngsters would listen and would not choose evil over good. 

So during the day we would organize prevention courses and in the evenings and the weekend the place would serve as a pub and a place for concerts. And with it's completely unique design it would attract a lot of people. Not just locals from Budapest but also tourists from all over the world. In the Pub there would be good drinks and food with fantasy name connected to prison. Beside this we would also serve small souvenirs as well. 

And what if you would like a tattoo for souvenir... In JailBreakers' it's also possible we would make a Tattoo Saloon as well in the Center, and here you could have all the prison tattoo design from all over the world as well the "normal" patterns.

The JailBreaker's Center is very important for me. It's not just my dream to achieve something in my life that makes a difference. But this would also be my Redemption, to do good over my crimes. With this Center we could change the life of many young people and also help those who got into prison to start a new life, to reintegrate into society. The Center would even give jobs to ex-convicts, who truly want to change.

So please help me fund the Center. Be a real JailBreaker, who prevents crime and drugs! That's why the name is JailBreakers' Center it's everyone's who contributes to the cause.And if this will be a success in Hungary I would like to make it a worldwide franchise.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need the funds to buy the suitable property for the Center. I've already checked a few places in Budapest, I have a friend who works as a property agent and he helps me in this.

Beside this I need to renovate the place and furnish and design it. And buy all the necessary equipment. I will also need to hire the staff to run the place. 

I know I ask a big amount of funds for the project but it's an ambitious plan. The good news the after the Center is ready it would get enough income from the Pub and the Tattoo Saloon. So I could run it without further funds, I could organize all the prevention courses from the income, that part will be completely free for anyone.

Myself personally could contribute a lot to the Center's success. In University I studied International Relations, and it included business studies as well. I am very persistent and I never give up my goals. Hey I went through four years of hell and I am still here :)

People who contribute to the cause would be always welcome in the JailBreakers' Pub. I plan to make a membership card for every contributor and if you ask for it I will send it by post. This card would give you a huge discount in the Center.

 

The Impact

The JailBreakers' Center will have a great impact in Hungary's Crime Prevention. The Crime rates would drop significantly as much less young people would get attracted by crime and drugs. Also less ex-convicts would get back to prison as the Center would help them to start new life and to reintegrate into society. We would even give jobs to ex-cons. 

And remember why prevention is important- If there's no crime, there is no victim neither.

If this Center can work in Budapest, Hungary then I plan to make similar centers in other bigger European cities then through the world. I think it's a just cause and a good way to fight against crime and drugs.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest risk of the project is that the Hungarian government might put obstacles to it. As now they fight against civil organizations and even universities (like the case with the CEU).

But I hope that democracy will prevail, and you can help it. If I reach enough funds I plan call on European Union democratic organizations to back me against the government by justifying my cause.

And I plan to buy the property for the center in a left wing (democratic leadership) district of Budapest, so I would get all the necessary permissions to run such a place.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't contribute to the cause by funds please help to spread the word about it. It's a good cause, tell everyone about it. Tell those people who you think would like the idea.

For example: -The fans of series connected to prison - Prisonbreak, Orange is the New Black, Oz

                           -People who would fight crime and drugs. 

                           - People supporting democracy and civil organizations

                           -People who like cool Pubs and good drinks :)

                           - People who like rock music and tattoos

 

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! And share my facebook page too! :)

 

Thanks a lot Everyone!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey Everyone! 
I am János "John" Csorba and I want to tell a few words about me and my project. I believe it's a true and just cause but it's also personal in my case. After finishing University and have made a big mistake, money attracted me too much and as it happens it ended me four years in prison. 
I've served my time but I would like to help other people not to fall into the same trap. So my idea is to make the JailBreakers' Crime Prevention Center in my Capital Budapest. In Hungary Crime and Drug Prevention is very ineffective, as the government doesn't spend enough funds on it and also because young people don't listen and trust policemen and drug experts when they talk to them in the classrooms. 
But what if in a realistic and cool environment, in a prison style furnished and decorated Pub people like me who have the genuine experience with crime and drugs talk with them?! We now the real temptation but we also now the price of it, so the youngsters would listen and would not choose evil over good. 
So during the day we would organize prevention courses and in the evenings and the weekend the place would serve as a pub and a place for concerts. And with it's completely unique design it would attract a lot of people. Not just locals from Budapest but also tourists from all over the world. In the Pub there would be good drinks and food with fantasy name connected to prison. Beside this we would also serve small souvenirs as well. 
And what if you would like a tattoo for souvenir... In JailBreakers' it's also possible we would make a Tattoo Saloon as well in the Center, and here you could have all the prison tattoo design from all over the world as well the "normal" patterns.
The JailBreaker's Center is very important for me. It's not just my dream to achieve something in my life that makes a difference. But this would also be my Redemption, to do good over my crimes. With this Center we could change the life of many young people and also help those who got into prison to start a new life, to reintegrate into society. The Center would even give jobs to ex-convicts, who truly want to change.
So please help me fund the Center. Be a real JailBreaker, who prevents crime and drugs! That's why the name is JailBreakers' Center it's everyone's who contributes to the cause.And if this will be a success in Hungary I would like to make it a worldwide franchise.
 

What We Need & What You Get
I need the funds to buy the suitable property for the Center. I've already checked a few places in Budapest, I have a friend who works as a property agent and he helps me in this.
Beside this I need to renovate the place and furnish and design it. And buy all the necessary equipment. I will also need to hire the staff to run the place. 
I know I ask a big amount of funds for the project but it's an ambitious plan. The good news the after the Center is ready it would get enough income from the Pub and the Tattoo Saloon. So I could run it without further funds, I could organize all the prevention courses from the income, that part will be completely free for anyone.
Myself personally could contribute a lot to the Center's success. In University I studied International Relations, and it included business studies as well. I am very persistent and I never give up my goals. Hey I went through four years of hell and I am still here :)
People who contribute to the cause would be always welcome in the JailBreakers' Pub. I plan to make a membership card for every contributor and if you ask for it I will send it by post. This card would give you a huge discount in the Center.
 

The Impact
The JailBreakers' Center will have a great impact in Hungary's Crime Prevention. The Crime rates would drop significantly as much less young people would get attracted by crime and drugs. Also less ex-convicts would get back to prison as the Center would help them to start new life and to reintegrate into society. We would even give jobs to ex-cons. 
And remember why prevention is important- If there's no crime, there is no victim neither.
If this Center can work in Budapest, Hungary then I plan to make similar centers in other bigger European cities then through the world. I think it's a just cause and a good way to fight against crime and drugs.
 

Risks & Challenges
 
The biggest risk of the project is that the Hungarian government might put obstacles to it. As now they fight against civil organizations and even universities (like the case with the CEU).
But I hope that democracy will prevail, and you can help it. If I reach enough funds I plan call on European Union democratic organizations to back me against the government by justifying my cause.
And I plan to buy the property for the center in a left wing (democratic leadership) district of Budapest, so I would get all the necessary permissions to run such a place.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you can't contribute to the cause by funds please help to spread the word about it. It's a good cause, tell everyone about it. Tell those people who you think would like the idea.
For example: -The fans of series connected to prison - Prisonbreak, Orange is the New Black, Oz
                           -People who would fight crime and drugs. 
                           - People supporting democracy and civil organizations
                           -People who like cool Pubs and good drinks :)
                           - People who like rock music and tattoos
 
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! And share my facebook page too! :)
 
Thanks a lot Everyone!

story:
For 10 years I have been running a record store that I do not own, with that I have realized that without ownership I can't make the proper changes for a thriving business in today's economy. My goal is simply to create an all ages venue in the Daytona Beach area that will also sell vinyl and offer a laid back atmosphere to enjoy a coffee or network with other local musicians. I have plenty of experience in sales and booking/promoting successful shows, I'm not much for asking for help but I truly believe in this endeavor and want the local music community to have a sanctuary if you will, a place void of judgement or "pay to play" shows. I am currently saving up my personal half and if we all work together we can really do something special. Hope to open in early 2017! This is on fixed funding so if we do not reach our goal in 60 days you will be refunded your entire donation! Thank you!

-Brandon Jolly

story:
SF Beta is in trouble and we need your help.

Our goal is to relaunch SF Beta as a major monthly event, starting with our Web 3.0 Mixer this month. 
To do this, we need your help raising $1000 by Friday. 
Your support has the power to keep SF Beta going. Without it, we may have no choice but to bring the series to an end.
If SF Beta has made a difference in your life, please make a donation today.

story:
While target shooting in the spring of 2014 I identified a shortcoming to my rifle support. This shortcoming was the inability of my rifle bipod to tilt and pivot while shooting off of uneven surfaces. I began searching for a suitable remedy and while there were a few they were cumbersome and bulky or only addressed one axis of movement. I then turned my attention to designing something that would solve this problem. 

This design is a modified ball and socket with engineered restrictions that limit the articulation to only the useable geometry. The geometry allows swivel from side to side, side tilt to gain an upright sight picture and front to center (as opposed to front to back) to assist in some recoil absorption and allows the shooter to “load” the bipod for a stable platform for target engagement at long distances. The design also allows a one-handed single point to adjust drag on all axis of movement or a complete lock of movement.

For example, if the operator is a blackout condition “door kicker” or dismounted patrol the AAA can be turned around on the rail and the operator can then mount a second lighting device. This will allow the lighting device to be locked to an angle to light the operator’s path so they do not have to use their primary target illumination device instead.

Product Description

The Articulating Accessory Adapter will consist of two major components and four minor components. The major components will be the parts that are to be injection molded of Aerospace materials for strength and weight reduction. The finished product will be manufactured in the United States, black in color and will have custom cross bolt, knurled nut, clamp and retainer. The Adapter will be assembled prior to packaging. The packaging will consist of a small (6X6 inch or similar) clear plastic bag with a cardstock fold-over seal with instructions, information and price printed on it.

Summary

I have been working on this project on my own time with several engineer friends for over a year and am starting the crowd funding stage. This is the result of many countless engineering and research hours…days…and months. While there are a few products that attempt to solve this dilemma none have produced a solution that is as simple to use and as compact as the Articulating Accessory Adapter. The AAA will transform a standard, rigid Picatinny mounted bipod into a highly useful tool that allows the shooter to track targets with minimal or no bipod foot movement. The design is in the Patent Pending stage and is protected according to the USP&TO laws.


After funding is complete please allow 90-150 days for delivery

story:
We are a group of friends who love apps. We play, use and dream of successful  app of our own that will help people and reach over 1 million downloads.

We can develop apps for the Play Store and we thought about a great idea!

Let's say you are an Indie developer like us (in other words, you are not a multi-millions budget company). In order to get noticed on the store you need to get a lot of downloads and score a good rating. No matter how good looking your app is, or how well it works - you just need to spend a lot of money for marketing and PR. We want to give you an option to promote your app via our app for a full month for the fair and low cost of only 5$. During this period you can receive hundreds or thousands of new downloads! 

Yes! Full month of promotion for you app for only 5$

You aren't an Android developer or don't have friends who develop games or tools? No problem at all. In our app you will be able to see and explore thousands of new app, and support the hard working indie community. You will be able to search apps according to a specific category and rate them between 1 to 10 stars! that's right, we have a brand new scoring system: you will be able to sort application by their rating and see apps that can get up to 10 stars rating (not only 5).  You will also be able to search app by country of origin and thus support small companies form you country or state.

Rate apps on a scale of 1-10 Stars!

Search apps by country of origin!

Everybody will be able to promote his or her app for the funny cost of only 5$ - and again - for a full month. During this period you will get hundreds or thousands of new downloads. You will also have the power to support and strengthen small or indie app developers. You will see great apps that were developed by your neighbors, the man sitting next to you on the bus or a member of your family.   

Well, our application is not complex in terms of technology. We can develop it, test it and launch it by January 2017. 

But, we do need your support. We want our app to work super fast, and we are going to need a lot of storage room for our Data Base. We want the data to be retrieved easily, and we want small companies or indie developers to be able to promote their app within 1 hour or less.

Popups or other annoying ads will never appear in our app. We are all about fair and honest deal, and we are gonna show you only content. Banners or video promotion popping from everywhere will never enter this app.

About 1000$ will be spent on app development and testing, In order to create a good and strong product we need to translate the app and market it worldwide. More than 90% of the budget will be spent on promotion of our and your apps together.

Please support us and help us reach our goal!

It's not for us - it's for you!

story:
The foundation of Fairly Simple

In 2011, during a conversation with a fair trade shop owner, I came to realize what I had already suspected--the problem of modern day slavery is large. But what I couldn’t accept was that this is “the way it has to be.” 

While I could understand that those trapped in cycles of poverty were continually exploited to produce items for "cheap", I couldn't believe that I had to keep being part of the problem instead of the answer.  

Since then, I have found many ways to generate awareness while making it my personal quest to find an ethical solution. In the process, I discovered many people who are frustrated by not being able to shop locally in full freedom to buy whatever they need without fear of doing more harm. That was the beginning of Fairly Simple LLC.

The first step is on your end.

While the causes and solutions in relation to human trafficking are complex and complicated, our personal response to help end this global crisis doesn’t have to be. Decreasing the demand for slave-made goods and services is a way to thwart those who profit from slavery and bring it to an end.  We even have the ability to protect and empower the most vulnerable with our purchases. 

The issues behind human trafficking are big and overwhelming, but being part of the solution doesn’t have to be.  It can be Fairly Simple.


Change your underwear change the world. 

When we replace the items we already buy with quality made products that are good for us and good for those who made them, we can change the world. Our purchases can empower the people behind the product. When you purchase your everyday basics, like socks, t-shirts, soap and underwear from Fairly Simple, you tell the world that ethical consumerism isn’t a niche, it’s the norm.  


We’ve got you covered.

Local access to fairly-traded basic items will have a lasting impact on people, communities and the environment, at both local and international levels. Fairly Simple bridges the gap between makers and customers to provide you with a transparent supply chain -- giving you the confidence you are changing the world from the bottom up. 


Fairly Simple Future 

Our goals for this crowd funding campaign are, you guessed it, Fairly Simple! I have spent the last six months establishing relationships with suppliers, connecting with my customers and testing products in the Dayton market. In that time, I have had a growing demand for a physical location to make it easier for customers to shop, try things on and visit us more frequently. Our price point is accessible, and our location needs to be accessible as well.


Our campaign goal is to raise $25,000. These funds will provide initial lease monies, store fixtures, launching inventory, and some promotional materials.  Meeting this financial goal will allow us to secure a physical brick-and-mortar location and outfit it with the necessary start-up equipment for Fairly Simple's success.  Our initial inventory will feature a limited range of basics for both men and women and will include underwear, socks, leggings, tees and camis and body care essentials. Suppliers for Fairly Simple will likely include Conscious Step, Krochet Kids, Ludic Soap, Maggie's Organics, Mighty Good Undies, Miscoots, Naja, and PACT apparel. 


Beyond Simple 

Meeting our tipping goal will give us start, but meeting our stretch goal of $35,000 will provide us with enough working capital to ensure Fairly Simple a long-term presence in the heart of Dayton. It would also allow us to expand our basic offerings to include our initial inventory in a wider array of color options and sizes, as well as add additional essential items like bras, loungewear and basic outerwear. 

Let your voice be heard and donate. 

Change the world from the bottom up--it's Fairly Simple.

story:
Who We Are

AfrikaZiara is a team of Pan-African social entrepreneurs and graduates of the MEST Africa training program. We’re privileged to know the industry as our CEO, Aubrey Ndiza has consulted for tourism enterprises in South Africa, Tanzania and Ghana, helping them with digital marketing. Our CTO, Elkana started a traveltech startup in university that promoted domestic tourism in Kenyan counties. Cavendish, our CPO has started multiple sustainable tourism initiatives in her community during university. Our COO, Eve was basically born in the industry as both her parents and other family members have been running tourism enterprises for more than 20 years. We've combined our software entrepreneurship skills along with our experience and network to continue innovating Africa's tourism industry.

Our Vision

Connecting African tourism to the world.

Our Mission

Providing local tourism enterprise owners in Africa access to innovative technology solutions to grow their businesses and develop their communities through sustainable tourism.

Our Product

An SaaS tool, Ziara helps local tourism enterprise owners in Africa to do data-driven online marketing on multiple online travel agency sites and social media. It takes care of their online marketing and gives them data and insights to optimize their online marketing campaigns to increase their chances of getting online bookings.

Our Work

We empower local tourism enterprise owners in Africa to sell their travel products and services to a global audience they currently do not have access to.

Help us to provide the highly needed infrastructure, funds and technology that bridges the gap between tourism enterprise owners and online travel shoppers - so local tourism enterprise owners in Africa get to sell more of their travel products and services while online travel shoppers can finally enjoy a truly efficient and convenient way to book their next trip to Africa.

The Problem

More than 35,000 of the local tourism enterprise owners in Africa struggle to create and maintain an effective online presence to attract online travel shoppers, so they miss out on more than 27 million tourists who search and book their travel plans to Africa online.

Pain Points

These local tourism enterprise owners run sustainable tourism businesses that not only impact their family’s economic development but also contribute to the economic development of the communities they operate in. For example, Ole Parosei is a tour operator in Maasai Mara, Kenya. He spends more than $500 monthly on marketing but only attracts 4 tourists in a month. From those 4 tourists, he only earns $6000. He has to pay his tour guides their wages, cover the costs of providing experiences to the 4 tourists and also pay for operating expenses such as office rent, utilities etc. Most of the money he gets from providing experiences to the 4 tourists he gets monthly, gets invested into the Maasai Mara community. If he doesn’t get any bookings, he is not the only one affected as his community look up to him to bring tourists so as to earn an income. Without our SaaS tool, Ole Parosei’s business runs at a loss and the community of Masai Mara lose out on economic development opportunities.

Your Support

We need your kind support to develop this innovative solution and create an economic development opportunity for local tourism enterprise owners in Africa using technology.

We are raising 10,000 USD to finalize the development of our product and get to enable our customers use it. The 10,000 USD will be used as follows;

  • Startup Costs: $2,800
  • Technology Infrastructure: $3,400
  • Sales and Marketing:  $3,600
  • Sundry expenses: $200

Your Support is Appreciated and Rewarded

We have attracted 29 tourism enterprise owners across Africa so far and our target is to get more than 35,000 of tourism enterprises using Ziara. With your help, we know that we can achieve that.

We have a reward for everyone who would like to chip in and help us help local tourism enterprise owners in Africa.

  • $5 - Mention on our social media
  • $10 - Mention on our social media and blog
  • $25 - Mention on our social media, blog and website
  • $50 - Travel Voucher for any online travel agency,
  • $100 - 2.5% discount on next trip in Africa
  • $250 - 5% discount on next trip in Africa
  • $500 - 10% discount on next trip in Africa
  • $1000 - 20% discount on next trip in Africa

Your Support
We need your kind support to develop this innovative solution and create an economic development opportunity for local tourism enterprise owners in Africa using technology.
We are raising 10,000 USD to finalize the development of our product and get to enable our customers use it. The 10,000 USD will be used as follows;

Startup Costs: $2,800
Technology Infrastructure: $3,400
Sales and Marketing:  $3,600
Sundry expenses: $200

Your Support is Appreciated and Rewarded
We have attracted 29 tourism enterprise owners across Africa so far and our target is to get more than 35,000 of tourism enterprises using Ziara. With your help, we know that we can achieve that.
We have a reward for everyone who would like to chip in and help us help local tourism enterprise owners in Africa.

$5 - Mention on our social media
$10 - Mention on our social media and blog
$25 - Mention on our social media, blog and website
$50 - Travel Voucher for any online travel agency,
$100 - 2.5% discount on next trip in Africa
$250 - 5% discount on next trip in Africa
$500 - 10% discount on next trip in Africa
$1000 - 20% discount on next trip in Africa

story:
The Matriloany Network is a community of local jewelry stores and small businesses in Charlotte and Chicago that help young couples save from their engagement to their honeymoon!  

Pledge:

$99 -1 Membership

$149 or more - 1 Membership and 1 Gift Membership

Perk: 

10% Discount or Exclusive Deal from each Partner in The Matriloany Network

https://matriloany.com/partners​

Valid from 11/1/2019 - 12/31/2020​

Our Charlotte Partners:

  • 8 Brownlee Jewelers 
  • Savvy Bride and Haute and Co. Bridal 
  • Kelly Meyers Photography and Design 
  • The Tuxedo Shoppe
  • QC Party Rockers
  • Flowers From The Cellar
  • Baked Well Custom Bakery
  • NC Weddings of Distinction - Julie Furr, Wedding Officiant
  • Rose Chauffeured Transportation, LTD. 

Our Chicagoland Partners:

  • 3 CD Peacock Jewelry Stores 
  • Haute and Co. Bridal
  • Firefly Events, Decor and Flowers  
  • Beyond Catering

Our National Partners:

  • Gaspar Insurance - Home, Business and Auto - 48 States
  • Awards Plus - Promotional Items, Awards and Gifts - National

story:
Our Part of the World

Typically, most startups operate from home. The challenge however is that not every home is conducive to host a business meeting; has access to internet facility or other office equipment that can make doing business easy.

For a lot of Startups in our part of the world, when you leave your home environment, you cannot pick or make calls and have business meetings on your phone because commuting from one place to the other (depending on your city) could be loud and inappropriate for business calls. So you need someone who can pick your calls all day.

Which part of the world in this? I am talking about West Africa. Our company Masoe Productions West Africa has worked with startups in different cities of West Africa be it Anglophone or Francophone including, Lomé, Togo, Cotonou, Benin, Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire, Abuja, Nigeria.

We understand these challenges and over the past 9 years, we have contributed in easing the process for startups.

Over the next 18 months, we plan to set up business communities in 3 cities across West Africa i.e. Lomé-Togo, Freetown-Sierra Leone, Abuja-Nigeria. Youth in this part of the world are innovative and this shows in their achievements and quick rise in their chosen field when they find their way to the West. We want to provide for them what is obtainable in the West i.e. a conducive environment.

Le Bureau will serve dual purpose of:

  1. Identifying and grooming young entrepreneurs, whose talents often go to waste in this part of the world as a result of failure to launch (A BUSINESS INCUBATOR).
  2. Being a launch pad for young entrepreneurs who have been able to start a business but struggle with the cost of running a profitable business.

The Beginning

Having worked with startups since 2010, in 2018, we started a partnership with Ghana Trade Fair Company to create a project, which would educate and position young entrepreneurs, using homegrown business models as compared to foreign models, which is often not applicable in our environment. Held in Accra, the capital city of Ghana, “the Pitch“ has trained over 100 young businesses from all over Ghana. So far, we have done two editions, the last held in March 2019.

With the success chalked with "the Pitch," we are moving to the second part of this stage, which is “Le Bureau”, a community of young and aspiring entrepreneurs.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our Project

We are creating an office environment for young entrepreneurs to hone their craft and grow their businesses. “Le Bureau” is a launch pad for young and aspiring entrepreneurs; a community where businesses can grow and synergies can be formed.

  1. It will be a work space for small and non-resident businesses
  2. It will be an incubator for young entrepreneurs and startups where they will be hosted for an average of three (3) years. During the gestation period of a business.

The big picture is to setup hubs in at least 7 cities of West Africa. This will cater for the 15 countries in this sub-region. However, of immediate importance is the creation of hubs in two (2) cities i.e. Lomé-Togo, Freetown-Sierra Leone. We plan to raise $140,000 to set up two work spaces in these cities. Funds raised will be used to:

  1. Acquire a lease and setup an offices.
  2. Acquire office facilities required by startup companies: boardrooms, chairs, tables, front desk etc.
  3. It will also go into the creation of a digital printing press. With this we can offer more communications services at rock-bottom prices and develop small businesses.

Regional benefits

In addition to the office space and facilities;

  1. We will organise training in different aspects of entrepreneurship at least once a year.
  2. We will organise interactive sessions with potential investors and CEOs of established companies in order to speed up the growth rate of the startups and further establish these small businesses/entrepreneurs.
  3. It will equally serve as an avenue to leverage on the regional strength of West Africa, a population of over 300 million people. Operating from different cities, these entrepreneurs have the advantage of using “Le Bureau” offices in cities across West Africa as annexes making it easy to expand their businesses to different cities across West Africa.

Your support is all that we need and we are ready to offer you valuable perks as a reward for your investment. Support our project with financial contributions and by telling somebody else to contribute. Use the Indiegogo share tools  to make sharing easier.

Our talents

Wizkid, Dbanj, Tiwa Savage, Sakordie, M.anifest, 2face etc. all these globally celebrated music artistes come from West Africa. The arts is growing in West Africa but technology and other sectors are not growing as much and this is what an economy needs to grow.

With Le Bureau, we want to replicate the success story of people like Jason Njoku, founder of Africa’s Netflix, Iroko TV, Sim Shagaya founder of Africa’s largest online store, Konga.com.

A lot of these success stories started late in life. They started at an age where they already had immense responsibilities, which made it more difficult to fly. We want to catch them young (entrepreneurs) and provide all they need to rise so that we can have a prosperous West Africa that relies less on the West particularly regarding illegal migration.

Join us to make this a reality.

story:
Well Hello!

First, we want to say thank you for taking the time to read about our vision. We have had great feedback and eager families waiting for this idea to take flight. We have so many great ideas and can't wait to share them with the community. Let's take a few minutes to go over our plan and how we hope to make this dream a reality!

A little bit about us, we are three local moms that represent a large young family community in Calaveras County. We each have a passion to enrich our community and provide a much-needed resource for our local families here in Calaveras County.

  • Cheree works from home as a Camp Director along with raising 2 kids. She will bring her passion and vision to this project and will be dubbed as our "Chief Awesome Officer"!
  • Lea is a working mom and has 2 amazing kiddos. She has a background in working with kids of all ages and will be our "Ringleader of Chaos" that handles the day to day operations of the business.
  • Nhu is a business women extraordinaire who runs a successful website company all while raising 3 boys!  Nhu will use her creative mind to be our "Head Unicorn Wrangler".

THE NEED

This idea was born out of necessity as we all have active young children needing connection and support. We noticed there is a serious lack of options for our families in Calaveras County. We have the park, which is great on good weather days. We also have local library story times but still, this proves as minimal options for our families.  After visiting other play spaces, we could not help but think we desperately need something like this central to Calaveras!

THE VISION

Our vision is to open a play space for kids, parents, and caregivers to come relax and connect with the community. Parents can come enjoy a cup of coffee, let their little ones play all while bonding with other families. Working parents can come and get work done with high-speed internet. Stay at home families can come take a break and refresh.

THE MISSION

We want to be a staple in the community and local hub for families.  We want to fill a need and support families who are in the same, sometimes challenging, stage of life. Together, as a village, we can support each other, grow together and making this parenthood journey a little easier. Because TOGETHER we are BETTER!

THE VIBE

We want a wide open space with a laid back homey feel. We want communal farmhouse table and cafe style seating with comfy chairs and couches where friends can gather, have lunch, do computer work, all while having a safe indoor space for their kids to play.  At any angle, you would have a full view of your kids. There will be different design schemes separating the adult and kids area

GOALS

  • In addition to a play space, we also what to create intentional time which is geared toward parent/child interaction. We want to help engage our families by providing family enrichment time each day and will include activities like arts and crafts, music and movement, or even interactive play like a treasure hunt or planting flowers together. 

  • Another idea is to host a weekly family support class where parents can gain tools for raising children. We want to find ways to better support our families in all aspects of parenting because the closer we are as a family network, the better parents we are!

  • Another exciting component of our business model will be to create a networking system that will promote local family business. We want to call it “The Village Connect” and it will link to our facebook page. We hope to come out with an online directory of sorts. a

OTHER IDEAS

  • On the weekends or evenings provide a rentable multi-use space. This could be for kids birthday parties or even a local home-based business pop up shop.

  • Babysitter Board/ Date Night Swap/ Rent a Grandma

  • Family Movie Night and Family Field Trips

  • Mom's Night or Dads Days!

  • Have a spot in our space that features a local family business who is listed in our directory so people can get to know you and your family business. Maybe even display some work or items for sale.

  • Provide a space for working parents to have meetings, get work done, all while having an eye on your children. If our location allows, possibly even a parent drop-in office for use.

FAQ SHEET

WHERE IS THE VILLAGE GOING TO LOCATED?

We found a great downtown location in Murphys, Ca, that is within walking distance to the park! We are still waiting on County approval but fingers crossed we get this secured soon so we can open the space this summer!

WHAT AGES OF CHILDREN ARE ALLOWED?

We want to focus our toys and activities to the younger crowd. As we will not have a specific age limit, we hope parents will use their best judgment on your child's play needs. We are hoping in the future to expand and offer older children's activities.

WHAT ARE THE HOURS OF OPERATION?

To start, we will be open from 8am - 2pm (Monday - Friday) for the school year. As we grow we want to offer extended hours for after school, summertime, and weekends.

COST

HOW MUCH WILL THIS COST FOR THE CUSTOMER?

Prices will be $10 for the first kid and $5 there after. Adults and children under 1 will be free!

Monthly Memberships will be $45 a month the first kid.

Subsequent child memberships will be $10 extra a month.*

*Memberships will include unlimited play for the month.

HOW WILL YOU FUND THIS STARTUP?

There is no doubt that starting this venture will take community support. As a leadership team, we are all working moms who can’t afford to invest large amounts of cash for start-up costs. We want this to be funded by the community, for the community.  We are just acting as spearheads to get this idea rolling and hopefully, it will be a self-sustaining and grant-funded project once it is up and running.

The initial plan is to start an Indiegogo crowdfunding account and pre-sale punch cards and monthly memberships. We will also have sponsorship opportunities where businesses, families, or individuals can sponsor an area of the space. For example, sponsor at the "Sprout" level for $500 and we will hang a plaque in a designated play space area of your choice recognizing your name. Choose from the Book Nook, Imagination Station, Creative Space, Building Area, Play Structure, or even create your own!

This will be a grassroots effort that will start small and will grow once sustainable. 

PLEASE NOTE: If we do not meet our financial goals, all monies will be returned.

WILL THIS BE SUSTAINABLE?

According to our calculations, the average needed to be sustainable seems very reasonable given the fact Calaveras County has a booming young family population most of which with multiple kids.

We also have the potential for grant opportunities once we are no longer a startup. Most grant funds can not fund start-ups. Once we prove this is a community asset that is enriching lives, there is a good chance grants will become available, maybe as soon a 3-6 months after opening.

WOULD THIS BE A DONATION OR PRE-SALE TICKETS?

This way of raising support would be completely an investment into a good cause with the added bonus of discounted pre-sale tickets as a way to thank our early supporters. We are not a non-profit and can not offer any tax write off at this time.

WHAT ARE THE PRE-SALE PRICES?

$40 for a month membership instead of $45

$35 for a 5-time punch card instead of $50

I DON'T HAVE YOUNG KIDS,  CAN I STILL SUPPORT?

Maybe you wish you could have had something like this when you raised kids? Or maybe you're a Grandma or Papa who would love to see this for your grand-kids? Or perhaps you want to help bring a new type of business to our community? Whatever the case, anyone is welcome to help support our cause. Sponsorship of a play space area is a great way to show support!

WHERE ARE WE AT IN THE PROCESS?

Right now the plan is to use our Facebook and funding page to reach out to as many people as we can. We hope to raise enough support soon so we can start to fill in the space as soon as we are approved through the county. Then we will need to host a few family paint days, move in the furniture/toys, and add some final decorations. The goal would be to open doors in a few months. We would love to be open in early August to help offset the summertime blues.

WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?

  • Buy a pre-sale punch card or membership to help us reach our start-up goal!

  • Sponsor a play area to help us get the space set-up.

  • Read over our needed donated items list and see if you might have something to donate that will help keep our start-up costs down.

  • Sign up for our “Village Connect” and list any resources you know of that will be helpful to our families. At the very least, we would love to have an amazing network directory!

  • Join our Facebook page and like our posts!

  • Help spread the word! Share our facebook page and pass out our business cards to get people excited about our idea :-)

  • Know of any resources that would benefit our cause and mission, let us know!

WRAP UP

We know this is a lot of information to take in, but the biggest component of our success will be community support. We wanted to be 100% open and be honest about the hard work it will take to make this happen. We hope that by sharing our full plan you will jump on board and be inspired to help us make this dream a reality.

It feels so close that we can already see the clinking of glasses at the ribbon cutting ceremony celebrating this monumental community effort!

WHERE CAN I CONTACT YOU?

If you have any questions or want to talk more, please contact us at hello@thevillage.family. For the latest updates on our progress please follow our facebook at fb.me/thevillagemurphys!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

We wanted to be 100% open and be honest about the hard work it will take to make this happen. We hope that by sharing our full plan you will jump on board and be inspired to help us make this dream a reality.It feels so close that we can already see the clinking of glasses at the ribbon cutting ceremony celebrating this monumental community effort!WHERE CAN I CONTACT YOU?If you have any questions or want to talk more, please contact us at hello@thevillage.family. For the latest updates on our progress please follow our facebook at fb.me/thevillagemurphys!THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Descriptions in English and German. / Beschreibungen in ENGLISCH und DEUTSCH.

Belarus. Rescue closure of the company in times of crisis.

I started working on this project on August 27, 2020. Due to many problems and nuances, the release was very delayed.
Greetings to everyone who reads this. My name is Maxim, I want to talk to you, please see my project. Even if you don’t want to help me, I’m sure it will be interesting for you to read about what is happening in Eastern Europe. Perhaps you would like to share a link to this project in social networks, in any case I will be grateful to you.
I apologize for the writing style and translation. The main task is to convey the meaning of the message to each audience. The original text is in Russian.

IN BRIEF: WHAT IS MY PROBLEM AND WHY DO I WANT TO COLLECT FUNDS?

The problem is that due to the situation in Belarus, our European partners may suffer losses. 2020 has undoubtedly been a difficult year for one and all. In Belarus, amid the pandemic, many private enterprises have already been “closed”. Financially independent enterprises closed in May 2020 so as not to drive themselves into a "debt hole". Our situation is much more complicated. We work in the field of sales, and at the moment we have many debtor clients who have not settled with us for the shipped goods. This would not be very problematic if it were not for the sharp depreciation of the Belarusian currency and the “insolvency” of state-owned enterprises. A more detailed description of our business will be in the main article below. Due to the economic situation in the country, our company cannot continue its activities. And even if I managed to raise money to save our company, I would not be able to use it in Belarus. One way or another, our company will close in 2021, and I want to raise funds to pay off debts to European suppliers (at least partially). We will not see this money, but our conscience will be clear.  After all, the only thing should be 100% - our European partners should not suffer because of the Belarusian problems.

IN BRIEF: WHY DIES BELARUSIAN BUSINESS?

All Belarusian companies have been maintaining trade relations for many years on the condition of deferred payment for the shipped goods. If in neighboring countries there is such an opportunity to do business, then payment methods are strictly and punctually observed. Everything is different with us. As a rule, no one complies with the conditions set out in the contract. And since we trade in imported goods, the shipped goods will be devalued in Belarusian rubles at the time of payment. There are times when money for a shipped product is returned within several years.

IN BRIEF: HOW DID WE GET STARTED AND HOW DO WE WORK NOW?

Our business is very simple. We buy goods in Europe and sell them in Belarus. The product is good and of high quality. For a long time, the management of many enterprises adhered to the opinion that uninterrupted production of products can be carried out only on high-quality serviced equipment. And what is most important, thanks to the quality of consumables for this equipment, which we supply. Until a certain time, there was a stable economic situation in Belarus, and our clients had the opportunity to pay on time. Then in 2011 there was an economic crisis. But it was possible to work. Difficulties began in 2015-2016. When many state-owned enterprises stopped paying for the goods on time. At the same time, the unspoken rule “buy the cheapest” appeared in state-owned companies. And in 2018, a decree was issued "On the financial recovery of agricultural enterprises."
