Unfortunately, bank loans are totally frozen in France and we have not managed to get any loan to start this project, this is why we need your help !

What We Need

We need to raise about € 60.000 (about $ 69.500) to buy the boat, decorate it with our brand, and pay every fees and taxes that need to be paid on it.
These € 60.000 can be detailed as follows :
- We would need about € 40.000 (about $ 46.300) to buy the boat itself and make it decorated with our colours and brand : it is a boat named "ZAR Z9 SL". Here is a photo of the boat "naked" :


and how we would like it to be with our brand and colours on it :

- Then we would have to pay fees to Indiegogo (third party fees and additional currency exchange fees included) for about € 8.000 (about $ 9.300).
- French VAT (Value Added Tax) 20% : € 12.000 (about $ 13.900)
- Total needed to be raised = € 60.000 (about $ 69.500)


What you get
You get according to the amount of your donation : 
- a 10% discount for a boat rental of your choice in Port Grimaud, 
- a personalized free boat tour in Port Grimaud on the boat "ZAR 49 SL" you will have helped us to buy, with up to 8 other contributors,
- discounts on a rental of a house or an apartment available from us in Port Grimaud for your next holidays.


For example, a donation of 50 Euros (about $58) is good for a 10 percent discount on a boat rental in Port Grimaud. A very good deal !

For 150 Euros
(about $173), you’ll receive a free boat tour of Port Grimaud on the boat "ZAR 49 SL" you
will have helped us to buy and you still get your 10 percent discount on a boat rental in Port Grimaud.
A 200 Euros (about $230) contribution is rewarded with a 5 percent discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10 percent boat rental discount.
A 500 Euros (about $625) contribution is rewarded with a 10 percent discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10 percent boat rental discount.

Example of discount for a rental of a fisherman house (house for 6 to 8 people) in August rented with Boutemy Immobilier :



Pricelist : € 2,500 a week (average price in high season
for this kind of house).
With a 10% discount, the price will be € 2,250 a week instead of € 2,500 a week.

For larger donors, you will also take advantage of discounts on our fees for the purchase of a house or an apartment in Port Grimaud.
We are so sure you will fall in love with Port Grimaud !
See details of the perks below against.
You have 3 years from the fundraising date to take advantage of your perk. 
In case of a successful fundraising, we may have many happy donors who will wish to get their perk(s). In this case, the donors will be served in the order of the requests received by email.
Enjoy your holidays in Port Grimaud with us !

What you get in case of failure to achieve the objective of funds raised

In case of failure to achieve the objective of the funds raised, you will be fully refunded of your donation's amount.
The impact


· This project is very important for our Agency. We would like to get Port Grimaud known as a unique French "Little Venice" listed by UNESCO as an exceptional work of the twentieth century. 
Your contribution will help us make our job much better and be more efficient.


If the project works with many donors or even if it does not work, it will also help Port Grimaud to be known all
over the world thanks to this Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign and we hope it
will boost general business in Port Grimaud.
· We will show the results of this campaign on our blog http://boutemy-blog.com and our Facebook Page by May 2015 at the latest, and if you agree your name will appear as a donor who helped our Agency to grow.

Risks and Challenges
· You have to know that we have never done this kind of project that mixes Crowdfunding, Tourism, Holiday Rental and Real Estate. It is a all new and innovative program.
However, we have been working for years in Port Grimaud and we perfectly know our lake side town. 
The only difficulty is to get those funds, that is why we are looking for your help !

Other ways to help !
We know that everyone will not be able to contribute to our project, but you can still help ! 
Talk about our project to your friends and tell them also to generate ads for our project.
We also need you to help us get Port Grimaud to be known and discovered. Talk around ! Why wouldn't you come to visit Port Grimaud and Saint Tropez Area one day ? For your next holidays ? 
Please come to our agency to say hello !
Feel free to use our communication tools to connect us to you and learn more about us : 

Our website (about us, our properties for sale and for rent) : www.boutemy.co.uk
Our blog with news from Grimaud, Port Grimaud, Saint Tropez and Sainte Maxime : http://www.boutemy-blog.com
Facebook (our everyday life) : https://www.facebook.com/boutemy.immobilier
Twitter (the same but in summary) : https://twitter.com/Boutemy_immo
Google + : https://plus.google.com/104126459636941344186/videos
Youtube (all of our properties in video) : https://www.youtube.com/user/Boutemyimmo
Dailymotion (like Youtube) : http://www.dailymotion.com/Boutemy-immobilier
And of course do not forget to use sharing tools from Indiegogo ! These are the most powerful ones for sure ! 
Thank you, thank you, and thank you again for your help and attention.

story:
What We're Asking For & Where It Will Go 

Funding amount is relatively high because it includes startup costs and first 4 month of Operating Expenses. The reasoning for this is to insure that we have time to get enough awareness and business to cover operating expenses

Capital will be used for:

Enclosed Trailer - $4000

Legal and Filing fees - $1000

Estimated Gas Costs @ 650/Month - $2600

Shop Mobile Phone to take calls, interact with social media and accept credit cards @ 100/Month - $400

Personal Wage Expense @1160/Month for two -$9280

(40 hours a week @ minumum wage (7.25) = $290 a week)- so we can both do this full time 

Storage Costs (Trailer and Merchandise Storage) @100/Month -  $400

(Estimated) Start-up Merchandise Inventory Costs- To start the Shop will carry skateboarding hard goods, drinks, and food/snacks

Skateboard decks ------100 @ $30  = $3000

Trucks (pairs) ------------50@ $15  =$750

Wheels --------------------50 @ $15  =$750

Bearings -------------------50 @ $10   =$500

Hardware & etc ---------100 @ $1  =$100

Food / Water ---------------------------$250

Total: $ 26030

Any additional Contributions we receive will go to:

·  Holding and sponsoring competitions

·  Sponsoring Locals and forming a team

·  To deliver skateboarding product to skaters phone or app orders (Broken Deck Emergencies)

·  Help get parks in SA built, improved, and/or repaired

·  Shelves, displays and hanging installation in the truck

·  Building rails/ramps on the exterior of the trailer to make it skate able 

·  Installing lights to the top of the truck for night skating at spots through San Antonio

· Open running website to show schedule, contest calender, stock, delivery info, etc

·  Installing a sound system and free wi-fi into the skate truck

·  Shop Brand Decks, Wheels, Bearing, Apparel

·  Opening and operating a second truck in Austin, Texas 

The Impact

There are 3 main effects that will result from this shop

·  Expand skateboarding - by making product more available to those who want it, helping to get new parks built and old parks fixed, by having a place for skaters meet and hang out, and by

·  Bring the SA skateboarding community together- by traveling to different parks and spots throughout the day, posting on social media sites to meet up with skaters, hosting and sponsoring competitions and contests, and by skating with people of all ages and skill levels to learn from each other.

·  Enhance the view of skateboarding in San Antonio skate- by showing the positive sides to skateboarding, showing how it has positively affected people’s lives by keeping them out of trouble

 

Risks & Challenges

Our main risks and challenges are obvious for anyone who’s ever driven around San Antonio a, inconsiderate drivers and traffic. The truck we will be driven by Mike who owns and drives the truck everyday

Another risk is having a store run by people with no retail or business experience, I have been working in retail for the past 4 years, since I was 16, 2 of those years in a management position.

Lastly, you don’t want someone running a skate shop who doesn’t skate, Both Mike and I have been skating for a total of about 20 years between us. We’ve skated in different places around the country and with a lot of different people here in SA. We keep up with brands, shops, news, and pros.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute so we will also be having a referral contest. The top 3 referrers (calculated by contributions through your share link) will receive a personalized SktShp T-shirt. The top referrer will also help design and receive their own shop pro model deck. Word of mouth is just as good as contributions and better than any advertising we can do so if you’d like to see this become a reality here in SA and in other Texas cities spread the word and give us your support! :D

Follow Us! And let us know if you have any questions, comments, ideas or recommendations for the shop. It is for you guys

Instagram - https://instagram.com/sktshp/

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/pages/SktShp/414471358712845

Twitter  - @SktShp

story:
Hello to all indiegogo surfers!

For the last 20 years working as a field tech guy in various jobs, I was required to drive all around the country.

And although state laws are in place and the fact that I consider myself by now as a professional driver, I found it difficult to ignore my smartphone "cry for attention" while driving.

Testimonials and surveys show that it is actually everyone's problem

(teen age Drivers are on the top of the list with the likelihood to be involved in accidents with the distracted attention cause)

That's why For 2 years now I worked during my spare time on my venture called "cellMUTE+ app".

cellMUTE+ app is disributed for

FREE!

(On Google Play & Amazon app store)

cellMUTE+ free app locks the screen when the car surpasses a threshold velocity.

Only speed dial & GPS app are allowed.

cellMUTE+ free app allow the UNLOCKING of the screen if the user has declared that he or she is not currently driving.

I managed to self-fund cellMUTE+ free app (40K $) its development (marketing & patents included) and achieved approx. 8000 downloads to date.

But my vision goes beyond just a "stand alone app", And Unfortunately I cannot afford additional bank loans or help from family.

My complete vision for the project requires the development of the

"supervised driving mode©"


Allowing parents for teenage drivers to sleep peacefully knowing that their children are guarded from using the smart phone while driving the FAMILY automobile.

The Supervised mode will include:

1. Screen lock while driving (manual unlock DISABLED)


2. Vehicle out of radius alert

3. Eratic driving behavior or speeding alerts

4. Track the family vehicle on map

Funders of this campaign are welcome to suggest more features & those will be taken under consideration.

After all that being said I will summarize by saying the following:

Help cellMUTE+ project become

 the accidents preventer

 SUPER HERO

 it can be!

Help fund this project! For this campaign is truly about

SAVING TEEN LIVES!!!


Besides the above you are welcome to enjoy cellMUTE+ promotional video:


And take a sneak peak at our T-shirts:

story:
I am Erica "The Kitchen Beautician" and have been a stylist for 16yrs. Hair is my life! I dream of owning an urban hair franchise one day. I am a competition and event stylist who's clientele has grown drastically in the past few years. I currently rent a booth at a local salon but my brand is over shadowing this salon. I have 2 employees who currently work under me as assistants. One who happens to be my sister and is an up an coming make-up artist. The other is a license cosmetologist and specialty braider. Now all I need is a building of my own to launch my hair empire.

 

WHERE THE MONEY GOES

By contributing you will be helping to increase the income of my 2 employees as well as insure job security as we are quickly out growing the current salon we are in. All funds donated will be added to current savings and go towards securing, moving into ,decorating and/or renovation of a building to house the 1st of many The Kitchen Beautician Hair & Makeup Bars. We would like to be ready to open by mid September early October. This is why your contribution is needed and appreciated to insure we meet our opening deadline. 

 

Challenges & Solutions 

 The Kitchen Beautician brand is well know in Orlando and the surrounding cities. This is due to the aggressive online and city wide advertising me and my team does. Though it can be many challenges in any start up, I believe because of this popularity we will avoid a lot of start up company pit falls. I have a long term business plan to eventullay turn this into a chain of urban salons in Orlando and the surrounding areas. Another way to try and insure a profitable outcome in moving into a building is that the building is in the same area that we are currently working in so there will be no extreme change for existing clients.  All donations big and small are greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

 

PLEASE POST AND SHARE THIS TO ALL YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA SITES AND HELP ME GET THE WORD OUT. BE SURE AND SHARE

story:
Hello!

First off, Thank You for taking the time to read our campaign. Kalevala Aquaculture was created by a former paramedic and surgeon's assistant with a passion to bring fresh, sustainable and biosecure Pacific White Shrimp to Metro Detroit. Using our understanding of biology and chemistry along with our desire to give a healthier alternative to commercial shrimp to the area, we will produce new harvests every week, year round. 

Why? We are seeking to deliver a product of unique quality with the lowest environmental impact possible to a region that has only ever had weeks old frozen shrimp shipped from thousands of miles away. Using Zero Exchange Method aquaculture and working with a cooperative farm in Indiana, we will produce shrimp harvested on demand of the customer at prices comparable to the frozen choices of questionable quality and safety found in supermarkets. 

Water is not wasted. Unlike some aquaculture methods, the only replenishment needed in the Zero Exchange Method is to replace what is lost through evaporation. For the whole facility, this will usually require less water per month than is used by an average American household.

We should note our product does not risk becoming an invasive species in the Great Lakes Watershed as these shrimp cannot survive in fresh water or Michigan's climate. We care about the preservation of our precious Great Lakes as much as you do and the Michigan Department of Natural Resources approves of the import of this species into the State as it poses no risk to our waterways. 

For every pound of ocean caught shrimp sent to market, nearly five pounds of "bycatch" ocean life is destroyed according to the U.S. Fisheries Department. Commercial farm-raised shrimp are often laden with antibiotics and subjected to water contaminated with heavy metals and agricultural runoff. Mangrove forests are often destroyed to build the farms, removing important areas that naturally prevent erosion of coastlines. 

Kalevala Aquaculture will not use antibiotics and our water source will be carefully monitored to prevent risk of contamination from lead or other dangerous chemicals. Only heat, salt, feed, and biological water filtration will be used in our growth tanks. This Zero Exchange Method technology is tried and true and brings shrimp production into an economically viable range for small facilities of modest crop sizes.

Fresh shrimp also have the added benefit of being much tastier than frozen shrimp. The meat is much sweeter than frozen choices. Our shrimp also do not require the "mud vein" to be removed (where toxins build up in commercial shrimp) as it will cook off, and the shell does not need to be removed before eating thanks to Pacific White Shrimp molting cycles making it soft and safe to digest.

With your help, Kalevala Aquaculture will secure a lease of a facility large enough to hold the growth tanks and equipment necessary to produce antibiotic free shrimp in the area.

Why We've Come to You

Kalevala Aquaculture needs to secure a letter of intent of the lease of a large commercial space (at least 3,500 square feet or 1,200 square meters) and licensing/permits in Metro Detroit to establish our facility and attract investors for the capital equipment and start-up costs. Essentially, the $6,000 we are seeking from generous people like you is known as "seed capital" and is a common requirement for a business such as this when pursuing investment.

Since this is an "all or nothing" campaign, if we do not meet our goal, your contribution will be returned to you and we wish to thank all of you who did contribute and hope you continue to be passionate about ideas such as ours that are good for the well being of the planet.

The entire project will require approximately $100,000 to become operational and sustain itself until profitable harvests can be achieved four months after the first sale of shrimp. Each harvest produces more shrimp as the biological filtration medium in the tanks establish, resulting in enough shrimp being produced to be profitable on the third harvest rotation of the growth tanks. We expect to start growing our first crops within three months of securing a facility.

Other aquaculture facilities similar to ours in rural Indiana, Iowa and Minnesota regularly sell out of stock each week when a new harvest comes to marketable size. Kalevala believes this will also be the case in Metro Detroit with over five million potential customers in reach of our facility.

Furthermore, if our campaign exceeds the funds we are requesting, the additional money will be applied towards equipment such as the growth tanks or biofloc reactors to reduce the capital required from investors. These additional funds will allow us to lower the initial price of our shrimp thanks to having less to repay in loans.

The Perks: or, the Neat Stuff We're Offering You.

Your contributions to our dream mean a lot to us! We understand your donations to our campaign have come from your own hard work and no matter how much you give, we want to recognize you for your help. Any amount you give will earn you a place on our "Wall of Fame" both on our website and a plaque in the facility and discounts on purchases of our shrimp.

For certain amounts, we offer "Distant" and "Local" perk packages. Since it is not possible to ship our shrimp great distances fresh (and also defeating the purpose of locally grown food), the "Distant" perks include more branded items while the "Local" perks include free shrimp, discount coupons and tours of the facility. If you live far from the Detroit area but have family or friends in the area that you would like to pass local perks to, please know the coupons are transferable. 

We hope you find a perk that you enjoy! Your generosity means the world to us and we want you to be satisfied both in knowing you're helping bring sustainable aquaculture to Metro Detroit and in our expression of thanking you for believing in our mission.

It's not Just About Kalevala Aquaculture, it's About the Future

While our primary goal is to produce the tastiest, freshest shrimp anyone in Metro Detroit has ever seen, we also plan to assist other burgeoning aquaculture facilities throughout the Midwest to become successful. To us, there is no competition when it comes to others helping protect our environment and human health. We dream of every major city having locally grown shrimp and we will do what we can to make it happen. 

Schools and universities will have access to our facility to help them develop their own aquaculture programs and research how to improve the efficiency of the Zero Exchange Method for future use in other seafood and possibly aquaponics. We will also welcome experimental technologies such as solar water heating into our facility to further reduce the impact our farm will have on the environment. 

We also hope to expand by the fourth year of production to double our output so that restaurants that use sustainable foods in the area will have an opportunity to offer locally produced shrimp to their customers.

Kalevala Aquaculture will also contribute a certain amount of our profits to support local causes such as Great Lakes conservation and community gardens.  Our aim is to eventually invest twenty percent of our profits into causes in the region.

Risks We Will Overcome

All businesses, especially new ones, need to be concerned with their financial disposition. Kalevala Aquaculture has carefully planned our future financial needs and established pricing and labor levels to cover our expenses for the next four years while setting enough revenue aside for unforeseen circumstances every step of the way. We have done the diligence required of investors to establish our ability to operate this business and believe securing the additional funding we will require to be probable, although not guaranteed. 

Crop loss is mitigated by the use of a natural gas emergency generator to continue to provide heat and aeration to the growth tanks in the event of a power failure. Should water chemistry change in an unexpected way, safe materials such as baking soda or molasses are introduced to the water to restore the pH or Carbon-Nitrogen Ratios, respectively. 

We also have the benefit of cooperation with an aquaculture facility in Indiana that has been supplying shrimp to customers for over five years to assist us, giving us their years of experience in problem solving should Kalevala discover a situation requiring skill beyond our capability. This Co-Op also gives us significant discounts on juvenile shrimp and their feed, reducing our costs to consumers. 

There are challenges... And we look forward to overcoming them all. 

Other Ways You Can Help Us

Spread the word about our project! We'd love for the campaign to reach everyone interested in an idea such as ours. We would gladly answer any questions anyone has, regardless of their intent with Kalevala Aquaculture, as developing sustainable aquaculture around the world is bigger and more important than us.

You can spread this campaign to your social media connections using Indiegogo's sharing tools and you can also find us on Facebook.

We at Kalevala Aquaculture would once again like to Thank You for taking the time to read our campaign and hope that at the very least it inspired you to make your little part of the world a better place for all. Please feel free to contact us with any questions you may have.

With Warmest Wishes and Regards, 
                                 ​~Kalevala Aquaculture

We care about the preservation of our precious Great Lakes as much as you do and the Michigan Department of Natural Resources approves of the import of this species into the State as it poses no risk to our waterways. 
For every pound of ocean caught shrimp sent to market, nearly five pounds of "bycatch" ocean life is destroyed according to the U.S. Fisheries Department. Commercial farm-raised shrimp are often laden with antibiotics and subjected to water contaminated with heavy metals and agricultural runoff. Mangrove forests are often destroyed to build the farms, removing important areas that naturally prevent erosion of coastlines. Kalevala Aquaculture will not use antibiotics and our water source will be carefully monitored to prevent risk of contamination from lead or other dangerous chemicals. Only heat, salt, feed, and biological water filtration will be used in our growth tanks. This Zero Exchange Method technology is tried and true and brings shrimp production into an economically viable range for small facilities of modest crop sizes.
Fresh shrimp also have the added benefit of being much tastier than frozen shrimp. The meat is much sweeter than frozen choices. Our shrimp also do not require the "mud vein" to be removed (where toxins build up in commercial shrimp) as it will cook off, and the shell does not need to be removed before eating thanks to Pacific White Shrimp molting cycles making it soft and safe to digest.
With your help, Kalevala Aquaculture will secure a lease of a facility large enough to hold the growth tanks and equipment necessary to produce antibiotic free shrimp in the area.
Why We've Come to You
Kalevala Aquaculture needs to secure a letter of intent of the lease of a large commercial space (at least 3,500 square feet or 1,200 square meters) and licensing/permits in Metro Detroit to establish our facility and attract investors for the capital equipment and start-up costs. Essentially, the $6,000 we are seeking from generous people like you is known as "seed capital" and is a common requirement for a business such as this when pursuing investment.
Since this is an "all or nothing" campaign, if we do not meet our goal, your contribution will be returned to you and we wish to thank all of you who did contribute and hope you continue to be passionate about ideas such as ours that are good for the well being of the planet.
The entire project will require approximately $100,000 to become operational and sustain itself until profitable harvests can be achieved four months after the first sale of shrimp. Each harvest produces more shrimp as the biological filtration medium in the tanks establish, resulting in enough shrimp being produced to be profitable on the third harvest rotation of the growth tanks. We expect to start growing our first crops within three months of securing a facility.
Other aquaculture facilities similar to ours in rural Indiana, Iowa and Minnesota regularly sell out of stock each week when a new harvest comes to marketable size. Kalevala believes this will also be the case in Metro Detroit with over five million potential customers in reach of our facility.
Furthermore, if our campaign exceeds the funds we are requesting, the additional money will be applied towards equipment such as the growth tanks or biofloc reactors to reduce the capital required from investors. These additional funds will allow us to lower the initial price of our shrimp thanks to having less to repay in loans.
The Perks: or, the Neat Stuff We're Offering You.
Your contributions to our dream mean a lot to us! We understand your donations to our campaign have come from your own hard work and no matter how much you give, we want to recognize you for your help. Any amount you give will earn you a place on our "Wall of Fame" both on our website and a plaque in the facility and discounts on purchases of our shrimp.
For certain amounts, we offer "Distant" and "Local" perk packages. Since it is not possible to ship our shrimp great distances fresh (and also defeating the purpose of locally grown food), the "Distant" perks include more branded items while the "Local" perks include free shrimp, discount coupons and tours of the facility. If you live far from the Detroit area but have family or friends in the area that you would like to pass local perks to, please know the coupons are transferable. 
We hope you find a perk that you enjoy! Your generosity means the world to us and we want you to be satisfied both in knowing you're helping bring sustainable aquaculture to Metro Detroit and in our expression of thanking you for believing in our mission.
It's not Just About Kalevala Aquaculture, it's About the Future
While our primary goal is to produce the tastiest, freshest shrimp anyone in Metro Detroit has ever seen, we also plan to assist other burgeoning aquaculture facilities throughout the Midwest to become successful. To us, there is no competition when it comes to others helping protect our environment and human health. We dream of every major city having locally grown shrimp and we will do what we can to make it happen. 
Schools and universities will have access to our facility to help them develop their own aquaculture programs and research how to improve the efficiency of the Zero Exchange Method for future use in other seafood and possibly aquaponics. We will also welcome experimental technologies such as solar water heating into our facility to further reduce the impact our farm will have on the environment. 
We also hope to expand by the fourth year of production to double our output so that restaurants that use sustainable foods in the area will have an opportunity to offer locally produced shrimp to their customers.
Kalevala Aquaculture will also contribute a certain amount of our profits to support local causes such as Great Lakes conservation and community gardens.  Our aim is to eventually invest twenty percent of our profits into causes in the region.
Risks We Will Overcome
All businesses, especially new ones, need to be concerned with their financial disposition. Kalevala Aquaculture has carefully planned our future financial needs and established pricing and labor levels to cover our expenses for the next four years while setting enough revenue aside for unforeseen circumstances every step of the way. We have done the diligence required of investors to establish our ability to operate this business and believe securing the additional funding we will require to be probable, although not guaranteed. Crop loss is mitigated by the use of a natural gas emergency generator to continue to provide heat and aeration to the growth tanks in the event of a power failure. Should water chemistry change in an unexpected way, safe materials such as baking soda or molasses are introduced to the water to restore the pH or Carbon-Nitrogen Ratios, respectively. 
We also have the benefit of cooperation with an aquaculture facility in Indiana that has been supplying shrimp to customers for over five years to assist us, giving us their years of experience in problem solving should Kalevala discover a situation requiring skill beyond our capability. This Co-Op also gives us significant discounts on juvenile shrimp and their feed, reducing our costs to consumers. 
There are challenges... And we look forward to overcoming them all. 
Other Ways You Can Help Us
Spread the word about our project! We'd love for the campaign to reach everyone interested in an idea such as ours. We would gladly answer any questions anyone has, regardless of their intent with Kalevala Aquaculture, as developing sustainable aquaculture around the world is bigger and more important than us.You can spread this campaign to your social media connections using Indiegogo's sharing tools and you can also find us on Facebook.
We at Kalevala Aquaculture would once again like to Thank You for taking the time to read our campaign and hope that at the very least it inspired you to make your little part of the world a better place for all. Please feel free to contact us with any questions you may have.
With Warmest Wishes and Regards,                                  ​~Kalevala Aquaculture

story:
Son of Man is out to create the best sagardo (Basque for cider) you've ever had. In order to do this we are raising money to purchase a traditionally-Spanish, but American made Kupela.

Our company is committed to making and sharing the best product possible. Fermenting in wood gives soul to cider. Kupelas are traditional wooden fermenting vessels used to make cider, wine and sour beer throughout the world.

Year after year, generations of Basques have made cider in ancient, patinated Spanish chestnut kupelas. While we don't have Spanish chestnut in the States, we can source top quality, sustainably harvested American oak. The interplay between the cider, wood, oxygen and the microorganisms thriving in the barrel is fundamental in creating a living product that tastes delicious.

We are asking for your help to finance the purchase of a gorgeous, 5,000 liter American oak kupela from the skilled craftsmen at Foeder Crafters. The barrel is being designed and built to our exact specs, mimicking the traditional vessels housed in every ciderhouse around San Sebastian. When complete, we will be able to make an authentic Basque style cider in both flavor and process. Wild yeast. Oregon apples. Spontaneous ferment.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $18,000 to purchase a beautiful, American made kupela. The equipment will be used to ferment cider and will be the centerpiece of our Txotx parties, where guests will have the opportunity to sample cider direct from the tanks. 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will be invaluable in propelling our launch this fall. The kupela will help us produce the absolute best Basque style cider possible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the ability to make a financial contribution. Hell, if we had the money we wouldn't be on indiegogo in the first place! Regardless of whether or not you can support us with cash, please share this campaign with anyone and everyone you know! The more folks that know about what we are doing the more likely our project will be funded and turn into a success! Evangelize about Son of Man cider!

 

Visit www.sonofman.co for more information

story:
The Traveller Coffee.

I have been traveling around Asia since I was a university student because of exchange student grants that I have received, and was offered, by the most reputable INGOs in the world. Most programs were in Foreign Affairs Training, Culture and Language Awareness, and even Contemporary Dance Appreciation (Yes, I am a Contemporary Dancer). Since then, I fell in love with many different places, cultures, people and food.

I may not be the most intelligent, but I am very passionate about my interests, such as different cultures, foreign languages and meeting people in all walks of life; that is why I chose to study International Relations.

I got the chance to eat and taste authentic and famous menus/dishes from the different countries and places I was able to visit. Who would have thought I would have the opportunity to taste international cuisines as authentic as possible? But I believe it is because I demonstrated hard work, passion and coffee; namely the power of coffee. When I was a student I would always drink coffee in order not to sleep, and so I could focus more on my studies. From that point of time until now, coffee is my strength and power. Us working professionals need coffee to boost our productivity at work, am I right?

Anyway, to put it up in a nusthell, I would like to build a coffee shop which will offer many different famous coffees (the best as it were) from around the world, in my area of which I live! With that, I would be able to share my love of different cultures, as well as travelling, to those people who are busy working for their life and their families, allowing them to “travel the world” in my shop by giving them a taste of different coffees from around the world. Wouldn’t it be amazing: simply sitting in one place sipping your coffee, but feeling like you've traveled around the world? That is my business dream.

 

With that being said, we need to raise at least $20,000 for this start-up coffee shop, to introduce famous coffees from around the world.

Notwithstanding from all the sweat and time it will take to have The Traveller Coffee to start brewing, we want to get beans open without going to the bank and asking for a loan from people who don't really share our vision.

I already have a commercial space that I will use, but it still needs to be renovated for it to be more appealing and conducive for those travelers. And it's good to note that my location is in a very nice spot for tourists and whatnot as it is considered a hidden gem of the Philippines. It is also one of the best places to surf and swim because of its majestic waves. You can find it on the map, Catanduanes, Philippines. More so, I will still need to have coffee machines and grinders, and to get my suppliers for the beans. I studied and marketed as to where will I buy those ingredients to be used for the international recipes that I will offer in the coffee shop.

As of now, we still need to have at least 70% to start us in brewing.

Coffees to be offered are:

  1. Egg Coffee from VietNam
  2. Kaffeost Coffee of Finland
  3. Cafe des espices of Morocco
  4. Argentina's Cafe Lagrima
  5. Cafe del Olla of Mexico
  6. Spain's Cafe Bombon
  7. Italian's Cafe Lemon Espresso
  8. Flat White Coffee of Australia and New Zealand
  9. Pharisäer of Germany
  10. Buna Coffee of Ethiopia
  11. Kapeng Barako of the Philippines.

Each experience has affirmed the longing I have to a open a coffee shop and elevate it to its highest level of performance not just as a business but as a powerful, relevant forum for meeting people from every background.  By using a coffee shop as a medium to meet people we can affirm, encourage and inspire our customers to be the best version of themselves. We also want to be a hub for local resources and individuals to connect with each other. Besides genuine interaction, our job is to provide the quality coffee, tasty treats and a comfortable space for those connections to happen.

story:
Who we are


Hey! I'm Jett Murdock, a high school student from California, and I am representing Avjord Organics! We are raising money to help cover the startup costs of a real company for real adventurers. We were sick of all the "healthy" snack foods with flours, syrups, and high-glycemic sweetners, which wreck your health. Go into almost any health food store and you will find this in most of the packaged products. We here at Avjord have always loved adventure, fitness, and the earth that lets us experience it. Avjord (roughly meaning "of soil" in Norwegian) was created to provide real, nourishing snack to support our adventures, made with ingredients like organic mineral rich figs, organic creamy coconut, and rich, fair trade cacao, with no added isolated sweetners like brown rice syrup. Whether you are looking for a power packed pre workout snack or a quick bite before you scale a mountain, we hope to be there for you.
                                                     
                                                      What we need 
So far we have developed our first product, called Warrior Bites, in several flavors. Using ripe figs, juicy berries, decadent cacao, and rich maca among other ingredients,  we've created the perfect energy ball in double chocolate,blueberry chia, and vanilla mocha.  Unfortunately, our funds are just a little bit too low to pull everything together. That's where you guys come in. We're calling all warriors and adventurers to join us in making this planet healthier and more exciting! Here is a quick breakdown of the costs:

                                                               What You Get
This is all about you! This is a product for the consumer,  not for the quickest, cheapest buck. With a small investment to get this company off the ground, you open a world of possibility. Not only will you get the satisfaction of helping someone do something extraordinary, like climbing a mountain, but you can get some really cool perks, like clothes, free products, and even an adventure vacation anywhere in the world! Even the smallest donation can help us and you!

story:
Hello,

My name is James Sanigular,

President of Global African Foods Inc., 

We're asking for your help to purchasing our new All Natural  Shea Butter Lotion. 

All our ingredients are coming from West Africa and would like the proceeds from the sale of our lotion to help farmers in Liberia.

After 12 years of civil war, the country is in need of food manufacturing facility, Cold storage for the market women to preserve their goods after market hours.

About 80% of foods produced by local farmers spoil before getting to market and we would like to address that problem.
story_txt:
Hello,
My name is James Sanigular,
President of Global African Foods Inc., 
We're asking for your help to purchasing our new All Natural  Shea Butter Lotion. 
All our ingredients are coming from West Africa and would like the proceeds from the sale of our lotion to help farmers in Liberia.
After 12 years of civil war, the country is in need of food manufacturing facility, Cold storage for the market women to preserve their goods after market hours.
About 80% of foods produced by local farmers spoil before getting to market and we would like to address that problem.

story:
Purpose

Shortly after my staff and I lost our jobs after Hurricane Irma, I had a vision of working with my old team, by operating our own hotel.  We are all highly qualified and what a movie it would make!  I soon realized that, although entirely possible, it was not realistic.  I decided to focus on creating a temp agency to assist in getting my team back on their feet.   For some burning reason, I needed to have "karma" in the name, but it is out of emotional intelligence that I will keep that a secret for now.  After throwing the name around, I found that both Karma Lodging Company and karmalodging.com were not owned.   It took several months of incorporation, branding, video production and social media preparation to move forward.   My sincerest wish is that we can still provide help to those that are waiting to return to work and a healthy livelihood.

Budget

The "Karma is a Pitch" campaign consists of a 90-day, $25,000 budget.  The core of the budget, $10,000, is allocated to sales, marketing and mass media focusing on gaining hotel clients to fulfill their temporary and future human resources needs.   Perks are allocated the next 20% at $5,000, The remaining allocations are:  $4,000 to float temp agency payroll for the first 2 weeks; $2,000 for 90-day office lease; $2,000 for 90-day office payroll; $1500.00 for Indiegogo Fees; and $500 for 90-day phone, utilities, supplies.

Campaign Perks

It takes a lot of effort to come up with perks when you have no physical product to offer.  Our product is people.  We are starting with some exciting perks, some of which are exclusive and limited including "Karma is a Pitch" wristbands and serialized "Karma is a Pitch" challenge coins.  I am also offering Kaizen-based hospitality consulting services and invitations to our post-campaign picnic at Topeekeegee Yugnee Park in Hollywood, Florida... planned for mid-May.  If the entire goal is not met, the budget will be revised by percentage, with sales & marketing efforts reduced first.  Perks will be fulfilled regardless of the campaign outcome.

Impact

If the campaign pulls one family out of economic, physical or emotional turmoil... it will be a success.  My prediction is, that with full funding, there will be stories of houses not foreclosed upon, food on the table and integrity returned to a desperate community.   

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk I foresee is the loss of momentum as we move further away from Irma.  The 2018 hurricane forecast was released today, which will remind us all of the power of Mother Nature and the higher power of humanity for your fellow man.

The greatest challenge will be breaking into the highly-competitive and cut-throat temp agency sector of South  Florida.  I have arranged assistance with a colleague who works for an existing agency to assist those who remain unemployed after 90 days.  This includes fair wages and waiving rights to contracts that bind employees to one or more years of low wages and erratic work schedules with no health insurance or vacation benefits.

Can't Help Today?

There will be many of you who wish to donate to our cause but just can't do it at this time.   A social media "shout-out" is just as important as any monetary donation... participation is a gift that most of us take for granted.   

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

KARMA IS A PITCH!   JOIN US!

 

The Team

I ventured on this journey with two of my dearest associates and faithful friends, Valerie Fieret and Bibian Thony, whom I've known for almost 10 years now.  We made great headway during our first meeting in December of last year.  Valerie is engaged to be married to the love of her life, Morile Jean on the 22nd of April.   I met Valerie and Bibian in November of 2009 after taking over the housekeeping operations at the Shore Club in Miami Beach.   They both served as in-house security officers for the high-profile hotel.  After observing Valerie's presence and strength of character, I swiftly offered her an office coordinator position in my department and later promoted her to a supervisory role over a large common area housekeeping staff.  We later worked together at the Wyndham Palm-Aire and the Savoy Hotel in Miami Beach.

I will share more about Valerie and Bibian once I get a chance to meet up with them after the big wedding!!!

My name is Aaron Hill.  While in college, I was hired at Snowbird Ski & Summer Resort as a Houseman in 1992 and was promoted shortly after to Assistant Director of Housekeeping.  This was the beginning of an extensive hotel management career spanning 26 years.  Even with a film degree in my pocket, I continued in hospitality and by 2001 was leading the housekeeping department at the 1358-room Westin Bonaventure in downtown Los Angeles.   When Hurricane Irma hit, I was serving as the Rooms Director at the historic Savoy Hotel on Ocean Drive in Miami Beach.

KARMA IS A PITCH!   JOIN US!
 
The Team
I ventured on this journey with two of my dearest associates and faithful friends, Valerie Fieret and Bibian Thony, whom I've known for almost 10 years now.  We made great headway during our first meeting in December of last year.  Valerie is engaged to be married to the love of her life, Morile Jean on the 22nd of April.   I met Valerie and Bibian in November of 2009 after taking over the housekeeping operations at the Shore Club in Miami Beach.   They both served as in-house security officers for the high-profile hotel.  After observing Valerie's presence and strength of character, I swiftly offered her an office coordinator position in my department and later promoted her to a supervisory role over a large common area housekeeping staff.  We later worked together at the Wyndham Palm-Aire and the Savoy Hotel in Miami Beach.
I will share more about Valerie and Bibian once I get a chance to meet up with them after the big wedding!!!
My name is Aaron Hill.  While in college, I was hired at Snowbird Ski & Summer Resort as a Houseman in 1992 and was promoted shortly after to Assistant Director of Housekeeping.  This was the beginning of an extensive hotel management career spanning 26 years.  Even with a film degree in my pocket, I continued in hospitality and by 2001 was leading the housekeeping department at the 1358-room Westin Bonaventure in downtown Los Angeles.   When Hurricane Irma hit, I was serving as the Rooms Director at the historic Savoy Hotel on Ocean Drive in Miami Beach.

story:
Who is JA Biztown?

https://jaeasttennessee.org/

JA Biztown, or Junior Achievement of East Tennessee, is a non-profit dedicated to creating a generation of self sufficient and career capable youth. In 2017 alone they managed to help over 19,000 students in the East Tennessee area. Their corporate sponsors include Chick-Fil-A, Clayton Investments, and Pilot. These companies recognize the immense value JA Biztown brings to the community, and how the JA Biztown experience brings substantial value to the futures of local youth. JA Biztown uses real-world situations to create and inspire an environment conducive to learning. It teaches kids to love academia and create long-term goals to succeed in the real world.

Why We are Raising Money

Although JA Biztown has hosted over 900 classrooms, many schools are unable to send their students to gain this valuable experience. This is why we need your help; the cost of sending a class to JA Biztown is roughly $1,000 and that is our goal. With the money we receive, JA Biztown will be able to provide scholarships to the schools that may not be financially able to send their students. Every contribution made, no matter how large or small, will help us move forward and send as many children as possible to take part in this incredible experience.

How Donators will be Rewarded

T-shirts, Wristbands, Wall Plug, A Round TUIT Coin

If you donate $5 you will receive an around TUIT Coin. If you donate $10 you will have the choice of a wristband or a wall plug. If you donate $20 you will receive a round TUIT coin, one of JA Biztown's wristbands and a handwritten thank you letter. If you donate $30 you will have the choice between our two T-shirt designs. With a donation of $75 you will receive both of the T-shirt designs, a wristband, a round TUIT coin, a wall plug, and a handwritten thank you letter.

story:
The Answer: Smazzit Training Institute

  • Provide customized training courses to help more small businesses promote their websites.
  • Provide personal training via in-person and through live classes
  • Teach more business owners how to build their own websites 
  • Provide discounted and free training for older displaced workers/unemployed people with outdated skills 
  • Provide exclusive content to members on how to fix different website issues

My Credentials

  • I have been building websites and providing SEO & Reputation Management Services for small and start-up businesses for over 5 years.
  • I have 8 Google Certifications, including Waze and Microsoft Bing Professional Partner Certifications.
  • My 11-year teaching background in high school math and 7-year IT/Project Management background in helping people with various computer issues, made me want to get back in the classroom. I love it!
  • Customers/Clients who have taken my courses and whom I provided SEO Services for gave positive reviews. You can read the feedback here for Smazzit Reviews 

 

What We Need

We are trying to expand our company, which is why we are asking our community for help. We are trying to raise roughly about $10,000 to help with two critical areas.

  • Hire more instructors to do Face-To-Face Training.
  • Hire more instructors to do more different types of courses. (Just to name a few, SEO Training for beginners, Web Design, Wordpress, IT, Tax,languages,  legal and more.)

By contributing to our campaign, you will help us scale this exciting opportunity and help more businesses succeed.  And for your amazing contribution, we have some fabulous rewards to give back.

 

The Features

For perks, we have our "Power Of Knowledge" merchandise, custom t-shirts for men and women, canvas tote bags, luxury ballpoint pens, Twitter Shout Outs (10,000 follower), Web Maintenance Memberships and online courses.

 

Business Promotion

If you contribute at least $25, You will receive a personal feature in our "Power Of Knowledge" Blog, and interview on our radio show with links to your business. Not only will we promote your business, but a link back to your website help increase your search engine rankings.

Local SEO Training & Membership

Learn how to rank your own website, Google My Business setup and optimization and how to increase sales in your local area.Also enjoy continuous personal support with our live chat app and exclusive content for members. Donate at least $99 and it's all yours.

 

Course Snippet For Local SEO

 

Build A Website Day 

Regardless of the nature of your business or what your company does to create profit, having a new first-class website is essential to your online business success. We will have your new WordPress site up and running in as little as a few days.

Bonus***

You can't go wrong with a Stop Da Hate Custom T Shirts & Caps. Show the world you are against hate.

 

Other Ways To Help

If you want to help us by another way, you can promote our school on your blogs, social media sites and by word of mouth. Also many struggling business owners need help with promoting their sites or a new website perhaps. Just sharing my campaign with your network will help so much. We will greatly appreciate it.

Thank you all again.

- Smazzit Training Institute

story:
WHO AM I AND WHY I NEED FUNDS?

I am 23 and I finished my study 2 years ago so I have to do jobs to support my family and my career but I am short at height and I look like a kid so every time I search for work I either got rejected or fired between 1 to 2 months just because they find someone good, I don't want to play victim so I want to start my own business. I don't want to be left behind one of my friends from work told me the actual reason why the manager fired me at that time I was confused what to do this is not my mistake how I was born. from childhood, I always want to live a respectful life so I discuss with some friends and they all agreed to help me. I have collected 2400$ I need more 1800$ to start the business I don't have any other thing to give you back but if you help me, I will be very great full  

HOW MUCH I NEED  

I don't want millions, I don't want to a huge amount of money I just need the rest 1800$ so that I will start my garage and show everyone I am no different.

I don't know what to say but I just want to tell you no one is forcing you I can't give you anything in return so if you want to help me you can otherwise it's ok I pray for everyone's happy life. 

HAVE A GOOD DAY EVERYONE

story:
My name is Kevin Johnston, I'm originally from the Orkney Isles in Scotland and I've just moved back after a decade of musical adventures around the UK. I was heavily inspired by the Battle Of The Bands events in the early 2000s but the facilities and resources were slim for rock musicians in Orkney. I originally left because I wanted to learn more about music production so I could write, record and perform my own music at a professional level. Now, with an honours degree in Digital Music And Sound Arts, three EPs, two albums and several gigs under my belt I want to use my experience to create the perfect place for musicians to reach their own potential: Kraken Tunes.

What We Need & What You Get

The biggest barrier a musician faces when starting a project in Orkney is having somewhere to practice (especially true if you're a drummer), so I primarily wish to open up a proper rehearsal studio, providing spaces for bands or solo musicians to practice without disturbing others or being disturbed. The rooms will be spacious, fully kitted, soundproofed and comfortable to ensure a perfect environment for creativity and honing of skills.

I will host jam sessions for people to come in to use the facilities and meet other musicians. There will be a shop to sell essential music equipment (strings, drumsticks etc.), local music recordings, t-shirts and refreshments. And I will host workshops from established musicians to share their experiences and techniques. I aim to create a community hub for musicians to meet, collaborate, practice, teach and express themselves.

I will be running the business as a Community Interest Company, with profits going back in to the business to purchase new equipment or pay the fees for gigs in the local venues. I already have a premises in mind and I'm currently in liaison with the landlord to secure it.

The Impact

Orkney is a creative and cultural place. We love our live music, we love creating things, but without the infrastructure for musicians to flourish, they will leave or give up. In the early 2000s there was a boost in the music scene with the Battle Of The Bands inspiring many of us to take up instruments and then go on to accomplish incredible things. I'm not going to name names, but we have Orcadians who started at the Battle Of The Bands and are now in internationally touring bands, just because there was that little bit of a music scene twenty years ago. There is the potential to encourage the next generation to follow their own hearts and accomplish amazing things and I want to make it happen with your help.

Risks & Challenges

And this is why I come to you, asking for your support. As you can imagine, there is a cost to opening up a business like this. I need to pay for equipment, soundproofing, insulation, business costs (like setting up the company), creating a website, rent and advertising. The good news is that I can apply for funding grants to cover a chunk of the upfront costs, but with a successful crowdfunded campaign I can increase my chances of securing grant funding and get the business opened as soon as possible.

In the perks, I'm including exclusives that will only be available for this campaign. There's a t-shirt with an exclusive design (to be revealed), a discount card and other more novel rewards. You are helping me and I want to benefit you accordingly, as an early supporter of the business.

So, please consider supporting Kraken Tunes and we can help the musicians of Orkney reach their potential.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this campaign far and wide, all over social media
  • Join the Kraken Tunes group on Facebook to share your ideas and keep up to date with all the news: https://www.facebook.com/groups/328871601348121/
  • Stop me in the street and I will happily talk music with you
  • Start a band!

story:
Short Summary

Right now, the entire world is confronted with a common enemy, COVID-19. 

At this time, we must all come together, support, and encourage one another during these challenging times. The UNITED Empowerment Band is a symbol of: courage overcoming fear, hope overcoming doubt, and a reminder that in times when we are confronted by a common enemy.... UNITED, we will overcome. 

Your purchase of a United Against COVID-19 Empowerment Band shows your pledge to stand United. Proceeds are being donated to COVID-19 Relief Funds around the world.

The Impact

Contributions from donors like you will also help to reduce our product cost so that we can have greater margins, leading to more money donated to the Relief Funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, we would absolutely appreciate you sharing this campaign on your social media accounts and/or emailing this campaign to others who may be interested in helping out. Thank you for your consideration.

story:
Domnian Hosting

We at Domnian Hosting want to be able provide the public with reliable server hosting. We started off in 2012, Where we came up with the idea to start a server on Minecraft. The only problem was that we could not find a reliable host so William decided to host it locally on his very own PC. This campaign for Domnian Hosting will help us make server hosting easier in the future and with the help of everyone we can achieve that goal. This is important to us because we feel like the quality of hosting has declined. We want to return it to its glory and make it easy for anyone to have a server.

Funding

The money we earn will strictly be going to the company and that alone. We will not take any money for ourselves. We need around $10,000 or more to make a humble beginning in the world of Entrepreneurship. We need to be able to afford server racks and eventually a small building for our planned Data center. So $10,000 is the minimum we need. We have some amazing perks to offer to you! They range from 3D printed emblems to being a founding sponsor of Domnian Hosting!

Where The Money Is Going

We need the money to help with a few things:

  1. The Campaign Perks - No Set Amount
  2. Become an LLC - $235 + $235/yr
  3. Multicraft Hosting Panel - €2.95/mo
  4. cPanel Web Hosting Panel - $45/mo
  5. WHMCS Billing Panel - $15.95/mo
  6. Hosting Equipment - ~$85/mo

The Impact 

The impact of our company can hopefully change the idea of server hosting for the foreseeable future. If you choose to donate, you will be helping more than just us. We have no intention to abuse the money in anyway. We are here to help!

Risks & Challenges

As a small business we may encounter a lot of challenges. But have no fear! We will overcome those challenges no matter what it takes. We value our customers and will keep them up to date with our situation via our twitters and other forms of social media. We are hard working people and will not let small things get in the way. We have an amazing team of people that will strive for 98-99% up-time with our servers.

Plans For The Future

Unlike many server hosting companies, we have big plans for the future. When the company gets large enough and there is enough money saved up, we plan on building our own data center with the focus on green energy as well as the environment. Stemming from our liking of OVH using water cooling to cool their servers, we plan on continuing the trend and joining them in this monumental leap.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Spread the word to your friends! We need all the help we can get, even if you can't donate you are important to us!! We care for the public and feel like it's time we give back. So please, spread the word!

Just For Fun

If this campaign ends up reaching it's goal of at least $10,000, The majority of the management team (some have opted-out) will put their mouths on the line and do the Ghost Pepper Challenge on camera and post it for all of you to see on our YouTube Channel for your amusement at the cost of our burning insides.

story:
For special offer check out our Facebook page!

Our Simple Plan to Reach our Goals

I believe we can easily hit our $200,000 goal with your help. We don't expect 1000 people to donate $200, that would obviously be great, but I know people don't just have that laying around! Okay, well maybe some of you do but your not going to just give that to anyone you've never met before. I think its much easier to part with a single dollar than it is many dollars! We do offer perks to help speed up the process but all I would really ask for is a donation of whatever your comfortable with but more importantly than the amount a social media share. Its going to be the power of social media that really helps us achieve our goals. If 1,000,000 people see our fund all we need is 2% to donate a single dollar.  So with your help we believe we can make a dream come true. Keep in mind the greater the amount donated the less of an impact the process fees will have on our overall total fund. Not only is there a percentage fee but a .30 cent charge per transaction. 


Sicilian Villa

My father is the hardest working man I know. He worked many years and many long grueling hours as a contractor. I use to work with him when I was younger and we were always the first onsite and always the last to leave. He didn't work that hard for himself, he did it because he always wanted to provide his family  a better life than he ever had.  And I wish I had the means to make his dream come true but I simply do not. He has always sacrificed his own dreams to help others. Well now its my turn to try and give back! After my grandfather past away my father inherited a piece of land with a home/winery and vineyard on it in Sicily. Unfortunately many years ago, the home was destroyed by an earthquake and was left to ruin because our family was to poor to rebuild.  Hoping to build there one day my father went ahead and obtained all the necessary construction permits to rebuild in the Etna National Park which is a protected area. After obtaining the required permits he also had a villa designed. This was 8 years ago!

As life around us changes so do the opportunities and the dreams we once have do as well. The idea of his dream Villa on his families land is getting further and further away. So much so he's ready to throw in the towel and sell the piece of property that has been in our family for generations! I feel that this moment is my opportunity to help my fathers dream become reality.


How You Can Help & Experience a Taste of What Sicily Has to Offer Yourself

When my father who was born in the U.S. and is also an Italian Citizen who speaks the language fluently, first decided he wanted to rebuild the Villa and vineyard he also decided that he would love to rent out the Villa and share with others what its really like to be a Sicilian. Not only by allowing you to stay there but also by being your personal guide throughout Sicily. You will experience things that you would never have even heard of while on other guided tours. We have extensive family over in Sicily and they have plenty of home made wine and massive family dinners, you will feel extremely welcome and truly know what it is like to be a Sicilian.

We need to raise $200,000 to fully construct the Villa. The plan is to instead of building a Private Villa and then rent it out we  will do things backwards here. As backers  you have the opportunity to be apart of the construction of the villa from start to finish with month to month updates on the construction progress. But you will also get the opportunity to be some of first to ever stay in the newly built villa that you helped fund.  When you purchase a perk you will receive the corresponding gift or voucher to reserve your rental dates.** Airfare not included** This is an all or nothing campaign which means if we don't meet our goal you get refunds. So make sure you help spread the word so we can smash our goal and move forward.

In short everything is in place, he just needs the necessary funds in order to start construction. 

The Land

The land is located in the MT. Etna National Park and is between the beautiful city of Taormina which is known for is great beaches, food, world class shopping, and the major city of Catania which is known for its night life, ancient history and markets.

You can see in this close up the old home that is sill partially standing but the roof is collapsed in. This home will be torn down and the new villa built in its place.


The Villa Now

This is the old villa on the vineyard that wine was made in, which was destroyed many years ago. My great grandfather use to collect the grapes and make the wine on this very property himself!


(Below) My Father and his Friend Nello on the property

The old wine press is pictured above.


The Villa Building Plans and Layout

Below is the first of two possible main floor layouts (two main level bedrooms)

Lower floor first layout design

Main floor layout design two with loft

Lower floor design two


The View

This is the view from the front door!



Rental Availability

*The winner of the trip will be awarded a voucher for their vacation which will reserve their spot with us. Upon completion of the villa The winner will be contacted and allowed to pick any 10 consecutive days in Sicily. The winner will have first choice of dates when the build is complete. The airfare will be for two regular priced economy class seats round trip, any additional luggage fees will be the responsibility of the winner.  Once arrived transport will have been arrange to bring you to the villa where you will spend you 10 day vacation.  Your guide will be at your disposal, if you have any particular sites you would like to see with in a day trip he will bring you there, he will also recommend some of the best must see places and restaurants to visit. *Meals not included*  And if you want you are invited to attend local festivities with our extended family. All though a safe place to visit you will be traveling at your own risk. You must have a Valid passport to travel to Sicily!

Obviously before anyone can stay here or set a date the Villa must be built! As a contributor you will receive monthly construction updates. Unfortunately the way things are built over there construction times tend to run longer, sometimes upwards of a year. Most big vacations like this are planned a year in advanced anyways. So as construction progresses we will update you with photos and construction completion updates. As soon as we know a completion date we will open up rental dates for the next five years on a first come first serve basis for dates.
Just remember and take into consideration in a construction process there can always be delays  so we can't guarantee a one year turn around time but at this time with the building plans and permits in place there is nothing stopping us from starting now!

Bumper sticker designs!
Option 1

Option 2
story_txt:
For special offer check out our Facebook page!Our Simple Plan to Reach our GoalsI believe we can easily hit our $200,000 goal with your help. We don't expect 1000 people to donate $200, that would obviously be great, but I know people don't just have that laying around! Okay, well maybe some of you do but your not going to just give that to anyone you've never met before. I think its much easier to part with a single dollar than it is many dollars! We do offer perks to help speed up the process but all I would really ask for is a donation of whatever your comfortable with but more importantly than the amount a social media share. Its going to be the power of social media that really helps us achieve our goals. If 1,000,000 people see our fund all we need is 2% to donate a single dollar.  So with your help we believe we can make a dream come true. Keep in mind the greater the amount donated the less of an impact the process fees will have on our overall total fund. Not only is there a percentage fee but a .30 cent charge per transaction. Sicilian Villa

My father is the hardest working man I know. He worked many years and many long grueling hours as a contractor. I use to work with him when I was younger and we were always the first onsite and always the last to leave. He didn't work that hard for himself, he did it because he always wanted to provide his family  a better life than he ever had.  And I wish I had the means to make his dream come true but I simply do not. He has always sacrificed his own dreams to help others. Well now its my turn to try and give back! After my grandfather past away my father inherited a piece of land with a home/winery and vineyard on it in Sicily. Unfortunately many years ago, the home was destroyed by an earthquake and was left to ruin because our family was to poor to rebuild.  Hoping to build there one day my father went ahead and obtained all the necessary construction permits to rebuild in the Etna National Park which is a protected area. After obtaining the required permits he also had a villa designed. This was 8 years ago!
As life around us changes so do the opportunities and the dreams we once have do as well. The idea of his dream Villa on his families land is getting further and further away. So much so he's ready to throw in the towel and sell the piece of property that has been in our family for generations! I feel that this moment is my opportunity to help my fathers dream become reality. 

How You Can Help & Experience a Taste of What Sicily Has to Offer Yourself
When my father who was born in the U.S. and is also an Italian Citizen who speaks the language fluently, first decided he wanted to rebuild the Villa and vineyard he also decided that he would love to rent out the Villa and share with others what its really like to be a Sicilian. Not only by allowing you to stay there but also by being your personal guide throughout Sicily. You will experience things that you would never have even heard of while on other guided tours. We have extensive family over in Sicily and they have plenty of home made wine and massive family dinners, you will feel extremely welcome and truly know what it is like to be a Sicilian.
We need to raise $200,000 to fully construct the Villa. The plan is to instead of building a Private Villa and then rent it out we  will do things backwards here. As backers  you have the opportunity to be apart of the construction of the villa from start to finish with month to month updates on the construction progress. But you will also get the opportunity to be some of first to ever stay in the newly built villa that you helped fund.  When you purchase a perk you will receive the corresponding gift or voucher to reserve your rental dates.** Airfare not included** This is an all or nothing campaign which means if we don't meet our goal you get refunds. So make sure you help spread the word so we can smash our goal and move forward.

In short everything is in place, he just needs the necessary funds in order to start construction. 
The Land
The land is located in the MT. Etna National Park and is between the beautiful city of Taormina which is known for is great beaches, food, world class shopping, and the major city of Catania which is known for its night life, ancient history and markets.



You can see in this close up the old home that is sill partially standing but the roof is collapsed in. This home will be torn down and the new villa built in its place.

This is the old villa on the vineyard that wine was made in, which was destroyed many years ago. My great grandfather use to collect the grapes and make the wine on this very property himself!





(Below) My Father and his Friend Nello on the property


The old wine press is pictured above.The Villa Building Plans and Layout

Lower floor first layout design

Main floor layout design two with loft

Lower floor design two

The ViewThis is the view from the front door!

Upon completion of the villa The winner will be contacted and allowed to pick any 10 consecutive days in Sicily. The winner will have first choice of dates when the build is complete. story:
Bonjour chers amis, ou cher inconnu,



Si tu es arrivé ici c'est déjà bon signe! Et je te remercie déjà pour ton intérêt. 

Quelques explications tout d'abord:

Je suis un jeune français de 27ans, diplômé d'une licence en architecture et aujourdhui responsable de rayon décoration dans une grande enseigne de bricolage.

A aujourd'hui mes goûts et mes envies vont vers la création d'une franchise de l'enseigne allemande internationale KARE DESIGN sur les terres canadiennes. Je connais celle-ci suite à ma participation chaque année au salon maison et objet de Paris.

Pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas cette marque, voici leur site internet: 

http://www.kare-design.com/fr/shop28018/product...

Cette marque internationale n'est pas encore présente sur le sol canadien et souhaite s'y implanter. Elle propose comme vous avez pu le voir des objets décoratifs mais surtout du mobilier design très typé. Elle vise de ce fait les petits budgets mais aussi les plus grands. C'est d'une part l'offre décorative de kare design, mais aussi sa renommée et mon envie de m'expatrier au canada qui font que j'envisage de créer cette franchise à Montréal. 

Ainsi, après une prise de contact avec kare design, j'ai besoin de 3300euros pour réaliser une étude de marché sur place. Cette somme va me permettre aussi d'avoir le soutien de kare design dans ma création d'entreprise car la demande faite ici n'est que la  première pierre à l'édifice pour ensuite pouvoir établir mon businessplan et trouver les financements.

Je fais donc appel à vous ici car je crois vraiment au prêt participatif qui est, pour moi, le reflet d'une société plus humaine! 

Petite précision: si la somme demandée n'est pas atteinte, indiegogo vous rembourse les sommes engagées à la fin du temps imparti. 


Merci pour votre aide quelle soit financière ou morale. 

Partagez cette page à tout votre entourage. Le succès de ce crowdfounding dépend de vous!

story:
Who we are

Favour Farms began operations in march 2012 on a very small scale with about 1000 Layers birds in a village called eyenkorin in Asa local government area of Kwara State. 2 years later we were able to grow the farm to about 1700 layers bird with the proceed from the sales of eggs and dungs.As demands for eggs and dungs increases.  In February, 2015 we took a term loan of five million naira from a commercial bank to enable us expand favour farms  so as to meet up with the increasing demand for chicken and eggs. The loan greatly help favour farms to add additional 4000 layers bird and 500 turkey. This help us to maintain a good turn-over.

The above snapshots represents a few picture of our Farm
Where we are.
Before now Favour Farms was greatly doing well because of the increase in demand for eggs and dungs which we strive to meet on daily basis simply because favour farms happens to be one of the recognized farm among the poultry farms in kwara state Nigeria.  But towards the end of November in the year 2015 due to the sudden "BIRD FLU" epidemic that rampage most bird farms in Nigeria in which our farm was greatly affected, we suffered a huge loss as over 100 percent of our birds to the said epidemic.
We had to retrench most of our workforce as we could no longer afford to pay monthly salary as a result of the loss. The tenure of the loan we borrowed from our bank is still active and still runs till date with huge interest.

We had sold off some of our hard earned valuables to help offset part of the loan.

What We Need

We desperately need your Help

In resuscitating our poultry farm, we need fund  in procuring the following items:

Renovation of 2 existing pen house and also to complete the other uncompleted  one.

1. Mini Delivery van

2. Feed milling machine

3. Feeding Troughs for Broiler and Turkey birds

Ways to contribute

Please tell your friends, family, and colleagues

When you support FAVOUR FARMS, you can choose to receive one of our AWESOME PERKS! For this campaign to be successful, we must raise $4,200. We’re confident that, with your outpouring support and your help in spreading the word, we will get there!If you are passionate about our project, food for nation tell someone about us. Even if you don’t contribute, it would help us a lot if you’d put in a good word about us with someone you know. Share this campaign on Facebook, Tweet about it, blog about us, email it, Pin it, Google it, help us get the word out. If you know any local media types, send them our way!

Thank you for giving voice to our hopes…

OUR UNIQUE PERK AND REWARD. 

As a sign of thanks for your outpouring support/ donation to help us, we are offering some amazing perks to appreciate You. 

A better world is possible. At Favour Farms, we know that when we work together, we can create lasting change for Bird Flu that rampage most Bird farms in Nigeria. Thanks in Advance.
