story:
I’ve been a medical cannabis patient for several years. When I first started using it I found myself having to choose between going out, being with my friends, or even just leaving the house, and staying home to medicate. I often thought that it would be amazing if there was a place where I could go, medicate, and spend time with my friends in a social setting outside my home. I knew there were places like that in other states, like Colorado and Washington, that had legal recreational marijuana.

Last year I became ill for an extended period of time and had to choose to medicate over leaving my house for weeks at a time.  At this point the idea for Honey Bee & Wolfe was born. I knew that in order for me to see this idea into fruition cannabis would have to be voted into recreational use, and in November of 2016 it happened.

I need $850,000 to open Honey Bee & Wolfe. I need it for two reasons; I need to be open for a minimum of one year, and I will need general, one time, startup costs.

Being open for a year is a big deal. Most new businesses are only open from between three to six months before having to close their doors. I need to have the money to pay the retail space rent, utilities, my staff salaries (whom I intend to pay a living wage), product, food and beverage purchases, and other miscellaneous expenses like toilet paper, printer paper, cleaning supplies, etc. for a whole year. Another yearly cost will be the recreational licensing for growing and selling marijuana. When the licensing becomes available for purchase I may need more than one license.

I will have several very expensive onetime costs in opening Honey Bee & Wolfe. Cannabis is strongly scented. I will need to purchase and install a ventilation system that will keep the smell down for any potential neighbors and properly remove the smoke from the lounge as it accrues. I intend to offer food so I will need to get any kitchen my retail space has up to code. If the space doesn’t have a kitchen I will need to pay to have one installed for me. There will be construction costs for the facility I rent, at the very least allot of concentrated elbow grease and new paint, at the most a complete overhaul. I will need to purchase initial product, furniture for the lounge, office furniture, a printer, a scanning system for lounge guests and the software that goes with it, specific software to track any cannabis I grow and sell, computers to run the software, etc. There are specific security standards I will need to implement for when I acquire licensing to grow and sell cannabis, a secure holding area for product that is not out for sale, such as a large lockable safe, security cameras, and ensuring safe and secure access to product by only employees.

If the facility I initially rent for Honey Bee & Wolf does not have the space for a grow I will need to rent an additional space and pay the rent and utilities for it for a year as well. I will need to purchase the things to start the grow, additional security for the facility, taxes on the product I grow, anything I manufacture, like concentrates, any other fees and taxes owed to the state, county, or city (if they decide to implement any), etc. All before I can sell any of it. 

Honey Bee & Wolfe will be a place where people from all walks of life can come and enjoy themselves while also enjoying cannabis. It will be a place where people can come to relax, chit chat with their friends, make new friends, play games, be they tabletop or video, read, etc.

I will have availability to teach people that want to learn how to make a joint, try out a bong before purchasing their own for at home, learn how to use a pipe, or try out an edible in a safe space.

There are unique risks and challenges to having a business that is in the cannabis industry, especially in a state that is just starting to allow recreational use. Currently there aren’t any other businesses in the Orange County area that are doing what I am seeking to do. I am most likely going to be one of the first. I will not be able to sell marijuana after my initial opening; my guests will need to bring their own. I intend to allow them to bring their own even after I begin to sell.

I’m doing a crowdfund because banks do not want to lend to people that are considered high risk. The cannabis industry, even though it is growing and is doing quite well in other states that allow for recreational use, is a high-risk industry. Mostly because it’s still federally classified as a schedule 1 substance, though hopefully that will change in the future, sooner rather than later.

If I do not reach full funding I will continue to work on other ways of acquiring it. Private investors are a consideration and even though it is unlikely I would receive bank funding I would still try that route.

I know that not everyone going to be able to contribute, or want to. I ask that if you can’t, or don’t want to, share us on your social media or with friends and family. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about the campaign! We hope to see you at the lounge when we open!

story:
Short Summary

We are a family run and owned, small company from a small town in Iceland.

We started developing and designing our featured product, the Bouquet wine box, by coincidence. We were actually just "dressing up" regular wine boxes so they could be placed on the table in a wedding we attended and realized that this was a product that should be available for everyone.

We have acquired a patent for the design and are now in need of funds to start production. We have put all our savings into the project and are hopeful that this will make it possible for us to reach our dream of starting and running our own company for years to come.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for packaging (boxes, bags & flowers) and bottling. We are working with a Spanish wine company for the wine and leasing facilities in Spain for packaging.

You have the chance to help us make our dream come true and also have the opportunity to be one of the first persons to taste our delicious wine that comes in its own "flower vase" and looks beautiful in its surroundings.  

All funds go toward the project, and every little helps!

We would also like to make it clear that all the packaging is 100% recyclable, as we are very protective of the environment. 

If you are not able to help us fund the project please help us by sharing this, thank you so much.

story:
Seit die Gentrifizierung und der Glas-Stahl-Bauwahnsinn Einzug in den Kiez gehalten haben, sind wir dankbar über jedes Fleckchen Pauli, das noch etwas vom alten Kiezcharme bereithält. Mithilfe dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne möchten wir den Erhalt des AngelKlubs ermöglichen und aufzeigen, daß Hamburgs Kunst und Kulturangebot bezahlbar bleiben muß und nicht einer elitären Gruppe vorbehalten sein sollte!
 
Das Geld dient dazu, die von der Stadt auferlegten Bauflagen zu erfüllen, wie z.B. die Erstellung eines neuen Schalltechnischen Gutachtens, den Einbau einer Lüftungsanlage, den Ausbau der Toiletten und den Umbau der Eingangsbereiche.
 
Mein Name ist Aaron Böhm und einer der ersten Mieter des blauen Hauses gewesen. Durch meinen Hintergrund als DJ, Musiker und Veranstalter von Events war ich die treibende Kraft bei der Gründung des Angel*Klubs. Als Klub von Künstlern für Künstler, bietet der Angel*Klub eine Plattform für noch junge, unbekannte aber auch etablierte Künstler, DJ's, Maler, Filmemacher. Die neuen Bauauflagen der Stadt sind neben der Herausforderung jetzt vor allem auch eine Chance, den Angel*Klub einer breiten Öffentlichkeit zugänglich zu machen. Als st.paulianischer Musiker und Künstler versuche ich einen der letzten nicht kommerziellen Orte Hamburgs in Eigeninitiative am Leben zu erhalten und somit auch die Stadt durch das Projekte national und international attraktiver zu machen. Ich freue mich über Eure Hilfe und Unterstützung. Support den Angel*Klub!

story:
Our Story

It all started when we visited a Bar In Austin,Texas on a Friday night. We walked into the bar and the place was packed. We stayed in line for 15 minutes to be served a Flat, Weak BEER for a ridiculous  price . That's when we decided, we need to make this experience waaaay better, and Unlimited BEER was born.

What Makes Us Different

All Our Draft Beers Will Be On A Fast Draft System To Guarantee A Perfect Pour & Expedited Service.

 Choice Of 5 Flavors Of BEER Dressings. 

All Our Beers Will Be Served At 29 Degrees. AKA Ice Cold.

Ninja Card Throwing Games + Multiple Card Games For You And Your Friends.

XSpace - A Space Where You Can Have A Quite Time, Work On A Project Or Work On Your Next Business Idea.

Future Vision: Pub Design Will Include A Future Provision For Self Serve Draft Beer System (you will be able to pour your own beer from a draft) When Self Draft System Is legalized In Texas.

Long Term Vision Is To Create Worlds First Pub With 500+ Selections Of Selfserve Draft BEER System in Austin, Texas

The Perks

Once In A Life Time Perk Of FREE BEER FOR LIFE. Please See Perks Section For Details.

Pub location

Our Team Is Looking At Austin Downtown, Mopac & Domain Area For Retail Space With Patio.

 

Pub Opening Date

Estimated Pub Opening Date -December 27th 2017

 

Contribution We Need

Our Team Has Raised Over 150K In Funding From Personal Loans And Investors. Our Goal Is To Collect a Fixed Amount Of 350K Via Crowd Funding By Offering Once In A lifetime Perks To Our Supporters. If We Do Not Reach This Set Goal, Indiegogo Will Refund 100% Of Your Money Back, So There Is NO RISK To You.

 

Giving Back To Austin Community

We Strongly Believe In Giving Back To The Austin Community. 5% Of All Profits Will Be Donated To Austin's Childrens Shelter. 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please Share This Project & Perks With Your Friends And Family To Make Unlimited BEER A Reality.

    Please Use The Indiegogo Share Tools For The Ease Of Sharing This News.

story:
We are proud to present our invention, our idea and our project that will literally revolutionize the boating community and the world of RVs!

We started with a need that is in fact also a problem and we found a simple, efficient, and esthetic solution.  We are proposing an invention that will permit the user to dispose of trash when aboard a sail boat, fair size motor boat or even a motor home without restraining the space inside the vehicle.

RVs and boats (sail or motor) do not have a precise place where to dispose of waste.  We wanted to reproduce the habits individuals have in their home: when the bin is full, it is put in a larger exterior bin until it can be emptied.

This idea arose when the two ocean lovers that we are were irritated by the absence of a simple garbage bin while on our sail boat.  

We tried shopping, but no marine garbage bin was available on the market!  Patrick thus decided to create a prototype.  We saw an opportunity and decided to undergo the steps to patent our project. Finally, as we talked about our project, opportunities for motor homes materialized.

Some products can significantly transform our habits while others fill a need of less importance.  Our invention will fill your needs and will help preserve a clean environment whether it is in the water or on the ground.

The environment is also something that we are committed to.  For every garbage bin sold, we will give a percentage of sales to organisations such as “Ocean Clean-Up”  that have for mandate of cleaning our oceans. 

Join us in order to make a difference in the RV world!

Vicky Maltais & Patrick Prevost - Co-founders of Victoria Marine


Who we are

We are the co-founders of Victoria Marine: VR and Maritime divisions. We built everything from A to Z according to our convictions: our logo, our slogan, our invention, etc. For example, on the logo, the two sails represent the two Ps of Patrick Prévost and the name, Victoria Marine, is based on Vicky Maltais’ first name as well as meaning “Victory”.

Our slogan “A victory for our oceans!” started with the principle of offering a product for waste management on board and our desire of supporting an organization that has the same goal as us: cleaning the oceans! It is a priority to rid our oceans of plastic, but it is equally important to make sure we do not contaminate them further!

Patrick Prévost, Production

I am passionate about everything connected to boating and am very knowledgeable about the boating world.  You have a question about navigation? I have the answer at the tip of my fingers!  I was very young when I bought my first embarkation, a racing catamaran, and I continued with more imposing models.  I am at my second patent; I have the ability to find solutions to recurring problems.

Since early childhood, I have been sailing and have enjoyed the best moments of my life on water. In the last few years, I bought a classic sailboat where I enjoy all my summer vacation with my family. Rapidly, in my outings, I was irritated by the lack of a simple garbage bin. I then decided to create a model and as opportunities became more and more obvious, Victoria Marine was born!

Vicky Maltais, Sales

I was conquered upon my first few minutes of navigation with Patrick.  Boating quickly became one of my passions.  With my studies in industrial production, management and productivity, I previously held a position as quality supervisor in the aeronautic field. I am particularly good with management, planning, sales and marketing.  In fact, I had previously built my company from A to Z.  This new project is an exciting challenge since it awakens the business woman in me.


The Problem

When we are in a habitat, whether it is on water or earth, we consume and inevitably produce waste.  The disposal of what we consume is just as important as its use.  Fair size boats which include a kitchenette do not have a precise place to dispose of waste.

Thus, each boat owner is faced with the same problem.  When the small kitchen bin is full, the bag is stored in the chests, tied to the guardrail or deposited in the zodiac.  The bags smell and leak and contaminate the deck.  As for the chests, these are used for ropes and filling them with trash uses up much needed space.

For motor homes, a similar problem arises.  On campsites, we must bring the garbage every night to the large container at the entrance in order to avoid attracting animals.  Furthermore, if the caravan is in the middle of nature, then the only place to put the garbage is inside the RV or in the car in order to avoid encounters with bears and racoons who might be tempted by the leftovers!


The Solution

We wanted to reproduce the habits individuals have in their home: when the bin is full, it is put in a larger exterior bin until it can be emptied.

Our RV garbage bin has a look that is similar to traditional garbage containers.  It has a device that allows it to hook on and lock to RV and boat balconies in order not to take up space.  It is made solely of stainless steel and UV treated plastic in order to avoid corrosion.  It is hermetic and includes an integrated key-lock.

On a watercraft, it can be placed behind the boat as well as on the back side or the front.  On a RV it can be placed on the side handle or on the back ladder. Light, solid and robust, it is conceived to be weather resistant.  It is also interesting to mention that our invention could be used as extra storage space or as a recycling bin. Since waste management and the protection of the environment are crucial to us, it was important that we found a solution to this problem.

Our invention can even help prolong your vacation since the owner has a specific place where to put his garbage! Then, upon return, he simply needs to unlock and remove the garbage bin from its plinth and bring it to the large container. Also, since it is locked, it cannot fall into the water or be stolen.  If ever by chance it would fall into the water, it would float.


Technology

  • Light, Esthetic, Hermetic

  • 65 L capacity

  • Designed for outdoor use

  • Perfect as a trash or a recycle bin or as an additional storage compartiment

  • Stainless steel components

  • You can even lock it for more safety

  • A drain has been fixed to the bottom of the container in order to facilitate  cleaning

  • It adjusts to different sizes of balcony supports outside of boats. As for RVs, it would be perfect fixed on a support on the rear bumper



Our Mission

Our mission is to offer our customers a quality product that efficiently meets their needs in the maritime field and to become an international benchmark for marine trash cans.  The core values ​​of Victoria Marine are righteousness, quality, efficiency and offering a prompt service as well as having a deep respect for consumers and the environment. Advocate for a maritime environment without waste and a complete cleaning our oceans!

Victoria Marine invites you to properly dispose of your waste on board while taking care of the aquatic and terrestrial environment.

With your help, we are proud of contributing to the cleaning of our oceans!  Upon your purchase, a percentage of sales will be allotted to the “Ocean Clean-up” programs in order to support the cleaning of our wonderful bodies of water!

Our slogan: A victory for our oceans!


Target Market

The target market is quite vast. First, we have owners of sail boats and fair size motor boats.  Second, our invention will be useful for campers and RV owners. Then, we have boating and camping accessory distributors and manufacturers of boats and motor homes. Finally, rental companies for RVs will see a basic product that can be profitable to them.


Donations

Our invention solves an irritating and constant situation. After many international searches, we realized that this invention does not exist!  When we are in a habitat, be it on water or earth, we consume and inevitably produce waste.  The disposal of what we consume is just as important as its use.

Since waste management and the protection of the environment are crucial to us, it was important that we found a solution to this problem.  More and more organisations are born with the mission of cleaning our oceans. Thus for every garbage bin sold, we will give a percentage of sales to organizations such as «Ocean Clean-Up»  that have for mandate of cleaning our oceans. 

Also, one of the projects that we would like to eventually set up is to find a way to use plastics from our oceans to make our bins in order to recycle that plastic.


Costs


Future

To start off, we want to offer a single model. However, eventually, we want to offer our users different sizes, colors, and product ranges. It would be interesting to have a carbon fiber upscale bin or to offer models exclusive to boat constructors with the same colours, accessories and shapes as their creations.  The possibilities are endless!

The buyer can then have two marine garbage bins on his boat to put aside recyclable mater.  However, in the future, it would be interesting to have a compost option annexed to the marine garbage.

Perks


Victoria Marine FAQs

Q: When are the garbage bins available?

A: The garbage bins will be available for shipping late 2016.

Q: I don’t have any money to donate, how can I help?

A: Don’t worry! You're amazing anyways and thanks for even contacting us. We need help to share this project around with any media we can. It can be with social medias like facebook, instagram, twitter, websites and bloggers. Also with more traditional media like newspapers, magazines, tv, radio and journalists. Friends and family are also great!

Q: Can I invest and are you looking for agents and distributors?

A: We are open to expressions of interest from investors, agents and distributors. Send us an email with your details and resume and we will see what we can do. Email:  victoriamarine@outlook.com

story:
Our Concept is Simple
Nachos. Who doesn't love them?
Finding nacho enthusiasts isn't the issue. We're everywhere! 
Finding nachos on the other hand... not as simple.


Until Now

Our goal is to curb your nacho cravings as efficiently as possible.

Sherrol has managed a quick service Mexican restaurant for half a decade. It didn't take long for her to realize the item everyone kept requesting wasn't even on the menu. 

We value time but don't view quality as a necessary compromise. 


Where We Are Now

We (Sherrol and Colette) have been taking a course through City Hall for small business start-ups. We meet with the grant committee next month and if all goes well, will receive a grant to cover a portion of the start-up costs for our business. 

People love the concept and are eager to dig in. The location we've found is close to home, in the up and coming neighbourhood of "Barton Village". Barton Street has gotten a less than stellar rap over the years which the City of Hamilton and Nacho Dias are hoping to change. With the rising cost of real estate, Barton Village's price tag is no longer aligning with it's 'low-income' reputation and newcomers to Hamilton are on the hunt for a local hangout. 

In addition to our more self-serving interests (working for ourselves, 5 minute commute by foot, and NACHOS GALORE) we would also love to be part of revitalizing a neighbourhood we happen to call home.

The landlord loves our concept, thinks we are a perfect fit and is eager to lease to us.

The catch?

There are a number of other costs involved in securing the location we've found, which has to be done prior to our presentation next month. We need the grant to get the location, we need the location to get the grant (as a restaurant isn't much of a business without an address!). 

That's where you come in!

We Have - 

A great concept, a strong work ethic and an awesome location. 

We Need - 

The funds to make this place great.

What will we use the funds for?

  • Securing our location
  • Building Permit (To allow seating)
  • Renovations (Paint & Flooring), Decor
  • Marketing/Packaging


HELP US MAKE EVERYDAY NACHO DAY..

story:
Who are we?

We are Max and Philip, we're both 16 years old. Both we have the same goal in our life, and that is to be free!

At this moment we are hobby photographers/filmmakers, and travellers. Max have been taking photos and making movies for about a year and a half now, but for Philip it is about 2 years. We can't explain in words how much it means to us, and how much it already has given us of life experience and joy!
Then we also have Mette on our team, she's the girl who keep an eye on the finalcials for the project. If something goes bad in the budget she'll take care of all that stuff and make sure everything is good! 

Why does this project count for us?

As described in the top, freedom in life means a lot to us! The idea of that anyone would like to sit in a office, working with something that they really doesn't want to, make us sick! Everyone should be in freedom of doing what they love! 
To have the free rights to do whatever you want, what you like, and what you would appreciate is what everyone should have the free rights to! Therefor we began this project.


Fera Hammocks

came alive when we were talking about the in town annual festival and other projects on our minds, and then the idea of freedom came up! We're gonna make an extra way to camp when the annual festival starts. Both we have our own hammocks, which we use a lot, and give us many great opportunities! 



All of the funds raised by this campaign will go directly towards the completion of our project and to the continued development of the Fera Hammocks. We need people like you to give as little or as much as you feel comfortable, to ensure the success of our project!



Are you that type of a person who like to meet new people and love to be close around them, this option might be for you!
Do you want to be just a little more cool than everyone else, this option might also be just for you!
Do you have skills with a camera, you could even come help us reach bigger goals for the future!

What if we NOT reach the entire goal?
If not we reach our entire goal for the project ($9550) the raised funds will still all go to the project! Every single cent ever donated to the project, will be spend to the project! 
 
What you can do: Come join the community which will be held mostly in Denmark, come help us stand an amazing party together in the Fera Hammocks Domes, and take pictures to show your friends how you are helping to grow our community! Follow our social media campaigns for tips on how to stage the best night in a dome with us, and other helpful information!



We also need:
People interested in a summer job!
A coordinator to help coordinate the hole arrangement!
Someone that can be helpful with taking down our area in the end of the summer!

Are you interested in a summer job or giving a big help to the project 

take contact!

Email: ferahammocking@gmail.com
Phone: +45 4044 1318


The People Behind The Project!

Philip CEO & Founder

Max Human Resources Associates

Mette Financials Associates


Thanks for your support! 

As a way of expressing our gratitude for your generosity, we have set up a variety of perks as a way of saying thanks for your participation. As a local or global community member, you can be a partner in the realization of a project that is for Danish and visitors to our inspiring Fera Hammock Project!

We create a ending party for you, there is something for everyone and we thank you for your contribution - so come join us the last day of this season and get a free night!


How much does your raise count?

Whatever you donate $1 or $1500 it will all be a very kind help to the project! But the less you donate, the longer time it'll take to establish the "Fera hammocks" project. Indeed we'd still like to give you something back whatever how much you donate! 

You can read more about this in all the perks! But yeah, the less you donate, the less can we give back, sorry! $1 donations are the smallest option, but still one of those perks we hope to have most people on, since we would like to credit so many people as possible! 

For everyone outside Denmark, do not get scared of donating to the project! We have you all in our head. If we get the project up this summer, then will "Fera Hammocks" be an option for many more people around more countries!    

With Help From Current distributors

Our distributors EdgeDomes, who help us distributing the geodesic domes and borrowable hammocks we need, we like to say such a big thank you to them with help from you! 
EdgeDomes got some really nice products for our project, so take a look at their website to see what products your money will be spend for! 


Risks & Challenges

We do have some risks & challenges tho. Because we cannot decide how weather will be all day, therefor you can risks that you get a rainy night in or a filled dome the day you come! 

Of course we only want the best night for everyone, so if you have booked at least 3 days in row, and it turn out  80% of the time is rain we'll give you back 50% of the money! 

We look forward to see as many people as possible, our calculations says we would be able to have 1400 visitors in just 35 days! Everyone should have the best time with "Fera Hammocks" only, so we will be there 100% for every visitor!


Other Ways You Can Help "Fera Hammocks"

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Don't you feel that you are likely to make a donation, can you still do us a very big help!

We're also on some social medias! We'd like you to tell folks around you about us, and our project. Share us with the people you think could be interested in a night with other fresh people in hammocks! 


Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools folks! :D
story_txt:
Who are we?
We are Max and Philip, we're both 16 years old. Both we have the same goal in our life, and that is to be free!
At this moment we are hobby photographers/filmmakers, and travellers. Max have been taking photos and making movies for about a year and a half now, but for Philip it is about 2 years. We can't explain in words how much it means to us, and how much it already has given us of life experience and joy!
Then we also have Mette on our team, she's the girl who keep an eye on the finalcials for the project. If something goes bad in the budget she'll take care of all that stuff and make sure everything is good!

As described in the top, freedom in life means a lot to us! The idea of that anyone would like to sit in a office, working with something that they really doesn't want to, make us sick! Everyone should be in freedom of doing what they love!

story:
Short Summary

We Shop, We Vote! We make it easy to vote every time you shop. 

Businesses, through campaign contributions, wield significant influence in our government and it's not always clear which of our favorite brands support the values and politicians that we believe in. 

We believe it should be easy for you to support the brands and businesses who support the values, politicians, and political party that you believe in. 

We shop, we vote is developing a shopping companion app to help all people influence the political process through everyday shopping experiences. 

Imagine contributing to the presidential campaign of your choice every time you go to the grocery store. 

Your contribution to our crowdfunding campaign today will give us the funds we need to develop this app and put it on your smartphone within the next few months. Together, we shop, we vote. 


What We Need & What You Get

In exchange for your contribution, you will get our shopping companion app as soon as it is ready. The funds we raise will be used to pay for development and design of our app. We want to get the app to you as soon as possible so you can get the insights you need to start influencing the political process every time you shop. 


The Impact

Businesses wield a lot of power with the politicians we elect. Every time we shop we contribute to companies who contribute to politicians, but it's not always clear which brands and businesses are contributing to which politicians and political parties. 
We take away that pain and make it easy for you to buy from the brands and companies that support your values. 
  • Shop
  • Scan
  • Get political insights - we analyze campaign contribution data and make it easy for you to see if the item you want will help support Democrats or Republicans
  • Buy the brands who believe what you believe - buy from the brands who financially support the presidential candidates that you believe in! Maybe you're feeling the Bern? Are you with her? Do you want to make America great again? Do you just want to make sure you aren't financially supporting a candidate or party that you want to loose. 
Your everyday shopping decisions can have a huge impact on the presidential campaign, our politicians, and the political process in our country. With our help you can vote every time you shop. 

Risks & Challenges

Our key challenge is getting enough support to hire the development team and get our app on your phone. Other risks and challenges that could delay our project include extra time needed for development &  design. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no problem! We could sure use some help in spreading the word :)

story:
Hello and thank you for taking the time to read about my crowdfunder. My name is Esmeralda Camara and my business' name is La Jarana (ha-ra-na) Clothing and Merchandise. We are a company based in Pasadena, CA, USA that works with artisans in Yucatan, Mexico to create a clothing line for guayaberas (wye-a-berra).

 

Guayaberas are traditional shirts from Latin America, often worn formally. They can also be casual attire. Yucatan is a very hot and tropical place, therefore the clothes are designed to keep you cool and dry, which is also perfect for California weather; they are great to wear year-round for these regions!

 

I want you to know where your money is going and how you will be helping turn this vision into reality! Your money will be going into paying for the first shipment of clothing for the La Jarana brand clothing, the making of contracts for the artisans and representatives/recruiters and finishing the La Jarana website where you can order online.

 

Any donation would help. My goal is to sell in boutiques and stores and one day open my own shop and I will also have an online store. Please help this dream come true, thank you for taking the time to read about La Jarana Clothing and Merchandise.

 

UPDATE: Because There has been a perk added, in order to break even, the donation goal is now $3,000, but we cannot make any changes to the donation goal on this campaign because there have been donations made and Indiegogo won't allow any changes once there has been a donation.  

IF YOU GET A PERK EXPECT AN AN ORDER FORM SENT TO YOUR E-MAIL BY LAJARANA.CO@GMAIL.COM SO YOU CAN CUSTOM MAKE YOUR GUAYABERA.

story:
"Camp Nostalgia is exactly the experience you need, at precisely the moment when you need it." 

Why? Because adulting is hard...

We channeled everything awesome about summer camps of our youth, and recreated it for you. We added a bit of Pacific NW flair to create the coolest camp ever! 

Camp includes gourmet camp food (seriously, we are hiring private chefs), an epic dance party, arts & crafts, nature walks featuring river views and waterfalls, hangover yoga, the pool, campfires, s’mores and field day, ropes courses and archery all these things are happening. Oh, did we forget to mention the booze? 

The Details: 

Where is Camp, is this taking place at an actual summer camp? Yes, it's a real camp. We plan to use the amazing facilities of Camp Namanu in Sandy, Oregon which is an easy scenic 45 minute drive away from Portland, OR.

When is Camp Nostalgia? We are targeted to host Camp Nostalgia on June 3-5, 2016. The camp has limited space so if we get enough funding to sell out the first date we will offer a second date! The coolest part of this if you can't join us in June but love the idea you will have the ability to join us for the  second date. Either way you get to experience camp!!!

What can I expect to get from Camp Nostalgia? You can expect to sleep in a bunk, make some amazing new friends, play all day, eat, drink, and party it up at night at our dance party or around the campfire. No responsibilities just a fun camp with friends. 

Who can attend Camp Nostalgia? Any adult age 21 and over. One and all welcome. 

Is camp coed? 

Sure is! Camp Nostalgia is coed, however our standard cabins are not. So, in keeping with the summer camp spirit, boys and girls are in separate bunks, but feel free to make out in the woods. 

Still not convinced? Reserve a whole cabin for your group and we will allow co-habitation. 

What if someone is coming alone and is nervous about not knowing anyone?

Please don't be! We are huge on creating a fun inclusive environment. You’ll have tons of time to meet new people and hangout with your bunk mates. You can also get some pre-camp introductions out of the way on the Camp Nostalgia Camper Facebook Group. Still not sold, you can always hang out at Blue Wing lodge and watch all the activity unfold while you read and play board games with the camp staff...they have a really hard life;)

Who We Are:

Erin W. leader, owner and planner extraordinaire of this epic shindig. She has 10 years of experience in event planning and runs her own company. She is obsessed with the color orange, brunch, and all things subscription box. She also loves any excuse to throw a great party...hence camp! 

Michael W. is the husband and self named CFO. He's great at crunching the numbers and doing all the heavy lifting. He also throws a mean Frisbee.

The amazing Liz Q. who pulls all the little pieces together and serves as an extra set of hands when Erin's two just aren't enough. Her skills include volunteer wrangling and the ability to use a walkie talkie while driving a golf cart and drinking coffee.

The fashionable & stylish Hannah J. is fueled by her great smile and the ability to put our marketing plans into action. If you are reading this she's responsible. We also love that she moonlights as hair stylist and keeps us all looking fab!

The design guru Alicia H. who handles all our branding needs. Her skills include being a creative genius and unlimited patience with our planner extraordinaire's perfectionist tendencies, tight timelines, and no less than 5 rounds of edits for all materials. 

After a few years of working out logistics for Camp Nostalgia we all agree the pieces are in place to make the dream a reality.

Why We Need You:

We truly believe in this camp and have invested heavily in it, the research is done, the foundation is laid, the venue has been found, activities have been tested but we need the capital to bring all the awesomeness of event weekend into reality and reserve exclusive use of the camp.

If we exceed our goal, you will enabling us to increase the number of dates we can offer the camp. In fact, if we get enough support, we want to expand the camp to include more dates and locations in both Oregon and Washington.

Risks & Challenges:

We aren't going to claim that everything will be perfect but we can tell you that this event has been our brainchild for the last few years and we feel that 75% of the possible challenges have already been overcome. The last 25% is two part: raising the capital to reserve exclusive us of the camp and proving that we aren't the only ones who feel the need to go back to camp. A fully funded project means we are 98% over our obstacles to make camp happen!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word! Share our campaign on social media, talk it up to your friends, yell it from the roof tops. CAMP IS COMING!!!

And that's all there is to it.

A fully funded project means we are 98% over our obstacles to make camp happen!   
Other Ways You Can Help: Spread the word! Share our campaign on social media, talk it up to your friends, yell it from the roof tops. CAMP IS COMING!!!
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Follow us on...

 twitter,com/TheLivingRoomBN    facebook.com/TheLivingRoomBrighton


Hi. I'm Sam. My team and I are seeking funding for a community-led Tea & Juice Bar and called The Living Room, which will launch in Brighton, England, in early 2016.

The Living Room will provide a little bit of everything; as well as being a cosy place where you can pop in any time for a cup of delicious tea, a freshly-pressed juice or a nice hot bowl of soup, we'll be hosting a bunch of events right from yoga and meditation to artistic performances and exhibitions, as well as youth clubs, book clubs, board game evenings and presentations on all kinds of interesting topics – patrons will be encouraged to put their own events on too. The focus will always be on coming together to promote wellbeing and good times.

This is your chance to make The Living Room a reality.

You can help by investing any amount of money to make The Living Room happen, or by sharing this campaign using the hashtag #makeTLRhappen or following us at www.facebook.com/TheLivingRoomBrighton.

This is a fixed funding project, so you'll get your contribution back if we don't reach our target. If you have any questions, please get in touch here.


The Living Room is all about community – our aim is to create our own community of like-minded people, while serving our own local community in any way we can.

Other words that are important for us are care, kindness, friendship and fun; The Living Room will be a supportive environment where anyone can come to find themselves, get support and have a good time.

We'll also be working alongside local charities and organisations to help them in their daily work of tackling homelessness head on.

If this sounds like the kind of place you'd like to spend your time, please contribute to this campaign and make it happen!


Just about everything's in place - the business plan is ready to put into action and the financial calculations are done to the penny - but getting a business like this up and running doesn't come for free, with rent, wages, furniture, and loads of other little things to pay for.

We'll be extremely grateful for any amount you can invest - big or small, it'll help bring this concept to the world and make a lasting positive impact on our community.

For example, everyone who invests just £2 will be giving an organic cup of tea to a homeless person, as well as getting their name on a "thank you" poster that will be framed at The Living Room when we open. And it doesn't stop there - once we reach our target and get up and running, we'll give a cup of tea a home for every one we sell.

You can find out more about this in our video interview with Sara Emerson from Project Antifreeze (http://www.offthefence.org.uk/antifreeze/)



Since coming to live in Brighton after nine years living abroad, I've been touched by the situation of numerous people I've seen and spoken to living rough on the streets.

I decided to offer my help through The Living Room, a business I've been working on and planning for some time – and now I'm assembling a team of superheroes to finally make it happen.

We know we can't solve the homelessness problem alone, but we believe that by cooperating with local organisations who are already doing great work, The Living Room can make a significant difference. We have a number of arrangements already in place with such organisations – some of these include:

  • working with Business Action On Homelessness to offer training and employment opportunities to homeless people

  • buying our soups from Dine, a kitchen service that provides homeless people with training for catering careers and feeds its profits into the First Base Day Centre

  • working with various organisations to distribute any unsold food to people who need it

  • working with Project Antifreeze to regularly provide tea to Brighton's homeless people – the same delicious organic tea that we serve our customers

  • collecting and donating to local organisations so they can keep doing their fantastic work – providing things like food, accommodation, clothing and various support services for homeless people in Brighton

To make any of this happen though, we'll need a viable business model. The first step for that is funding – and that's where you come in...


The Living Room will need funding of at least £55,000 to:

  • Pay for the business start-up costs: this includes equipment, furniture, refurbishment and legal fees among others. This is expected to be £25,000

  • Pay the wages for at least two part-time employees through the first year of trading: We expect sales to grow during the first year so we can afford to pay employees from the second year onwards, but until then we'll need some help. This is expected to cost around £19,000

  • Cover Indiegogo's fee of 5% (£2,500) and transaction fees of 3% or more (£1,500+)

  • Pay for perks, including our employees' time required to provide them (£7,000). All perks include giving homeless people in Brighton tea through Project Antifreeze (at least one cup will be given out for every £2 raised - that's a minimum of 27,500 cups of tea if we reach  our funding goal!)


Below is a summary of some of the things we're offering to our investors. To find out exactly what you can get and how much to invest to get it, see our perks on the right hand side of this page. Note that the pictures below are just for illustration, and the actual designs may vary from these.

We can also offer a range of corporate packages for larger investments, so please get in touch to discuss this option further.


Simply put, exceeding our goal means we can do more. For example:

  • The more capital we raise, the more chance The Living Room has of survival, and the more good we can do in the local community as time goes by – for example, each £10,000 of additional capital we raise will keep The Living Room running for another month, giving us more time to reach our sales targets with less pressure

  • It will also mean that we'll be covered if we need to pay a higher rent than expected for our premises, or if we end up needing more staff than anticipated - in turn, this will create more jobs in the local area

  • Each £2 raised equals a cup of delicious organic tea for a homeless person, no matter how much we raise - so for example, if we reach double our goal then at least 55,000 cuppas will be given out


Through The Living Room and the fantastic organisations we're partnering with, your contribution will help numerous people in Brighton who are struggling to get their lives back on track. Thanks to you, they'll get more to eat and drink, receive more support for their various difficulties, find accommodation and get back into the workforce. In short, you'll be helping them take the first important steps in regaining control of their lives.

By funding this campaign and helping The Living Room launch, you'll be making a telling difference to the lives of these individuals - not just during this Indiegogo campaign, but long into the future as The Living Room continues doing the work described above - your contribution is the gift that keeps on giving. Without it though, The Living Room won't exist and none of this will happen.

If you live in Brighton or you intend to visit at some point, you'll also have the opportunity to see a business you've funded take shape and grow, and if you've contributed enough to earn one of the relevant perks, you'll also receive a free cup of tea (or more) when you come to visit.


If you're unable to invest yourself, or you're not yet sure if you want to but you believe in this campaign and you'd like to help out, there are a number of things you can do that would be really appreciated:

  • Promote the campaign by sharing the link on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media channels (once is enough, but the more frequently you can do it, the better) using the hashtag #makeTLRhappen

  • Talk to your friends (and strangers too!) about the project: just remember the name - The Living Room - and tell them to check it out here on Indiegogo

  • Indiegogo provides some great sharing tools to help you spread the news - just look in the top left of this page

  • Finally, if you own or work for a blog, magazine, paper, radio or TV show or station or some other publication, please do whatever you can to give some airtime to The Living Room's Indiegogo campaign and encourage others to come and take a look - the more exposure it gets, the more chances we'll have of succeeding! Remember to use the campaign hashtag where possible - #makeTLRhappen


The city of Brighton & Hove has the highest proportional population of homeless people across the whole south coast of England and it's only growing – the number has doubled in the last five years alone. Furthermore, Brighton and Hove Independent recently reported that long-term rough sleepers are 35 times more likely to commit suicide than the general population.

When I moved to Brighton in August 2015, I was shocked by the number of people I saw living on the streets - I'd been planning to start up my own business in any case, and after these people told me the stories of how they'd ended up homeless and the lack of support many of them were receiving in one of the wealthiest cities and countries in the world, I felt like I had to do something to help them.

I spent a lot of time speaking to relevant people including rough sleepers themselves and the charities and organisations that work day in, day out to help them, discussing my ideas with friends and considering how I could either support the great work already being done or make a contribution of my own.

I found that the homelessness problem is a complex one. It involves many factors, including social and mental health issues, depression, drug and alcohol abuse and negative perceptions and assumptions from the public.

Many of the people I spoke to had become homeless because of a relationship breakdown or a job loss - it hit me that this kind of thing could happen to any of us, at any time. Not only that, but once homeless, it's extremely hard to find the motivation and support to get back out of the situation, and applying for a job is hard without a home address and a place to maintain personal hygiene.

Add in the depression and illness that arises from spending so much time out on the streets, and taunts of “get a job!” (or worse) from certain members of the public, and it truly is an unimaginable life.

It's a tough situation, and for many, like Jamie (pictured here with my dog Miguel) it's impossible to see a way out.

I realised that with all the problems associated with homelessness, I would be out of my depth trying to organise an initiative to house them, and even if I did, there are so many issues that have to be tackled simultaneously in order to ensure that such a project would remain a success beyond the simple provision of accommodation. So instead, I decided to look into how my original business idea, The Living Room, could offer some hope to people in this most desperate of situations.


I've never done anything like this before, so I'm breaking new ground by entering into this industry. What I do have however, is bags of passion, determination and a good business brain. In fact, I taught business and marketing for a total of 6 years and worked in marketing for another 5 after that.

We're not naive here in The Living Room team, and we know that it's not enough just to want to help. Having a viable business that's attractive to our target customers is our top priority - only then will we be able to realise our goal of supporting the people who need it in our local community.

We have a network of dedicated and well-informed friends and advisers, who are more than willing to invest their time and energy to help us and contribute their expertise in areas like business management, hospitality and catering, finance, commercial real estate, SEO, homelessness issues and more. We're open and willing to listen to, and act upon, what these people have to say, and we're not afraid to change course on some issues if we're convinced it's the right thing to do.

We're meeting new people every day who, because of the nature of this venture, want to lend their support in the form of time and effort, knowledgeable advice and other things of value that they or their organisations can contribute. The support and positivity for The Living Room has been overwhelming, and we're grateful to everyone who has given something of themselves so far.

As far as the project itself is concerned, the only risk is that we don't reach our goal – if we do, The Living Room will happen, and if we don't, it won't. It's as simple as that. So the only thing you'll be losing if we don't reach our goal is the opportunity to enjoy the incredible experience we're planning to create for you.

And that pretty much brings you up to speed on where we are right now - where we go from here is down to you.


All you need to do is go back to the top of this page - on the right hand side you can contribute to our campaign, or you can simply share it on the left.

Either way, any support you offer will be hugely appreciated!


Thanks a million,

Sam and the team


P.S. You can pay by card using the PayPal option without creating a PayPal account - just select "Go to PayPal" followed by "Pay with a debit or credit card" and then uncheck the box that prompts you to save your information with a PayPal account. Then select "review and continue", followed by "continue without logging in".

If you have any other questions, please get in touch here.

Follow us on... twitter,com/TheLivingRoomBN    facebook.com/TheLivingRoomBrighton
Hi.
I'm Sam. My team and I are seeking funding for a community-led Tea & Juice Bar and called The Living Room, which will launch in Brighton, England, in
early 2016.The
Living Room will provide a little bit of everything; as well as being
a cosy place where you can pop in any time for a cup of delicious
tea, a freshly-pressed juice or a nice hot bowl of soup, we'll be
hosting a bunch of events right from yoga and meditation to artistic
performances and exhibitions, as well as youth clubs, book clubs,
board game evenings and presentations on all kinds of interesting
topics – patrons will be encouraged to put their own events on too.
The focus will always be on coming together to promote wellbeing and
good times.

This

You
can help by investing any amount of money to make The Living Room
happen, or by sharing this campaign using the hashtag #makeTLRhappen or following us at www.facebook.com/TheLivingRoomBrighton.This is a fixed funding project, so you'll get your contribution back if we don't reach our target. If you have any questions, please get in touch here.

community of like-minded people, while serving our own local
community in any way we can.


Other

can come to find themselves, get support and have a good time.


We'll

You can find out more about this in our video interview with Sara Emerson from Project Antifreeze (http://www.offthefence.org.uk/antifreeze/)

	employment opportunities to homeless people



	buying

	the First Base Day Centre



	working

	who need it



	working

	customers

	clothing and various support services for homeless people in

in...

We can also offer a range of corporate packages for larger investments, so please get in touch to discuss this option further.



Simply put, exceeding our goal means we can do more. For example:

	more capital we raise, the more chance The Living Room has of
	survival, and the more good we can do in the local community as time
	goes by – for example, each £10,000
	of additional capital we raise will keep The Living Room running for
	another month, giving us more time to reach our sales targets with
	less pressure



	It
	will also mean that we'll be covered if we need to pay a higher rent
	than expected for our premises, or if we end up needing more staff
	than anticipated - in turn, this will create more jobs in the local
	area



	Each
	£2
	raised
	equals a cup of delicious organic tea for a homeless person, no
	matter how much we raise - so for example, if we reach double our
	goal then at least 55,000
	cuppas will be given out

By

contribution is the gift that keeps on giving. Without it though, The

you're unable to invest yourself, or you're not yet sure if you want

	Promote

	Talk

	remember the name - The Living Room - and tell them to check it out
	here on Indiegogo

	look in the top left of this page



	Finally,
	if you own or work for a blog, magazine, paper, radio or TV show or
	station or some other publication, please do whatever you can to
	give some airtime to The Living Room's Indiegogo campaign and
	encourage others to come and take a look - the more exposure it
	gets, the more chances we'll have of succeeding! Remember to use the
	campaign hashtag where possible - #makeTLRhappen

story:
Digital Money Should be Fun!

Currently, digital currencies are very functional and they can do many mind blowing things. Our aim is to make it more accessible. fun and interactive.


Made with love

We are a team of engineers from Toronto, Canada, dedicated to creating fun devices for digital money. We use revolutionary technologies to create beautiful products everyone can use and enjoy. Our first device is Tixie, a digital money clock.



A Quick Demonstration

Get an Exclusive T-Shirt or USB drive


CHOOSE A PERK




Why Bitcoin?

We believe e-currencies like Bitcoin will play a vital role in our futures. By placing people in full control of the first programmable money, great things happen. The technologies such as Cryptography and Blockchain makes it the most robust and valuable e-currency. Bitcoin is also the first true digital currency and without the invention of the Blockchain by its anonymous creator, none of this would be possible. Bitcoin's revolutionary Blockchain technology is more than just a currency, its also a trust-less and world wide ledger with many applications.

Frequently Asked Questions

Visit our website at realcointickers.com to view an updated list of the FAQs.

Share the campaign 

Copy the unique link at the top left of this campaign page and share it on social media. You will be rewarded when we have our referral contest.

HAPPY NEW YEARS!

story:
I have started this campaign hoping that big-hearted people will help me to achieve my dream.

I am the father of those two little kids and I do my best to give them everything they deserve, but I see that's not enough (trying all I can do!). The all four of us, we do live in a small 12 m2 room that we rent from my employer and you can easily imagine what it looks like when we are having dinner all together or sleeping - there is no space for even walking.

Why I am doing that, is because I am sure Idiegogo is the right tool to help me raising the amount I need in order to achieve my personal and family goal, which lasted for many years.

At the moment, I need those $5k in order to get the needed amount for a common apartment.

Why should you contribute? Because is my last hundred meters in a personal 1 km marathon and it's really achievable with your help. This will make me happy and pleased as a father, this will satisfy my wife, this will allow more time to be spent with my kids, not two work in several places, finally, this will give us more space for living in adequate standards!!!

story:
Support meaningful projects by watching a commercial with Plenty!

There are many great projects going on in the world in which people help each other out or help to protect nature and wildlife. Traditionally you can support them by memberships, with monthly payments. With Plenty however you can support charity projects for free! How? With Plenty you can discover and support charities from all over the world, just by watching a commercial. Do you also feel it is time to use commercials for the good? Help us to make the non-profit and social app Plenty a reality by making a contribution on Indiegogo!



It’s an opportunity we can grasp together

We watch commercials every day, everywhere. Online advertisements, social media, commercials on television or YouTube, posters, shirts and guess what, they are even on your pen! Businesses from all over the world are incredibly eager to have you get to know their company and message. Research points out that within the first six months of 2014, internet advertisement revenues hit the 23 billion dollar mark, and this is just online, only measured in the USA. That’s more than some countries make in a year! That means that huge amounts of money are spent just on product promotions. So we asked ourselves a question: what can we do to employ such revenues for a better cause?


Charities, foundation, NGO’s and NPO’s

Lots of people want to make the world a better place. And businesses wish to contribute to the community. Foundations are being set up to serve good causes. We have spoken with NGO’s (non-governmental environmental organisations), but also with smaller foundations. They all work committedly on projects that contribute to the well being of our planet. We want to contribute to our planet as well by supporting meaningful projects.


Plenty brings fun into watching commercials.

This is where the idea of Plenty kicked in. Plenty is going to be an app for iOS and Android platforms, enabling you to support a charity for free; simply by watching commercials. To make it even more interesting, we also thought of ways to make commercials fun, by adding a gaming element. 

By transforming a commercial into a fun micro-game we allow users to enjoy themselves and keep a commercial interesting. Even better, with this gaming element, Plenty is the first advertising platform that can guarantee its advertisers that viewers immerse themselves within their brand experience. Plenty wants to connect conscious brands with conscious people and support the good cause, that’s a triple win!


We truly believe that we can use commercials for the good, as long as we all do it together. And for us to make this happen, we need your help!


How it works



The idea of Plenty is simple: by watching commercials together, and having more fun while watching them, we can raise money and use it for charities. You can use Plenty when you are in the bus to school, in the train to work, while relaxing in bed or in any other situation you feel comfortable with (that includes your restroom). So with very little effort and no money involved you can support a charity every moment of the day, as many times you’d like!


Main screen

Once you open Plenty you get to see the main screen from where you can either watch a commercial, choose another project, or check your stats and read more about the charity you want to support.


Commercial with game layer



When you watch a commercial you will also get to play a minigame. Except that this makes the activity more fun, it also helps us to make sure that commercials are being watched until the end. Sounds interesting for businesses who want you to see their commercials right? These organisations are going to pay money to the charity of your choice, for every commercial watched!

We believe that gamified commercials can be enjoyable for app users, and at the same time interesting for those businesses which are trying to reach people with their hearts in the right place. We think that this hand in hand approach is essential to make a good sustainable application and a good way to really make a change.

The team

The team consists of three enthusiastic guys graduated from the Industrial Design department at the Eindhoven University of Technology, with a Master of Science degree, each one specialised in a different direction. Different interests but similar backgrounds makes our team strong and dynamic. All of us are multi-disciplinary trained and therefore we are comfortable working on different stages within the design process. From the design and prototype of the app, our website, the explanatory movie and even the soundtrack to our teaser: It is all made by us, for you. We hope that this shows our commitment and expertise on this project!



A Foundation

Our vision is to start a foundation as a legal non-profit organisation. This foundation will function as the organizational backbone of the app Plenty from which we can get in contact with businesses to arrange contracts for commercials.  

We will work on a transparent foundation: information regarding revenues, costs and cash flows will all be visible on our website. We believe in valuable relationships with all of our partners: the users of Plenty, the charities and the businesses (Fair Trade & Green). That is why we think a foundation with full transparency behind the app Plenty is the way to go.

Our goal

The Plenty Foundation is non-profit. But to bring this app into reality, we do need sponsors. Here is an overview of what we would do with your contributions:

€ 25.000: With 25.000 we can make a simple version of Plenty. App users are not able to select other projects. Instead we choose the projects that will be supported. There won't be personal and global stats available. Of course you can still expect fun little games while watching a commercial. With the 25.000 we can hire programmers to make the app, built a database, rent servers, streaming video's, link data of user's to projects and so on.
€ 50.000: With 50.000 we can include the option for you to choose the projects you want to support. On top of that we will add more games and more commercials.
€ 100.000: With 100.000 we can make the application as we’ve envisioned. This includes more projects, commercials, games and personal and global stats, so you can really see your impact.

You can help us!

Donate money. With the money from the donations we can start a foundation and make the Plenty application.
Commercials. Do you own a business and do you wish to show your commercial at the launch of the app? Send us a message!
Programmers. Are you a talented programmer living in the Netherlands who wants to help us building the application? Let us know!
Spread the word! Share the link to this page to your friends and family, via social media like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.


Benefits

What is in it for our sponsors? By donating money for Plenty you indirectly donate to future charity projects and help to create a radical new approach to targeted advertisements. So together we can make the world a better place. What greater motivation would you need to help us make Plenty a reality?

In addition, we have the following rewards waiting for you:

€ 0 - 25: A digital copy of the soundtrack from our video: Happy Peppy!
€ 25 - 75: A handmade knitted bag with tea from Nepal distributed by World Tea (Dutch: Wereldse Thee). World Tea supports vulnerable target groups in order to reduce poverty in the poorest parts of Nepal. For our campaign 100% of the tea bag’s value will go to the farmers in Nepal!
€ 75 – 250: Two bags of tea from Nepal. Including two different tastes of course. 
€ 250 and above: Do you want to associate your business with our initiative? Do you believe in the potential of Plenty and want to become a star sponsor? For donations of €250 and above your business will be named on the “Star Sponsors” page within the app itself. So in the near future millions of users can see your business as a social responsible supporter of Plenty in it's development phase.



For € 250 you get a bronze star, for €500 a silver star and for € 1000 you get golden star with a maximum of five golden stars! See the left photo above to get an idea of the Star Sponsor page.


Additional notes:
- Please note that this campaign is fixed. This means that if we do not reach our goal of 25.000 you will get your money back. Rewards are distrubuted once the campaign is succesfully finished.


- The idea of Plenty and its designs are registered at the Office of Intellectual Property of the Benelux. 

- Visit our website: www.gogoplenty.com for our Blog!

- Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/plentyapp
story_txt:
Support meaningful projects by watching a commercial with Plenty!There are many great projects going on in the world in which people help each other out or help to protect nature and wildlife. Traditionally you can support them by memberships, with monthly payments. With Plenty however you can support charity projects for free! How? With Plenty you can discover and support charities from all over the world, just by watching a commercial. Do you also feel it is time to use commercials for the good? Help us to make the non-profit and social app Plenty a reality by making a contribution on Indiegogo!
It’s an opportunity we can grasp togetherWe watch commercials every day, everywhere. Online advertisements, social media, commercials on television or YouTube, posters, shirts and guess what, they are even on your pen! Businesses from all over the world are incredibly eager to have you get to know their company and message. Research points out that within the first six months of 2014, internet advertisement revenues hit the 23 billion dollar mark, and this is just online, only measured in the USA. That’s more than some countries make in a year! That means that huge amounts of money are spent just on product promotions. So we asked ourselves a question: what can we do to employ such revenues for a better cause?Charities, foundation, NGO’s and NPO’sLots of people want to make the world a better place. And businesses wish to contribute to the community. Foundations are being set up to serve good causes. We have spoken with NGO’s (non-governmental environmental organisations), but also with smaller foundations. They all work committedly on projects that contribute to the well being of our planet. We want to contribute to our planet as well by supporting meaningful projects.
Plenty brings fun into watching commercials.
This is where the idea of Plenty kicked in. Plenty is going to be an app for iOS and Android platforms, enabling you to support a charity for free; simply by watching commercials. To make it even more interesting, we also thought of ways to make commercials fun, by adding a gaming element. 
By transforming a commercial into a fun micro-game we allow users to enjoy themselves and keep a commercial interesting. Even better, with this gaming element, Plenty is the first advertising platform that can guarantee its advertisers that viewers immerse themselves within their brand experience. Plenty wants to connect conscious brands with conscious people and support the good cause, that’s a triple win!
We truly believe that we can use commercials for the good, as long as we all do it together. And for us to make this happen, we need your help!
How it works
The idea of Plenty is simple: by watching commercials together, and having more fun while watching them, we can raise money and use it for charities. You can use Plenty when you are in the bus to school, in the train to work, while relaxing in bed or in any other situation you feel comfortable with (that includes your restroom). So with very little effort and no money involved you can support a charity every moment of the day, as many times you’d like!
Main screenOnce you open Plenty you get to see the main screen from where you can either watch a commercial, choose another project, or check your stats and read more about the charity you want to support.


Commercial with game layer
When you watch a commercial you will also get to play a minigame. Except that this makes the activity more fun, it also helps us to make sure that commercials are being watched until the end. Sounds interesting for businesses who want you to see their commercials right? These organisations are going to pay money to the charity of your choice, for every commercial watched!We believe that gamified commercials can be enjoyable for app users, and at the same time interesting for those businesses which are trying to reach people with their hearts in the right place. We think that this hand in hand approach is essential to make a good sustainable application and a good way to really make a change.The teamThe team consists of three enthusiastic guys graduated from the Industrial Design department at the Eindhoven University of Technology, with a Master of Science degree, each one specialised in a different direction. Different interests but similar backgrounds makes our team strong and dynamic. All of us are multi-disciplinary trained and therefore we are comfortable working on different stages within the design process. From the design and prototype of the app, our website, the explanatory movie and even the soundtrack to our teaser: It is all made by us, for you. We hope that this shows our commitment and expertise on this project!
A FoundationOur vision is to start a foundation as a legal non-profit organisation. This foundation will function as the organizational backbone of the app Plenty from which we can get in contact with businesses to arrange contracts for commercials.  We will work on a transparent foundation: information regarding revenues, costs and cash flows will all be visible on our website. We believe in valuable relationships with all of our partners: the users of Plenty, the charities and the businesses (Fair Trade & Green). That is why we think a foundation with full transparency behind the app Plenty is the way to go.Our goalThe Plenty Foundation is non-profit. But to bring this app into reality, we do need sponsors. Here is an overview of what we would do with your contributions:€ 25.000: With 25.000 we can make a simple version of Plenty. App users are not able to select other projects. Instead we choose the projects that will be supported. There won't be personal and global stats available. Of course you can still expect fun little games while watching a commercial. With the 25.000 we can hire programmers to make the app, built a database, rent servers, streaming video's, link data of user's to projects and so on.€ 50.000: With 50.000 we can include the option for you to choose the projects you want to support. On top of that we will add more games and more commercials.€ 100.000: With 100.000 we can make the application as we’ve envisioned. This includes more projects, commercials, games and personal and global stats, so you can really see your impact.You can help us!
Donate money. With the money from the donations we can start a foundation and make the Plenty application.Commercials. Do you own a business and do you wish to show your commercial at the launch of the app? Send us a message!Programmers. Are you a talented programmer living in the Netherlands who wants to help us building the application? Let us know!Spread the word! Share the link to this page to your friends and family, via social media like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

So together we can make the world a better place. What greater motivation would you need to help us make Plenty a reality?
In addition, we have the following rewards waiting for you:

World Tea supports vulnerable target groups in order to reduce poverty in the poorest parts of Nepal. For our campaign 100% of the tea bag’s value will go to the farmers in Nepal!€ 75 – 250: Two bags of tea from Nepal.
