story:
Smart things inspire!

Decto is an early stage manufacturing company, that produces personal smart sensors and detectors. We are passionate about smart things that make our everyday-life smarter, easier and healthier. Therefore, together with the powerful and educating Decto software our products give you the tools and the knowledge to improve the quality of your life.

The Decto team is developing and producing products for everyone at an affordable price. Using components from EU and producing the products in EU we can guarantee the best quality. Our module concept is driven by the concern about the environment. Decto smart sensors are equipped with microprocessor and are more environmentally friendly as they have no batteries, displays, speakers, cables and extra buttons. Those things are already in your smartphone. Use them!

Products:

  1. AIR - measures air temperature, humidity, and pressure;
  2. LUMEN - measures the intensity of light and luminance;
  3. ALCO - measures ethanol level in breath;
  4. BT MATE - a portable device, which makes it possible to leave the sensor to a desired location to take measurements. The device comes in handy when you want to keep your smart phone with you, rather than leave it to a certain location for measuring, or you would like to use different sensors simultaneously. BT MATE connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth. BT MATE is essential for Apple users.

The next product in the Decto series is called NUC, which is a personal radioactive wave detector to protect you and the people around you from the danger that cannot be seen with a bare eye. It helps to discover beta and gamma waves, sum up exposure dosage, pin the radioactive places on the map, warn others about the danger and report the authorities to clean up the waste.

Decto needs your support to bring this valuable product to the global market. There is a lot of radioactive waste around us and it poses a threat to everyone! Show your support and get your own personal Decto NUC with a pre-sell price!

First 100 pcs - $69 and gift BT MATE + delivery

101- 500 pcs - $69 + delivery

501- ... pcs - $79 + delivery

Friends Pack: 3 NUC's and 3 BT MATE's - $290

Re-seller Pack 20 pcs : $1290 + delivery

Be part of the personal detector story!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Where did you get the idea to create Decto NUC?

The Internal Security Services (ISS) found an 85-kilo container in Estonia, designed to hold radioactive material! Decto NUC was created to locate such dangerous materials. It is important to prevent the exposure of dangerous radioactive materials and to protect us from radioactive sickness! 

Article about the findings: http://news.err.ee/v/politics/environment/4a1b5112-b31d-48e2-94ca-07b5fd4d2764/iss-finds-radioactive-substance-container-near-tallinn

PRODUCT FEATURES

How do Decto products work?

1.  Firstly, download the Decto Free or Decto Premium software to your smart device.

2.  Open the app.

3.  Connect your personal DECTO device directly, using a micro USB (OTG supported), or via Bluetooth with Decto BT MATE.

4.  The product is ready to take measurements. If necessary, please, read the manual, which is under the sign “?”.

Why should I use Decto products?

Decto products are designed to help to improve the quality of your life. The products are your personal smart detectors and sensors.

There are sensors and detectors already available. Why should I use yours?

Decto sensors and detectors are smart and small, light weighted, environmentally friendly, available at an affordable price and supported with an educating software.

Do you like to travel around? Getting a new home in another area? Decto products are for you then! Measure the air temperature, air pressure, humidity, the intensity of light/luminance and radiation with the Decto devices wherever you go.

How portable are the sensors? How much do they weigh?

Decto sensors weigh about 0.5-1.4 ounces (10-15 grams), you can easily keep it in your pocket or handbag.

Do I need to download the app to use a Decto sensor/detector?

Yes, hardware needs software in order to work, even a printer. You can download a Free or Premium Decto app from Google Play or App Store. Drivers for Windows, Mac and Linux will soon be available.

Will Decto sensors work with any smart device?

Sensors/detectors are compatible with iOS 9.0+ devices and Android 4.3+ devices with Bluetooth and OTG (on-the-go) support. 

Is the Decto mobile app available free of charge?

There is a Decto Free and Decto Premium version. Decto Free version provides you with the measurement results, time and date, easy sharing and location (coordinates), notification function, the usage of one sensor at a time. Decto Premium provides you some handy extras: map view, usage of multiple sensors simultaneously and camera function. If there is a necessity for those features, then consider downloading a Premium version (one-time fee) and use it in all account linked smart devices.

Will I receive any alerts?

Yes, you can set minimum and maximum values in your app and get immediate notification, when the measured results are out of the previously defined level. All the notifications can be customized in the settings section.

There’s a blue LED light in all Decto products. Why?

Blue LED light is an indicator, which shows that the sensor/detector is connected to your smart device and that your smart device supports OTG (on-to-go). If the LED does not light up (or if you are using an iPhone, a tablet or a PC), then we recommend to use Decto BT MATE to connect via bluetooth.  

TECHNICAL QUESTIONS

How trustworthy are the measured values?

All sensors/detectors are pre-calibrated by the sensor/detector manufacturer and go through calibration procedure on our production line to increase its accuracy. Our partner in the field of calibration is Metrosert Ltd. They perform the calibration and verification of measuring instruments, certification of products and management systems in Estonia.

How long will the battery last?

Smart sensors and detectors do not have a battery. They work while being attached to you smart phone and use its battery. BT MATE has a 380mhA Li-ion battery and it lasts differently for each sensor. For example, Decto NUC consumes a lot of energy, so it takes 36 hours from being fully charged to empty.  

Are the sensors/detectors waterproof?

No, they are not. 

What is the operating temperature?

Recommended operating temperature for Decto sensors/detectors is from -40°C to +85°C. There is a limitation due to the processor recommended conditions.

Can the measured sensor/detector data be saved and shared?

Yes, your data, as well as location via GPS, can be saved to our secure cloud and/or shared publicly. Decto application also works as a "big data" map and everyone can make a contribution by sharing air pollution, radiation, temperature etc related measurements on a map. Sharing, of course, is not compulsory and can be edited from the settings.

DISTRIBUTION

What happens to the money you raise?

Your money will be used to invest in mass-production: tooling, manufacturing setup and component parts.

When will the NUC and mates ship?

According to the plan, in May 2016.

Where will you ship?

We ship worldwide!

Do they come with a warranty?

Yes! We offer a 12 month manufacturers’ warranty with all our products.

I am a distributor. How do I contact you?

Please contact info@decto.eu.  

CUSTOMER SUPPORT

Do you have customer service and technical support?

We sure do! You can contact us via email - info@decto.eu. We would be glad to give an answer to all your questions. For extra information, please visit our website – decto.eu.

Can I change or cancel my perk?

Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk

To get a refund on your perk contribution, while the campaign is active, please email support@indiegogo.com. After the campaign, we will evaluate refunds on a case-by-case basis but are not obligated to do so.

I have a problem backing you up?

Please contact support@indiegogo.com.

Will there be continued support/updates for the app?

Sure! We already have a roadmap for new features. If you have any suggestions please contact us - info@decto.eu.

My name is MICHAEL BARBOSA work for more than 21 years in intelligence in Colombia, to participate in the military and most important country's intelligence on the location of terrorists, perpetrators of violence, rescuing missing and kidnapped persons, operations my specialty was finding people in these years of experience, I realized a problem, that there was no communication between victims society and state and to analyze more deeply observe that the problem is global, for that reason create a company SOUGHT specializing specifically in finding people.
My campaign in the first stage is to create a channel of communication between victims, society and states or governments through a mobile app and a website that handle a single database of missing people to create a community where people can report the disappearance, record them and thus make it public this will quickly facilitate the tracing and expediting the process as well as receive anonymous information on the location of the missing to help you find them.

                                                                                                    SCREEN 15.6 "DVD RW VIDEO

TOTAL                                   20.000 

It is an innovative initiative, we can benefit everyone at some point in our lives, most of us know someone who has been a victim of violence, terrorism or disappearances and why not create a tool that somehow reduce the risk, it is a legally set up company in Colombia chamber of commerce under registration 9009885551-1 NIT.
 If we do not reach the goal invest your donation in the initiation of the App which is the heart of the company.
Mobile App and web adding my experience in the location of people the experience of many years of work with excellent results, which got many awards, medals and an economic board as an incentive to hard work, plus the help you can provide aremos this new initiative a reality.
Nothing is easy and this will be a challenge, open obstacles like everything in life but the truth always have circumvented with wisdom and intelligence.
You can contribute in many ways apart from the donation, sending us ideas that can strengthen App, tell his brother, neighbor friend of this new tool due out later this year, posting our video on their social networks, when the App's a actually download that would be very important because with a message of strength that you send to families will be a great contribution, you can support us with great serious technology, I appreciate all your support simply having reached the end of this reading is important to us thanks.

story:
Join Fagri Enterprise take our next step. Assist us to expand to empower.

In the midst of all the challenges, Fagri Enterprise has managed to take off. This campaign is to enable us raise funds to inject into our business.  Contributors would be helping us a great deal.

Primarily, the funds will go into the acquisition of agricultural inputs from farmers for onward supply to other farmers in the Agriculture supply chain. Funds will also be used to purchase tricycles to support our delivery service and also employ more hands to help us market and sell these inputs. 

Achieving this funding goal will not only help the enterprise expand but most importantly, contributors will help us support farmers in our target market and also empower us to create jobs for a number of unemployed youth in our community. So indirectly, contributors will be creating jobs for the youth right here in Ghana even though they are miles away. Helping us reduce unemployment means, contributors will help the youth stay away from social vices that occur as a result of the absence of jobs. The  impact of contributors would be far reaching. 

A lot of challenges exist for us as a startup business which includes access to capital. We may not be able to raise the funds we require but we are not giving up. We are going to use what we have to reach our goal as a business enterprise.

Please if you cannot contribute, kindly tell others about us and our cause.

Thank you!
story_txt:
Join Fagri Enterprise take our next step. Assist us to expand to empower.In the midst of all the challenges, Fagri Enterprise has managed to take off. This campaign is to enable us raise funds to inject into our business.  Contributors would be helping us a great deal.Primarily, the funds will go into the acquisition of agricultural inputs from farmers for onward supply to other farmers in the Agriculture supply chain. Funds will also be used to purchase tricycles to support our delivery service and also employ more hands to help us market and sell these inputs. 
Achieving this funding goal will not only help the enterprise expand but most importantly, contributors will help us support farmers in our target market and also empower us to create jobs for a number of unemployed youth in our community. So indirectly, contributors will be creating jobs for the youth right here in Ghana even though they are miles away. Helping us reduce unemployment means, contributors will help the youth stay away from social vices that occur as a result of the absence of jobs. The  impact of contributors would be far reaching. 
A lot of challenges exist for us as a startup business which includes access to capital. We may not be able to raise the funds we require but we are not giving up. We are going to use what we have to reach our goal as a business enterprise.
Please if you cannot contribute, kindly tell others about us and our cause.
Thank you!

story:
Brief Description

  • Simulation videogame of bonsais growth and care
  • Everyone with Android in their smartphone or tablet can play it
  • Will be free to download in Google Play Store and without advertisings
  • Internationalization. 8 languages on focus: English, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese, Chinese, Russian, Italian and French
  • Highly educational and funny
  • Google Game Services integration. There will be score(oxygen) rankings,  achievements system, savegames on the cloud and more
  • Not necessary to be connected to internet to play
 Note: go straight to the gallery to see high quality original screenshots of the game, the ones here are reduced in size for aesthetic purpose.

  

Gameplay. Where do resides the fun and challenge? The defiance of learn

  Shouhin Bonsai dare you to deal with the continuos growth of up to 3 bonsais. You will have to take care of them in this specific aspects: solar energy absorved, hydration, substrate mineralization, substrate distribution, pruning, defensive fertilization and combative fertilization.

 Time in game is a bit accelerated compared to our time, therefore you will experiment a bit quickler growing of bonsai items(leaves, branchs, trunk, flowers, fruits) than the ones in real life. This was subtly adapted to not experience boredom. Since this is a simulation as closer that it can to the real world, I don't want to accelerate the in-game time more than it is now.

 To experiment quickler the behaviour of the bonsais versus the year seassons, SB implements 3 weeks for a seasson, so a year in-game are 3 months of our-daily life.

 The user will have to take a look into the game daily, at least once, to keep their plants healthy. I never thought to make the player a slave of the game, I always thought about everyone, since the one who checks his smartphones once daily, while traveling back from their jobs, to people which have more time to be connected. There will be an option for those who want to take vacations of the technology: enabling an specific in-game action you'll freeze your progress. Then when you want to come back to play again you revert the action, with no loss(and not growth of course) at all.

 Internet free. Although Google Game Service will be integrated to SB(so requires login to their server), I'm aimed to make the gamer free to play in everywhere, without need of internet connection.

  

Three kind of bonsais, three bonsai kinds

 Cypress, the bonsai of bonsais is a must. Cypress is a shouhaku bonsai, which means a conifer one. I also wanted to include another variety of trees, that's why we will have a Maple, representing zakki bonsais, broadleaf one; and a Jasmine, representing hanamono bonsais, floral.

Some words about the abstraction. A closer look

 To write the simulation of a real world thing one must study it, deeply. Then one have to define a level of abstraction for the simulation, how deeply you want to show the rabbit hole, this is necessary to not fall into madness. The deepness reached contents me, it goes pretty far.

Sickness

 Each bonsai element(branches, leaves, male flowers, female flowers, fruits) can get sick. There are currently eight simulated diseases. The progress of a bonsai is linked to its health.

Natural interpretation of bonsai growing

 The bonsai growth has randomness and control. Example: will never exist fruits if first there aren't male and female flowers.

Mineralization reduced over time

 It is known that one of the components of the photosynthesis factory are the minerals within the substrate. Over time these minerals get depleted due to the consumption made by the plant. At some point, photosynthesis production is relatively low due to the above, good moment to change the substrate, but note...  it's good if it's spring, while in another seasson bonsai can be damaged.

Irrigation power

 Be cautious with the irrigation with full watering can! The power with which the water comes out of the watering can, can mess up the distribution of the substrate and cause stress on the plant, resulting in a reduction in the production of photosynthesis. Watering should be at low pressure and well distributed.

 UV radiation

 Shouhin Bonsai also simulates the variation in solar UV radiation. There are days that's more severe than others, that determines how much you could expose the bonsai in the sun without causing burns. Also note that different seassons means different solar energy power, and of course, due to this, plant dehydrated quickler in the summer than in the winter.

 Preventive fertilization

 Exist artificial and organic preventive fertilizers provisions, the latter being more efficient but more complicated to get! Everything has a cost(gold) in the game and you must learn to manage it. The only way to get gold is completing achievements or participating in the annual local and international exhibitions.

 Annual exhibitions

 Like all bonsai lover knows, there are bonsai exhibitions, and bonsai beauty and care contests around the world. Shouhin Bonsai is no exception. It has two annual(in-game) exhibitions, one local and one international. At the end of the exhibition, the user gets a place in the competition, which equals a certain amount of gold. That gold will serve to maintain your bonsais healthy and therefore allow a faster growth.

  

Updates...

 Want to know more about the game? Reference to the Updates side of the website, there you'll find some more videos, screenshots and more. This is the last updates:

How does it feels the interaction with the screen?

 You can see the big picture of your bonsai and each items closely. By doing that you will be able to detect a sick component. If you're skilled in detecting when the plants in your garden are sick you'll do the same here. Each item varies its colors proving that is sick, if it doesn't receive at least some sunlight will head discoloration. Not only its color varies, also in size and form, since they can wilt. By zooming in, you can also detect if a branch is bleeding sap due to a pruning, sometimes will get damaged.

A bit of the defensive fertilization side of the application

 Basically the defensive fertilization is about to have in-game gold to get artificial fertilizers or raw materials to construct organic fertilizers. As you know if you read, the gold is obtained in the annuals exhibitions, where you'll get a ranking position based in the health of your bonsai, beauty and amount of bonsai items(fruits gives more points, balance between male and female flowers give some anothers, and also the leaves). Artificial fertilizers are not so good as the organic ones, they cover few defense, are cheaper and works for a large amount of days. On the other hand organic fertilizers expires in a week, they cover more defense(up to 75%) and constructing them is expensive. This way the game push you to be rather exposed to plagues at the beggining, and slowly, by getting gold in exhibitions you'll construct a better wall for plagues.

 Another items are being created, which will influence the defense againts plagues. They can be coupled with any of your bonsais, one item for one bonsai. This items can be obtained completing achievements. I'll give some randomness in the obtaining of these objects, so we can enjoy variety and fun. Some of them will only help you for a specific kind of plague, i.e.: [+20% protection againts Small Mealybugs]. To note, there are 6 kinds of plagues: Acarus, Red Spider Mites, Small Mealybugs, Big Mealybugs, White Flies and Plant-louse.

About the developer

 Shouhin Bonsai is developed by JorobusLab, a one person entrepreneurship founded in 2012. Damián(aka IgorJorobus) has developed several proffesional administrative applications for small and medium enterprises to end doing videogames, his true vocation. Be free to check out his portfolio on JorobusLab website.

  

Game development progress

 At the beginning of this campaign SB was on 75% of progress. Currently it is 85%.

TODO's and WIP's

 Order in here doesn't matter
  • Internal achievement system
  • Store system(ie: where you can purchase the fertilizers with gold)
  • Implementation of Maple and Jasmine
  • In winter plants go into the "greenhouse", I must design those graphics
  • Design of several items to get via achievements, included backgrounds
  • Connect the game with Google Game Services
  • Outsource translations
  • In-game tutorial
  • Some SFX left
  • Some music left

  

Rewards offered

 Don't worry about how to get the in-game items. After your support, give me 1~2 days to personally contact you and I'll show you how we can easily achieve this.

 About the t-shirt and stickers: I'm working on that, will take some days to show you the models, what I can ensure is that will be of high quality and can be sent to anywhere in the world.

  

Another ways of support Shouhin Bonsai

 Commenting about the game in the comments section will help a lot, comment whatever you want about the game, say if it likes you or say what would you change or add from it. Also you can ask something about the game, I'm going to answer you shortly.
 I'll ask you to share this website by clicking on the links at the left of the page, by Facebook, Twitter or Google+.
 Finally you can follow us on some of this social websites:

  • Facebook
  • Google+
 Below is the official website of JorobusLab but since I can't embrace all the fields of information publishing because of time(have to finish the game) I'll use this as main place for Shouhin Bonsai related things(be aware to check this site between 2 days). Then when campaign gets done, I'm going to emigrate all the information to my website and keep writing there. I compromise myself to post about a topic each 2 days.

story:
For english translation click here.

Hallo, mein Name ist Christine Mai und ich möchte mit meinem Team ein ca. 20 h großes Grundstück in der Nähe von Landsberg am Lech in einen Spiel- und Freizeitpark für behinderte und nicht behinderte Kinder umbauen. Unser erstes Ziel ist es, behinderten Menschen - seien es die Eltern oder die Kinder - eine gemeinsame Freizeitgestaltung zur ermöglichen . Der ganze Park soll mit Spielgeräten ausgestattet werden, die von beiden Gruppen gemeinsam genutzt werden können, damit von vorn herein keine Trennung entsteht.  Wer betroffen ist, weiß genau wie schwierig die Freizeitgestaltung ist, wenn für jeden etwas dabei sein soll.

Unser zweites Ziel ist es, diesen Park auch sozial schwachen Familien zu ermöglichen. Der Eintrittspreis soll zwei bis drei EUR nach Möglichkeit nicht übersteigen.  Jeder von uns kennt die großen Freizeitparks, die hohe Eintrittsgelder verlangen und das Mitbringen von Speisen und Getränken verbieten. Damit ist es meist aber noch nicht getan. Im Park selber gibt es haufenweise kleinere Aktionen, die wieder extra kosten. Damit wird ein Tagesausflug für kinderreiche Familien und Durchschnitts-Verdiener fast unbezahlbar.

Unser All-In-Park wird außer Gastronomie keine versteckten Kosten haben. Ob es Kinderschminken, Ballontiere basteln, Gold schürfen oder ähnliche kleine Aktionen sind: Alles ist inbegriffen. Und wer seine Speisen und Getränke selber mitbringen möchte, kann ein gemütliches Picknick auf unserem Gelände machen.

Um die Kosten für den Park so niedrig wie möglich zu halten, sollen alle Geräte ohne Strom betrieben werden.  Unter Anderem möchten wir auch eine Pferdelaufbahn für mechanische Pferden bauen. Diese Pferde gibt es in verschiedenen Größen. Sie können sowohl von Kindern als auch von Erwachsenen bedient werden. Damit auch hier Rollstuhlfahrer nicht ausgeschlossen werden, möchten wir eine Konstruktion bauen, die es ermöglicht den Rollstuhl zur Kutsche umzufunktionieren. So können alle gemeinsam einen Ausritt starten.

Wenn wir eine Finanzierung über Banken anstreben würden, könnten wir die Eintrittspreise nicht halten. Damit wäre es nicht unser Ziel und somit auch nicht unser Park.

Wenn man bedenkt, dass einzelne Firmen mehrere Millionen in ein Fussballstadion stecken, nur damit es deren Namen trägt, sollte es doch auch möglich sein, diese Summe für einen sozialen Zweck zu sammeln. Wenn es nur um Werbung geht: Toben Sie sich aus. Wir haben ausreichend Platz.

Unser größter Traum wäre es, wenn weltweit begeisterte Fans nachziehen und ebenfalls einen All-In-Park eröffnen.

Das Team:

Christine Mai, Peter Obermüller, Judith Mosher, Lucyna Rarus, Roman Polanka,
Melanie Schack, Doris Ksibi, Christina Reinhold, Josef Ksibi, Lisa Mai

 

Hello, my name is Christine Mai. Me and my team would like to turn this piece of land (50 acres lot) into an adventure park for disabled and able-bodied children. Our first goal is to serve disabled people – whether parent or child – so that they can enjoy leisurely time together with their families. The entire park is to be filled with toys and games that can be used by both groups, so that a separation will not follow. Affected parties know how difficult it can be to find fun entertainment and activities that are all-inclusive.

Our second goal is to make this park affordable for financially challenged families. We envision an admission fee between 2 and 3 euros. All of us are familiar with huge, popular theme parks that charge pricey admission fees and require of their patrons to purchase food and beverages, should the patron get hungry or thirsty.  Within the park costs often add up to even more as many smaller activities are not included in the admission fee. Considering the combined cost, it is becoming nearly impossible for middleclass families, especially larger ones, to afford a visit.

Our All-in-park will have no hidden costs, whether balloon animals, face painting or digging for gold. The purchase of refreshments will be an option while at the same time a picnic area will be provided. To keep costs down, we are envisioning a park in which no activities require electricity. If at all possible, we would like to build a racetrack for mechanical horses. These mechanical horses exist in all sizes already and can be used by adults and children as well. To include wheelchair bound attendees, we are hoping to construct an attachment that could convert a wheelchair into a functioning carriage. This way a whole family could start a ride together.

To have our park financed by banks would mean that we would have to charge much higher admission fees than we would like, and that is not our goal.

When considering how much large corporations are willing to spend on naming a sports arena,  one would hope that a smaller amount could be collected so that financially disadvantaged families can enjoy a fun filled day.

Our dream is to inspire others and see similar parks popping up all over the world.

The Team:

Christine Mai, Peter Obermüller, Judith Mosher, Lucyna Rarus, Roman Polanka,
Melanie Schack, Doris Ksibi, Christina Reinhold, Josef Ksibi, Lisa Mai

Christine Mai, Peter Obermüller, Judith Mosher, Lucyna Rarus, Roman Polanka,Melanie Schack, Doris Ksibi, Christina Reinhold, Josef Ksibi, Lisa Mai

story:
Breve reseña

Los colaboradores financian ideas con las que se sienten apasionados y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.

Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Presenta más detalles:

  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.

El impacto

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.

Riesgos y desafíos

Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  • Recuérdale que use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Y eso es todo.

story:
Join Pagi Community and receive all products for up to 50% OFF for LIFE!!

 

 

Hi there. My name is Igor. I’m an Environmentalist and Entrepreneur and that’s my Story.

 

I moved to Bali a year ago to run a Real Estate business. I was so excited and motivated. I had a few investors interested in my idea to build a condominium. Nevertheless, after 6 months of preparation and hard work my project  had to close up. While I was traveling around Bali in search for the best spot for the condo I found so many places that were stunning. However, on the other side, it was hard not to notice tons of trash scattered everywhere. What I saw that day made me think how the problem of littering in Bali can be solved and what exactly I can do for the matter. So with the help and support of my friends I started cleaning coastlines every week. Some time later I joined some other activists who also cleaned the beaches every weekend. But each time when I was collecting trash on the beach, I was telling myself that it will not resolve this problem. The trash will come back again and again. So next 6 month I spend creating a line of 100% plastic-free, reusable, biodegradable products meant to replace everyday use items at your home and businesses. Which has to subsequently reduce the use of plastic in the whole Bali. It’s time to say goodbye to plastic!

 

 

 

There was a time when plastic made so much sense - it was easy to use, inexpensive, and when you were done, you just threw it out. Sounds great right?

 

 

Well, jump ahead a couple of decades and I've learned it’s clogging our landfills, destroying our oceans, and impacting our health.

 

 

 

I'm opening an EXCLUSIVE LIFETIME MEMBERSHIP deal only on Indiegogo. 

By backing my campaign, you get special membership to our store FOR LIFE. With a membership, you’ll get up to 50% OFF our products plus first access to all our latest products. 

Also with Pagi Community Membership you will get special discounts in our partners when you will come to Bali.

 

My first goal is to replace all improper straw such as Plastic Straws, Paper Straws & Reusable Straw witch is not hygienic. 

 

 

 

The first step is establish local company and get all licences will cost 9220$.

After the company will be open I need to create a stock which will be able to provide enough straws for local restaurants and  that will cost 8000$ 

 

 

 

 

Why Switch to Pagi Straws?

 

With so many options out there for sustainable products, how do you know which ones are right for you? And how do they stack up against each other? I created this resource to outline the best reasons for using wheat straws, and how they’re different from paper straws.

 

 

 

Pagi Straws are compostable, so they won’t need to end up in a landfill.

What’s the most obvious difference between straws made of plastic and straws made of wheat stems? I think it’s pretty simple: the latter is natural, the former is not. Plastic, in its many forms, is made from petroleum—a nonrenewable resource that comes from fossil fuels. Wheat—a plant, of course—is a renewable resource that comes straight from Mother Earth, and she’s much more keen on taking it back when you’re done with it. Since Pagi Straws are purely wheat, they’ll biodegrade in the compost.

 

 

 

Straws that biodegrade cause less harm to the environment and wildlife.

 

If you spend any time on social media, I bet you’ve seen this viral video

 

         
 
 

 of an injured sea turtle posted a couple years ago (warning: it’s graphic!). Though fortunately the turtle survived, animal rescue workers pulled and tugged for several minutes to remove a foreign object from its nostril—a single-use plastic straw.  


Plastics like that are here to stay for a long, long time. And every single one that ends up in our oceans and landfills is a potential harm to wildlife, and the overall health of the planet. When you opt for biodegradable products, you’re reducing the number of harmful plastics that end up in fragile ecosystems worldwide.

 

 

 

Bioplastics sound great in theory, but the reality is that they’re largely misunderstood, and in many cases don’t break down any faster than regular plastic.

There’s a lot of general confusion about what exactly are bioplastics, and what happens to them after you discard them. Because of misleading marketing, many consumers make the (often incorrect) assumption that bioplastics are always biodegradable. But the term “bioplastic” only refers to what it’s made from, not how it will break down after it’s thrown away.

  

Bioplastics are made from “biomass”—often pulp that’s leftover from processing other products, like sugarcane. While bioplastics may come from plant-based material, the molecular structure can prevent them from breaking down any differently from regular plastic. Many bioplastic materials are recyclable, but not compostable.


Some kinds of bioplastics, called bio-polymers, do biodegrade, but only under very specific conditions—and not what’s created by your backyard compost bin. As a result, they must be composted in municipal facilities, and many areas don’t have them. If bioplastic products get rerouted to a recycling facility, there’s no technology to tell them apart from regular plastic, so they often get sent to the landfill anyway.   

 

 

Paper straws are certainly a better choice than plastic, but wheat has a leg up in a few different ways: less processing, no sogginess, and bonus points for reducing air pollution!

Aren’t paper straws a more obvious choice for an alternative to plastic? Sure, if you like your straws nice and soggy. On the other hand, wheat stalks are designed by nature itself to support the plant and withstand the elements!  

 
Beyond the stability of the material, wheat has a few other advantages over paper straws. For instance, what’s one of the necessary evils of paper production? Deforestation. Mature forests must be destroyed to harvest wood for the pulp needed to make paper, and it’s all heavily processed before there’s a final product. Pagi Straws use wheat stems that are the byproduct of wheat production, so no additional plants must be grown or harvested in order to make our straws. In some countries like China, the stem byproduct is disposed of by burning, which contributes to air pollution. By creating a market for this unwanted byproduct, we’re eliminating the need to burn it, and helping to cut back on air pollution!

 

 

Next Step

 

Create an online store where I can put my line of 100% plastic-free, reusable, biodegradable products​. 

 

 

 

More about products:

Vegan Reusable Food Wraps use plant-based Candelilla wax and non-GMO Soy wax. They also contain tree resin and jojoba oil and use natural cotton. This means they’re cruelty-free and completely vegan.

The combination of these ingredients results in the wax wrap being flexible, self-sticking, and unscented.

Candelilla wax is normally two-times denser than beeswax, so this may mean the vegan wrap is less pliable than the beeswax wrap. The vegan wrap also can’t be easily mended with additional melted wax, unlike beeswax wraps.

Soy wax is a renewable resource, so using it in this wrap means an environmentally-sustainable product.

The tree resin and jojoba oil also provide additional properties. The tree resin provides natural antibacterial properties, while jojoba oil is a natural fluid plant wax and is anti fungal.

 

 

 

 

Cotton swabs are made from sustainably grown bamboo and cotton. They’re 100% biodegradable and come in a variety of colors - so you can add some flair to your bathroom. 

The bamboo stem ensures they’re ultra lightweight and strong. 

They’re designed to be more hygienically effective than your average plastic cotton swab.They're made with a thinner cotton tip which is recommended for a more effective clean. 


Bamboo’s eco-positive attributes continues to delight researchers…

Recent studies have indicated that many bamboo products are not only carbon neutral, but carbon negative! Bamboo produces 30% more oxygen than your regular run-of-the-mill tree.

Why Plastic-Cotton-Swabs Were Designed By The Devil.

Plastic-cotton-swabs are only used once and then trashed or flushed down the toilet. Which means they end up in landfill or worse - our rivers and oceans, where they will stay FOREVER!

What sucks even more about plastic-cotton-swabs is that they can not be recycled. These nasty mofos are made with the assistance of non-renewable oil in the manufacturing process. 

 

 

 

 

 

Stainless Steel Thermos

An eco-friendly stainless steel water bottle with all of the features you could hope for in a bottle-for-life. The bottle is leaf proof and chip resistant, with a wide mouth for easy drinking and cleaning. The 18/8 food grade stainless steel used to make the bottle and lid is a sustainable material, and is easily recyclable at the end of life (although we can't see a reason why your bottle won't last for life!). 

The double-walled construction gives the bottle vacuum superb insulation, keeping hot drinks hot for 12 hours and cold for 24 hours.

 

Tea drinkers rejoice. Safe and durable heated hydration storage bottle features a small removable infuser for loose leaf or regular tea bags, making it easy to brew or refill on the go - a unique and cute gift for mom or dad or anyone who enjoys tea outside the home

 

Make yourself a promise to take everywhere with you and refill, and avoid buying bottled water completely.

 

And others products:

 

 

My next objectives are:

 

  • Develop a platform to mobilize the proactive base of the city, giving impulse to initiatives of environmental activists and start-ups.
  • Create a transparent trust fund intended to finance social projects and start-ups which are aimed towards the development of the city.
  • Bring together thousands of people with practical intelligence to invest in the project and distribute funds to finance other initiatives.
 
 
 
 

The idea is to open Environmental Company which will become a successful example of uniting a community around a common cause. What makes Pagi Community unique is that 30% of the company profit will be reinvested in social projects aimed at the city’s development. The project will bring together thousands active citizens following their passion for high-quality environment development.

 

 

Ideas for reinvest:

 

Collaboration with Precious Plastic

 to set up Workshop

 

Recycling Mini Factory & Waste Management Company 

 

 
 

 We can produce from our waste such a cool staff as a manholes, paving slabs, curbs and other elements of improvement.

 
 
 

Polymer products are not only widely capable of replacing many other materials, but are also environmentally friendly. Distinguishing characteristics of paving slabs polymer sand:

  • Impact resistance
  • Environmental friendliness
  • Aesthetics
  • Cost
  • Durability

Resistance to external influences

The range of operating temperatures of paving slabs made of polymer is from -50 to +70 ° C, which allows its use in regions with a harsh climate. Durability, impact resistance and resistance to external influences and the effects of aggressive chemicals are confirmed by laboratory tests.

 

 

Next step is:

 

Purchase and instal Water Vending Machine

in Schools, Public places & Markets.

 

 

It can help to reduce all plastics which we are using daily

 

 

 

The only way forward is to get everybody involved

story:
The United or Divided States of America?

Increasingly the United States of America is becoming the Divided States of America. Class divisions, lack of opportunity, poor race relations, and economic disadvantage continue to empower the rich at the expense of others. Illiteracy and specifically illiteracy about how America works is arguably the primary culprit. 

32 million adults in the U.S. can’t read. That’s 14 percent of the population. 21 percent of adults in the U.S. read below a 5th grade level, and 19 percent of high school graduates can’t read. We probably don’t need to spell out the benefits of reading and writing for you. Economic security, access to health care, and the ability to actively participate in civic life all depend on an individual’s ability to read. And what about literacy about the American Dream? Too many Americans have no clue what the American Dream is. In fact for many, the American Dream has become a nightmare. Folks are working two and three jobs just to survive while some Americans with advanced college degrees find themselves on food stamps. Educational inequity in America remains prevalent, drop-out rates continue to sour, and the working-poor largely remains poor. It is no secret that race relations in America is at an all-time low while race-related incidents are on the rise. Debt and economic hardship continue to plague many Americans. In a nutshell, the American Dream is fast-becoming a nightmare. 

While working to empower Camden high school drop-outs via a Rutgers University community collaboration, Dr. Sharron Scott and Rob Piekarski, EdM agreed that illiteracy, and illiteracy about the America Dream in particular, is problematic. Drawing on their education, life experiences and love for books, The Lit Spot was birthed as an innovative literacy-themed bookstore and cafe with the goal of rendering the American Dream understandable and thus more attainable.

What We Do

The Lit Spot' sales and services (books, media & educational workshops) primarily focuses on four CORE literary themes:

Class – The knowledge and understanding of class and social mobility in America; characteristics of the low, middle, and high class Americans.

Opportunity  – The knowledge, appreciation, and exploration of opportunities to read, write; the ability to seize and create employment, educational, and entrepreneurship opportunities 

Race – The knowledge, understanding and impact of the American social construction of race 

Economics – The knowledge and ability to make informed and effective financial decisions​

 

Who We Are

Dr. Sharron Scott is an author, educator, social justice advocate and the Managing Director of The Lit Spot. Robert Piekarski a veteran educator, writer, and counselor serves in an advisory capacity as Chief Advisory of The Lit Spot. Rob is a graduate of the Temple and Rutgers Universities with degrees in counseling education. He has lived and worked for more than forty years in the Camden County community. Sharron is a native New Yorker and founder of REEL Education, a consulting firm that ‘Teaches Thru Technology.’ A former K-12 American History teacher, she currently teaches REEL Racial History, REEL African American History, and REEL Black Life at the Pan African Studies Community Education Program (PASCEP) at Temple University. She also instructs at Rutgers University and in the College of Education at Temple. Dr. Scott completed her undergraduate degree at Emory University and her doctorate degree in Higher Education at Temple University.

What We Need & What You Get​​

  • Our start-up expenses come to $50,050, which are single time fees associated with opening the The Lit Spot. These costs are funded by donations, private investors and crowdsourcing. Please note that we expect to be operating at a loss for the first couple of months before advertising begins to take effect and draw in customers. The Lit Spot will be receiving periodic influxes of cash to cover operating expenses during the first two years as it strives toward sustainable profitability. Funding will continue through InDemand, a continuing crowdsourcing service offered by Indiegogo. 

  • Contributors' name will be prominently displayed in The Lit Spot for all to see those worked to make The Lit Spot possible!

Risks & Challenges

Over the past few decades there has been a lot of speculation about the demise of the American bookstore and some of it may not be entirely unfounded. As big names like Borders fall under the weight of online retailers, e-books, and electronic forms of entertainment, how can small independent bookstores hope to survive? While things aren’t great for bookstores in America today, they also aren’t quite as bad as they seem. Despite dire predictions about the future of print media, Americans still read quite a lot of books, shelling out billions of dollars for them every single year. While a hefty chunk of book sales now happening online, many bookstores both small and large are still raking in healthy profits.

According to the American Booksellers Association, the number of member independent bookstores has increased more than 20 percent since the depths of the recession, from 1,651 in 2009 to 2,094 in 2014. Therefore, The Lit Spot believes this may be a good time to get into the industry and gain market share.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about The Lit Spot's campaign - Please direct potential contributors to igg.me/at/thelitspot
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share our campaign
  • Donate gently-used books and media that address The Lit Spot's Literacy CORE - Class, Opportunity, Race, and Economics

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you!
story_txt:
The United or Divided States of America?
Increasingly the United States of America is becoming the Divided States of America. Class divisions, lack of opportunity, poor race relations, and economic disadvantage continue to empower the rich at the expense of others. Illiteracy and specifically illiteracy about how America works is arguably the primary culprit. 
32 million adults in the U.S. can’t read. That’s 14 percent of the population. 21 percent of adults in the U.S. read below a 5th grade level, and 19 percent of high school graduates can’t read. We probably don’t need to spell out the benefits of reading and writing for you. Economic security, access to health care, and the ability to actively participate in civic life all depend on an individual’s ability to read. And what about literacy about the American Dream? Too many Americans have no clue what the American Dream is. In fact for many, the American Dream has become a nightmare. Folks are working two and three jobs just to survive while some Americans with advanced college degrees find themselves on food stamps. Educational inequity in America remains prevalent, drop-out rates continue to sour, and the working-poor largely remains poor. It is no secret that race relations in America is at an all-time low while race-related incidents are on the rise. Debt and economic hardship continue to plague many Americans. In a nutshell, the American Dream is fast-becoming a nightmare. 
While working to empower Camden high school drop-outs via a Rutgers University community collaboration, Dr. Sharron Scott and Rob Piekarski, EdM agreed that illiteracy, and illiteracy about the America Dream in particular, is problematic. Drawing on their education, life experiences and love for books, The Lit Spot was birthed as an innovative literacy-themed bookstore and cafe with the goal of rendering the American Dream understandable and thus more attainable.
What We Do
The Lit Spot' sales and services (books, media & educational workshops) primarily focuses on four CORE literary themes:
Class – The knowledge and understanding of class and social mobility in America; characteristics of the low, middle, and high class Americans.
Opportunity  – The knowledge, appreciation, and exploration of opportunities to read, write; the ability to seize and create employment, educational, and entrepreneurship opportunities 
Race – The knowledge, understanding and impact of the American social construction of race 
Economics – The knowledge and ability to make informed and effective financial decisions​
 
Who We Are
Dr. Sharron Scott is an author, educator, social justice advocate and the Managing Director of The Lit Spot. Robert Piekarski a veteran educator, writer, and counselor serves in an advisory capacity as Chief Advisory of The Lit Spot. Rob is a graduate of the Temple and Rutgers Universities with degrees in counseling education. He has lived and worked for more than forty years in the Camden County community. Sharron is a native New Yorker and founder of REEL Education, a consulting firm that ‘Teaches Thru Technology.’ A former K-12 American History teacher, she currently teaches REEL Racial History, REEL African American History, and REEL Black Life at the Pan African Studies Community Education Program (PASCEP) at Temple University. She also instructs at Rutgers University and in the College of Education at Temple. Dr. Scott completed her undergraduate degree at Emory University and her doctorate degree in Higher Education at Temple University.
What We Need & What You Get​​

Our start-up expenses come to $50,050, which are single time fees associated with opening the The Lit Spot. These costs are funded by donations, private investors and crowdsourcing. Please note that we expect to be operating at a loss for the first couple of months before advertising begins to take effect and draw in customers. The Lit Spot will be receiving periodic influxes of cash to cover operating expenses during the first two years as it strives toward sustainable profitability. Funding will continue through InDemand, a continuing crowdsourcing service offered by Indiegogo. 
Contributors' name will be prominently displayed in The Lit Spot for all to see those worked to make The Lit Spot possible!
Risks & Challenges
Over the past few decades there has been a lot of speculation about the demise of the American bookstore and some of it may not be entirely unfounded. As big names like Borders fall under the weight of online retailers, e-books, and electronic forms of entertainment, how can small independent bookstores hope to survive? While things aren’t great for bookstores in America today, they also aren’t quite as bad as they seem. Despite dire predictions about the future of print media, Americans still read quite a lot of books, shelling out billions of dollars for them every single year. While a hefty chunk of book sales now happening online, many bookstores both small and large are still raking in healthy profits.
According to the American Booksellers Association, the number of member independent bookstores has increased more than 20 percent since the depths of the recession, from 1,651 in 2009 to 2,094 in 2014. Therefore, The Lit Spot believes this may be a good time to get into the industry and gain market share.
Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about The Lit Spot's campaign - Please direct potential contributors to igg.me/at/thelitspot
Use the Indiegogo share tools and share our campaign
Donate gently-used books and media that address The Lit Spot's Literacy CORE - Class, Opportunity, Race, and Economics

And that's all there is to it.Thank you!
